Summary: To be honest this was a last minute booking. And now I know why they had rooms available. Worst place ever. Disgusting and extremely rude staff. Keys never worked right. Lack of bedding and uncomfortable bedding. Both kids got bit by a spider. Oh my gross! Called down to front desk to ask for extra pillows. There was 4 of us. I was told “there is a king bed in the room and you have 4 pillows on that bed. You take 2 of those pillows and use them for the kids”. Have in mind these are small pillows. In addition, I did hear they staff complaint about guests leaving one piece of trash in the continental breakfast area. Just my thought, aren’t employees there to help keep the place clean and be respectful to guests? or do they simple just want to ride the clock and play with phones?

Summary: OMG where do I even start . Probably the worst hotel I’ve stayed at in 35 years. We reserved a room that slept five people (including pull-out-couch).  We arrived to our room around midnight. The key card that they just gave us did not work in the door. Went back to the front desk and the girl was so rude. Told us we must have held it near our cell phone which erased it. Isn’t this the year 2023? Doesn’t everyone have a cell phone near their wallet or in their pocket? Got into our room and wanted to go to sleep pretty quick, so we could wake up early for Disneyland. There were no blankets or pillows for the pull-out-couch bed. Called back down to speak to the rude girl at the front desk. She informed us that they were “out of blankets” for the couch and we could just use some of
Room tip: Avoid this hotel. Stay at a Marriott

The toilet wouldn't flush, pillows were paper thin, room overall was extremely outdated, smelled of weed the whole time, the people above us were incredibly noisy, felt like the ceiling was going to cave in, the room across from us had someone heckling us and our family every time we walked to our room, pretty sure he was homeless. No one available to change them and no other rooms so we had to change sheets ourselves. Terrible service from rude hotel staff. Walls are paper thin. Parking structure and hotel halls reeked off marijuana. Terrible experience!

The hotel is very easy to find and spot. The walk to and from the hotel from disneyland is easy and definitely can be done. The rooms we nice and the bed is comfortable. They do charge $20 for parking and hold $100 incase of damages.

The room had stained furniture. The hallways were lined with trash outside doors. There were diapers and food boxes as we made our way to the room. It smells. The toilet ran all night. There was no fan in the bathroom. It was just gross. I wouldn’t stay there again. Luckily we only stayed one night before going to a Disneyland resort the rest of the weekend.

Ac was broken and faucet leaked all night staff refused to move us til day 3 when we had one day left. Spoke to manager and she was not helpful and refused to even discount the stay. All they did was bring 2 box fans

Our room had crumbs in the bed  “new” room. Hair everywhere in there. The internet doesn’t work. They don’t have a breakfast. The toilet which they knew where not working flooded our room while we were gone and our stuff got toilet water on it. They didn’t try to refund or do anything that resolved it. They moved us and said it as an upgrade. I liked my room. The new room wasn’t an upgrade. Both my husband and I are disabled and it made it difficult

There what water dripping from the vent in the bathroom, there was a poop Stan on bed, the card didn’t work, I had to yell to get attention that the front desk, the room wasn’t clean when enter, some lights didn’t work over all I never be staying in this hotel again

My room smelled of mold, which is a health hazard. The staff said they had no other room available. What are we to do once we get into the situation, with a reservation? This sort should be taken care of before a guest arrives.

The first evening the whole second floor smelled of urine. This did improve the second night but still not great. (Not as worse) Also, breakfast was disappointing. You get a muffin and granola bar. We have stayed here in the past and had a great experience but this trip was just no good.

OK rooms, but don't expect quality amenities. The internet is effectively useless - it fails to connect often and when it does work it is incredibly slow, breakfast is virtually unavailable (they say until 8 am, but I came at 7:45 and it was gone), A/C did not work, paper thin walls (loud).

Customer service felt forced. Was put on a floor with no ice maker nor was I told, It was down the entire stay. When we got to our room after check in, I found standing water. ( the toilet was leaking). I attempted to call the front desk via room phone and no one would answer, I had to call from my cell. When they did answer, they wanted me to hold. When I said no, they didn't like that and I told them I had standing water in my room. Maintenance showed up 10 minutes later. When down to complain and the gentlemen up front said he can remove my parking fees.  I explained that would not be sufficient and then with and attitude he said he can refund my money and we could leave. There was another elevator closer to our room that was out of order. Was not repaired our entire stay.

Summary Heading: When are we going to stop using Covid as an excuse for bad service?
Summary: This was the epitome of over promise and under deliver. The rooms were nice enough. We booked 2-1 bedroom apartments (so basically 2 rooms with beds) for our family of 4 and my in-laws family of 3 so we had plenty of room to spread out. That's about the only good part of our stay. We had requested conjoined rooms if possible when we booked the rooms but when we got there we found out that our rooms weren't even on the same floor and there was nothing they could do about that. We booked this hotel for our Disney trip and liked it because it was close enough to walk, but they offered shuttle service as well. Turns out that they don't offer shuttle service, they just point out how you can use the city transport. The "free breakfast" that they boast of has been shut down due to

I would not recommend this hotel. The room was clean, but rest of hotel carpets and elevator were terribly dirty. Our 5th floor stairwell exit next to the elevator was blocked off with yellow caution tape the entire stay - terrible fire safety violation and it was not rectified when I mentioned it to front desk. Breakfast of 2 granola bars and a muffin was subpar. Young man at front desk did help us retrieve some lost items, but rest of staff were not as friendly. No room cleaning service available either, which could be ok for a short stay of 2 nights or less. Overall disappointing experience.

Never staying there again the hotel was just not up to it standards it over promised while your a booking it that stay was just not a good experience something in the room wasn’t allowing my wife and my self sleep comfortably we stay at many hotels this is by far the worst iv never made a complaint like that

The staff were excellent, but the cleanliness, maintenance and their version of breakfast at this location were unsatisfactory. Common areas were poorly maintained and not cleaned regularly. Their seemed to be a complete lack of pride in appearance.

Worst stay. Filthy rooms that were never cleaned prior to stay. Trash was still in there. Food in the fridge and microwave. Ran out of towels 2 nights in a row. Managers are nowhere to be found to make a complaint to.

Cleanliness is very poor. Couches in the room are so dirty. When inside the room, you will hear the people talking and walking in the hallway and the worst the sound of walking people on the upper level even on quiet hours. Hallway smells cigarette. that we don’t even don’t want to walk going to the elevator but we have no choice coz that’s the only way out. Breakfast is included but on our surprise, they will only give us muffin that you can buy outside and some crackers.

Dirty, Noisy, and definitrly not worth the money!!! No accomadations, broken elevator, free breakfast was a joke. Did I mention DIRTY. Trash everywhere on the property, inside and out. We were there three days and none of the exterior trash cans were ever emptied.. Do not stay here!!

Summary Heading: Terrible parking lot, uncomfortable beds, no WIFI
Summary: Parking lot is microscopic, beds were rock hard and bed frames were dangerous for small kids, WIFI did not work, and free breakfast was a tiny muffin with a granola bar in a bag. Location was great, but room was clearly not cleaned in a very long time. Everything was dusty and air filters were so dirty they were dropping dust through the vent

No maid service internet didn't work, no towels, beds uncomfortable, no breakfast just plainly false advertising.  Never stay again we visit Disneyland every year and we won't stay there again or will any of our family or friends....

This hotel was so dirty, hair on towels and used tissues under bed. They don't clean the room or give new towels.  The breakfast was a joke, Stale muffin and a bar in a bag.  Not to mention front desk calling at 10PM waking us up, when I didn't answer the house line since I was asleep they called on my cell phone to tell me to move my car.  NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL

The staff were amazing and tried to compensate for poor quality of rooms and breakfast offerings. Furnishings in rooms were old and filthy, refrigerators do not have freezer in them, and there are no USB ports in rooms.

Friendly staff and clean rooms. The family suite is very accommodating for big families. I wish it specified it on the website because I was nervous that we wouldn’t have enough space for sleeping arrangements. Luckily we had more than enough space. I got the two double bed family suite and in the second room, there is another full/queen bed that has an extra pull out bed underneath it as well (advertising this would be in the hotel’s favor). Also, on the website I also wish they gave you the option for special requests when you’re booking as well. Other than that, recommended

Summary Heading: Decent but would not stay again
Summary: Bed and couch are not comfortable. A/C is incredibly loud. No daily housekeeping. Have to pay extra per night for parking. Not the cleanest room. Staff is not very friendly. Only good thing was that it was close to some good restaurants and Disneyland.

Very poor service at this location. Nobody was even willing to clean our rooms, my wife who is carrying a baby, had to go downstairs and bring down all of our dirty towels, and carry up six new towels in her arms while carrying a baby. All this because the staff was unwilling to even deliver towels to the room. The garbage‘s were overflowing, and we were told that the only way to get service was to bring the garbage is down ourselves, and we were on the third floor, with the elevator is not working, and then they would give us a new bag. Seriously, the lack of service was ridiculous. Breakfast was only two granola bars and a stale banana muffin… each day for 5 days…Not really a breakfast at all. Also, the juice they offer is only for the kids. We were told to go back to our

Upon checkout we learned there was no housekeeping . If we wanted more towels or coffee we had to go to the lobby to get it . No one picked up our dirty towels or garbage. The internet did it always work so then the tv did not always work. The continental breakfast was 2 granola bars and a muffin with nothing to drink. There was no manager on site the entire weekend … or at least we were told no one was there. We have tried to contact the manager since we left and no one has returned our call.

The lady at the front desk made me stand outside in the cold with my sleeping 9 month old and 3 year old. We finally got let in for 30 seconds to be told we have to go back outside to get to the room. The lady did not tell me husband that they would be charging us twice for the room & that one would be refunded within a week. He could have avoided this if the same card was used but she did not care enough to provide that information.   The breakfast is a joke! A bad with a small stale muffin and a small granola bar. Complete joke.   Do not stay here. Look elsewhere. There are a lot of other hotels nearby.

The hotel is close to the park, and lots of food choices. The room was big and quiet. The AC didn’t work, and the pool was located in the parking garage. It’s very basic and I feel the cost of the stay was a bit pricy. Especially, when you have to pay $18 a night. Breakfast was a grab bag which was a muffin and granola bar. Nothing fancy.

Hotel was nice with big rooms and location was close to Disnayland! Lack of storage of luggage before check in or after check out was a huge let down. Especially since they are so close to Disneyland.

Loved the staff and hotel location overall. Stay here very often for our staycays for Disneyland. Hot water didn’t exist, neighbors were unruly/loud, breakfast hours were way too short, the AC didn’t work. The tub was a bit dirty but the room was clean.

Old pee stains on toilet seat and around  Hair around the bath tub  Found THC pens and trash around the beds  3 doors down smelled like Marijuana was smoked inside   Definitely not family oriented, near Disneyland

So close to good restaurants at Anaheim Garden Walk. And Almost one mile away from Disneyland. Easy to reach from I-5. It’s on a very quiet street and has a safe parking lot (charge 18 dlls + tax per day)

There is more wrong than right with this property. Staff tried, but the mold and mushroom growing in the bathroom was only the worst of so many issues from doors not working, lights and tvs not working, outlets not working and so much more.

No trash can Internet a piece of  crap I had to waste all of my data the fridge made ice cream into milk and milk into ice the breakfast was packet I just ate the same thing for breakfast every day a muffin and juice and nature valley bars don't waste your money get a better hotel

Lovely hotel, good location to Disneyland and restaurants.  Staff friendly, room was fabulous, spacious and clean.  Staff very helpful.  Shame that the wifi was quite poor in the room.  Package breakfast (due to covid) could have had a little more variety and items since breakfast is included in the price.

Summary Heading: Beds could have been better, internet was poor
Summary: This is a good option for those looking for something affordable. The pool/hot tub is basically in the parking garage. The beds aren’t very comfortable. And the internet in the back of the building was bad. Also the location must be near some kind of truck dock because every morning at 6am I heard loud beeping.

Summary Heading: I cannot recommend for either long stays, nor for families. This hotel is going down fast.
Summary: This La Quinta is not up to par with other the inns under this franchise. My most recent visit has put this particular inn on my “Never Visit again” list.  1) They are using Covid as an excuse to not provide daily cleaning services. That fine for an adult staying a couple of nights. That policy is horrible for a family staying for a few days.   Please Note: this means no one is collecting the garbage from your room unless put it outside of your door.  This means you have walk down to the lobby to get fresh towels and coffee. It is both gross and a huge inconvenience.  2) They using Covid as an excuse to not provide the La Quinta breakfast we are a custom to. Instead, you get the same pathetic brownbag every morning with two granola bars, a muffin & a juice. And no juice unless

The website stated they had a fitness center and continental breakfast. When we arrived, both were canceled due to Covid. They did offer a chocolate muffin and granola bar each day. They did not clean the rooms and we were there a week. They did not take out the trash, give fresh towels, or clean linens. And if we asked for more towels, they questioned us. We asked to store our luggage for a few hours after we checked out and they refused. They refused to accept a scooter from a rental company for us, even though all of the other hotels in the area provide that service.

Summary Heading: ok if you need the space for a big family
Summary: check in and out were great. Customer service and hospitality were great.  the room- bathroom so gross. it was not clean. Wifi never worked. the key cards and elevator only worked when they wanted to. breakfast is a muffin and 2 granola bars. Parking is 18 bucks a night. deposit is $100. you can walk to the toy story parking lot where they are offering the shuttle service to and from disney which was nice so i didnt have to pay for more parking.

Great bed and location but they sold me a room with breakfast and they gave us a bag with two granola bars and a chocolate cake. The internet connection suck. No housekeeping was offer, didn't mind. The toilet flush very slow.

My husband and I traveled from Utah to visit Disneyland and Universal Studios.  We reserved 4 nights at this hotel.  When making the reservation, something came up enticing us to save $75.00 by applying for a Windham credit card.  We did so (only to save the $75.00).  We were approved, and used the card to pay for our room.  I even called to make sure we were doing it correctly.  When we arrived, they said we hadn't paid.  They would not allow us to pay with the new card because we did not have it in our possession yet.  We had to pay with another card, and forego the savings.  Our room was over $800.00 for the 4 nights.  Strike 1:  Unkept promise  Strike 2:  Nobody ever came in to clean our room/make the beds/replace towels etc... for the entirety of our stay.  We had to go ask

So we have stayed at this La Quinta every time we have gone down to the Disneyland area and we have been many times over the years. I understand when places are understaffed or things need to be updated and or fixed. But this was a horrible experience for us on our most recent stay this past weekend 10-9-21 through 10-11-21. We booked our hotel a long time ago in advance, I think about 5 months ago and had a great price because we had planned on going to Disneyland for Halloween time. We live 4 hours away, and did not check our email in the morning we left and went straight to Disneyland. Later in the afternoon on the day that we were checking in, Saturday 10-9-21 we arrived at the hotel only to learn they "candled our reservation, and said they had no rooms available". We have

Our only regret other than booking and having to stay at this disgusting hotel is that we could not simply go elsewhere because our contract was with Priceline.  The front desk was unbelievably uncivil. Thankfully we had our car for refuge when we arrived early to check in at this La Quinta as we had requested an early check-in but when we arrived, we were told no check ins until 3:00 regardless of earlier requests. As we were denied, we and our grandchildren were sent back outside into the heat to wait for hours. Unthinkable rudeness! We, nor they were even allowed in the lobby "due to covid". We saw this repeated many times with families throughout our stay.  There is no breakfast, no maid service, no amenities of any kind at this La Quinta. This place was filthy and stank

So bad treatment from the staff So bad service No clear policy Bad experience with this hotel I will not repeat it again I will not recommend it to anyone At time of check in 100 dollar taken as security deposit I checked out since a week and not refunded

Summary Heading: Skip sleeping in your car better
Summary: Staff rude, no towels, rooms dirty, keys kept not working, their excuse is covid changed everything.  Told no supervisor on duty. Costs extra to park a vehicle each night.they over charge and double charge. They say contact your bank.  Terrible place

We are annual pass holders or as you call Magic Key holders so we stay in Disneyland every other weekend. Our usual hotel was booked so my sister booked this hotel. Our trash cans were overflowing seeing as we were throwing things away and we asked if our room could be cleaned and were told no because of covid, and we would have to pay extra. Then our towels were dirty after a few uses so we asked for new ones and I was given towels with makeup stains and black spots all over them. Then one of the nights the lights went out to the bathroom. We asked if we could leave your luggage their after check out because our flight wasn’t leaving till later and they said no…because of covid. It seems covid is their scapegoat. We have stayed at plenty of other hotels who do an amazing job at

One day trip to Disneyland and spent the night at the hotel before returning back to San Diego the next day.  The hotel had hot water and all the basic amenities needed.  It was spacious.  We had 3 regular size beds for 3 of us.  We all slept in separate beds and had a wonderful sleep on the pillow top mattresses.

Summary Heading: Will not stay there again did not care for the filth in the bathroom
Summary: The bathroom was absolutely disgusting there was mold all over the tile and the seat in the shower had mold everywhere underneath it the lady last night at the desk was nice but the guy working this morning when I check out it was very rude The room was actually very big king size suit

Wish there was better breakfast. Overall great location! Hope to go back soon. I think the breakfast if it was more items it would have been better. All we got was a bar full of chocolate and sugar. Not happy with that:

I spend the most horrible nights of my life in this hotel the bathroom was clogged the a/c didn’t work property the shower didn’t work and they moved me to a different room and the shower didn’t work ither the water was extremely hot ,the door was broken you can get in the room without a key and is a lot more things that make not to stay in this hotel again

Not clean, not enough personal, no towels, no pillows, no sheets Nobody can help you, you should get to the lobby for paper, towels, toilet paper, etc. You have to clean your own room. No breakfast offered Internet conectaron terrible

My family of 6 booked to stay here 8/2/2021 thru 8/14/21. It has been terrible since we checked in. From the start very rude customer service from everyone we encountered. When we booked online the website stated “free hot breakfast” and when we arrived only cold bagged items were offered. One of the main reasons I booked here was for that, too avoid having to buy for 6 people each morning. I was told no housekeeping will enter the room, understandable due to COVID, and to leave the towels, trash and bedding outside my door and they will replace it with clean towels and linens and when I did so nothing happened. My family came back to the room at 10pm with no blankets, linens or clean towels and when I called the front desk was given attitude over the phone and very rude

The room has an extra $100 deposit added to your fee and is returned two or three days after your visit.  You will also pay an additional  $18.00 per car parking fee to park your car at the hotel you just paid for.  In case you don’t see this information on the website they will show you in bigger print at check In.  Apparently this is a problem and others must have complained. The room is charged immediately not right before you leave.

This place states it offers continental breakfast, but all you are getting is a muffin & juice. Also, room service is never done. We have trash piling up, no towels, & ran out of toilet paper. Would not recommend.

Summary Heading: Old, dark, dingy hallways. Lobby was terrible. Room was good.
Summary: Not worth the money they ask. Room was fine but lobby and hallways were horrible. Lobby looked scary hallways were dirty and dark. Swimming pool area was shabby. Not worth the money paid for. Lots of noise in hallways poor TV channels given.

Summary Heading: If you’re looking for a nasty nightmare, these are your people.
Summary: We arrived and were surprised to find out that our reservation we placed months prior AND called to confirm 48 hours prior was cancelled in the middle of the night before we arrived. They claimed that our credit card declined (spoiler alert: another hotel was able to run our card just fine an hour later so it wasn’t an issue on our end). So we were 1000 miles from home with 5 kids and suddenly no accommodations. However, as we dealt with the nightmare level customer service of this place, I began to realize what a blessing this might be while I had nothing I could do but look around the lobby. Rodent feces trailing under their worn down lobby couch, nasty old fake nails popped off and laying on the ground in random areas, old food chunks in corners, a thick layer of grimy dust

Summary Heading: La Quinta:  Now you're just somebody I used to know
Summary: I have stayed here many times while going to Disneyland;  with my kids and husband, with my Mom, with just my husband and with my husband and now grown daughter.  The layout of the room, proximity to the park and the buffet always made it my first choice.  I knew there would be no buffet with the pandemic, but I didn't expect a dirty room, no housekeeping of any kind and no luggage storage for later departure.  There is also a $100/night "security fee" that was put on my card at checkin that was never disclosed to me when I reserved on the La Quinta website.  That was never on there before.  I was really disappointed because this has been my "go to" place for a long time and it was so CRAPPY.  The woman who checked us in shortly after midnight Friday was nice and so was the guy

The hotel was quite dirty for regular situation but especially dirty during a pandemic. Never saw a single staff person cleaning other than the hotel maids. There was pee right in front of the stairwell door that took them over an hour to clean up. Each floor had its own unique odor.  None of the remotes worked without issue.

Really bad experience. The location is great, but that’s it. The hallways on level two, where littered with food and trash. Walls needed patching and painting. The room desperately needed to be cleaned/vacuumed. The couch was covered in sand. The shower was stained and mold all over.

Nothing special, you have to request everything at the main office so there's alot of back and forth. First day there the third floor reeked of weed. How did employees not notice that horrid smell.....

Summary Heading: Don't Stay at La Quinta, Anaheim
Summary: I was extremely disappointed with my stay at La Quinta, Anaheim. There was "no" maid service for the 4 days that I was there so my room was really messy and dirty with the 3 of us in the room. I had to beg the front desk clerks for towels and toilet paper and to get grief for it. The clerk rolled her eyes at me and acted completely annoyed because I needed these necessities. There is "no" continental breakfast even though their website states that there is. It's a lie! The front desk clerks are rude and very unfriendly. Do yourself a favor and find another hotel to stay at.

Late check in due to hotel staff, no internet on 5th floor, broken TV remote on check in, dirty pool area, no breakfast, understaffed. I would not recommend to anyone for the price. Motel 6 leaves better impression and costs a fraction of the price

Summary Heading: A/C didn’t work in the room.
Summary: Don’t go there. It’s a beat up hotel with one way in and one way out . It’s noisy and nasty 🤮 when you walk you can hear the floor cracking it’s terrible. I will never stay at Laquinta anymore. The staff is horrible because they didn’t try to help at all

Summary Heading: Would Not Recommend - Read all the reviews and trust it!
Summary: This was my second time booking at this hotel, last time being 6 years ago. I read the reviews and figured they were just being picky, but nope, it's as gross as they say. Dog poop everywhere around the property. I understand that it should be dog owner's responsibility to clean up after their pets, but that is obviously not happening, and nothing is being done about the dog poop by anyone. The rooms were dirty. The sofa was stained with dirt and looks like it too hasn't even cleaned in years. Bathroom had peeling paint. Tub didn't drain. Worst of all, the toilet overflowed on our first day of 4 days booked.  Called from desk, they came pulled out dirty toilet paper and put it in the wastebasket, didn't do anything about the tub. We asked for maintenance to help us mop up the

Slow internet. Vomit smelling hallways. Dirty bathtub. Extremely loud AC units. Horrible lighting. Only up side is how close it is to Disneyland. Breakfast was included but nobody told me (not the multiple calls I made before going and not upon arrival) that breakfast was unavailable. Got charged before arriving which I was told on the phone that that would not happen, as I wanted to put the room charge on a different card. Didn’t get that charge back until days after I checked out. Kept my security deposit but was told I would get the refund for the $100 5-7 business days later. Horrible experience and will not be trying La Quinta again.

I would agree with the terrible reviews for this hotel. For $200 a night with no amenities, why? The pandemic is winding down, I can only assume that they are trying to make more money. Yes, bring earplugs as the walls are very thin and they won't do anything to quiet loud neighbors. Stay somewhere else.

Wow, I typically don’t write bad reviews for places (this might actually be my first one-star review ever - you can see my history!), but I feel the need to warn others about this place. I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights with other family members, who chose and booked this place. By no means do I expect anything nice for a hotel like this, but it was actually disgusting.  The room and hallways smelled like a mix of chlorine and mildew. Since there was no housekeeping service whatsoever, I requested my own clean sheets, as they smelled musty and felt itchy my first night. Two sets of “clean” sheets had literal balls of long black hair in them and several strands all over the “fresh” pillowcases. I want to gag just thinking about it (see photo, which I’m deleting from my phone

Well...they took $111.70 from me to “hold” and I leave the room and they reimburse me $100. This place is a total joke, $11 or not you practically stole from me. That hotel was left exactly the way it was when we arrived. Dirty, other people’s hair on the wall in the shower...oh yeah and the tub flooded as I showered, like what a complete dump. I would be so embarrassed working here.

This place sucks. Even after June 15, all amenities are still closed. The pool and hot tub are gross and dirty, the wifi sucks, the staff is rude, the elevator hardly works, the ice machine is broken, the hotel is dirty, there are hobos, and you will absolutely have to sleep with earplugs to get any rest as the hotel creeks and rattles all night. Not happy for close to $200/night. Don’t pay more than $50/night for this dump. The hotel across the street (JW Marriott) is way better. You will be much better off staying at a different hotel.

Summary Heading: Worst hotel we have ever stayed in
Summary: There were Cockroaches in the bathrooms. Bugs and insect wings on the bed. TV was broken. Lock block on our room door malfunctioned locking us out of our room for over an hour. Staff would not provide us with pillows for the pullout sofa. No breakfast was served as advertised. Homeless people were trying to get into the hotel. The area is so sketchy that the staff keeps the lobby doors locked.

It was a great stay and rooms were clean and well done. Only had some problems with the wifi but other than that the stay was great and for a good price. Would recommend and would stay here again. Thank you!

I booked their “Spring Promotion” that offered free parking and free breakfast. When I arrived, they tried to charge me parking and asked me to look through my reservations to confirm my booking included parking initially claiming that I was wrong. After they realized I was right, I asked about breakfast as my reservation clearly noted free breakfast and I was told by the receptionist that they were NOT offering breakfast at this time. Not even a bagged breakfast!   Felt like we were totally lied to in their advertisement and website.  The walls are incredibly thin. We were woken up numerous times at night from loud people walking down the halls.  The light in our bathroom vanity didn’t work and the whole floor smelled like cigarettes.

Everything was just perfect. The staff was friendly, very helpful. The internet was the only thing I wasn’t happy about. It was really slow. I had to work from my laptop and I wasn’t able to connect at time. But when I did it was just slow. But everything else was just fine.

Summary Heading: Location is all it has going for itself
Summary: Beds were as hard as a rock. Some people may like that. But we didn’t. There were a few things also that weren’t so great. Front desk staff wasn’t so friendly. But the location of this hotel is great. That’s about it.

Compared to other la quinta properties this is a dump. The rooms were no clean and the hallways smelled terrible. I would stay in Buena Park next time and drive further to my destination rather than stay here again.

Stayed here in 2016 for 5 nights whilst visiting Disneyland.  Room was brilliant, it was made up of a main room with 2 double beds, a second room with double bed and double pullout, tv, wardrobe and fridge, small area for hot drinks and a bathroom.  Freshly decorated and plenty of room for us all.  Took about 10/15 minutes to walk to the park, although I believe there is a bus you can catch.  Staff were all brilliantly friendly and helpful.  Hotel style, over motel style so you felt safe coming home of an evening.  Right next to Garden Walk with plenty of restaurants and a few shops etc.  Breakfast was included and good, however super busy as to be expected at a hotel so close to Disneyland.  Only downside was the pool, it was super small and built under the hotel, so was

Just checked in about half an hour ago. While the room is okay, everything else about the place just screams multistory dirty motel. Hallways reeked of marijuana (IN the non smoking section) and a feint stink of mildew and possibly dog urine. Elevators and parking are littered with trash and bottle caps.   But most egregious is the bait and switch tactic of advertising a winning pool and breakfast. No such thing apparently. And yes, it is the time of Covid, but I’ve spent the last four weekends traveling up and down the state (in lieu of a normal vacation), and everywhere we’ve stayed (mind you, under the same state rules) have either allowed these services, alerted prior to booking they weren’t available, or made some attempt to compensate the visitor (walking breakfast to be

Summary Heading: BE AWARE OF PARKING FEE...Good Location
Summary: The property is showing wear and needs some polishing and replacing. Unlike other La Quinta's, they do not have a hot breakfast other than oatmeal and toast.   THEY CHARGE $18 (+tax) a day to park and DO NOT disclose this openly on the Wyndham website while making reservations. You have to click on the terms & conditions link for this disclosure.. NOT RIGHT! I felt very ripped off as they basically stole $60.00 from me as I had no choice other than to pay the additional parking fee as other hotels in the area were full. Shame on Wyndham for not posting the parking fee or just including it in the cost of the room
Manager Response: I am saddened to hear of the issues that occurred during your stay. Please rest assured we are taking the proper steps to address this issue in order to provide better service in the future. We appreciate your feedback about our breakfast as we are continually making improvements. Thank you for your review.

Summary: My sister booked this hotel for us for our trip to visit “the house of mouse” ie. Disneyland. When I read some of the reviews I must admit it did concern me a little however I was pleasantly surprised. The  staff at reception were friendly and efficient. The room we had was large ( they had us in a double room which had a double and queen sized bed separated by sliding French doors).  The  room was clean and the beds comfortable. Just a couple of little things were that indeed the walls are thin so if there is a Large excitable group like we had on the first night it can get noisy ( nothing that a polite would you mean just keeping it down a little wouldn’t fix). The second night no noise issues at all. The other is that breakfast is only served until  9 am ( other hotels is
Manager Response: I am glad to hear that you enjoyed our staff and the cleanliness of our hotel during your stay with us. We hope to have you with us again in the future. Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us.

Summary: This was our first time at La Quinta and I loved it. Great room with breakfast included.  One thing I appreciated was that our pet was welcome at no extra charge. We will make this our go to hotel.This is definitely  a great family hotel
Manager Response: I am glad to hear that you enjoyed bringing your pet with you during your stay with us. We look forward to having you with us again in the future. Thank you for taking the time to review our property.

Summary: It was nice being close to Disneyland but the quality is low. I thought the price was right but then they add the parking fee and there is no free shuttle to the Disneyland Parks. The beds were uncomfortable. The room's air quality was low.
Manager Response: I am saddened to hear of the issue with the mattresses in your room. Please rest assured we are taking the proper steps to address this issue with the beds in order to provide better service in the future. Thank you for your review.

Summary: Everything was great.  Was able to get early check in.  Front Desk very helpful.  15 minute walk to Disnelyand. Clean!!!  Breakfast was adequate, not typical LaQuinta breakfast otherwise would be five stars.
Manager Response: I am glad to hear that our staff were helpful to you during your stay with us. We appreciate your feedback on our breakfast, as we are continually making improvements to our property. We look forward to having you with us again int he future. Thank you for your review.

Summary: The location is good, the attendants were friendly and attentive. The bedding could be nicer and it was a bit noisy on the 2nd floor with car noise from the outside. There was some construction. Breakfast is decent.
Manager Response: I am glad you found our staff to be friendly and attentive to you during your stay with us. We appreciate your feedback on the noise issues, as we are continually making improvements to our property. Thank you for your review.

Summary: Not only was the service & family room absolutely perfect for our 7 family members to stay, we swam in January!  The hotel pool was under a patio covered area, heated and very accommodating with plenty of seating and towels. Nice jacuzzi too!  There is also a laundromat for drying all your swimming wear. The night we arrived we walked (1-2 minute walk) to the Anaheim Garden Walk to eat dinner. This area is full of photo ops and many other choices of activities and places to eat. We spent a couple of hours there and by the time we got back it was time for the kids to get ready for bed. Great time! In the morning  we were so grateful for the large breakfast room with plenty of seating. It was the perfect quick breakfast and we were off to Disneyland. Definitely planning another
Manager Response: I am glad to hear that you enjoyed our pool and the service of our staff during your stay with us. We look forward to having you with us again in the future. Thank you for taking the time to review our property.

Summary: The hotel is really run down and not kept up very well. Parking is horrible. The bed mattress was like a potato chip and you sink in the middle. You could feel every spring in the fold out couch bed, The ice maker on the 3rd floor was leaking.
Manager Response: Please allow me to express my sincerest apologies, as this is not the impression that we want you to have of our property. I am saddened to hear of the maintenance issues that occurred during your stay with us. Please rest assured we are taking the proper steps to address these issues in order to prevent any future occurrences. Thank you for taking the time to review our property.

Summary: My family all traveled to Disneyland to celebrate my daughters 2nd birthday, there was 17 of us total and we stayed in 5 rooms.  I loved their 2 bedroom suites, it made it so convenient to put the kids to be and still have a place to socialize and have a glass of wine at the end of the day.  The staff were all very friendly.  They called one night saying others were complaining about our noise level.  We had rooms close by and were all excited to see each-other.  We of course quieted down after but they were so friendly in the way they handled the situation.  The breakfast was a nice touch.  The rooms were clean and parking was easy.  The walk was about 20 minutes with a stroller to get to the parks.  Lots of my other family rode the bus if they didn't have a stroller.  I would
Manager Response: I am glad to hear that you and your family enjoyed the rooms and our staff during your stay with us. We look forward to having you with us again in the future. Thank you for taking the time to review our property.

Summary: 10min walk to Disney, lots of restaurants walking distance  and close the freeway Suite are big enough for a family staff are great . Breakfast is basic, toast , cereal enough to get  going. Large seating area
Manager Response: I am glad to hear that you enjoyed our staff and the location of our property during your stay with us. We look forward to having you with us again in the future. Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review.

Summary: The valet service is a scam. The valet attendant at night was parking valet vehicles in non valet spaces causing only valet parking to be available at the time the parks are closing. Forcing everyone to valet their vehicle and increasing his tips.
Manager Response: I am saddened to hear that there was an issue with our valet attendant during your stay with us. Please rest assured we are taking the proper steps to prevent any future occurrences. I hope you enjoyed the rest of your time with us.Thank you for your review.

Summary: Stayed 3 nights with 4 teenagers.  The 2 room suite with a trundle bed is very good for sleeping set up and privacy.  The breakfast has a lot to be desired but we got by eating cereal and bagels.   We bought our ART bus tickets  at the front desk and caught the bus next door.  Very convenient for getting to and from Disneyland.
Manager Response: I am glad to hear that the room was a good fit for you and your family. We look forward to having you with us again in the future. Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review.

Summary: The room was clean but the bed sheets had some hair. Not something you really wanna see when you stay the night somewhere to rest. The bath tub was missing pieces to it. So i would say the stay it’s self was alright.
Manager Response: Please allow me to express my sincerest apologies, as this is not the standard that we hold for our property. I am saddened to hear of the cleanliness issue that occurred during your stay with us. Please rest assured we are taking the proper steps to address this issue with our housekeeping team in order to prevent any future occurrences. Thank you for taking the time to review our property.

Summary: La Quinta Inn and Suites is a wonderful place to stay. From check in to checkout it had it all. A young man checked us in and helped us with getting our bus tickets to go to Disneyland each day. He was very kind, considerate and helpful. That first night we went across the street for dinner. There was Pizza, Cheesecake Factory, PF Chang's, and an entire couple of blocks of different food places called The Garden Walk. The bus was very easy to catch and was a short trip to Disneyland. The return trip was just as easy. Our suite was very clean and huge. It was a corner room and we could see the fireworks from our window. The breakfast was good with a good variety of food. The breakfast room accommodated enough people each day. The parking attendants (yes, there is a fee for
Manager Response: Wow, what a glowing review! I am happy to hear that your enjoyed your stay with us and that our staff was considerate and helpful. I am glad that the location worked out for you and your family. It sounds like you and your family had a great vacation. We look forward to having to having you stay with us again! Thank you for your review.

Summary: The staff it’s really nice and friendly!  someone was  knocking at our room door around 12:27am saying “service”,  which I don’t think it was someone from the hotel staff, probably it was a prank, but I got scared because we was sleeping already! Hotel manager and stuff be careful with this things!
Manager Response: I am glad to hear that you enjoyed the friendliness of our staff during your stay with us. We appreciate your feedback on the noise during your stay with us, and will make sure that our front desk team is properly informed of this. Thank you for your review.

Summary Heading: Clean rooms, but in need of upgrading.
Summary: Our two bedroom, two bathroom suite was a bargin at $199. it was clean, but in bad need of upgrading. Our bathroom door was warped and barely closed. Looks like it was repaired several times, but should have been replaced. The pool and spa were also outdated and had a strong smell of chlorine, enough we didn't even use it.  If you're on a budget, just want a clean room and don't mind outdated hotels, this hotel works fine. If you have a family, I recommend the two bedroom suites.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback, as we are continually making upgrades to our property. Please rest assured we are taking the proper steps to remedy the door issue in your room. I am glad you found your room to be clean during your stay with us. Thank you for your review.

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay. It was very clean and we enjoyed having the extra room. Location was great. We walked to Disneyland everyday and there is a grocery store up the street. For dinners we grabbed food from California Kitchen and other restaurants across the street. The breakfast was a little slim on protein. They only serve boiled eggs but they did the trick. The staff was really nice and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed the room and our staff during your stay with us. We appreciate your feedback on our breakfast, as we are continually making improvements to our property. We look forward to having you with us again in the future. Thank you for your review.

Summary: Stayed here on points. Got into our room which was quite large, but very outdated and musty smelling. Sat on the bed and could hear the springs creak. Moved to the couch and the same thing happened. Decided to cut our loses and pay for a room at Hyatt place down the street. Five stars for Hyatt place.
Manager Response: I am saddened to hear that the room was not up to your expectations for your stay with us. Please rest assured we are taking the proper steps to prevent any future occurrences. I hope you enjoyed the rest of your visit to Anaheim.Thank you for your review.

Summary Heading: Beds are TOO SMALL, If you want to sleep well.. pick somewhere else
Summary: The property does not have any Queen sized beds, only full sized beds. So, please make sure when you book the rooms that you are aware of the small beds. If you plan to sleep with your partner, go to another property.
Manager Response: I am saddened to hear that our beds were not the right fit for your stay with us. Please rest assured we are taking the proper steps to make sure that our guest's are properly informed on what size beds we have before their arrival. I hope you enjoyed the rest of your visit to Anaheim.Thank you for your review.

Summary: Service was awful, wet spots on the floor I suspect it was dog urine ,room air conditioner continually shutt off, I think there may be a motion sensor on it so when you’re sleeping it cuts off in the middle the night. Bed in extra room was Awful! Way too pricey for this hotel
Manager Response: Please allow me to express my sincerest apologies, as this is not the standard that we hold for our property. I am saddened to hear of the issues with our property that occurred during your stay. Please rest assured we are taking the proper steps to address the service and appearance issues in order to prevent any future occurrences. Here at La Quinta by Wyndham we strive to exceed your expectations. Thank you for your review.

Summary: The hotel is surprising clean and free of odor for being a pet friendly hotel! The rooms were very spacious and very clean. It would be nice if the parking lot is little bit bigger, a little more grassy area for the dogs, and better signage facing on-coming traffic on the Clementine street for drivers to find the place easier.
Manager Response: I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and that the rooms were clean and spacious for your stay with us. I appreciate your feedback on our pet area as we are continually making improvements to our property. We hope to have you stay with us again. Thank you!

Summary Heading: Not a great place to stay
Summary: The place wasn't all that clean,  had to pay $15 to park then when we went to park we were told there was no parking.  The unit was tiny, the divider glass was broken, sofa cushions sank in, sofa bed broken. With all the hotels in the area go somewhere else. we only stayed 1 night then moved to a different place for the rest of our trip. The room was also way over priced
Manager Response: I am saddened to hear of the parking and room issues that occurred during your stay with us. Please allow me to express my sincerest apologies, as this is not the standard that we hold for our property. Please rest assured we are taking the proper steps to address these issues to prevent future occurrences. We appreciate your feedback, as we are continually making improvements. Thank you for your review.

Summary: Disappointed with the accommodations. I’ve stayed at a number of la Quinta locations and this was by far the worst. Paying for the location, but not worth it. In the future I’d spend my money elsewhere.
Manager Response: I am saddened to hear that we did not exceed your expectations during your stay with us. Please allow me to express my sincerest apologies, as this is not the standard that we hold for our property. Please rest assured we are taking the proper steps to improve our property. Thank you for your review.

Summary: They literally scammed us and planted evidence. They claimed we broke the TV and put towels into the bathtub.  We were in room 504 and after I took a 10 minute shower I realized the tub wasn’t draining. We needed to pick up a friend for the airport and figured we’d let the front desk know before we left. They offered us a key for 502 but because we needed to pick up our friend from LAX in less than an hour we wouldn’t be able to move our stuff. She said it would be okay to do it when we got back and we would just leave our 504 room keys in the room.  We came back from picking our friend up and got back around a little after 1:00 am. We went and packed our items and moved them from 504 and 502 and I double checked the tub. It’s more than doubled in how much water was in it. I

Summary Heading: Make sure you don't forget anything when you leave!
Summary: I left my dirty laundry in one of the La Quinta laundry bags and the housekeeping staff either threw it away, didn't turn it in or didn't mark what room it came from.  Luckily I didn't leave any expensive clothing in the laundry bag.  Unfortunately, this issue left me with a negative overall experience with LaQuinta.
Manager Response: I am saddened to hear of the issue that occurred with locating your missing items. Please rest assured we took all the appropriate steps to locate these items, if they are located we will contact you immediately. Thank you for your review.

Summary: FLEAS!!  In not one but two rooms we booked!  And when we complained we got “well we are a pet friendly hotel”.  THAT WAS A HEALTH HAZARD. THEY NEED AN EXTERMINATOR.  We did end up getting two new rooms but no apology or concern. They swept it under the rug and just gave us new rooms. My boyfriend requested to speak to the manager, hoping making the problem known to a manager would get the health hazard taken care of or at least raise more concern. But no. The manager ignored all attempts at contacting him for the 2 days we were there.  Disappointing all around. Don’t take your family or dogs here.
Manager Response: I am saddened to hear of the housekeeping issue that occurred during your stay with us. Please allow me to express my sincerest apologies, as this is not the standard that we hold for our property. Please rest assured we are taking the proper steps to address these issues with both our housekeeping department and our front desk staff. We appreciate your feedback, as we are continually making improvements. Thank you for your review.

Summary Heading: Great family Accommodation for a disney trip
Summary: We stayed here for 3nights for a short disney vacation. Room was a good size for a family of 5 and we walked to and from disney with 3 children under 9 easily. There looks like there is a bus but we didn't use it. It suited what we needed for our stay and would recommend for families visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us, and that the room was just what your family was looking for  during your stay with us. We hope to have you with us again in the future. Thank you for your review.

Summary: Came for The Jimmy Buffett Concert at The Honda Center...excellent place to stay!! Would highly recommend it. Great location. Rooms are very spacious and the beds are super comfy. Did not try the breakfast.
Manager Response: I am glad to hear that you enjoyed the size of our rooms during your stay with us. Thank you for taking the time to review our property.

Summary: The website & reservations states there is a shuttle at a cost to Disneyland, upon arrival there is no shuttle we had to take an Uber. The breakfast is not continental its bread, juce, yogurt, cerial, banana, boiled eggs NO scrambled eggs  The bed sheets had been changed,  i found a toy between the the sheets from the previous guest, the bathtub had not been cleaned in weeks, there was filth on the walls and creases of the tub.
Manager Response: I am saddened to hear of the housekeeping issue that occurred during your stay with us. Please allow me to express my sincerest apologies, as this is not the standard that we hold for our property. Please rest assured we are taking the proper steps to address these issues with our housekeeping department. We appreciate your feedback, as we are continually making improvements. We do offer tickets at our front desk for the shuttle that is run by the city of Anaheim, I apologize for the confusion. Thank you for your review.

Summary: The parking seemed to be a little unorganized. When I checked in I was told it was self parking at $16/day.  A few hours later when I was in the lobby to purchase something from the shop the front desk agent told another guest that it was valet parking only but that it was free.  Not enough parking for the number of hotel rooms.   The dog area advertised online is not even close to accurate. Its a small 4ft area of grass and there weren’t any doggie bags.   Picture of the outside of the hotel is old, it has since been remodeled.   The AC was very loud.   The room size was gray and very spacious.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback, as we are continually making improvements to our property. Please rest assured we are taking the proper steps to update all sites for an accurate description of our properties amenities. I am glad you enjoyed the size of your room during your stay with us. Thank you for your review.

Summary: Nothing is as it seems in pictures. Out of date. Cleaning needs improvement. Breakfast is good some employees are very nice others are not. Location is very convenient if your going to Disneyland. Elevator outside the hotel is not very convenient.

Has a good service and staff is cool! We expect a full breakfast because we already been on another la quinta inn (san diego) and they had a very good food, that’s why we chose this one for out trip to disney, but it was ok! The only thing was that the parking is too expensive!

We booked a suite.  2 full beds in 1 room, king bed in 2nd room. Very spacious. 2 bathroom and 3 televisions.  20 minute walk to Disneyland but the Bus stop is right next to hotel, so that was very convenient when traveling with kids.   Parking is a joke.  They put cones on the parking spots and the covered garage is full. The parking attendant was very nice, but parking needs improvement.  Really liked the pool area.  It’s covered, but not heated.  Water was cold, but kids loved it since it was hot outside.

Summary Heading: Family sized rooms. No parking for family cars.
Summary: This hotel has big rooms for bringing the family to Disneyland. Enough room for a family of 6. We booked a room for a family of 6. Yet they only put 5 bath towels in the room. But big families headed to Disneyland generally drive vehicles that can carry a whole family, like minivans and SUV's. This place has tiny parking spaces and not very many of them. Over 100 rooms, but only 36 parking spaces in the garage. There are a dozen more tiny spaces outside, but the valet keeps half of them blocked off. Very happy with the room, but cannot return to a hotel where I can't get a place to park my car after 5pm.

Summary Heading: Worst stay at la quinta in my life
Summary: First, we were charged up front for all 4 days 3 nights. Which left us with having to stay at this hotel despite the horrible experience from day 1 since our money would not be refunded for 7 business days.. we asked. The bedding was covered with dog hair and I'm allergic to dogs so I asked for new blankets and I was told to come get them myself and that dogs were allowed throughout the hotel so it wouldn't do any good anyways. There is a parking fee that is not stated anywhere in the reservation itself, which at the very least they should let you know to plan on spending for, that was 50$ out the window. They are very rude. We tried to switch card information since they charged us the night before we were set to check in with the wrong card on file and we were told that we were

Summary Heading: Property is OK, woman behind desk needs to be replaced. Paid parking.
Summary: I stayed at this location and it was ok for the most part. Nothing wrong with the property but there is a woman that works the front desk with a  Y for her first name. I checked in with no vehicle. So I wasn't told there was a $15 charge for anyone parking even temporarily, including visitors. So visitors will cost you $15 if you have any, each car.  After I checked in, the next day I had a motorcycle with me. I came down later in the day to see a note that said parking was for guests only. I took the note to the front desk lady with a Y in her name, This lady told me that parking was $15 for any cars at all. I said I wasn't aware of that and I was a guests staying here, why is there a fee? Said it's for everyone, all cars. I said ok, thought about it for a minute and said "OK,

As a Disney annual passholder I have stayed many times over the last 12 month's. Great value. Great location. Comfy beds. Clean rooms. Pleasant staff. ART shuttle stop right behind hotel and they sell tickets at the front desk.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but $15 a day parking fee.
Summary: The property is clean and the service was very good.  But I cannot give more than an average rating to any hotel that lists car parking as available but does not inform you of a daily fee until you are checking in.

Summary Heading: Looks nice but disappointed after check-in
Summary: After check-in, a young lady called and knocked on door to ask for my ID and ask me to come see her in the lobby. She told me that they mistook me with another guest.  She could not find our reservation and ask me to pay again. After standing two hours in the lobby and calling the booking company, they found my reservation, thanks God. The whole time they made me feel like I was a fraud. We got to stay in the same room, but that night we couldn’t sleep because the AC was noisy & leaky and the bed was uncomfortable. The next morning, they moved us to a different room, which was less noisy but still uncomfortable bed.

Very comfortable stay in 2 bedroom suite. Reasonably priced and easy walk to disneyland. Plenty of room for 4 of us with the nice lounge area also.  Staff very friendly, would stay here again. $6 uber ride on the days you dont feel like walking to disneyland.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel for a short stay
Summary: We had a small suite with a king size bedroom and a pull out couch.  The beds were very comfortable.  The breakfast is very nice, but very busy.  The walk to Disneyland was just about 10 minutes.  This wouldn’t be a very luxurious hotel if that is what you are seeking, but if you plan to be away most of the day and only go there to sleep and shower I would recommend it.

Location was close to Disney but the room had roaches and the beds were very uncomfortable.  The property feels like it needs some updating from wear and tear and time.  During the seven days that we were there, they never changed the linens even though we had removed the sheets and covers and placed them on the floor.  We told the person at the front desk about the issues with the roaches and she didn’t seem surprised. We do not recommend this location.

Fairly spacious king bed room, had additional sitting room. Room was clean but more effort could be made in the common areas. I've stayed at a few La Quintas and this one surprised me with the poor breakfast offerings, ok for kids I guess and it is near Disneyland. Internet was spotty, sometimes good and sometimes not at all. They should be upfront about the $15/night parking fee, I hate surprises at check in.

When we arrived, the lobby was full of spilled food and when I pointed that out to the three staff members at the desk, they acknowledged that they knew about it.  There was also food and gum on the carpet on our floor, the fifth.  Our room was not cleaned when we asked before we left for several hours and when we returned, I was told that no one was available.  We were out of tissues, coffee, almost out of toilet paper and towels and our tiny wastebaskets were full from take out the night before.

Filthy room, bad parking, bad breakfast.  Found and stepped in dog poop in the room.  Good location Outside attendants nice and housekeeping staff helpful. We will never come back to this property again.

The rooms ok but the internet was very slow I was there with my family so hope the next time we can make  Overall was good but not enough time for breakfast  on the suite room we use the sofa to sleep but wasn’t comfortable to sleep make a lots of noises the springs

Plan on having your car valet parked.  Waffles were good at breakfast but there could be more choices in the protein department.  Good restaurants nearby.  Save $5 per entree rather than eating at Disney.

Shower was terrible, toilet ran all day,wasn't that clean, and I fell if your already paying to stay somewhere parking should be included. It was 15 dollars a day to park your car on the property its not that much but if your paying 500 dollars for the room you shouldn't have to pay for parking

Family vacation to Disneyland 2 day hotel stay was less than desirable. Room was not picked up or clean. Bed headboard dirty with handprints. Tub did not have stopper. Toilet paper not replaced or on roll holder shampoo and soap not replaced nor towels. Very disappointed. Will not stay there again.

Always a nice place to stay when visiting Disneyland with a pet.  As a "Gold points" member, this is perhaps our twentieth stay.  So I'll leave some of my normal comments.  It would be nice if some thought went in to presenting a nicer hot breakfast.  The addition of hot biscuits and gravy or small omelets with sausage would be a nice addition.  Other places like Best Western provide such items.  LaQuinta's toaster oven, rather than a real toaster, for making toast or heating a bagel turns out dry less than warm food, its oatmeal and bowl of yogurt is pretty minimal and outdated.   The internet while it does work is slow and difficult to search with, taking long pauses watching the hourglass before connecting. I also don't like La Quinta's new billing process under Wyndham.  It

Every year, a trade show brings me to Anaheim. I have stayed in countless hotels there and haven’t cared for any of them. The La Quinta is a fine, basic hotel, the rooms are spacious and clean and the location is good if you are here for a convention or Disney. From some rooms, you can hear a loud air conditioning/ventilation system. Ask for a room change if that disturbs you.

We booked Sheraton st Disney! They said in a conversation that they were pet friendly!! They are NOT!!! Got there and we were told we couldn’t leave the room without taking  our dogs!!! What???? We were meeting our little Goddaughters for Disney!! We gathered our luggage and checked out! It would have been a catastrophe but I called the front desk st La Wuibta, a ten minute walk to park and they booked me in a gorgeous room!! Two room suite!! We were checked in within 20 minutes!!! The dogs loved  it!! Their crates were in their own little room!! The staff was great!! The room was much nicer than the Sheraton!! Thank you so much!!!!

There were so many things wrong with this hotel stay! The staff was not the most friendly when we checked in, the window in our room on the FOURTH floor would not lock and my three year old was able to slide it open and there was no protective screen, the sliding door in the room kept coming off it’s track and would not open or close, the extra pillows I asked for were stained yellow with I’m not sure what, there was a nail sticking out of the carpet that my daughter stepped on, the frame our bed was on was broken, the pool area was gross. I asked for a refund, they gave me back my parking fee of $60 which I said was not sufficient and when I was put on hold to speak to the manager, no one ever picked up. When I spoke to the desk clerk, she gave me attitude and tried to tell me

This hotel is awesome for cost and location,  but it would have been great to know they charge $15 for parking when we booked our stay.  The staff was very helpful, and the hotel is pretty nice. We will likely stay again next time.

This company clearly does not care about their employees. They offer minimal accommodations. There is very little staff and their not very friendly. Breakfast is included but needed improvement. No bellman but they do have carts. This hotel is close to the attractions and accepts pets. If you can’t find a better review this one is ok if you can’t find anywhere else that takes pets. The rooms are neat and clean. We stayed in the two bed king suite. So if you can go a little smaller you could probably get more bang for your buck and earlier check in and later check out if you need it. Guess the room we stayed in was limited.

Desk clerk checked in new person, gave them our room key and room, that person robbed our room, then was given correct room and key. Employee refused to give info on robber to police, we were up all night with police, missed our day of vacation sleeping, and buying new toiletries that were taken, management never called us to see how we were doing for the next 2 days, we had to request a meeting with them upon checkout, our money was refunded to us, but did not cover our lisses. Dirty sheets, not enough towels, rude staff, breakfast is the same every day, no water pressure, leaking sink pipes. Broken TV that was never replaced.

Wonderful hotel accommodations for wheelchair users, we had such a great experience. Walking distance to Disney and other attractions. Curb side help was great. Wish there was a full breakfast and less smokers.

Found underwear and socks hanging from lamp shade, bodily fluids most likely throw up under tv stand, 4 days and never got extra pillows, king suite and you stare at a concrete wall of a parking structure. The list goes on this place needs to be bulldozed or completely renovated.

Was in town for business and had to stay in the area on night. Staff was nice and got me a ground floor room as requested. Room as nice and clean staff was friendly at check in. Bed was comfortable and room was quite and dark no problems sleeping. Good water pressure in the shower.   Will stay again next time down on business.

Summary Heading: Nice and clean but that was it
Summary: Beds too small no hot food items for breakfast upon checkout girl did not return my credit card, and when i called for it i was told it was not there but I'm 100 percent sure she did not return it with my reciept so i had to go thru the trouble of canceling it and reordering a new one

Kind of a mix of good and bad but comfortable enough.  Breakfast included, choices limited unless you like bread products. Close to ART transit stop.  Paid parking is available, $15/day.  Noises transfer from hall to rooms quite easily but we slept well enough as king beds were comfortable, extra bed was fairly hard so not as nice. Would stay again but may look elsewhere first.

I needed a room close to the House of Blues. Walking distance. Easy check in. Very nice room. Clean. Partied all night and walked back to an amazingly comfortable room. This will be my hotel for anything I plan to do when I'm visiting the Anaheim area.

We stayed here overnight on our way to San Diego.  I found this hotel to be clean and very quiet at night.  Parking is a little confusing, though.  There is a very small parking garage which has arrows directing you into the garage, but no arrows directing you out.  So it appears to be one way, but there's no other way to get out.  Maybe they could remove the arrows?!

Summary Heading: Poor ventilation which resulted in mold & mildew on windows
Summary: The suite had poor ventilation which resulted in mold & mildew that was visible on the windows. My family & I checked in with good health & checked out with congested noses & sore throats. Also the free breakfast had pre-made waffles that sat under a heated light bulb...try offering self made to order waffles.

Summary Heading: Not up to par with La Quinta
Summary: This is a great place for families as the hotel is walking distance to restaurant row and many family attractions.  When we stayed, the hall carpet was stained (dirty), there was thrash in the stair case, the water was shut off for maintenance.  The staff did a great job at notifying you of the water shut-off at check in.  We found empty bags in a drawer, hair in the bath tub a leaky shower faucet, and the water was slow to drain when we showered.  We were not aware that we had to pay for parking daily--which was priced competitively.   This hotel is not up to par with all of the LQ hotels which we have visited.  The highlight of our stay was the house keeping staff who always offered a smile and good day.  The minuses aside what we already shared, was that our online

Summary Heading: Nice pet friendly stay for the price
Summary: Overall, a good/ok stay. Location is great so you can walk to Disneyland, garden walk, as well as many restaurants around. Also, a 20 min walk to Anaheim convention center. And  it's a pet friendly hotel with no extra fees. The downside is that the breakfast room is in the same hallway where the guest rooms are located. People walk and talk loud while going to have breakfast and will wake you up in the morning.

Dont stay at this property you have to pay for parking. Elevator and garage was very dirty. The pool was located under the garage. Very noisy with guests running down the hallways. The housekeepers were very loud with their music blasting in the hallways.

We arrived about 2 hours before check in.   Staff was not friendly.  I have never stayed somewhere that you can’t check in and get through the payment process and have your room assigned to you when it is ready. There was no stopper for the bathtub so we had to put a washcloth in the drain to hold water. No exhaust fan in the bathroom area which made it ridiculously humid. Beds were very tiny mattresses were hard and rolled toward the middle.  We ended up leaving two days early to another hotel that we were much more satisfied with and it cost about $120 less for the two days  that was right across the street from the entrance to Disney.   I would never stay here again .

the fold out bed in the 2 bedroom suite was very uncomfortable, very thin with springs in your back.  First day the toilet broke and 2nd day had no hot water.  4 adults stayed in the room.  We had 3 washcloths, 2 small bottles of shampoo, 2 coffee cups, 2 coffee pods and one decaf. Walls very thin.  Would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Our toilet ran 24/7. The “breakfast” was anything but. I won’t stay here again. Hard bed too. Noisy guests running up and down the halls. Illegal cars parked between handicapped spots. Stairwell reeked of pot.

This hotel is a good value for the money. Each room/suite has a refrigerator and microwave oven, which came in handy on this trip. The room was clean and comfortable. It's very convenient to the Anaheim Garden Walk, and other shops and restaurants. If ever I return to Anaheim, I'd stay here again.

We didnt do Disneyland this time just stopping by on our roadtrip but we would definitely stay here again. The room was very spacious and clean. Just wished the breakfast option was better but not a big deal.

Great location and friendly staff. Was able to do early check in and late check out, hotel was very clean. Less than a mile walk to Disneyland and breakfast was good. Cons was paying extra for parking.

Upon checking in the front desk was not welcoming and wasn’t very helpful. We got there about 9pm and when we got to the room, we called the front desk to ask about more pillows for the pull out bed. They told me that was why they had 3 pillows on each bed so you could take 2 from the beds for the pull out. I asked if they had any extras and they said “ahhh we might have one hold on.... yeah, we have one. You can come down and get it if you want.” Then I asked if we could get more towels, as we had booked the room for 4 adults and 2 children and there was only 4 towels. They again told me that they were unsure if they had more towels. I understand it was 9pm, but I’ve never had any hotel tell me they didn’t have more towels! Unbelievable! They then told me that they found two

Part of our negative experience isn’t really their fault, but they play a role. This place is so bloody loud. If you stay, DO NOT stay on the 2nd floor. That’s where the breakfast room is and even though we are fairly far, people are so loud, and they walk by from using the second elevator, it’s just loud from pretty early. The doors slam closed and apparently most adults do not understand the simple concept of a controlled closing of a door. It’s beyond me. Nor do they understand the concept of inside voices. So while the hotel can’t enforce manners, it can make their hotel more “sound” friendly.  The part they totally have control over is the windows. I thought our window was open it was so loud, but nope. I didn’t know they made such thin windows.  Now we have stayed at other

Enjoyed our stay at this hotel.  Close to Disneyland and a Cheesecake Factory right across the street.  Breakfast was great!  Swimming pool and heated spa were appreciated by all.  Parking is tight but it was sufficient and well monitored.  Friendly & helpful staff.

The outside of the hotel says old school, but the rooms have been completely redone and they look great!  I was pleasantly surprised.  Everything was brand new and clean!  I would have given a better rating, but the price has gone up considerably in the last 6-8 years.

Summary Heading: No Hot water No Shower We dont care
Summary: Hotel staff didn't care that we had no hot water for shower at check in, no offer of compensation for this inconvenience, when mentioned at check out  reply was you should not have checked in. Had revs for month upon arrival you are told no hot water sorry, why not e-mail in advance

This hotel was amazing. It was quiet and clean. Staff were super friendly. And a plus, my chihuahua was able to join in on the fun. Parking was a little limited but we always had someone help if we needed it.

2nd floor is very loud in the morning for breakfast. Shower drain was very slow. Otherwise worth the price. Check in was easy and very accommodating, Uber to / from the parks is cheaper than the shuttle. Waking isn’t that bad either.

Close to Disneyland and the various meetings I needed to have. The room was quiet, comfortable and the price was reasonable for the quality of the facility and staff. I highly recommend this hotel if you are in Orange County

One of the best Hotels I stayed at. Didn’t add on extra fees at the end or once we got there. What I reserved online is what I got. Great staff and bomb breakfast. They warned us about kids but I didn’t hear too many kids past 9. A lot of guest were obviously for Disneyland and if I was headed to Disneyland I would love to stay at this hotel. Super close. Friendly staff. Kid friendly. Reasonable parking fee (although I may be biased because of sf area)  Was in town for a concert at house of blues and it was 3 min walk to the concert. I don’t normally do reviews but the place was very well deserving of a positive review.

This hotel has a few advantages but not many. Close to Disney and some good restaurants are located across the street. Now for the disadvantages; 1. Property is in poor shape 2. Rugs are filthy 3. Toilet had to be flushed 4-5 times for results 4. Staff with an attitude 5. Rate changed from $155 to $349. There is no way this place justifies $349. 6. Poor breakfast buffet

Great week. We have stayed here consistently for the last 5 years and will return again. Stephanie at the front desk was awesome and took care of us. Pool was nice but the hot tub was out of order during our stay. Close to restaurants and a close walk to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Building is so old it is falling apart. Motel8 is probably better than this dump
Summary: Tear this hotel down and build a new one.  It is so old it is like staying in a run down Motel8.  Why waste money on room remodeling if the building itself is falling apart.  You can see all the old rusted pipes in the parking garage.  The stairs to the parking garages are all rusted and falling apart.  The pool and hot look like they were built in the 60s.
