This hotel was close to Disney which we liked and was updated but the bedroom was in the front room and you could hear every noise in the hallway. The couch (living room) area was in the back which made no sense. The bed was too hard. We have stayed at many LaQuintas and always loved the bed. The breakfast was minimal. Just waffles, muffins, oatmeal. We have stayed at other LQ which served eggs, bacon etc.

Too bad the breakfast is lame I’ve stayed in lots la quintas and California ones have terrible breakfast and also you to pay for parking when you’re staying there. In the past you didn’t have to pay. That’s a little on the greedy side.

I am enjoying my stay here. If you’re working and don’t mind the hustle and bustle of Disneyland tourist, it’s pleasant. I would like to see more meat selections for breakfast. Staff is nice and helpful.

We came for a few days to go to Disneyland with our toddler.   Here are the cons: •The hottub was broken and the pool was very cold. We came from snowy Washington and were looking forward to swimming/soaking. That didn’t happen. •The walls are PAPER thin. We got woken up every night because we could hear dogs barking, and the drunk neighbors walking, talking and everything between. It was really annoying.  •The bus shuttle service is through a third party. It’s $5.50 per person, per day. You have to walk to the neighboring hotel to get on. Not only is the system they use very confusing, but the shuttle was late and caused us to be late for our day in Disneyland.  •The included breakfast didn’t have a ton of options (cold cereal, pre-made miniature waffles, oranges and

Summary Heading: Gives La Quinta a bad reputation
Summary: No hot water for 3 days, only comped for 2.  Breakfast was not the nice spread in the pictures.  The bathroom was disgusting, screws falling out of toilet paper holder, wall and door crumbling from what looks like rot, baseboards peeling away from the wall & tub, thin and rough sheets & blanket.  I’ve stayed at many La Quintas for work, which is why we chose this hotel for our family trip.  It was nothing like the others I’ve enjoyed staying in. It’s just gross, needs new carpet that isn’t stained & a complete overhaul - starting with the boilers that kept going out and leaving us without showering!

The only thing good about this place was how close it was to Disneyland.  The hot water hardly worked so I hope you like cold showers.  Don't let the signs in the elevator or hallways mislead you because they definitely don't have vending machine on their floors.  Their breakfast area is so small that you practically have stand when eating.  Don't bother reporting any problems with the smoke detectors, because they won't care.  Bottom line... Pay a little more and stay somewhere better.

Please beware that you will need to pay for $15 per day for parking even if they do not have parking space. Also, TV in your room is not guaranteed to be working properly and free breakfast is free but horrible.

We stayed here because we were traveling with a dog and La Quinta does allow does without a deposit which is nice. However, the appearance is not the best. The carpets are stained in the hallways pretty bad, some of the detail in the restroom was rusty and our shower water was cold in the morning which was odd. It's close to the park and the closest shuttle stop is 20 feet away, so that's a plus. You get what you pay for with this hotel.

The location is excellent for visiting Disneyland Resort.  The breakfast was excellent, very clean breakfast area.  The beds were comfortable and our room was very quiet.  We used the fridge and microwave which was very handy.

We arrived at the hotel close to noon Feb 18 via an Uber from LAX. The lady at the front desk said check in was at 3P. No rooms were available yet and probably would not be until that time. Seemed odd that she was stressing the 3P check in. Most places have a time like that but usually will let you in earlier as they clean the rooms.   They took our bag to keep behind the front desk until we came back to actually check in to a room. We went to Downtown Disney and took an Uber back. When we arrived back at the hotel, a gentleman was very upset they didn’t have hot water. I talked to the front desk and asked what was going on. Jenny said there had not been hot water since this morning due to the boiler breaking down. They were HOPING it would be fixed tomorrow. I asked why I

Summary Heading: Accepts dogs, but not trult dog friendly
Summary: There is zero area for your dog to do it's business, unless they are willing to poo in the parking lot.  Not 1 blade of grass.  We had to walk to another hotel to use their grassy area.   Employees, well most employees, were friendly.

Stay ANYWHERE else.  We moved after one night to the hotel next door!!!!!! We could not sleep because of the noise of rooms around us.  A maintenance Man walked straight into our room without knocking and mumbled something about a blocked sink and left????  It just felt rundown, cheap and unsafe.

Wish we could have had someone respond to our complaint about no hot water.  We called everyday and asked that someone would come take a look and never received help.  Also the shower dripped all night long.  This made for a long night.  The bed in the second room is made of concrete.

Hotel had no hot water in my room and the dryer in the laundry room was broken.  Staff were unapologetic and didn't seem to care that their guests could not shower or dry their we clothes after being out in the rain all day.  They need some training in customer service.

Summary Heading: Good stay, could use some upgrades
Summary: Overall, we enjoyed our stay. The room was as advertised. However, I feel the bathrooms need to be upgraded. The breakfast was just okay, but the service and friendliness of the staff was wonderful.  It was definitely a good deal for the money and not a far walk from Disneyland.

Everything was ok, buy staff gave us a room with special needs , meaning bathroom big an close to elevators , nice stay , breakfast ok , you know la quita style, they help us with park tickets , shuttle , parking fee is not show when you place your reservation

I stayed at this hotel to go to Disneyland. Is very close to the parks and you can pay $5 to use the shuttle to the park for one day or just walk for 10 minutes. I took a taxi because the day I went it was raining a lot. The room was big and clean, I would return for that. The breakfast though was very simple to me. It had the basic things but the non-packaged food were very few and mostly pastries. I didn't know if those were lactose free and because I'm lactose intolerant, I had to take a lactase pill.

Breakfast is kne of the lamest out of any La Quinta I’ve stayed at. Pathetic. Barely any TV channels either. Not enough space to take your dog to use the bathroom. Service was great with friendly staff. They need better breakfast at least with eggs and hash browns. Waffles and oatmeal are bust. Waffles over cooked and hard and oats under cooked really bad. Hard boiled eggs were shameful and looked old.

Very nice hotel. I was not happy about paying $15 for parking. My daughter came to visit for a few hours and was told to pay $15 to park. So if you have visitors coming you have to go somewhere else.  Overall  everything was going

Ok hotel.   But not environmentally friendly at all which is a shame in 2019.   Breakfast only served with onetime use plastic utensils and styrofoam plates/cups.  They could at the minimum use paper cup/plates.   Absolutely zero recycling available on site (room, lobby)  Shame

Great customer service. Their rooms are very clean and spacious. Breakfast was great. The service personnel was amazing. It was perfect for my family and I to go to and from the parks. Very friendly family oriented place.

Summary Heading: Anaheim La Quinta Fails to please
Summary: This La Quinta failed miserably in hospitality. The desk clerks were terribly rude and impatient. The breakfast is quite limited. The property is just ok. With so many choices, choose another option to make your Anaheim stay enjoyable.

I didn't have high expectations based on the stars but I was pleasantly surprised!  I took the family down to Disneyland and decided on this property because of the 2 room suite. I had a room that had enough space to sleep 6!  There were 2 double beds in one room and the other was a double with a trundle under it.  It was perfect for separating the pre-teen girls from the younger boys.  The heated pool and hot tub were amazing and got used quite a bit from us!  There is a large TV in the pool area and nice lounge space with couches.  The shuttle to Disneyland was right at the hotel...very quick!  Great space for the price!

My wife really liked the decor.  Service was good.  Price was very good.  Great, easy location.  Breakfast was very mediocre.  I had gone back to the lobby to get an extra blanket.  The young lady behind the counter was on the phone, after a few minutes, a young man who was standing next to the counter, and apparently  worked there, asked if I needed an extra blanket.  When I said yes, he immediately got one for me.

Visited Disneyland during peak season when all hotels charges an arm and leg. Was able to book a room for a two night stay in this hotel last minute at about $156/night. It is a basic hotel, clean, basic continental breakfast, nothing fancy. Plus for this place: location, clean, serves the purpose of an inexpensive place to stay when visiting Disneyland.

We travel every couple months and have recently committed to staying at LaQuinta's. While this is a short walk to Disneyland this hotel misses the mark on Customer Service and Room quality. We stayed in the 2 room king suite. Our bed was hard, and not just not a pillow top hard but box spring hard. Also, there were no pillows on the sleeper sofa and when we called down to inquire about getting a few the staff was less than friendly and I quote "there is 5 on the bed use those" and hung up. Also the breakfast left a lot to be desired. It was constantly out waffles, fruit, milk etc leaving the only options toast or yogurt. The staff was disinterested in helping and made it to the point you didn't want to ask for help. Parking here was $15.00 but included valet service which we

Good price for nice rooms, service was very good. Staff was friendly and courteous. Close to Disneyland and other shops and restaurants. Breakfast was ok, would of like to see more hot food like eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, more variety in hot foods. No smoking in stairwells, please. It stunk

This place is conveniently located within 10 mins walk of Disneyland and close to food and shopping areas. The room was comfortable and clean though the bathroom could be improved. There was spacious living area and the beds were comfortable, would come here again due to location.

Our room was very nice - like a suite. The staff was excellent. Our problem arose from the fact that, while we had booked our room with understanding that it was to be 3 different rooms in 5 nights, they would try to put us in 1 room for our entire stay. They were unable to arrange that so we sadly cancelled our stay with them.

I had an ac issue which caused my room to sound like a rain storm at 1:30 am. All I heard all night was dripping. I called and they said they’d fix it. They did attempt to fix it but not before most of my already packed stroller which was ready for Disney, got soaked. I had to buy new shoes for my two daughters and niece. When I checked out, the agent at the desk offered to cover my parking (I didn’t complain abu my belongings I just wanted to speak to a manager) I was advised that no one was on duty and she credited me one night stay and still charged me for parking. In the chaos we left my nieces first pair of boots in the room to dry and ended up forgetting them. Now I’m trying to get them shipped to us , they’re saying they can’t quote me a shipping price until I authorize

We greatly enjoyed our stay at the La Quinta in Anaheim. Room was clean and spacious and the staff was wonderful. We were able to bring our family dog and leave him in the room while we visited the park. Our toilet handle broke and they quickly fixed the issue. It was nice to have a mini fridge and microwave in our room. There was a separate living area that closed off with a sliding door, perfect for our dog. It was close to Disneyland (walking distance) and the Gardenwalk was just across the street.  The staff was friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Even after we checked out, the helpful service continued. Our daughter thought she left her stuffy in the room and we were already a hundred miles away. I spoke to the front desk and the gentleman I spoke with personally went

Close to Disneyland.  SHORT breakfast hours- no exceptions!  A bit over priced- but I guess you are paying for location, location, location.  Shuttle bus is a great value, too.  Staff are friendly and helpful.

Trip with family to celebrate a birthday at Disneyland for our granddaughter. The room was clean but was disappointed with the barking from the dogs I did not know they allow dogs there would have thought about it and is it a little different before booking the room

It was a great stay overall , staff is friendly . Rooms are spacious , could use some work in the bathroom but not complaining , great for long day after Disney. Super close to restaurants and cheap Uber rides to and from

Summary Heading: Great Find Just a Short Distance from Disneyland
Summary: Stayed for business and leisure.  Room was clean and well kept.  Front desk staff were very friendly. The hallway outside of my room got a little noisy at times with excited children but it wasn't too bad. I didn't get a chance to have breakfast at the property but perhaps next time.  The location was convenient and just a short 10-15 minute walk to Disneyland.  Plenty of shops and restaurants nearby as well. Will be returning!

Although location was wonderful for walking to Disney and also having a pick up location in the rear for bus transportation our stay did come with some hiccups. Breakfast room was small for the amount of guest and only had mini waffles, oatmeal, cereals, yogurt, selection of breads, boiled eggs and some fruit. Parking is $15 a night. Our shower didn’t have heat for a day. If guest were loud enough you can hear them though the walls at times. Other than that the hotel employees were extremely wonderful and nice.

Summary Heading: Excellent value for a low price!
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel probably around 8-10 times, and will continue going back! The staff are great and rooms are very large and accommodate families. You are close to Disneyland and can pay for the shuttle to/from the park (less than 10 minutes). Another perk is that the shuttle to this hotel isn't completely full like alot of other hotels.

This hotel is very loud. Windows let a lot of noise in and the doors all slam. The breakfast was very weak. The room was nice, but the hotel was very basic. La Quinta hotels are all SO different. Some are really nice, some are far from it. Hard to know what you are going to get. VERY inconsistent.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, a little far from the parks
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel a few times, and we really love the rooms.  We travel as a family, and we rent one of the biggest rooms (1 king, 2 double, 1 sofa sleeper), and it has been great for us.  The only downside is the distance from the parks.  It is a longer walk to the parks from this hotel, but it is a great location for shopping at the nearby mall, and a lot of restaurants are close by.

The hotel was clean and spacious for our family of 4. Breakfast in the morning was decent , nothing too exciting. It only took about 15-20 minutes to walk to Disneyland. Overall a great experience and their pool is nice!

Summary Heading: average stay. 1 thing alone may keep me from returning here
Summary: clean rooms. friendly staff. good location. price was alright. i feel like i could have gotten a better hotel for a similar price. i stayed at the Marriott on convention earlier this year for less than what i paid here. i dont think i would stay here again because i can literally hear the neighbor rooms and rooms above WALK, let alone talk. i can only imagine they also heard us. and my gf and i have loud sex. not sure if i would stay here again for that sole reason. but i might.

Summary Heading: Amazing great staff service will stay again.
Summary: To cleaness to room and beds very comfortable and the staff at the breakfast was great we got there late but they let us in to get our food to be able to take to our room thank to all staff at La Quinta Inn in  Anaheim California

Summary Heading: Very good location and good restful sleep
Summary: It is a very good place to bring your family.  Specially, if your are going to Disneyland and California Adventure Parks.  Taking the shuttle bus saves you time and money at the Disneyland parking lot.  The free breakfast is very good for the whole family.  It is adequate for a good morning start.  I have been staying at this La Quinta Inn for over 25 years.

Other than the location, walking distance to Disney, super easy!!  The room was hot, the AC unit was auto set to heat and no way to change it to cold, it was terrible... the noise factor horrible, we were on the 4th floor and there was continuous noise at all hours

This hotel is in a good locaton and i like the room set up when travelling and need two separate sleeping rooms.The main bedroom was nice but I travelling with my adult kids and i got the pull out. It was noisy every time i moved on it and uncomfortable old style not memory foam.The couch altho attractive had some minor staining as did the window sheers , both easily remedies if the hotel wanted good reviews. Typical of DL hotels some minor repairs would help including the main entrance ceiling that needs repair and their hotel washrooms need to be cleaned more regularly including floors.I notified the front desk about the one by the cafeteria as it was nasty and they did send someone to clean it The one thing that would stop me from using this hotel again as i find not

Very traveler friendly. I have traveled for over two decades now and have found that la Quinta has always been a constant. Great rooms and service wherever you stay and this one was no different......

The entrance to the building was nice and the staff kind.  I cannot get out of my mind the fact that the bedding on the pull out bed was stained with urine.  The smell was there but unable to pinpoint until pulling all the sheets down.  Although a nonsmoking hotel, the guests smoked at the entrance as they wait for their cars.  The fee of $12 a night per vehicle I thought was unreasonable but I should have read the small print. Rooms are very cramped.
Manager Response: Valued Guest,  We are very sorry to hear of your negative experience while staying with us.  We appreciate the constructive critique, as we are continuously striving to improve our guest experience.  It is only through your feedback that improvements are considered and made.  Our hope is that you will give us a chance to better serve you in the future.  We very much appreciate your business and thank you for staying with us.    Sincerely,   Danielle  LQ Customer Care

Summary: My family had the three room suite and it was just perfect. The hotel staff was very friendly and the breakfast was good. It was close to Disneyland and the bus picked up right outside the hotel. There where tons of families that stayed at the hotel and everyone we spoke to was very friendly.

The hotel was very clean, good size room for the price, close to Diseyland.  I like that the shuttle is right behind the hotel and didn't have to move our vehicles the whole time we were there.  The breakfast can be improved a little, but overall it's fine.

As stated I was unhappy with this hotel almost from the time of arrival, hidden fees, dirty sheets on one bed,pool was full on leaves, breakfast only adequate and loss of hot water one evening on our return from a long day at Disneyland.
Manager Response: I’ve read your comments about your stay at La Quinta Anaheim.  WOW – not the type of experience we want you to have!  Our goal is to provide you with a positive, memorable experience each and every time you stay with us as our guest.  I’m sorry that we didn’t do so for you. Rest assured your comments will be shared with our team, and it’s through comments such as yours that we’re able to improve.  Thanks again for your time, and I hope that in your travels you’ll once again consider La Quinta Inn and Suites as your choice for lodging accommodations.

Summary: The rooms were wonderful; the beds were separate from the TV room.  (Very comfortable beds)  The breakfast was great with waffles, cereal, eggs, muffins, etc.  This hotel was very close to the Garden Walk and only a 15 minute walk to Disneyland.  The ART bus is also very convenient. The staff was always very pleasant and helped with any questions about getting around the area.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback! I’m pleased to hear that you had such an enjoyable stay at Anaheim La Quinta. Our team looks forward to providing you with exceptional service in the future.  It’s our commitment to serve our guests to our best ability and hope to always exceed your expectations.  We’ll see you soon.

Summary: Rooms are clean and most importantly the beds are very comfortable and you get a wonderful night sleep. The staff at this hotel is very friendly and helpful. Will definitely be staying here again when we go down there again.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback! I’m pleased to hear that you had such an enjoyable stay at Anaheim La Quinta. Our team looks forward to providing you with exceptional service in the future.  It’s our commitment to serve our guests to our best ability and hope to always exceed your expectations.  We’ll see you soon.

Summary: This was our second time staying at this location and it was perfect. Everything is clean and comfortable. Staff is super friendly and helpful. I love the fact that I can bring my  dog with me when I stay here.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback! I’m pleased to hear that you had such an enjoyable stay at Anaheim La Quinta. Our team looks forward to providing you with exceptional service in the future.  It’s our commitment to serve our guests to our best ability and hope to always exceed your expectations.  We’ll see you soon.

Summary: Nice hotel - clean, pleasant staff, good location (walked to Disneyland, about four blocks), near restaurants (though some of those were a bit pricey). A nice place to stay overall at a reasonable price.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback! I’m pleased to hear that you had such an enjoyable stay at Anaheim La Quinta. Our team looks forward to providing you with exceptional service in the future.  It’s our commitment to serve our guests to our best ability and hope to always exceed your expectations.  We’ll see you soon.

Summary: though the hotel advertises a "breakfast" it really is a continental breakfast, not a full breakfast like other La Quinta Inns.  The place needs updating and attention to detail in cleaning and maintenance.
Manager Response: I’ve read your comments about your stay at La Quinta Anaheim.  WOW – not the type of experience we want you to have!  Our goal is to provide you with a positive, memorable experience each and every time you stay with us as our guest.  I’m sorry that we didn’t do so for you. Rest assured your comments will be shared with our team, and it’s through comments such as yours that we’re able to improve.  Thanks again for your time, and I hope that in your travels you’ll once again consider La Quinta Inn and Suites as your choice for lodging accommodations.

Summary: Good value if you want to be near Disneyland.  Front Desk agent was very friendly, helpful and efficient.  Rooms are fine.  It's nice that they're all suites, and have mini-fridge and microwave.  Great for families.

Where can I start the room was okay but the bathroom was the worst the tub had a crack and from one side was higher than the other the toilet was clogged  this is the first time staying at this location and probably my last the valet guys were great
Manager Response: I’ve read your comments about your stay at La Quinta Anaheim.  WOW – not the type of experience we want you to have!  Our goal is to provide you with a positive, memorable experience each and every time you stay with us as our guest.  I’m sorry that we didn’t do so for you. Rest assured your comments will be shared with our team, and it’s through comments such as yours that we’re able to improve.  Thanks again for your time, and I hope that in your travels you’ll once again consider La Quinta Inn and Suites as your choice for lodging accommodations.

Summary: Love staying here.  Staff are very friendly.  Facility is very clean and modern.  Valet parking eliminates a problem of finding a space on my own.  Good breakfast.  Check-in and departure always a breeze.  Will definitely rebook here.
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to tell us about your experience at La Quinta Anaheim. Your satisfaction and continued trust in La Quinta Inn and Suites are our top priorities.  I look forward to showing you that we’re working hard to make sure each visit meets your expectations and our high standards.  Thanks again for your time, and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: This hotel is a great place to stay near Disneyland! Disneyland is an easy walk away. The room was spacious, with a separate living room area and sleeping area. The living room area is by the window, so even though there was construction going on across the street it was quiet and peaceful. The staff couldn't have been more helpful when we left a small item in the room and needed it sent back. I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to tell us about your experience at La Quinta Anaheim. Your satisfaction and continued trust in La Quinta Inn and Suites are our top priorities.  I look forward to showing you that we’re working hard to make sure each visit meets your expectations and our high standards.  Thanks again for your time, and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: I’ve stayed here twice, and like that there are rooms available that have a living room with a sofa bed.  Having a little extra space helps keep everyone happy.  Rooms are clean and comfortable.  Free breakfast is nice but basic...just waffles, cereal, yogurt and hard boiled eggs.  Located at the beginning of the shuttle route, so there’s always plenty of space on the bus on he way to the park, and one on the first stops on the way back.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback! I’m pleased to hear that you had such an enjoyable stay at Anaheim La Quinta. Our team looks forward to providing you with exceptional service in the future.  It’s our commitment to serve our guests to our best ability and hope to always exceed your expectations.  We’ll see you soon.

Summary: Although some have posted bad reviews, we had a great experience!  Comfortable room, good value, nice location!    We stayed two nights at the La Quinta Inn & Suites Anaheim this past week.  Were very happy with our experience.  Had a Two Room Two Double One King Suite w/Sleeper Sofa for our group of six.  Enjoyed having beds for everyone plus two bathrooms.  Enjoyed the convenience of a free breakfast plus valet parking included in the $12 parking fee.    Bought one-day bus passes to ride ART (07 Hotel Circle Clementine Line) to Disneyland.  Convenient stop just behind hotel, though the bus did not come every 20 minutes as advertised on the site.  You can text 41411 to see when the next bus will arrive (text 'RIDEART 2020' to see when it is expected at La Quinta Inn, text
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback! I’m pleased to hear that you had such an enjoyable stay at Anaheim La Quinta. Our team looks forward to providing you with exceptional service in the future.  It’s our commitment to serve our guests to our best ability and hope to always exceed your expectations.  We’ll see you soon.

Summary: As an elite member I would not expect a room next to the elevators, in such a busy and noisy place. The room was dark as some light bulbs were burnt out. Pillows were hard and lumpy (perhaps time for some new ones) Directly below our window were the garbage bins and garbage was picked up at 5:30 am. We tried to purchase adult Disneyland tickets from the front end staff who first told us she did not have any. Staff member beside her said yes we do. We bought and paid for two adult tickets. The next morning on the way to the park I noticed she have given us two children's tickets. When I tried to exchange them with the same staff member, she was not very helpful or polite. Bathroom was also not the cleanest. Definitely would not recommend this hotel to others.
Manager Response: I’ve read your comments about your stay at La Quinta Anaheim.  WOW – not the type of experience we want you to have!  Our goal is to provide you with a positive, memorable experience each and every time you stay with us as our guest.  I’m sorry that we didn’t do so for you. Rest assured your comments will be shared with our team, and it’s through comments such as yours that we’re able to improve.  Thanks again for your time, and I hope that in your travels you’ll once again consider La Quinta Inn and Suites as your choice for lodging accommodations.

Summary: Stayed here this past weekend. The staff is super friendly. The room was ok. We did have to drive to the park. One day after a very long day walking we decided to take a Lyft- that was super easy. The staff was very accommodating. The only upsetting part was the pool. The pool looked  like it had been “under construction” for awhile. That was the only issue. If you want a place to rest your head and don’t mind dogs. This is a pet friendly hotel. And don’t care about a pool. We were also fortunate to see the fireworks from our room, every night.

Was very upset because my family and I looked forward to swimming in the pool as we checked in we were not told it was under construction and that we could use the pool next door, then our room door was open as we got to our room. Didn’t feel right. We were charged a parking fee and weren’t aware of one. Hope for a great experience but didn’t. Rooms were clean distance to Disneyland was fine. Will not be staying again.
Manager Response: I’ve read your comments about your stay at La Quinta Anaheim.  WOW – not the type of experience we want you to have!  Our goal is to provide you with a positive, memorable experience each and every time you stay with us as our guest.  I’m sorry that we didn’t do so for you. Summary: Poor quality of service, air condition rattled, sheets not change, dirty, toilet plumbing not working accurately, no wake up calls, front desk did not answer phones, breakfast was adequate, not much of a selection

Summary: It's clean and the staff is friendly. I had a leak in my room and they promptly gave me another room and comp'd my parking fee for the trouble. This is not a 5 star hotel, but it's clean and has comfortable beds and nice tubs. What more do you need after a day at Disney? It's also across the street from some excellent restaurants at Anaheim Gardenwalk. Cheesecake Factory, PF Changs, Bubba Gumps. They have selections from McCormick & Schmick's Grille to Johnny Rockets. There's definitely something for everyone here.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback! I’m pleased to hear that you had such an enjoyable stay at Anaheim La Quinta. Our team looks forward to providing you with exceptional service in the future.  It’s our commitment to serve our guests to our best ability and hope to always exceed your expectations.  We’ll see you soon.

Summary: Stay in a lot of LQ's and I do have some commits on this stay. We were placed at the end of the hallway next to the laundry room. Throughout the night the staff kept coming and going the the laundry door would slam shut waking us up. Then around 5:30 the staff coming to work would stand in the hall and with loud voices chit chat. Not the way I wanted to wake up. The breakfast area was very clean and well stocked. The front desk staff was very friendly and pleasant.

Summary: Reason for not staying here: 1) Rooms were less than clean 2) Dresser drawer would not stay closed and childred kept running into it 3) Curtains we very dusty and gross 4) Breakfast options were the same every morning (soggy waffles).   5) Pool was not available to be used for our little kids.  Reason to consider: 1) 10 minute walk to Disneyland

Summary: I was able to book a family suite for my friend and I, and though we didn't need that much space, it was nice to have separate rooms for the night. It was a very convenient 20 min walk to Disneyland, so if you don't mind a walk, it was very pleasant. We were even able to leave our car during the day the next day while at the park all day, though we only had stayed for the night prior. The front staff was friendly and knowledgeable and the only thing that was a bit irritating is the lack of vending machines on our floor, despite signs saying they were available. other than that, great stay for $100.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback! I’m pleased to hear that you had such an enjoyable stay at Anaheim La Quinta. Our team looks forward to providing you with exceptional service in the future.  It’s our commitment to serve our guests to our best ability and hope to always exceed your expectations.  We’ll see you soon.

Summary: Convenient to the convention center and Disneyland, a variety of foods to eat nearby. Had to pay an extra 12 dollars a day to park in the hotel parking that was full and had to pay for valet parking on top of that to park in the lower level of the hotels garage.
Manager Response: I’ve received your review of La Quinta Anaheim. Looks like there was some form of miscommunication, I do apologize. There is a parking fee, but we do not charge valet on top of that. Valet is included with the parking fee.  I appreciate your feedback. Rest assured your comments will be shared with our team, and it’s through comments such as yours that we’re able to improve.  Thanks again for your time, and hope we’ll see you back with us at La Quinta Inn and Suites once again.

Summary Heading: This is the first and last time using La Quinta.
Summary: Cockroaches in room. Toilet didn't flush. AC didn't work in one of the rooms. Both tubs leaked. Thin sound barrier from above. The beds were old and had huge dips from excessive use. Sounded like olympic games were being held upstairs. They comped us one night even though we asked for no discounts.

Summary: The hotel staff was very rude! We could tell the sheets on the bed were not changed so we called down to the front desk and they told us we do not have any sheet to give right now and started yelling at us on the phone.  Really what kind of response is that!!!  Also the room next to me had a dog that barked all night!  We ended up checking out early.  Will never stay there again or refer anyone.

Summary: I have been at this hotel several times over the past several years, this time the staff was not up to the standard of the hotel. otherwise great hotel, good price, clean.  Enjoy staying at this hotel.

Summary Heading: Older Hotel a Few Blocks From Disneyland
Summary: All suites hotel states; they have put a wall in the room with sliding glass paneled Frenchdoor to create the suite effect. Very small bathroom with shower, separate sink in room. That said, 2 TV's, pullout sofa in one side and King bed in other w 2 dressers, closet az nd luggage rack. Good maid service, helpful front desk. Guest laundry a plus. Breakfast not that great compared to most LaQuinta prperties. Use the resort shuttle service, but walking to restaurants and Disney not very far. Big construction across street did not bother us. $12  a day parking fee.

Great location, excellent service and location. Hotel had tickets for Dinsneyland and a shuttle to Disneyland. Easy freeway access. The pool seemed a little small, didn't get a chance to try it. Parking was easy, the valet was very helpful. Excellent customer service all around.

Great price for the location.  The rooms are great for families.  A little closer to walk to Disneyland would be nice but I can’t complain with the price and quality of the room.  La Quinta breakfast is always pretty mediocre quality, but for free it gets up by until lunch.  I was impressed that at this stay they had upgraded to actual brewed coffee over the machines with instant that they usually have.  If they upgrade their powdered “scrambled” eggs and offer real butter it will be a welcome improvement.  Either way, this is a great place for our family to stay while on vacation.

My husband and I enjoyed a special birthday getaway.  This hotel was in a fantastic location - close to restaurants and Disneyland.  It was very easy to use the A.R.T; bus to the park as well as area stores.Rooms were clean and larger than many in the area.  Valet parking was an added bonus. Only drawback was the breakfast, which featured less items than most.

We stayed here for 6 days while we went to Disneyland. We were told the hotel was a 5-10 minute walk but it's probably more than 20 minutes. The rooms were clean and beds were made every morning so that was nice to come back to. They serve free breakfast. The only downfalls were the pool didn't work for six days while we were here. They told us we could use the hotels next door but when we did we got locked outside because we didn't have a key to their hotel. Our room keys kept getting demagnetized or something because they didn't work every time we left the room and came back to use them. Another thing, there's only two washers and dryers and they were always full so we didn't get a chance to do any laundry. The staff was nice though.

To begin with the positive...the large suite we booked for our trip lived up to our expectations. However, upon arrival we were informed that the pool was not in service. I had called the day before arriving and commented on how we were looking forward to our holiday including relaxing pool time; nothing was mentioned. We were told upon arrival that they were working on the pool and it was being serviced. In the entire week we were there, we did not once see anyone there working on the pool and we were told the exact same thing every day. The breakfast was ok...typical of what you would expect. Quite a distance from the parks but ok if you dont mind the walk. Housekeeping mistakenly picked up bathing suit of my son but then could not find it all week and nothing to compensate us
Manager Response: I’ve read your comments about your stay at La Quinta Anaheim.  WOW – not the type of experience we want you to have! Summary: Nice enough hotel if you just want the bare minimum. Front desk employees weren’t very friendly. Pool was out of service for the whole duration of our 7 day visit, although the lady at the front desk said it just went down and would be fixed the day after we arrived, that was a lie. Every day we asked about the pool, no one seemed to know what was going on as every employees answer was different than the last. As we were checking out, another family was checking in and the front desk people told them that the pool had just went out of service, um nope. It was out for the whole week prior to their arrival. Absolutley no compensation was given for the lack of pool, and on top of that, once we checked out and got our bill, there was a hidden resort fee for every single night that

Thanks again for your time, and hope we’ll see you back with us at La Quinta Inn and Suites once again.

Summary: The hotel cant do anything about the construction 50 yards outside my window but could have informed us and given us the option of a change. We learned of it at 10:00pm when the kids were already asleep. Was not a good night! When we asked about the pool we were told it was broken. Thankfully we had friends staying at another hotel near by and used the pool.

Summary: I am a single Mom and the staff was very helpful in helping my son and me find restaurants that delivered after spending the day deep sea fishing. they even gave of coupons. The valet guy helped us load up our car at the end of the vacation and was a real gentleman. The only con was that it was about $100 more than the price I was given when I booked.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Your review was such a delight to read!  Your comments will be shared with our entire staff.  We look forward to providing you with the same level of top notch service in the future!    Sincerely,   Danielle LQ Customer Care

Summary: We loved the proximity to Disney and the freeway!  Also, the room size was superb!  That additional sitting room was perfect for storing luggage and purchases.  We really liked the staff (except the breakfast staff were grumpy) and the parking was easy!  I would definitely recommend this hotel.  It was a good price and had all the amenities we look for when traveling!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  We sincerely appreciate the time you've taken to shed such a wonderful light on your experience with us.  We hope to continue having you as our guest for many years to come.  As always, we thank you for choosing La Quinta!    Sincerely,   Danielle LQ Customer Care

Summary: I’m so glad I ended up at this hotel. The staff and valet were so nice and helpful. Clean and updated room, free delicious breakfast, and very close to Disneyland. Also about a 30 minute drive from Newport Beach area. Thanks for a great night stay!
Manager Response: Faith,   We sincerely appreciate the wonderful feedback you’ve provided in your review.  Your comments will be shared with our entire team, as this will certainly boost morale.  We hope to continue providing you with the same level of exceptional service for years to come.    Sincerely,   Danielle  LQ Customer Care

Summary: I love how La quinta has the option where two couples can live in one room with privacy. My family and I love La Quinta we plan to chose this hotel every time we travel. We walk to Disneyland and it totally killed our feet because of the distance plus walking in the park. So if you plan to walk to Disney make sure to have proper shoes. Slides and slippers are def a no go! The pool does have way to much chlorine so if you plan to go to an event, dont go swimming several hours before and expect a shower to rid the smell.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Thank you for the top notch review!  We appreciate you taking the time to convey your feedback.  Please come visit us again soon!    Sincerely,   Danielle  LQ Customer Care

Summary: Very few hotels can accommodate 6+ family members in one room/suite. and even fewer do it affordably.  I have been in much better La Quinta inns, but for a high tourist area, this one is great. Could use better exhause fans and lower temp in hallways, and smoking area is inconveniently placed near pool/lounge area.

Stayed for 5 nights on a business trip.  Comfortable and spacious suite. Awkward the layout since the bedroom comes before the living room, but have seen it in the past in other similar hotels.  Breakfast is regular continental breakfast, but ok.  Included valet parking was a convenience.  Good location next to the Gardenwalk which have lots of places to eat.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   We sincerely appreciate the time you've taken to shed such a wonderful light on your experience with us.  We hope to continue having you as our guest for many years to come.  As always, we thank you for choosing La Quinta!    Sincerely,   Danielle LQ Customer Care

Summary: Spent a few days here for our Disney Trip. Wasn't too far to walk to and from the Parks. Swimming Pool was nice too. Very Quiet hotel, Staff was awesome. Breakfast was okay, could have been better. Overall, it was the perfect hotel for our first Disney Trip. Definitely making this our Disney Land Hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Thank you for the top notch review!  We appreciate you taking the time to convey your feedback.  Please come visit us again soon!    Sincerely,   Danielle LQ Customer Care

Summary Heading: ive never been treated so disrespectful. i was nearly in tears! Anaheim
Summary: and from such an establishment like La Quinta . I have stayed at many and many times and i have to say this is my first horrible experience. i booked a 2 room suite for a week but needed to make sure that a check from my church was acceptable. i was transferred to the front desk and was told it was fine as long as i gave the ck  in adv 7 days or used my credit card and the money would be put back on when the check cleared  (fair enough) i did that but when i went to check in - the manager Sam came from the back and was very curt and rude  he told me no that no one told me that and that would not accept the check - ok i said then i wont be able to stay because i needed the money back on my card he then told me that he would not refund my card either he treated me like i was

Thanks again for your time, and hope we’ll see you back with us at La Quinta Inn and Suites once again.

Summary Heading: A very good value hotel in Anaheim, perfectly placed for Disney
Summary: Very good value for money for a family of 4 staying in a suite room.  We didn't need to get 2 double rooms elsewhere or have one double bed and some uncomfortable sofa beds.    Rooms was large, clean and beds were very comfy.    Pool was more of ap lunge pool, but we didn't use it, and breakfast was very basic, but you aren't paying for a full service breakfast.  There are plenty of places to get a good breakfast nearby if you want that.    Staff were really friendly and helpful and we had a great stay for a few days while doing Disney.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback! I’m pleased to hear that you had such an enjoyable stay at Anaheim La Quinta. Our team looks forward to providing you with exceptional service in the future.  It’s our commitment to serve our guests to our best ability and hope to always exceed your expectations.  We’ll see you soon.

Summary: Property was clean. I made 2 very specific booking requests that were not honored upon checking in. When I called LaQuinta to address the error I was made to feel that the error was my fault. There was no attempt by agents to resolve or satisfy my concerns.  attempt

Summary: We had a nice stay at this La Quinta.  We were able to walk to Disneyland and even bring our 1-year-old back for a bit when he needed a break.  The breakfast is good and the rooms are much nicer than they used to be.

We’ll see you soon.

Summary: Nice accommodations, decent staff.  Breakfast needs improvement.  Very slow elevator particularly with waiting areas not air conditioned.  Parking is difficult, but valet is friendly and helpful. I would rate hotel a 3.5 out of 5.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Thank you for your candid feedback. We are very sorry to hear that the hotel was not up to par in the areas mentioned.  Please note this information has been passed on to our management staff to ensure improvements are considered and made. We very much appreciated your business and thank you for staying with us  Sincerely,   Danielle  LQ Customer Care

Summary Heading: Rooms adequate but don't expect an outdoor pool/spa
Summary: If want to lounge in the pool area, this hotel is not for you. No sun, just a concrete overhang. Room was spacious, clean and quiet. The breakfast fare was limited, but adequate. Within walking distance to Disney, shops and restaurants.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   We certainly appreciate the time you've taken to provide your feedback.  It sounds as though your experience was enjoyable overall. Your suggestions for a better stay have been shared with management.   We very much appreciate your business and thank you for staying with us.    Sincerely,   Danielle  LQ Customer Care

Summary Heading: Great place to stay if you are going to Disneyland
Summary: Close enough to walk to Disneyland, nice pool area, comes with breakfast!! Some of the rooms are a little dated but overall the rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable.  We really like the double beds and a sleep sofa!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Thank you for the top notch review!  We appreciate you taking the time to convey your feedback.  Please come visit us again soon!    Sincerely,   Danielle LQ Customer Care

Summary: We have stayed at this place a few times when we came to Disneyland (they accept pets) this time it was a different vibe no excitement from staff hot hallways because of no air conditioning COCKROACHES nasty COCKROACHES in the hallway and i seen a HUGE one exiting the elevator when i brought it up to staff she was rude and stated well your the only one that complained (YA IM SURE ) 2018 lady i have pictures of all of them I will be sure to post on yelp .... staff made multiple mistakes just a joke i think you get what type of operation is done here

Thanks again for your time, and hope we’ll see you back with us at La Quinta Inn and Suites once again.

Summary: I have stayed with my family in this La Quinta before and it was pretty good.  There has been a significant decline in the facility.  Our room was not what I had reserved.  The room they gave us had an air conditioning that cooled down to a steamy 78 - and that is after being fixed.  The whole facility was dirty.  Front desk person was pretty nice, but had few answers or solutions except for comping my parking for my two day stay.  I was expecting better.
Manager Response: Daniel,   We appreciate you taking the time to provide us with such detailed feedback about your stay.  We are very sorry to hear that several things throughout your stay did not meet your expectations.  This is certainly not the experience we hoped you would have with us.  Please note that your concerns regarding maintenance and housekeeping issues have been passed on to our Management Teams for immediate corrective action.  We do hope you will give us another chance as we will definitely improve our services.      Sincerely,   Danielle LQ Customer Care

Summary Heading: OK Not the Best we've stayed in
Summary: As a Dog owner its hard to find a nice hotel to stay in. We Stay at LaQuinta because generally they are good and accommodate our beloved Dog. This LaQuinta wasn't bad but not great either.Room was clean and spacious. Valet guy was the friendliest and most helpful of all. Front desk were not overly friendly just ok. Didn't like that we had to pay for a shuttle to Disney and $12 to park. The shuttle was slow getting there and then we stopped at several other hotels. The next day we just walked it.
Manager Response: Jody,   Thank you for your candid feedback. We are very sorry to hear that the hotel was not up to par in the areas mentioned.  Please note this information has been passed on to our management staff to ensure improvements are considered and made. We very much appreciated your business and thank you for staying with us.    Sincerely,   Danielle LQ Customer Care

Summary: La Quinta Inns & Suites,Anaheim   Their website says, Free WiFi & Breakfast  What they serve is NOT breakfast! You could call it a continental breakfast so people are not expecting things like eggs, bacon or sausage, and potatoes. The staff person said, we have eggs. I'm sorry but a hard boiled egg is not something I want to eat for breakfast.
Manager Response: I’ve received your review of La Quinta Anaheim.   Looks like we dropped the ball on meeting your expectations.  I appreciate your feedback; this is definitely not the experience we want you to have when staying with us!  Your feedback will help us improve our operation.  Rest assured your comments will be shared with our team, and it’s through comments such as yours that we’re able to improve.  Thanks again for your time, and hope we’ll see you back with us at La Quinta Inn and Suites once again.

Summary: It’s difficult to find a hotel that will accommodate family size of 6 without adding another room to our bill. We choose the suite that has 1 king bed and 2 double beds. One big suite that has 2 separate rooms and there is a sofa bed in the living room. My son slept on that sofa bed and it was old and, springy and very uncomfortable. The hotel is run down does need to be renovated but for the price it is feasible.  They had the basic breakfast, mostly waffles, toast, bagels, yogurt, oatmeal and hard boiled eggs.. basic basic.  There is a charge for parking $12 plus tax.  Pool is connected to the parking garage covered pool.  ALL the ice machines were NOT working I went to all the floors, that was a disappointment.
Manager Response: I’ve received your review of La Quinta Anaheim.   Looks like we dropped the ball on meeting your expectations.  I appreciate your feedback; this is definitely not the experience we want you to have when staying with us!  Your feedback will help us improve our operation.  Rest assured your comments will be shared with our team, and it’s through comments such as yours that we’re able to improve.  Thanks again for your time, and hope we’ll see you back with us at La Quinta Inn and Suites once again.

Summary Heading: Close to Disney but not worth the money
Summary: We Love LQ’s in general, we have stayed in them ALL over the country. When planning our recent trip to Disneyland finding a close LQ with beds for the 5 of us I booked it! It stated in the website it had the LQ mattresses, parking $12, Shuttle and Brightside breakfast. Lies! The Mattresses were NOT normal LQ standard, no they were lumpy and rolled to the middle! Parking was $12 and the Valet company (Not LQ) was amazing! The shuttle is NOT LQ it is a $5.50 per person per use charge NOT complementary that was NOT stated on the website! And the Breakfast was horrible! There was very little to chose from and it was ALL Carbs! We recenlty stayed at an LQ in NJ and their breakfast was a full buffet so this was VERY disappointing. The AC unit leaked all over our stuff one night, and

Summary: This hotel is not worth the price! We experienced terrible service and several issues with the room. Our AC, WiFi, and TV's did not work. The room wasn't cleaned and it took in excess of 15 minutes to get our car from the valet. When issues were reported to the staff they acted like they couldn't help or didn't know how to solve the problems.

Summary: Decent hotel, staff was very nice. Centrally located near Disneyland and other nice restaurants abd shops. I would definitely reconsider staying there again for work and leisure.. Rooms were comfortable
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Thank you for the great review.  We take pride in the features you mentioned.  We look forward to serving you again in the near future!    Sincerely,   Danielle LQ Customer Care

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel if you get what you book
Summary: We booked specifically for the rooms accommodations.  We had two families and many age ranges.  When we arrived they told us that they did not have the rooms we booked and that third parties overbook, meaning those who check in first get their requested booking and we did not. The hotel has comfortable beds and is centrally locate, but the inconvenience of mixing family around for sleeping arrangements was not worth wondering if it will happen each time.  We booked 2 rooms with 2 queens and pull out couch.  We were told they only had Kings with a pull out couch.  Not a fun way to start your vacation after driving 4 1/2 hrs.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Thank you for your candid feedback. We are very sorry to hear that the hotel was not up to par in the areas mentioned.  Please note this information has been passed on to our management staff to ensure improvements are considered and made. We very much appreciated your business and thank you for staying with us.    Sincerely,   Danielle LQ Customer Care

Summary: REALLY loud.  Lots of noise from the hall.  You could hear everything from upstairs.  Kids screaming everywhere you look. Breakfast closed 5 min before I got there.  Too early for a vacation hotel. 1 elevator for a hotel that size isn’t enough. Very nice staff all around though.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   We truly regret that our accommodations did not fully meet your expectations.  Surely this was quite an inconvenience for you. We hope that you will consider giving us another opportunity in the near future.  Sincerely,   Danielle LQ Customer Care

Summary: This is the second LaQuinta we have run into that charge for parking. Unfortunately the LaQuinta app does not mention parking for this hotel and I feel before you book they should inform you as it's an additional fee of $12 a night. The only good thing is that they provide valet. Besides the front desk staff not providing me with my little elite status goody bag she had the nerve to tell me in a matter of fact tone that most LaQuinta's and/or other hotels charge for parking. I explained to her I'm in the Army and I travel a lot and 9 times out of 10 I stay at a LaQuinta and this one and LA's LaQuinta are the ONLY 2 so far that I encountered that charge for parking. If I'm a guess at the hotel I dont understand why my car has to also pay for a spot to park if you provide parking?
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   We certainly appreciate the time you've taken to provide your feedback.  It sounds as though your experience was enjoyable overall. Your suggestions for a better stay have been shared with management.   We very much appreciate your business and thank you for staying with us.    Sincerely,   Danielle LQ Customer Care

Summary: We were within walking distance to Disneyland. Great location. The room was great, and much bigger than I expected! Staff was friendly and helpful. We had no problems with anything during our stay. I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback! I’m pleased to hear that you had such an enjoyable stay at Anaheim La Quinta. Our team looks forward to providing you with exceptional service in the future.  It’s our commitment to serve our guests to our best ability and hope to always exceed your expectations.  We’ll see you soon.

Summary: Purchased the two room, two bed with trundle bed.  Room has a divider door (sliding) with slightly fogged glass.  Updated furniture and clean beds.  The staff is extra nice and really seem genuine without overdoing it.....always smiling.    Kids review:   Bad encounters:  -One towel hanging by sink had large orange stain/gunk.   -Pool access door is broken and you can gain entry, and so can anyone else.  Informed attendee of issue and was told it would be addressed but has not two days later.    Mentions:  -There is only one sink located outside of the actual "bathroom".  -"Fitness center" has a treadmill and two stair steppers, nothing more.   -Small fridge capacity -You can walk to Disney in about 15-20 minutes (average pace) -Breakfast is mostly "cold", no meats, scrambled

I highly recommend this LQ to all my Military brothers and sisters.

Summary: I would stay here again.  The room was clean, slept well on the regular bed but the pull out bed could have used a better mattress.  Air conditioner worked extremely well.  People at the property were very friendly.  Breakfast area was clean and there was a good variety of food.  The only thing that was disappointing was the TV reception.  I think they need to see about a new cable company.

Summary Heading: Cali in Santa Ana with La quinta Inn & suites only
Summary: This hotel is exactly what people likes if they care about quality and comfort for affordable 157$ per night.  All is clean, quiet if no construction working, free parking that is a must have in Cali, and breakfast is included.  45 min far from LA and its dirty motels 😁😁😁  made us really happy after 1 week, and then only we started enjoying CA.  20 min distance walk to the beach.  2nd floor is much better even with parking view, room was same as on booking.com

Summary Heading: Worst hotel I’ve ever stayed at in the Disneyland area
Summary: Let’s see, the air conditioning broke down while we were there, the bathtub drain barely worked so you ended up standing in your own filth, the phone in the room didn’t work so anything we needed from the front desk we needed to walk all the way down to the lobby, and for the climax, on the last day, the toilet broke and over flowed water all over the room and hallway. And of course we couldn’t call down to the front desk to tell them to shut the water off because the phone didn’t work!  Tyesia the front desk person was rude and in apologetic. Just move on to the next listing. There are cheaper and better places to stay.

Summary Heading: Two Room King Suite does not have two rooms or two king beds
Summary: Booked a King-Two Room Suite online, for a great price. Headed to Disneyland for two days and really just needed two beds and a nice place to sleep. Turns out despite it being advertised as two rooms, it is one king bed and a pull out sofa. The "rooms" are divided by a screen door and you have to walk through one room to get to the one bathroom. The front desk basically told me "sorry not sorry" and that they had no rooms or cots to help with our situation. When we called to ask for extra pillows, they were very nice and said they'd send them up right away. They didn't show up within two hours so we called again and they said they'd call the maintenance staff. To no one's surprise, 12 hours after our first call, we still never got any pillows or a call to say they were out. If

The sliding door that separates the rooms was off the track, the couch had stains on them. Every time I opened or closed the bathroom door it squeaked. Also, water from the ac was dripping onto my head while I was in the shower which was very unsanitary. Very displeased with my stay as I am a frequent guest at this hotel.

Summary Heading: Move on to the next listing
Summary: This is an old property that is getting more run down all the time.  We have stayed here off and on for the last ten years but it's a very poor offering for what they charge.  On our recent trip last week we were disappointed as soon as we got to our room.  The A/C unit is a loud bulky squeaky machine that made sleep almost impossible.  The bed was worse.  The bed was the most form and hard mattress we've ever laid on.  It was easy to leave early the next day and check out for another hotel (that was nicer and cheaper).  Think very carefully before picking this place.  The location is wonderful, the hotel is not.

It was all light bread with sweet marmalade.

If you are wanting to lay out by the pool at any stage of your stay, I warn you that the pool is covered as if you are in a parking garage. No access to sun at all. Other than that, it is close to many attractions.

Summary Heading: bad hotel, they dont care good customers,
Summary: I was attacked and bitten by a dog and the hotel did not want to be responsible for anything, and the manager never wanted to face me, they did not give me any kind of medical assistance. I demanded an investigation, then they sent me an email saying that the hotel had responsibility in any kind.

Summary: The room, service, cleanliness were all excellent. But the pool is under the cover of the parking garage with no view of the outdoors. Would not recommend staying here if an outdoor pool is a priority. Within walking distance of Disney. Valet parking is included in the parking fee and is available around the clock. Take advantage of that perk!

Summary Heading: Do not bother, plenty of other places to stay
Summary: My apartment was having work done, so my manager scheduled & paid for a room for my family (which includes two German Shepherd dogs).  She booked it through La Quinta's call center.  After reserving the room, leaving credit card information, then faxing in the credit card authorization form as she was instructed by the call center, she emailed me the confirmation.  The reservation was for the same day it was booked, all seemed well as I loaded my family & one of the two dogs (I own a Prius so would have to drive 30 miles back to get the other dog). We arrived and I went to check in alone so as not to leave our dog unattended.  The front desk clerk, Juan, ask if I had a reservation and asked for my credit card.  I asked if it was for incidentals but he said no, the room wasn't
Manager Response: Nina,   We are so sorry to hear of the negative aspects that you experienced during your stay.  Please reach out to our Customer Care team for further assistance at LQCustomerCare@LQReviews.com.  We look forward to hearing from you.    Sincerely,   Danielle LQ Customer Care

Summary: We’ve stayed here twice while visiting Disney and will go back!  - No insane resort fees! - Rates are always cheaper than surrounding hotels and include a free breakfast...it’s not fancy but we don’t eat large breakfasts at home, anyway. - Love the double rooms! Our daughter gets her own room with bed and tv so we’re able to stay up later watching our own tv in the other room. - Can see Disney fireworks if you’re on the side facing that direction. - Friendly front desk, breakfast, and parking staff. - ART bus stop is directly behind the hotel and you can purchase tickets at the front desk (can also purchase Disney passes to bypass the lines)...trust me, you do not want to park at Disney...takes forever to get into the structure and then you have to walk a mile to the front gate

Summary: Very nice rooms, got a free upgrade due to sold out. Charged for parking daily and they did not let me leave my car there on our last day of check out so we could enjoy the day there. Continental Breakfast is good and fresh. Bathroom was very clean and efficient.

Summary Heading: Decent Hotel, but not worth the higher prices, parking fee
Summary: We have stayed at this La Quinta Location several times over the years, but with the increase prices, mandatory parking fee, and limited breakfast this may have been our last.  For me and my family it comes down to the numbers, the hotel is great for families because it has all the 2 room suites, and it is within “walking distance” of Disneyland. However, the walking distance takes our family an average of 15 minutes either way with 4 kids ages 7-14 to get to security/ticket gates. This distance does not seem to justify the mandatory nightly parking fee.  I remember staying when there was no parking fee, then they began charging but only for valet parking, now they charge all parking.  The rooms have been updated since our first stay here, the beds are still not the most
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your review of your recent stay. We truly appreciate your feedback and will keep your comments in mind while we continue to hard to work to improve our guest experience. Sincerely,  Diana - LQ Customer Care

Summary: We needed space to spread out for 3 day adventure to Disneyland this was it. Parking! Those guys are amazing! In the beginning I was reluctant to pay $12 a day but so worth it. We had a slight issue with air con leaking but front end handled it right away. Love this place! Will return and refer family and friends.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you so much for taking the time to give us feedback on our property. We appreciate your positive remarks regarding your stay. We work very hard to deliver a superior level of service and are glad your stay was comfortable. We look forward to seeing you again real soon!  Sincerely, Diana – LQ Customer Care

Summary: This is my 2nd time coming to Anaheim and first time at this hotel. I really enjoyed the room and its separate living room. The bathroom is a little tight and may need a little remodeling. At first I thought they forgot to clean the bathtub, but then i looked closer and it was just some marks and rust in the tub. I would still stay here because I loved the room and the vanity and sink area. The front desk girl was very nice, the valet was quick and efficient. I enjoyed the pool too with my boys specially in the 90 degree weather!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your review. We look forward to seeing you again soon!  Sincerely, Diana - LQ Customer Care

Summary: Great hotel, nice staff, awesome location. We were visiting Disney and couldn't have asked for a better stay. Rooms were clean, pool was great. Thank you for making our vacation stay perfect.  We will recommend.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for staying at La Quinta Inns and Suites. We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay. Thank you for your comments and we wish to welcome you back to the hotel soon!          Sincerely, Diana – LQ Customer Care

Summary: Love the atmosphere of this hotel with the happiest place on earth Disney down the street, the feeling is always amazing the room are spacious and very clean. You have restaurants and sites with in a huge radius, you can walk or drive. almost anywhere. My wife and I had a great time.
Manager Response: James, Thanks for posting a review of your recent stay and for your very kind words about our hotel.  We are delighted that you enjoyed our location and clean, spacious rooms.  We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future.  Sincerely,	 Bennie, LQ Customer Care Agent

Summary: There are some pretty good upsides to this hotel - location if you are going to Disney, the rooms are spacious (ours had a separate living room divided by sliding doors), the people are very friendly.     The downsides are the Disneyland guests who get up at the crack of dawn and assume the rest of the hotel guests love hearing their yelling in the hallways and their kids screaming at 6:45am.  The hotel is also situated off Katella, a very busy and noisy street.  And then there is construction of some kind on the roof and we were awakened early by that noise.  Add to this cacophony is the incessant hum of some kind of blower (not in our room) and then the blower in our room with the AC.  Honestly, this was one of the noisiest hotels I've ever stayed in.  The breakfast is just
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  We appreciate hearing our guest’s feedback as it provides us with the opportunity to see where our guests feel we need to improve.  Your comments have been directed to our management team for review. We constantly strive to provide excellent service and satisfaction to all of our guests, and when a guest takes the time to write, we are especially grateful.  We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience caused to you during your stay. Thank you for your business and hope you continue to choose again us for your lodging needs.  Sincerely,  Diana - LQ Customer Care

Summary: Hotel was clean and ready early. Staff was very friendly, courteous, and helpful. Breakfast was ok. Could've used some variety as we had the same thing to eat all four mornings. Even though we had do not disturb sign out when we saw the housekeeping staff in the hallway they made sure we had sufficient towels and toiletries
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your review. We are happy that we had the opportunity to serve you and we hope you will choose La Quinta Inns and Suites in your future travels.          Sincerely,                                                                                                  Diana - LQ Customer Care

Summary: I was at this hotel on April 12 and 13 2018, with my family. The beds were full of hairs, I immediately called the front desk and they just told me to go and get another key for another room without even appologizing for the dirty room, the carpeting was very soiled and there was a strong smell of marijuana that went to our room, the sofas and sofa bed were very old and dirty, I won't be staying at this hotel anymore when I go to Disneyland, never again.
Manager Response: Yolanda,  We were very disappointed to read of your experience during your stay with us.  While an apology will regrettably not alter the outcome of your experience on this occasion, we do extend it with all sincerity. We continually try to do our very best for all of our guests. Each concern will be addressed, in an attempt to correct and improve our hotel.  We do hope you will choose to stay with us again so we can have the opportunity to provide you with a true La Quinta experience.    Respectfully,  Diana - LQ Customer Care

Summary: Dirty room. Had to wait past check in time to get into dirty room. Water heater broke and bathroom was leaking water on the floor. Plus wad the staff was for the most part helpful with trying to remedy the issues
Manager Response: Christina,   We appreciate you taking the time to provide us with such detailed feedback about your stay.  We are very sorry to hear that several things throughout your stay did not meet your expectations.  This is certainly not the experience we hoped you would have with us.  Please note that your concerns regarding maintenance and housekeeping issues have been passed on to our Management Teams for immediate corrective action.  We do hope you will give us another chance as we will definitely improve our services.      Sincerely,   Danielle LQ Customer Care

Summary: Great location. Walking distance from Disneyland but expected a lot more from breakfast, noise control and I thought it was a smoke(weed) free environment. I will probably look for another La Quinta location for the family.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   We are very sorry to hear of your negative experience with us.  The safety and comfort of our guests is very important to us.  Your concerns have not been taken lightly.  This review has been forwarded to management for further investigation.  Please reach out to the hotel's General Manager so that we can better address these concerns.  Again, please accept our sincere apology.  We hope you will consider giving us another chance in the future to better your opinion.  Sincerely,   Danielle  LQ Customer Care

Summary: excellent hotel for the price.  Staff was very friendly, courteous and helpful.  Room was clean and very pretty.  I would recommend more food options for breakfast.  The wifi was not as strong, but was still able to use our ipads.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your feedback. We appreciate you staying at La Quinta Inns and Suites and hope to see you again!              Sincerely, Diana - LQ Customer Care

Summary: My family and I travel to Anaheim at  least 3 times a year. We always stay at the La Quinta Inn & Suites in  Anaheim. For spring break it's just me and my son, who stays because we enjoy attending Wonder Con. This year was a little different for us. While my husband was taking me and son to the airport. My husband said needed to return home and get his medication. Once we reach our street, my husband started  driving reckless. Almost cause a head on collision. In the end he had a heart attack behind the wheel, will have open heart surgery in a few days.             I would like to personally thank the general manger for calling personally and asking how are family was doing, and waving the late's fees. Thank you La Quinta Staff for being so understanding. Being in a room fill
Manager Response: LA Keisha,   We appreciate the fantastic feedback and compliments you've given.  Our goal is to provide our guests with a superb experience.  We are pleased to hear that we accomplished that goal!  Sincerely,   Danielle LQ Customer Care

Summary: We’ve stayed here multiple times and each time our stay gets more disappointing. We barely got any sleep because we could here the loud creeking from the room above us all night. The spa was broken the entire time of our stay. These are two things that you kind of would like when you’ve been at Disneyland for three days. No water pressure in the sink. My husband and I woke up with a few strange bites on us... it will probably be our stay there.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   We truly regret that our accommodations did not meet your expectations but mostly we regret that we were unable to resolve the issues to your satisfaction while staying with us.  Your review will be shared with our management staff.  We hope that you will consider giving us another opportunity in the near future.  Sincerely,   Danielle  LQ Customer Care

Summary Heading: Clean, friendly staff, great location for Disney
Summary: Hotel is a great one for Disney. The staff was pleasant and welcoming. Rooms were very clean & pleasant. Breakfast was great for those who are not Gluten Free. If you are GF this is not the hotel for you.  Easy shuttle to Disney, but it's also an easy walk. Could see the fireworks from the room as well.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   We appreciate the positive rating and informative review!  Your thoughtful comments will assist our management team as well as our future guests.  As always, we thank you for choosing La Quinta and hope to continue having you as our guest for many years to come!  Sincerely,   Danielle  LQ Customer Care

Summary: my review is stated in my comments. I don't want to  waste my time to repeat them. One Personnel's attitude at the check in counter was unacceptable.  location is ok. food must add scrambled eggs, so tired of boiled eggs. perhaps to add more food selections. the room I expected was not what I was given. noisy near the swimming pool.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your review. We are sorry to hear that you were not happy with your stay at our hotel. This is definitely not the kind of experience we want our guests to have. We will make sure your comments are shared with our Management Team, so we can use them for further training purposes.  We do hope you choose us for your future travels.               Respectfully, Diana - LQ Customer Care

Summary: Our family recently spent 10 nights at this hotel. We were traveling from Australia on our first US holiday. We were very grateful for an early check in after a 14hour flight with little sleep. Breakfast was ok - limited options & a very small area. 10-15 flat walk to Disneyland or use the shuttle next door. Garden Walk shopping precinct was just across the road with many different restaurants. We mainly used Lyft if our feet were tired from a big day at the parks. Beds were comfortable & we enjoyed the separate living space with sofa bed. Staff were friendly. Our only main issue was the constant smell of Marijuana. On our last night other guest were smoking it in their room so much it was filling the hallways with smoke and we could smell it in our own room - not great for the
Manager Response: Kara,  Thank you so much for sharing your review and giving us an honest look at the guest experience in our hotel. We are pleased that you had a good stay overall. However, we apologize for the odor issue you encountered during your stay. We appreciate your business and hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely, Diana - LQ Customer Care

Summary: We only used this hotel to sleep as we stayed at Disneyland until 12:00 am and checked out at 8:00 am. The biggest plus was that we were able to check early in at 1:00 pm.
