Summary: Clean, spacious, and good service. This place is super close to Disneyland and has shuttle service. Breakfast was nice and simple. Has a large swimming pool that is open late. Overall great place to stay.
Manager Response: Lorena,   Thank you for taking the time to provide your wonderful feedback, as it is greatly appreciated.   We appreciate your business and thank you for staying with us.  Respectfully,   Danielle  LQ Customer Care

Summary: Somewhat crowded in terms of parking.  Limited. Also charged for parking. Breakfast marginal.  Pool noisy jacuzzi foamy towels I had to go find some.  Check out system needs review.  Toiletries one bottle for 3 guests. Was close to Garden Center for food so that was in walking distance. The location easily accessed by freeways.  Had good price but this area has many add on fees and taxes.  Read all the details before you book.
Manager Response: Hannah,   Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay with us.  We apologize for the issues that you have noted and are disappointed that our hotel did not exceed your expectations.  Steps will be taken to correct those problems.  We do hope you will choose to stay with us again so we can have the opportunity to provide you with a better experience.       Sincerely,   Danielle LQ Customer Care

Summary Heading: Great location and so close to the Cheesecake Factory!
Summary: We really liked the spacious room and although breakfast isn't fancy, it was very much appreciated since eating meals at Disneyland can be very expensive. I will definitely stay at this location again, next time we visit "the Happiest Place on Earth"
Manager Response: Sandra,   Thank you for taking the time to write such a great review!  We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay and the amenities we take pride in offering.  Please come see us again soon!    Sincerely,   Danielle

Summary: This is NOT a resort property  This is an older rebranded hotel over a mile from Disney park  My last stay here there was a theme park shuttle - not now  Plus they added a $14.00 per night parking fee and a lame valet service that gums up guest parking  Basic continental breakfast (no meats)  Underground pool  Front desk morning lady was very accommodating and should be sent back to hospitality school  Graveyard front desk person was very accommodating      Front of property trash can overflowing  They try to put up fancy pictures and paint to try to shore up this old property  There are plenty of nicer and closer properties with free parking  Do not stay here until they get rid of parking fee and valet  I am a La Quinta Elite and Rewards member and cannot recommend this place
Manager Response: Steve,   We are very sorry to hear of your negative experience while staying with us.  We appreciate the constructive critique, as we are continuously striving to improve our guest's experience.  It is only through your feedback that improvements are considered and made.  Our hope is that you will give us a chance to better serve you in the future.  We very much appreciate your business and thank you for staying with us.    Sincerely,   Danielle

Summary: The Aneheom La Quinta Inn is one of the best place we have ever stayed in....why, excellent service, especially from one of the front desk reps, Stephanie.  She is awesome in every sense of the word.  She has beyond excellent customer service skills.  She is extremely professional, warm, friendly, and know how to treat a person with respect.  We will stay ther again because of her.  The room is very nice, with modern decor and new amenities.  The bed is very comfortable and the shower is amazing.  They serve a great breakfast as well. We will definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review.  We will be sure to share your comments with our entire staff, especially Stephanie.  We look forward to your next visit!     Sincerely,   Danielle

Summary: Great place to stay with a family on a trip to Disney. Its about 1 mile or a 20 min walk to the entrance of either park. Small pool that is covered by the building but open to the air on 2 sides.  Breakfast was included and was good but gets old after a few days.   Best part was rooms are set up to sleep large families. Everything is tight but you won't likely be spending a lot of time in your room.
Manager Response: Dear Sean,  Thank you for your positive comments. We are happy that we had the opportunity to serve you and we hope you will choose La Quinta Inns and Suites in your future travels.          Sincerely,                                                                                                  Diana

Summary Heading: Change your entire front desk staff
Summary: In all my years of travel, both professional and personal, I have never experienced such an unprofessional front desk staff (I had interactions with three different staff members).  I have never had a front desk staff member, upon checking out, not ask me how my stay was or thank me for choosing to stay at the property.  This led me to believe that they possibly don't want to hear the answer.   As travelers, we have many properties to choose from and this experience will prevent me from ever staying at a La Quinta again.  I would have much rather spent my $1000 at another hotel where they value their guests.  I will say that your valet was the most professional/friendly staff member on the property.  Maybe he should run the front desk or at the very least, provide them some
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your direct and genuine feedback. Rest assured we will be looking into the comments you have made about your experience with our staff.  We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience and hope to continue having you as our guest.  Sincerely,   Danielle

Summary: Great service, clean rooms, and good variety of foods to choose from for breakfast. Location is very, very close to Disneyland and well- known restaurants. Some noise at night; although expected for families on vacation. Wore ear plugs one night out of four, so not too bad. Would go again!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Thank you for taking the time to write such a great review!  Your informative feedback will surely help our future guests with their travels.  We hope you will once again choose us for your lodging needs.      Sincerely,   Danielle

Summary Heading: Good Staff, need to work on beds!
Summary: Eventhough the property is conveniently located near Disneyland, with quick access to the disney shuttle just behind the property, we will probably pass on staying again... Main reason, THE BEDS.  They were extremely "wobbly" and uneven, not to mention the pillows i give them a 2 out of 10 score... Also, the breakfast area is tight and busy and not very good overall.  On the upside, if you are not a picky sleeper like me, the rooms are big and have an adjoining area with a second TV and a sofa bed, great for keeping the kids entertained while adults set up the disney visit.  Staff was nice and helpful.
Manager Response: Joaquin,   We truly regret that our accommodations did not meet your expectations but mostly we regret that we were unable to resolve the issues to your satisfaction while staying with us.  Your review will be shared with our management staff.  We hope that you will consider giving us another opportunity in the near future.  Sincerely,   Danielle

Summary Heading: Great location near Disney and lots of restaurants
Summary: The pictures on the website are a little deceiving. Not as nice and new as it appears but it's OK. The daily parking costs you and it's a little crammed so be careful where you choose to park because overflow occupants may block you in. Fortunately we took a shuttle to and from the Disney parks (which also costs) during the stay. They serve an all right breakfast. Staff is nice & room was nice & comfortable. You can hear a lot of road noise and ambulances pretty often during the night. We also heard the fireworks each night but our room was facing the other direction.. oh well...
Manager Response: Dear Guest, We appreciate you taking the time to provide feedback.  We are delighted to hear that you had a good stay in our comfortable rooms and appreciated our helpful staff.  We take pride in being located so close to Disneyland and are glad you appreciated the shuttle service offered.  We look forward to having you as a guest again in the future.   Respectfully,  Bennie

Summary: I loved that my guest room had 2 separate bedrooms with doors in between since I was traveling with teenagers.  But condition of the ceiling/floor of the room above was so poor that I couldn't sleep.  It was extremely creaky and noisy, it was difficult to sleep as any movement above made noise.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Feedback of your recent stay is appreciated.  We are delighted to hear that you liked your room layout; however, we are disappointed to hear that our ceilings and floors were causing a disturbance.  Due to our location near Disneyland, we do book a lot of families with children who tend to be a bit noisy.  We apologize for the disturbance this caused during your stay and look forward to having you as a guest again in the future.   Sincerely, Bennie

Summary: I stayed at this La Quinta for one night en route to Palm Desert. Had family matters in Orange County on the way down.  The property is located right in the middle of the Anaheim Resort (aka Disneyland area) and across the street from the shuttle parking lot. Parking is covered although it cost $20. We met some friends the next morning at the Cheesecake Factory, which is across the street, and the hotel allowed me to park the car in their lot for over two hours past check out since my dogs needed shade while we had lunch.  The room was a suite costing $150 for a holiday weekend!  Breakfast was a bit on the mediocre side, but we went out for lunch so I didn't eat much anyway.  Highly recommended for families.
Manager Response: Dear HadleyKatie, Thanks so much for your review.  We are thrilled to hear that you had a wonderful stay at our hotel and found it to be a good value.  We look forward to having you as a guest again in the future.   Sincerely, Bennie

Summary Heading: Gonna stay somewhere else next time
Summary: dirty towles left hanging on back of door from previous guests! Windows in room did not shut all the way. Some of the electrical outlets did not work. Tub and sink plugs did not work. Beds SUCKED! Time to try some where else!
Manager Response: Dear Guest, We appreciate you taking the time to provide your candid feedback.  We are extremely sorry to hear about the negative experience you had at our hotel.  This is certainly not the kind of stay we want our guest to have and your comments have been forwarded to management for immediate action to resolve these issues.  We do hope you will consider staying with us again in the future for a better guest experience.  Respectfully, Bennie

Summary: Not satisfied with our stay to this LQ facility, due to the excessive noise from upper floor (above our room - occupants walking around, kids running, etc.) unable my family and I to get proper sleep/rest.  I will not be returning to this hotel in the area again.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your review. We would like to offer our sincerest apologies for the noise issues you encountered during your stay. Your feedback is extremely valuable to us and will be shared with our management team, as we strive to improve with each and every stay. Thank you very much for bringing your concerns to our attention.                                                                                                                               Respectfully,                Diana

Summary: We absolutely love this hotel! We have been to the area multiple times and wouldn't stay anywhere else. We are a large family, and this hotel is always able to accommodate us! The service is great, and the Disneyland parks are less than 1/2 mile away. Easily within walking distance!It's also a great value for your stay!
Manager Response: Dear Charity,  Thank you so much! We are so happy to hear that you and your family were able to enjoy yourselves at our hotel! Thanks again for letting us know, and we look forward to having you back again!      Sincerely, Diana

Summary Heading: Walking distance to Disney Land but I will not stay here again.
Summary: Self parking space is very small and dark, if you return late at night you may not be able to find parking but the hotel charge you $12 a day parking no matter if they have the space for you to park or not.  My brand new car was damaged by a metal bracket sticking out in the middle of the parking space, I couldn't see it because it was dark at night.  The hotel did have a warning sign at the parking space but the warming sign wasn't easy to find it either, I am sure that I'm not the first person ran into that metal bracket that's why they put the sign up so they can get away with liability, I wonder if this parking space meet the fire safety code of Anaheim city.  Bathtub and sink drain not properly, the refrigerator in the room make so much noise that I could sleep at all. Free
Manager Response: Dear Guest, We appreciate your candid feedback.  Although we were delighted to hear that you appreciated our location near Disneyland; we are extremely sorry that our parking area didn’t meet your expectations.  Due to our location near the gates of Disneyland, we do tend to have a lot of guests with families and our lot does get very crowded.  We apologize for this having a negative impact on your stay.  Comments about your room have been shared with management to ensure our housekeeping and maintenance staff resolves these issues immediately.  We hope you will consider staying with us again in the future for a better guest experience.  Respectfully, Bennie

Summary: The staff was nice and accommodating, the rooms were clean, breakfast was good. The pool was clean and fun. I love that they have a shuttle to Disney, we were on vacation with family, one of which is handicapped and wouldn't have been able to take the 15 minute walk to Disney easily, so the shuttle was fantastic.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you so much! We are so happy to hear that you and your family were able to have a worry-free vacation and enjoy yourselves at our hotel! Thanks again for letting us know, and we look forward to having you back again!                Sincerely, Diana

Summary: I only stay at this hotel the price is great, the staff either day or night are wonderful.  It meets all my needs from shuttle bus to Disneyland to several restaurants with in walking distant.  The hotel is clean and quite. The rooms are nice and clean.
Manager Response: Dear Irene,  Thank you for your positive comments. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and hope your next stay is just around the corner!  We look forward to being here for you on your next visit.   Sincerely, Diana

Summary Heading: A great location for many Southern California hot spots!
Summary: This is a great location to be able to get to many destinations in SoCal.  You are very close to Interstate 5 which can take you north to Canada and south to Mexico!  Not to mention you are a long walk or short drive from Disneyland!
Manager Response: Dear Greg,  Thank you so much for sharing your review and giving us an honest look at the guest experience in our hotel. We are glad that you enjoyed the value and the convenient location of our hotel! We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.                 Sincerely, Diana

Summary: My inital thought of the staff was not bad. The front desk girl checked me in was okay a bit slow and unwelcoming . But this is where i got to see the real service , I get to the room and there is a problem with the tv and a smelly carpet . I call the front desk and was told if I had a problem I had to walk back to the front desk to tell them . So after getting my wife and children settled in a bit (toddlers need a bit of convincing) it had been around 30 mins. I make my way to the front only to see the front desk associates  a female and male  playing around with the office supplies acting as my toddlers do , as i approach closer they quickly tried to hide their mess and ask what they could do for me . When I expressed my concerns their solution was just to change rooms but my
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to share your review. Please allow me to seize this opportunity to sincerely apologize that your stay was anything less than perfect. We are very saddened to read your review, as we never want our guests to have such an experience. I'll make sure to review your comments with our entire team and see what we can do better! At La Quinta, we work very hard to make sure all our guests have a comfortable stay and we back it up with a 100% satisfaction guarantee. We do encourage you to reach out to us, as we would love to discuss how we can make up for a less desirable stay. We hope to hear from you again soon.  Sincerely, Diana  LQ Customer Care LQCustomerCare@laquinta.com

Summary: This is close to DisneyLand and is a get price for going to Disneyland, highly recommend for any family traveling to Disneyland or Anaheim to see a baseball game, the Angels Park is just down the street too.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you very much for staying at the La Quinta Inn & Suites. We are happy to hear that your stay exceeded your expectations. We certainly hope to see you again in the very near future.   Sincerely, Diana

Summary Heading: La Quinta is great for familites for Disneyland
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights with my husband.  Wanted a king bed and all they had was the king with a trundle.  I thought this would be more like a couch, but it was a second room with a double bed that had a trundle bed under it, also double.  8 people could have been comfortable in this room, although the bath would have been small.  Two TVs and dressers.  Hotel was fairly quiet, considering it was near Disney.  Across the street from Chessecake Factory, close to other restaurants, and within walking distance of Disney.  Also shuttle available for $5 a day per person.  Bed was comfy.
Manager Response: Dear Teri,  Thank you for choosing La Quinta Inns and Suites. We appreciate you sharing your experience with the TripAdvisor community as it helps other travelers decide which hotels the right one for them. We look forward to welcoming you back and until then, we wish you safe travels.  Sincerely, Diana

Summary: I have stayed here many times only had a problem two times but everything was handle in a professional manner. Now when I walk in everyone calls me by my name like I was part of the family. I just wanted to say thank you to the manager for making us feel like part of the family.
Manager Response: Dear Larry, Thank you for your kind words.  We are pleased to hear that you had an enjoyable stay. We look forward to seeing you on your next visit!

Summary Heading: Great for families who need space!
Summary: Stayed at the La Quinta Anaheim for 3 nights while vising Disneyland. We had a two room suite with King bed and fold out couch. It was great to have the separation of the two rooms with kids. TV's in both rooms. Rooms were nicely cleaned daily. The shower and tub area did need some maintenance, but was very clean and usable. Service was great...although check in was delayed two hours, but we were at the park all day so it didn't effect us. We were provided with a parking pass prior to official check in so we could leave our car at the hotel. Decent breakfast, nothing too fancy. About a mile walk from Disneyland. Near good restaurants. We would definitely stay here again, as it met our families needs for a vacation to Disney.

Summary Heading: Great rate and location with friendly staff
Summary: It's about a 20 minute walk  to DLR (but may seem like a gazillion after a long day at the parks). You pass by a 7-11 on the journey, so that's a great place to stock up on water and snacks to take to the parks (or for that late night nacho and Slurpee power boost). The staff at this hotel were all very nice. We chose this hotel for the location, rate, free breakfast and availability of suites with more than the typical 2-bed option. Lived up to these expectations. They also allowed dogs and I was happy to see and hear our canine companions (could have done without the sound of the children).

Summary Heading: Great Customer Service in decent hotel
Summary: For the good: Upon checking in at 10:30pm, there was a wait to confirm that the room was ready - to which we were given a free night of parking for the inconvenience - awesome and totally appreciated! :)  Upon checkout, again the front desk staff were courteous and nice.    Spent 2 nights  in a 2-room suite. It was ok, with soft beds and for the price, a deal. As others mentioned, walls are thin, so bring earplugs.  Breakfast was a carb-feast.  Lots of white bread for toast and waffles, never saw bagels. Boiled eggs were a plus for a bit of protein, and worked for the quick snack before heading to D-land. However, if you want a real breakfast, this isn't it.   So the Average rating is based on some of the issues I had for a newly renovated hotel. In this case, I think "newly

Summary Heading: A Night Away and Close to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at this La Quinta Inn for one night last week while we had friends visiting from out of town. Great location for us since we wanted to be able to walk to Disneyland. We had a 2 bedroom suite with two bathrooms and a TV sitting area and were very pleased with the room style and decor. Unfortunately, the walls and door to the hall are very thin and we were bothered by the family across the hall who had 2 small barking dogs. Also, the pool is adjacent to the parking garage and covered so it wasn't all that welcoming but we weren't there for the pool so it wasn't a big deal. The breakfast was a good surprise, I thought it would have some pastries but they ended up having waffles, muffins, toast, yogurt, oatmeal and juice/coffee/milk. Overall the close proximity and 2

Booked this hotel because of its price as well as its proximity to Disneyland. Stayed there with my family of five as well as another family of five that was also traveling with us; the suite we stayed it fit us perfectly. It is a nice hotel to stay if you are going to Disneyland, walking distance to the park and near a variety of restaurants. I liked that it is kind of located on an off street so you don't get that much of traffic or noise. You could actually hear and see the fireworks from the room we stayed in. Breakfast was okay and even though we stayed during the last week of July the hotel was never crowded. Would definitely consider coming back. Staff was great.

If you are looking for a place to stay near Disneyland look no further this is the best value for your money!We stayed here for a week and were very satisfied with both the service and location. I would return again.

We attended Wondercon 2017 and stayed at this hotel with our support dog.  The hotel staff was very accomodating, especially the wonderful fellow at the front desk - super nice!  Breakfast was great too!

My family and I reserved a room for our Disneyland trip 5 months in advance and had to wait 2 hours after we got there for it to be ready, which was overall 4 hours PAST check in time. We were told initially it would take 45 minutes, and we arrived 2 hours AFTER check in. It was absolutely ridiculous. There was another family in the lobby who said they had been waiting 2 hours for a room when we got there. This type of "service" is completely unacceptable and definitely something I never expected from this hotel. Definitely gave us a terrible start to what should have been a great vacation.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to share your feedback. We apologize for the inconvenience caused to you due to the delay at check in.  The hotel management team will be advised of your review in an effort to improve our operations.  We appreciate your feedback and hope you will provide us another opportunity to serve you again in the future.             Sincerely, LQ Customer Care

Summary Heading: Pet friendly as it can get
Summary: Great rooms, quiet and love the valet parking service.  Nice breakfast to start the morning before heading to Disneyland.  Staff is extremely courteous.  Nice pool and spa to relax in after a day of sightseeing.  Feel safe at night.  Within walking distance of national restaurant chains.

Great if going to Disneyland or Knotts because of proximity to both amusement parks. Rooms are well maintained and the staff is very good and will help with any problem that is encountered.  Parking is pretty tight though.

Pleasant experience. Walking distance from Disneyland and many restaurants. Employees, front staff and valet were all very nice. The pool area looked fun but we ran out of time to use it. Breakfast was good. Enough to get us going in the morning.

Summary Heading: One of the Worst La Quintas
Summary: My family stayed here during a trip to Disneyland, and stayed at a different La Quinta in the San Francisco area to which I can compare this one. Big caveat: all hotels in the Disneyland area tend to be overpriced and under quality. But for a national brand this one really surprised me. In brief, the breakfast was gross and frequently emptied of basics, only enough parking for half the guests, the bathtub was leaking strongly, there was literally zero toilet paper in the room when we arrived, the pull out bed was unusable, some of the front desk staff were regularly grumpy, and the maid service was horrible. The two biggest problems with this hotel are the poor maid service/maintenance and the pathetic breakfast.  The only positive about the hotel is the updated rooms.  One
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay with us. We apologize for the issues that you have noted and are disappointed that our hotel did not exceed your expectations. Steps will be taken to correct those problems. Please, if you would contact me at lq2009fdsr@laquinta.com, I would be glad to further assist you with these issues.

Summary: We chose the La Quinta because of the family rooms that sleep up to 6 people, rooms that split in 2 sections which provide a bit more personal space. Room is fairly clean and looks good, but then we found a bed light placed there purely for aesthetic reasons ... there isn't a wall plug near it to plug into, so it is placed there only to look nice. A little disappointing. And for some reason they didn't think to put in a safe.  The room would be the main reason it lost the 5-rating. Location-wise it is ideal: within walking distance to Disneyland (about 15min), and right next to a mall where you can find Cheesecake Factory, PF Chang and an indoor kids playground.  There is free wifi, but for some reason it logs on and off. A little irritating, but it is fairly reliable when on.

I give 4 stars for big rooms which kids liked. However, thin walls and hall noise meant early people (cleaners, kids) very noisy.  Beds decent, toiletries, but room not cleaned on 2nd day.  Good to have frig and microwave.  Excellent pizza place nearby (Pizza Press). Good 15 min walk to Disneyland. Cheesecake factory next door, car rental places nearby, shops/bars within 15 min walk. Staff (Juan) helpful, Stephanie (?) forgot to book a tour she said she booked for my friend. Main elevator was down half our visit. Breakfast good.

Summary Heading: Dissapointed at Parking Charges and Not Complimentary as other La Quinta Inn Hotels
Summary: Very Disappointed  because they do NOT provide complimentary Parking and Charge $12 per Night Per Car. My Reservation did not stated any information about this charges and ended up paying $72 extra which could of been for a Night stay.

Too many people have come and go in this hotel. Beds need to be changed out. There are roaches in there also.  If you can afford to go somewhere else i suggest you do so. They gave effort but, the rooms are so worn out. I would not recommend this place. Sorry.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay with us. We apologize for the issues that you have noted and are disappointed that our hotel did not exceed your expectations. Steps will be taken to correct those problems. Please contact me at lq2009fdsr@laquinta.com and we can further discuss these issues.

Summary: Love the room, very spacious and clean. Great customer service and affordable hotel. Near Disneyland and accessible to restaurants and other entertainments. Have shuttle to Disneyland as well. Definitely a great time!

Summary Heading: This hotel is going downhill fast
Summary: This used to be a fairly nice place to stay. As a matter of fact, I just stayed here Oct. 2016 and everything was fine. I returned Feb. 2017 and things have really gone downhill. The elevator is out of order throughout our stay and saw no one working on it. The ice machine was broke the whole time. The hotel is extremely loud with kids running up and down the halls and screaming in the parking lot. This was not the case every other time I stayed. My TV was broken and I was assigned the wrong room upon arrival which I had reserved 4 months in advance. I had called a month in advance to confirm and I again called 2 hours before arrival. I was assured on the phone everything would be ready. Upon arrival, everything changed. I was told that not all room were cleaned so she wasn't
Manager Response: We are disappointed to learn that our service fell short of exceeding your lodging expectations. This is definitely not the kind of experience we want our guests to have.  Providing a clean, comfortable room to our guest is important to us. We will make sure your comments are shared with our Management Team, so we can use them for further training purposes.  We would like to thank you for staying with us and hope you will give us another opportunity to be of service.  Please do not hesitate to contact the hotel directly should you wish to discuss the issues further.      Respectfully,  LQ Customer Care

Summary: We have stayed here many times. It is close to Disneyland, within walking distance to Garden Walk and a few restaurants. The ART shuttle stops right at the hotel to take guests to Disneyland for about 5.50 a person. The continental breakfast is nothing fancy. Bagels, waffles, toast and cereal. Some days there were no waffles or bagels out. The pool area is nice, but the hot tub was not hot at all. I think the pool was warmer than the hot tub. Our bathtub drain stopper did not work so we just took showers. The walls are also very thin so if people were in the hallway, you could hear them talking, walking, etc. The staff was very nice to us and greeted us with smiles each time we saw them. The only thing that annoyed me was getting a notice on my car about not having a parking

This hotel was a breath of fresh air. Easy on the eyes, very friendly staff and in a great location for Disneyland! Located right across from the TOY STORY parking lot and Cheesecake Factory. There is a shuttle you can take to Disney ($5.50 per person, per day) that picks you up in the back parking lot. Very convenient. Rooms are clean and very nice. Comfortable beds and AWESOME wifi! I was on the 5th floor and had no connection issues at all.

La Quinta in Anaheim is a great hotel to stay in when visiting Disneyland.  It is not too expensive, has a continental breakfast and is within walking distance to attractions. The suites are perfect for families with a separate room with a sofa bed and TV in addition to a king or two queen beds in the main room.  It will accommodate up to 6. I have stayed there before and I will stay there again.

Summary Heading: Very cute room for the Price
Summary: Nice hotel for the price, our room had a second sitting room with a desk, couch and second TV.  The view was of the parking lot, but I was not in the room much, so it didn't matter to me. The parking area is very small, but offers valet parking when available, however parking overnight/ valet parking is $12 per night.  Hotel is blocks away from Disneyland, several nice restaurants withing 3 blocks and a CVS.  Personally I did not think a car is need while staying here.   Even though I found the bathroom & vanity to be very small, I would stay here again.  I actually bought my own sundries at the 7-11 because I found the hotel's to be a little high.

Very unpleasant front desk staff, very noisie, too expensive for what they have to offer in terms of space for rooms and does not offer the basic needs as bathroom supplies as expected, will not be staying in here ever again
Manager Response: Thank you for your direct and genuine comments.  We really appreciated the feedback. Rest assured we will be looking into the comment you have made about your experience with our front desk staff.  We hope to continue to have you as our guest, and look forward to another chance to serve you. Your comments are taken seriously and we will take steps to make the guest experience even better.                                                                                                    Thanks, LQ Customer Care

Summary: well maintained, breakfast  with large variety and quality food. Most rooms are long and narrow but stayed in another wing of the building where the shape of the room provided more space to move around in.

Very nice, staff helpful and generous with swim towels!! The breakfast menu could have been better with more protein included , but it was nice.  The kids had a blast in the pool and spa!  The adults really enjoyed the spa after three days at Disneyland!!

The last two years staying here has become less enjoyable, our room we had to transfer 3 times one we had a broken Air conditioner, the other had a completely unusable bathtub. We have stayed in a lot of La Quinta's and have always loved them. This location so close to Disneyland lacks the service :(
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We truly regret that the accommodation and services provided were not what you have expected.  Your opinion and satisfaction is very important to us and we are very sorry we were unable to meet your expectations. Thank you for bringing this to our attention.  We do hope you give us another chance as we will definitely improve our services. Sincerely,  LQ Customer Care

Summary: This La Quinta is in a great location. It's close to Disneyland, the convention center and walking distance to a few restaurants. The staff was friendly and my room was clean and well kept as was the rest of the hotel. They also have valet parking if you choose to use it.

Summary Heading: Starting to get a bit shabby
Summary: I've been staying at this hotel annually for the last 8 years and it's generally nice but no frills. A couple of years ago it was refurbished and was really nice, since then it has started to show signs of wear and is Abby rough round the edges. Still a very convenient place for Disneyland or the convention centre.

Every interaction with staff was a pleasure. Rooms have been recently renovated. Included breakfast is nothing fancy, but gets the job done. Closeable living area is great for putting the kids to bed early. Great choice for a family trip!

Excellent service  good installations kind and helpful  front desk good cost good food excellent beds  10 Minutes walking they have a computer to print any kind of documents  (check inn, tickets, etc) that you need, but the day I try to used it was broken, front desk help us and print   :)

Love that La Quinta is extremely pet friendly and hands down beats the other local mid-priced hotels when it comes to traveling with four-legged family. Good location just east of Disneyland and Convention Center.

Summary Heading: Great! Great! Great! Especially for runDisney races!
Summary: Maggie was absolutely AMAZING! She made our stay comfortable, relaxing, and the customer service was the best I've ever encountered. On our first stay a few months ago, we didn't have a pleasant experience but she asked to give them one more try and we did... And, it was the best decision we ever made.  ADDITIONALLY, the location is perfect if you don't mind being a few blocks from Disneyland. The two times we've stayed here, it was for runDisney events. The shuttle picks us up right behind the hotel - can't get more convenient than that and it's also the 1st pick up on the shuttle line for runDisney (through ART transportation). The staff also puts out goodie bags first thing in the morning for the marathon runners which is equipped with a banana, granola bar, bottle water and

This is our second stay at La Quinta and are very pleased with our experience. Overall the staff is fantastic, friendly and willing to assist where they can. I’d like to give a special kudos to Maggie Lopez. She knows how to provide excellent customer service and made our stay an enjoyable one. Things happen, nothing about staying anywhere is perfect but what can help alleviate an issue is how the staff treats you and works with you. Maggie has made a very positive impression for my wife and I which is one reason we will continue to consider La Quinta as our #1 option for staying when we are visiting Disneyland for our Disneyruns. Love that you have morning goody baggies for the marathon runners.  Property is well maintained. Enjoyed the Jacuzzi area and towels supplies were

The room was perfect for our stay. We were close to the breakfast area and could create a secluded area for our pup so he wouldn't bark at the guests walking by. This location has POOR parking but we made due. It's a walking distance to Disney. Staff was friendly and helpful. We felt safe and as we were traveling with our 3 kids, 7 and under, this mattered a lot to us. I would return here.

This was a very nice Hotel.  I was able to move back and forth from Disneyland by using the ART that would pick us up at the hotel.  The best part of the my stay were the people. I have never met a more friendly staff.  They made my stay even better.    Thank You.

We had the 2 room suite. Loved it! Would be nice to add a mirror in the second room along with its own small trash can. Surprisingly the trundle bed was comfortable. The 2 full size beds were comfy too. Very close to Disneyland-less than a half mile walk. There is a shuttle bus that you can ride for a cheap price. I think it was 3-5$ per day. We used Uber in the am. Great variety at breakfast but should add gluten-free options for those of us with Celiac Disease. The pool and Jacuzzi were nice. The fitness center needs to be upgraded. We were rather disappointed with it. Only 3 machines and the room was barely large enough to fit those 3 machines. (Eliptical, Stair climber, and treadmill)The treadmill did not work. Was nice to have the TV in there. Very happy with maintenance

Cleaners will only come once to your door.  If your door still has a "Do Not Disturb" sign on it, they will take a picture of it as proof that they planned to clean it but cannot.  So they leave and won't come back.  They arrive at 8am (as I was told by the front desk), and they will never come back until the next day.
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear that your stay was not as satisfactory as we had hoped it would be. The hotel manager will be discussing your experience with the staff to ensure we are delivering the quality of service our guests deserve. Thank you very much for bringing your concerns to our attention.    Respectfully,  LQ Customer Care

Summary Heading: Nice property Close To Disneyland Park
Summary: Had a great stay at LQ and will return soon. The property is walking distance to Disneyland, local restaurants and other businesses. I did not encounter any issues and the accommodations were very good. My room had what I needed.

Do NOT stay in this hotel. It is a dive, our rooms looked nothing lIke the online photos. It smelled like crap. The hot tub was broke. The front desk staff dude was a jerk!!!!!! Found bugs in our room during the day. Do NOT stay here!!! Very disappointed. Showed up with a family of 7 and had to try and find a new hotel. Thank you Hyatt Place for saving our trip!
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay with us.  We apologize for the issues that you have noted are disappointed that our hotel did not exceed your expectations.  Steps will be taken to correct those problems.  We do hope you will choose to stay with us again so we can have the opportunity to provide you with a better experience.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               Respectfully,                                                                                                                                                                                                          LQ Customer Care

Summary: Overall service provided was good. Room was clean, the only thing they miss is on our second day they forgot to leave towels, toilet paper and my wife have to go to front desk. They apologize and gave her some.

Beds were so - so but there are two beds in one room which is separated by doors to a fold out sofa so you could fit 6-7 people in a room. Great for a budget so you can spend your $$ at Disneyland! Pool and spa to unwind after a long day of rides! =)

I have stayed at this hotel multiple times over the past 15 years.  The rooms have been updated and the free wifi is nice.  The free breakfast has slowly gone downhill, but it is still free.  I choose this hotel because I like to walk to the parks and enjoy the nearby restaurants.  Paying to park is a drag, but seems pretty common nowadays.  The rooms are spacious and clean but don't expect quiet hallways.

I was disappointed in the room. I did not understand that it didn't have two beds instead we got a bed and a couch.  My daughter put out the do not disturb sign because she as doing a final exam for college and our room never got made up and we didn't get clean towels.

I have stayed at La Quinta Inn's before and this was by far the most disappointing. Pipes made screeching noises every time someone, in neighboring rooms, flushed their toilets or took a shower and also randomly throughout the night - made it very difficult to sleep/rest.  Food was adequate. Cleanliness was OK. Staff was indifferent.
Manager Response: We would like to offer our sincerest apologies for the noise issues you encountered during your stay. Your feedback is extremely valuable to us, as we strive to improve with each and every stay. Thank you very much for bringing your concerns to our attention.                                                                                                                              Respectfully,                                                                                                          LQ Customer Care

Summary: Hotel was close to Disneyland. Shuttle pickup was right next door. Shuttle tickets available at front counter. Great hotel for friends or family. Suite accommodated group of friends comfortably. Will definitely stay here again.

We have stayed here for years and not had any problems. This year was not a good year. It seemed really dirty for them having just remodeled a couple of years ago. Our room did not get cleaned one of the days, 2 of the days we had no hot water, we had to go to the front desk for towels. I understand that people want to bring their pets but can they not put them away from people who do not bring pets ( bottom floor so they are close to outside?) we had barking dogs a lot this time. The staff was always friendly which is nice. I don't really care for the valet parking because if you need something from your car you have to hunt down someone to get your keys. I will have to let some time pass before I will stay there again which is sad because again we have stayed there for years

Stayed here one night .  It was okay - pretty typical for a La Quinta.  They allow pets so that's a plus for the future,  The breakfast was disappointing and the other guests were plain rude.  It is close to Disneyland and their parking if that is the destination.

Summary Heading: I'm a fan & cannot wait to go back!
Summary: From the front desk staff (Julian is a tremendous asset to your company) to the gorgeous rooms to the location, this is my new go-to place to stay in the Anaheim area. We had to minor issues which were more than professionally addressed and cleared up efficiently, and every minute spent at the property was wonderful. It's location, price, quality and staff cannot be beat in the area.

The breakfast wasn't the greatest but the rest was awesome.  Very close to Disneyland, 10 minute walk, and the property was excellent.  The rooms were very clean and roomy.  It was located across the street from some excellent restaurants.

The secondary bed is brick hard. Yhe toilet was stianed. The TV set didn't work one day. The parking lot is too small, forcing you to valet park when you arrive back at night. The breakfast was terrible, and we have had much better at other La Quintas.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to express your concerns regarding the experience that you encountered during a recent stay at our location. We are very sorry that you had such a negative experience while staying with us. We would like to better understand the circumstances of your experience. Would you mind contacting the hotel manager at lq2009gm@laquinta.com                                                                                                             Sincerely,                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           LQ Customer Care

Summary Heading: Pet friendly and affordable way to do Disneyland!
Summary: My husband and I love staying at La Quinta Inns because they are pet friendly (and don't charge a pet fee) - so we booked this La Quinta when we went to Disneyland and it was so nice! We had a huge suite where our dog could chill out while we went and acted like big kids in Disneyland. It's in walking distance to Disney so we didn't have to worry about parking, or driving after a night out in Downtown Disney. And the free continental breakfast was clutch when you know you're going to have to spend a lot of money on lunch and dinner inside the park.

No hot water for two of the three days we stayed.  Seems to be due to facility being at full occupancy.  Lots of noise from outside door.  Bus service to Disneyland is very good.  Food at hotel is basic.  Lots of places to eat across street.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback regarding your stay.   Our guest expectation is very important to us and when we fall short we take it very serious and strive to correct the issues. So that the General Manager can better understand the circumstances of your experience, please contact the manager directly at lq2009gm@lqreviews.com.  While an apology will regrettably not alter the outcome of your experience on this occasion, we do extend it with all sincerity.                                                                     Respectfully,                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      LQ Customer Care

Summary: This hotel is within close proximity to Disney parks, Downtown Disney, shops, and dining, as well as the freeway. In addition, the competitive room rate and accommodations make this hotel a great value for families.

We booked this room as it offered a separate room for our kids to sleep in  this part was great. However, they claim the hotel is smoke free we were on the fifth floor and there were numerous rooms of folks smoking. It was awful. Also, the hot water fir showers only worked 2/6 nights. The front desk at checkout was very very rude. The valet parking guys were very friendly and helpful. Next time we will be looking for a more friendly hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  This is definitely not the kind of experience we want our guests to have.  I'm so sorry about the issues you encountered with the hot water and the smoke odor. We hope you will allow us an opportunity to redeem ourselves should your future travels find you in the area again.

Summary: Staff took care of everything and made the stay nice.  They made sure that any requests that I had were taken care of.  This hotel has a very good staff that works together to make the guests stay very good.

Summary Heading: Looks nice, but don't look too hard
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel many many times over the past couple of years - mainly because they welcome dogs - but we are probably not going to stay there again. This could be a nice facility, but it is poorly run. The staff is pleasant, but you get the feeling there is nobody in the driver's seat. Each time we go, it is something new. We stayed there for almost a week one time, and there was the same gum wrapper in the hallway that was there when we first arrived. The outside grounds are littered with cigarette butts and the area where you can walk your dog is overflowing with dog droppings. Absolutely, owners should pick up after their pets, and we always do, but when people do not, somebody needs to go out and clean it up at least once a day. At times it's been so bad that

Great location, one block to several top restraunts, 15 minute walk to the ticket booth at Disneyland. Free basic breakfast, great waffles, clean pool and spa, covered parking, nice rooms and very friendly staff. I would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Great Location, stay was good deal
Summary: Stayed at the La Quinta with special rate. The hotel was a little loud with kids, but I had 2 dogs so it evened out. Breakfast was free and about a 6 on the satisfaction scale. Best part was right next door to Disney Bus to resort. Staff was exemplary and super nice.

We had a great stay. Breakfast was great, the rooms were clean kept up, and a great location. We were able to walk to the park and to the a few different food places. Get with the front desk on the times the bus passes to the hotel if you are not into walking. I would recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Guest service and housekeeping/general maintenance lacking
Summary: Check in/out service great, however front desk in evening wouldn't answer the phone, or follow through with commitments. Pool was dirty with improper chemical balance caused burning eyes for my nephew. A/C worked poorly in room. Tub didn't drain properly. Housekeeping did not replace towels or bath tissue so we had to get this ourselves after multiple requests. Breakfast food okay, but slim selection which never varied. Need to hire evening/night people who will answer the phone. Smoking area next to the pool so it was hard to breathe. Will find another location to stay our next trip.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback regarding your stay at the La Quinta Inn & Suites.  We’re very concerned about the issues you’ve mentioned and are sorry that we dropped the ball as we did during your stay.  You should expect a room that is clean and well taken care of, and we failed you here. We have worked with our pool company to regulate the chemicals. Our front desk team is going to use this review to help improve the quality of stay for our guests.

Summary: We stay at LaQuinta as often as they are available to us.  The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are always clean and quiet. The location is good, you can walk to Disney or take a shuttle which is conveniently located just around the back of the hotel. It is reasonable. Sometimes coming home from the park you have to wait for a shuttle because of the crowds but that is not an issue for us.

Nice sized room, wish we had been on the back to see the Disney fireworks, but we could hear them. Breakfast was ok, nothing special, pretty crowded. Pool is odd. You have to walk through the parking lot to find it under the parking garage. But it was clean and refreshing after a long day. Everyone we had contact with was nice, helpful. There were a lot of families. It could get a bit noisy in the mornings when people were excited to be heading out to Disneyland. We used the ART shuttle to and from Disney, that was convenient if nothing else. We also attended a playoff baseball game during our stay. It was nice to be near the freeway for getting there on gameday. Overall, a nice stay.

Summary Heading: Great location with the worst pool area under the parking garage!!
Summary: We chose this hotel because of their generous free dog stay policy and location to Disneyland was wonderful. The hotel, on the plus side, it was clean, no dogs scent in rooms, modern, friendly, helpful staff, with valet ($9 a night charge) and was great getting us a room with a view of fireworks on the 5 th floor! On the negative side the lobby is small without a nice seating area, packed breakfast area on the second floor without hot eggs, sausage, cheese or salsa, a small, dirty pool area under the parking garage was the worst one I have ever experienced at La Quinta for a higher price per night!! The location is ideal with a Garden Walk restaurant area across the street, 10 min drive to Disneyland. Would I stay again? Yes, if I brought a dog otherwise I would like to find a

So I stayed here in a 2 room suite for 4 days in Mid October 2016.  I used points for a free stay. The hotel is OK. Not walking distance from Disneyland but right on the bus line for 5 dollars a day.  Rooms are clean. And staff is friendly. Not Alot of frills. Pool and hot tub are ok but the hot Tub is Luke warm at best..  close to a few restaurants so that is convenient.

I really loved to stay there, people were so nice and kind, always clean. you can even go to Disneyland walking every morning and every night. I would stay there again with no doubts!!!! Great job  La Quinta!

Summary Heading: A New Skin on an Old Building
Summary: The Good: I like the suite style, giving you a separate room and a more relaxed feel. Attractive finishes.  The desk staff, valets and maids were all quite nice and helpful. Cheap price. Decent breakfast. The Bad: Found two cockroaches in the tub upon arrival. No fan in bathroom. Very noisy. Pool is under the building. Parking ran out one evening. And the worst: the fire alarm in the "living room" beeped every 20 seconds on Sunday morning starting at 7:30 (our one day to sleep in). It was apparently "fixed" only to repeat itself a couple days later, starting at 4:30am, a beep every twenty seconds.  Apparently since I had booked through Expedia there was nothing he could do in terms of credits or refunds.  Probably not going to go back.

This was our families 2nd stay for Disneyland. This location is perfect for your trip to Disneyland. The stay is inexpensive, includes breakfast, and your car will be safe because they offer a shuttle to the resort while your vehicle is safely parked in their garage. The only mistake I made was not opting for the queen suit. The double beds are...well double beds.

We loved our rooms. We had a separate king room with another room with 2 double beds and another room with a fold out couch. Plenty of room for all our stuff and even had 2 bathrooms! I got a pretty low price that was great considering the prices at the surrounding hotels. The price jumped up significantly for the next few weeks.

We really enjoyed the convenience of the La Quinta and the overall appearance. It worked well for us and was extremely easy to get to the parks and our check in and checkout was seamless.  No stress at all and a great staff!  Maggie Lopez was exceptional in all her efforts prior arranging immediate check in for some early arrivals in our party.  She was pleasant and professional and just a pleasure to meet!  We will return!  Thank you again!

great location - close to everything. Pool nice - staff nice - breakfast "ok" - wish there were better choices of yogurts -- rooms comfortable - we had the "apartment" which worked out great for our family with extended family so we could all stay together -- housekeeping very very accommodating with room supplies - pool was great and made for a 'cooling' off place after a long day at local parks.  Very close to Disneyland - Disney California and Knotts Berry Farm with transportation available so you don't have to walk - great restaurants next door as well as down the street. The Chinese restaurant listed on the 'order to deliver' is amazing!!  HIGHLY recommend.

This is a very good hotel we have sayed in this hotel many times and have had my share of probables in this hotel but they always make it right. We have become aquanauted with the manager. she is nice and always goes out of her way to say hello to us.

Temperature of the rooms difficult to control. Pool chlorine was several times the recommended limit and bleached all the families swimming suits. Close to Disneyland to walk to the park. Resist the urge to buy bus passes to the park. The free breakfast is a nice addition. The extra trundle bed had a mattress that was not worthy to sleep on, though the pull out twin mattress was great.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  This is definitely not the kind of experience we want our guests to have. I'm so sorry about the issues you encountered.  Would you mind contacting me at the hotel directly? I’m looking forward to speak with you.

Summary: I am torn between giving this a rating of a 2 or a 3.  Our room was nice and clean and also comfortable. We brought our 2 dogs and that worked out very well.  The problem was that this place must have paper thin walls because we could hear every time someone closed a door and every hallway conversation.  We were just a few doors away from the housekeeping area, and the housekeepers were extremely loud going in and out. Someone in housekeeping was running a commercial carpet shampooer in the room next to us and we had to call to complain because it was in the evening.  The bed was comfortable but we slept very poorly because of the noises throughout the night.
Manager Response: Thanks for sharing your comments about your experiences at our La Quinta Inn & Suites.  We appreciate you taking the time to post your comments about your stay, and we’re sorry you did not get a great night’s sleep while with us.  We’ll be working with our team to make sure they are more aware of the surroundings so we can stop issues like hallway noise from happening again.  We want all of our guests to have a great night’s sleep when staying with us and we’re hoping you’ll come back and give us another try!

Summary: We stayed here the first weekend in October to go to Disneyland.  It is about a 20 minute walk to the front of the parks.  We got a room with one king and a separate room with a sleeper sofa.  There is a sliding door that separates the rooms and both rooms have a TV.  The bathroom has a toilet and bath/shower.  The sink is in the main room entrance.  Beds were very comfortable and with the air conditioner fan on it drowned out all the noise.  The air blew very cold and was comfortable with the hot humid days outside.  The bathroom and room were updated and clean.  There was a microwave and refrigerator in the room.  This location does charge for parking and there are limited self park spaces.  Valet is an additional $9 fee in addtiion to the $9 a day parking fee.  Breakfast had

Summary Heading: Perfect stay that you will just love.
Summary: Enjoyed our stay while at Disney,  great price, very comfortable and clean.  Front desk was so helpful and fast when we checked in and out. My car was parked for us in a good spot.  This is a pet friendly hotel and out dogs just loved it too, go outside to do their business and back to the hotel room.  Breakfast was pretty good, waffles, bagels, cold cereal with lots of fruit, was good since it was free.  Would gladly tell anyone that this is the place to stay when you go to Disney since you can take the bus or walk within 15 minutes.  Really Loved Our Stay, Thanks for the wonderful service and we will see you again for our next Disney trip.

We Have Stayed at La Quinta before and was not disappointed staying here. the Room/Suite was spacious and Clean and Modern. 2 TVs microwave and Fridge. Staff were helpful. Bus/Shuttle (number 7) stops right next to the hotel for Disneyland. Tickets for shuttle can be bought at Reception for $5 Adult Day Pass. Very Good Eateries around the corner in Katella Ave. Well Priced. Very Happy we stayed here and would do so again

This hotel was so much more than we had hoped for! WE had a large group and the room fit all of us comfortably! The beds were great after a long day at the parks. The hotel was clean and family friendly. Very close to Disneyland and multiple restaurants. The ART bus stop was extremely close and made it super convenient to get from hotel to park every day. Will definitely be staying here from now on for our trips to Disneyland. Wish I had stumbled upon this place sooner!

Our room had no service for the first 3 days.  I know there was a card on the dresser that they would only change the linens after three days unless we put that card on the pillow.  But they didn't even come in and empty the trash or clean the bathrooms. Then when we called for them to come they didn't show up until the next day.  All of our towels were quite wet and soiled and needed to be changed but I don't think anyone form the hotel even saw them until the 4th day (out of 5 day stay)

Spent 3 nights here on our road trip. All the staff were very pleasant and helpful. Our room was a 2 room suite, which we hadn't booked so was surprised. We had a king bed in 1 room and a lounge which would have folded out to a bed, which we didn't need, this was in another room. The room was a good size and clean. The bed was very comfy. Breakfast was continental and acceptable. Had a small fee to pay for shuttle to Disney which run regularly but was still close enough to walk if you had the energy after a long day. Plenty of restaurants and convenience stores within walking distance. All in all a very pleasant stay.

Went to stay for a few days, be aware, this is a dirty and not well kept hotel. Arrived at 3:00 pm for check in, was given room  keys and sent up. The maid had just started to clean, went back to front desk, was given another room. When we got to the room, the maid was still working. UGH. This did not start well. The room was nice, but the hotel itself was dirty. Not what I would expect from LA Quinta. Would not stay here again.

Summary Heading: Excellant Place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: The hotel is located within walking distance of Disneyland.  The staff is excellent and the hotel is well kept and clean inside.  The rooms/suites are large and allow for extra space and sleeping area.  The hotel does charge for parking but is less than what other hotels charge.  It is a good value for where it is located.  The three star rating probably should be 3.5 or 4 but it meets all the standards and is comfortable for groups or families.

Staff was very helpful and attentive. They were very knowledgeable and were very helpful with anything we needed help with. The valet staff was very helpful.  I love that I can bring my dogs without fees and extra cost.  Our stay helped make our trip very enjoyable.  I have only one thing that I kind of had a problem with, not enough to not stay there, I don't think parking should cost. We paid to stay there, parking should be part of the cost.

We spent 3 nights at the La quinta before departing to drive Route 66 The room was very well presented and contained a king bed with microwave and fridge and w as very clean. Breakfast was below standard and served on paper plates with plastic knives and forks which bent with little pressure. There was lots of noise in the corridors at all hours of the day and night which sometimes disturbed sleep. Had to contact reception at 10pm to get the room above to stop children running. A good place to stay if you want to visit Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Good location and value for Disney.
Summary: This was my first stay at La Quinta.  Overall I will say it was a good experience.  For the price of the place I got what I expected.  The rooms were fairly clean, the location was great, and the staff was very friendly.  I am picky traveller but I do give reviews based on the amount I paid.  Since this is a budget hotel I will say it was a good choice.  The one thing I will complain about is the breakfast.  The breakfast is junk.

Not a bad stay at La Quinta w/in walking distance to Disney w/ pet friendly (very) accommodations.  Will go back when doggies travel w/us.  Most people were nice and when the sofa bed was not an option, the young man on shift 'took care of us'.  Overall, a descent place to stay.

We stayed 3 nights at La Quinta in Anaheim in early August 2016. The purpose of the visit was Disney parks. Nice hotel with strong colors in Mexican style. We received a suite with two rooms: a sitting area + 2 double-beds. Parking is not complementary ($ 9, valet parking). The hotel is located 15 minutes' walk from Disney parks. We decided to walk instead of driving and it was fine. The hotel is very simple, poor breakfast, pool is located next to the parking lot and a little old. Do not expect anything fancy... Staff was nice and welcoming, the price was reasonable relatively to August and other hotels closer to the park. We were all day in the parks and only came to sleep, so it was OK.

great hotel the family all enjoyed  good breakfast nice and clean pool we will come back to this hotel for our next trip. what i like more was at breakfast area all was nice and clean and it was a staff there checking all the time thats is a great customer service.  Thanks    Abraham

Summary Heading: Good Hotel, bathrooms not so good
Summary: Just stayed one night, but overall okay. Breakfast, okay. Slept well. Wish the bathrooms had a fan, and wasn't so small. Really wasn't there for the hotel room, but the walking distance to Disneyland was good.

Not a bad visit and the location is pretty good.  The bus picked us up pretty quickly going to Disneyland and having the Cheesecake Factory across the street was nice.  Rooms seemed old and the pool location wasn't too nice.  Staff was nice and the rooms were kept clean.  This was our second time staying here and would recommend if you are just going to sleep there.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel, Needs a Little Work
Summary: Spent 2 nights here on a family weekend at Disneyland. While our stay for the most part was a good one, there were a couple issues that might make us look for another hotel option near Disneyland in the future.  1) The tub/shower in our room was extremely dirty. It appeared stained and as if it hadn't been properly cleaned in quite a while. We seriously considered not even using it.   2) The AC unit in the room was rather loud, in fact, I turned it off at night. It wasn't that hot overnight so it wasn't a big deal, but if it had been any hotter it might have been issue  3) The water to our toilet appeared to have been turned off during our 2nd day at the hotel. We were awoken by a loud vibrating sound (which at first I thought was the AC that I had just turned on) before I

Stayed there for a family Disney vacation; it is really close to Disney Parks and in front of good restaurants. The rooms are ok, bathtubs need a little updating. Breakfast is a typical breakfast included in any other hotel fare.

The bathroom only offered handicap bars and a large space for a wheel chair. The lighting was poor and not much counter space room in the bathroom for handicap use.The breakfast was only okay. The staff was very helpful.

Average- room, clean, accomodations met my expectation for the price.  Traveling with 6 people, 5 adults & 18mo baby.  Close proximity to many places to visit as well as Disneyland.  All restaurants very close mostly within walking distance.  All restaurants definitely overpriced but that is expected next to Disney.  Overall good experience, Would ask for a better breakfast experience then just toast, fruit and hard boiled eggs.

Summary Heading: Great for teenagers and to take Catalina Flyer from Newport
Summary: This location was very clean, the bath room the rooms and the fridge as well as all guest areas. The staff was  helpful and friendly. We stayed in a double room with 2 teenagers. This was perfect for privacy but not having the expense or 2 separate rooms. Great location to take the Catalina flyer from Newport beach. The breakfast did not have a great selection. Parking lot is small. Be prepared to take all  things out of your vehicle you need to have your vehicle valet parked after the lot is full/ no extra cost. Have already made plans to stay again.

Staying in your hotel during the hot summer month in Anahiem, to have terrible A/C that is not adequate to keep your room cool is completely unacceptable to me. I can't imagine the cost of putting in the a new A/C unit, but I can promise that you'll continually lose repeat business due to that fact only. Every where I went in that hotel, I was consistently sweating and everyone else I saw.
Manager Response: Thanks for sharing your comments about your experiences at our La Quinta Inn & Suites.  We appreciate you taking the time to post your comments about your stay, and we’re sorry you did not get a great night’s sleep while with us.  We’ll be working with our team to get the a/c issues cleared up. Not having a/c during the summer months does not make for a comfortable stay. We want all of our guests to have a great night’s sleep when staying with us and we’re hoping you’ll come back and give us another try!

Summary: Breakfast was great for a big family, but they should change up for variety.  the cleanliness can be better especially the bathroom. maintenance was very slow  Room size is big Appreciated the 2 TVs in room

About a month ago, I stayed at this location for 2 nights on a trip to Disneyland with my partner and dog. This hotel had some great amenities and excellent customer service, but there were a few things that were pretty bad that I have to mention. Mostly a great value for the cost - see my tips at the end of this review.  Location: This hotel is about 3/4 of a mile away from the Disneyland entrance. It's walkable, but due to the heat I chose to take the bus/shuttle. You can purchase bus tickets in the hotel lobby - they are $5 per adult for an all day pass. The bus stop is in the Extended Stay America parking lot next door, and the bus arrives every 20 minutes. For the days I stayed, it was running from about 6:30 am to 12:30 am. Check my tips at the end of this review to find

We were very happy with our 3 night stay. The room was great plenty of room for a family of 4. Having a laundry room was also handy we did find the dryers with an out of service sign on them at times however on further investigation we realised they were working fine. Breakfast was no 5* breakfast but it was fine for us. We had the cereal or toast every morning with coffee or juice and would be satisfied to start our morning at Disney. The bus that goes to disneyland picks you up next door to the hotel which was perfect and the front desk can arrange your bus pass/ticket. We did walk home from Disneyland once and didnt think it was to far of a walk. About 10-15min Rooms were clean, neds were comfy, felt safe and elevator wasnt a problem with noise etc as some other reviewers

Worst La Quinta customer service at the front desk and by administrative staff I have in all the places I have experienced throughout the US.  Physical facilities and food were fine and the place was accessible to Angels Stadium and to restaurants within walking distance.
Manager Response: Thanks for your comments regarding your stay at our La Quinta Inn & Suites.  We’re sorry about the experiences you’ve mentioned, and your comments are concerning to us.  Service is something we take quite seriously, and we’d like to better understand what happened during your stay.  Would you mind contacting us at lq2009gm@lqreviews.com.  So we may discuss with you personally.  We appreciate your feedback and hope to hear from you soon!

Summary: Good Hotel close to park with out all the traffic. Quite Street. Close to restaurants. Short bus to Disneyland.  Request a 5th floor room so you don't have to hear the people upstairs. Also be advised that there is a $9 a parking and also a tourism tax.

Summary Heading: I will DEFINITELY be staying here on our next Family Vacation to Disneyland!!!
Summary: We drove in late from a Dodgers Baseball game on a Friday night. We were immediately greeted by Valet, He was so helpful and made us feel safe. We were told that our 2 room 2 queen with a pull out bed, was no longer available. So they upgraded us to a 2 room 2 king with a pull out bed. At no extra charge!! On top of that, it was a room at the end of the hallway (room 432). So you didn't hear any noise from the hallway or much of anything. The room it self was very spacious and very clean, the beds were very comfortable. We have small children, so we were not able to stay late to see the fireworks at Disney (plus we were on Texas time) To our surprise, we had the best seat in the house to watch the fireworks from our hotel window. Everyone was showered and ready for bed, when we

The service was very poor and the staff was unprofessional.  The room had pet dander all over the floor.  Tried to get extra towels and bedding.  Instead of providing the extra towels and bedding, I was told by staff that my reservation did not indicate that I would need extra towels and bedding.  The sofa bed was loud and uncomfortable.  My reservation was for two days, I checked out after one day and chose another hotel to stay in.  Will never stay at this hotel again.
Manager Response: Thanks for your comments regarding your stay at our La Quinta Inn & Suites.  We’re sorry about the pet dander and extra supplies. We will be having our maintenance team go over the room completely. Service is something we take quite seriously, and we’d like to better understand what happened during your stay.  Would you mind contacting us at lq2009gm@lqreviews.com.  So we may discuss with you personally.  We appreciate your feedback and hope to hear from you soon!

Summary: Rude and careless staff. I expected much different. The AC unit in the ceiling (in the bathroom) was leaking water. The shower pressure was so bad that we could not use the shower. And any time we called, it seemed like there was something more important to do. The room was not in a quieter location, but come to find out the hotel overbooked. I did not find this out until I went to check in. I guess a room guarantee means something different for your hotel. I didn't arrive until late, but still, my room type was guaranteed. Then to stand there while the clerk resets the machine. At 130 AM, I stood there for 45 minutes watching this guy not know what the heck he was doing. Then, at 1145 am the next morning, I called for a late checkout explaining all of the mishaps, and the

Stayed for three nights, the beds were comfortable and the place is quiet.  Not too far from Disneyland.  The continental breakfast although complimentary, not enough variety, a lot of empty carbs & sugars, the only protein are hard boiled eggs.  $9.00 per day is charged for parking whether self park or valet.  There are no bells or whistles at the LaQuinta on Clementine.  The rooms are nice enough, we were there for Disneyland, and were only at the hotel to sleep & shower.

We realize anywhere around Disneyland there are going to be noisy kids and people coming in late at night.  We were by the elevator and heard it dinging all night. We love the fact hotel is pet-friendly and has free wi-fi and free breakfast. If we'd stayed another night would have asked for a different room.

Dog friendly, grounds to walk dogs on and they don't charge extra or hidden pet fees. The covered pool area was really nice to cool down on a hot day. The staff is very friendly and they have valet parking. Continental Breakfast was good with combination of cold and hot foods to choose from.

We stay at this hotel because it's within walking distance to Disneyland and includes breakfast. We reserved the two double and a pull out bed. For a little larger family the room fits out needs and is a good value.

Compare to several hotels near by Disneyland; this is probably the best when you consider the price, distance and value trade off. About 1 mile away from Disney; nice double room, two bed; free breakfast and plenty of nice family restaurant ... What else could one ask for?

The valet/bell person grabbed the bags from my wife's hands and put them on his cart. I told him we did not need his help twice he proceeded to do it anyway saying it was no problem. We only had a couple of bags. I did not want to pay for him to take our bags to the room after paying $9.00 to park the car or even feeling obligated to tip him for the bags. He was very pushy and I feel he needs to be retrained as well as fix his personal hygiene if he is to set foot in my room to put the bags inside. This occurred at approx. 5:00 pm on my check-in date.

We have stayed here multiple times over the  last 8 years. I used to think it was a great little hotel close to Disney. The bus to Disney stopped in their parking lot, free continental breakfast and decent on-premise parking. I think they haven't changed, just our families expectations have grown with time. I think we got used to Hampton Inns and Residence Inns over the years. The staff at this hotel was pleasant and helpful. For the most part, hotel is clean and I think, recently updated with new flooring. This visit, our room's A/C dripped on the floor.  Not a huge deal, just kept a towel on floor to catch water. Staff came to look at it, but wasn't resolved during our stay. The breakfast variety is very minimal, again, we got used to other hotel breakfast offerings. You won't

I stayed in the La Quinta in Anaheim for 1 evening and I was impressed.  First off, they let us check in super early- a little after 9am.  The front desk gal was really friendly and efficient.  Even the bell boy (we didn't use him) was super friendly and helpful with directions and shuttle info.  Our room was nice and updated.  One area had 2 double beds with a flat screen TV, small fridge and microwave.  In another area there was a double bed with a trundle (pull out bed) underneath.  That section had its own flat screen TV, too.  There was a wall slider, so you could block off the 2 areas for privacy if you wanted.  The wifi worked great which was a big plus.  My only complaint was that the restroom smelled really musty.  Not sure if the housekeeper used an old mop or what?
