The room was very nice with plenty of room, good bed, nice separate living room and quite. It is located within walking distance to pretty much all of the sights in the area. Priced right, great rooms, friendly staff and a low price! What more can you ask for?

Staff were polite, the hotel is pet friendly but it has no area for pets.  Overall, I will stay again if I travel back to Anaheim. The cleaning service was a little slow to clean the room hallway and the vending machine area.

Enjoyed our stay.  Room and entire hotel were clean.  Every staff member we encountered were friendly and helpful.  I plan on staying here again in the future.  The breakfast was good with a good variety.

We enjoyed every minute of our stay here. Very friendly staff and spotless rooms with plenty of space. Approximately 20 min easy walk to Disneyland. Right next door to PF Changs, Cheesecake Factory and Bubba Shrimp.  Highly recommend La Quinta Anaheim.

Great staff but terrible rooms. No attention to details when it comes to room cleanliness. Had some sheets that looked they had blood stains and you could hear everything that was going on in the room upstairs.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel, I was very disappointed that your stay was not up to standard.  I will personally share your feedback regarding the attention to detail with our Management team at the property. If you would like to discuss this further please feel free to reach out to the General Manager at your convenience. Again, I apologize for not providing a more enjoyable stay and the Manager may be reached directly at lq2009gm@laquinta.com.  Thanks, LQ Customer Care

Summary Heading: Good sleeping accommodations, but very average (or below) overall.
Summary: We stayed here because we could not find availability in Los Angeles (or anywhere down the coast from our northern California drive).  The best thing about it was it had enough beds for our family to sleep in.  The layout of the room was somewhat awkward.  In particular, they had a closet with a door that opened up into the room and it was right next to the bathroom.  The bathroom had a vanity out in the main room with a separate small room for the toilet and shower.  I personally wish they did not allow dogs or wish they would at least contain them better (all to the first floor maybe).  Multiple times I went to access the elevator only to find people with multiple dogs waiting to get on the elevator.  Plus there were others letting there dogs use the bathroom just outside of

This hotel was a pleasant surprise - a great deal on a rate, comfortable, clean room, walking distance to Disneyland, plus free breakfast, pool, and reasonably-priced parking. This will be our go-to hotel whenever we're in town from now on!
Manager Response: I appreciate your positive feedback about our hotel. We do take pride in catering to our guests' needs the best way we can. If you're traveling to our area gain soon, don't  hesitate to call us.   Thanks, LQ Customer Care

Summary: The location is very convenient to Disneyland and restaurants. It helps us to know this is dog friendly hotel. The hotel staffs are very courteous and helpful. The rooms are clean and spacious. For this price, we can't ask for more.
Manager Response: I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and that you would recommend us to a friend. We hope to welcome you back to the hotel in the near future.  Thanks, LQ Customer Care

Summary: This hotel was adequate. The breakfast was all right, not great. Our room was not cleaned one day and we were not offered any compensation for the inconvenience. We could not hear our neighbors on either side but we could hear the noisy people upstairs very clearly. It is definitely a 20 minute walk to the Disney parks.

Great service. Clean, comfortable and large King room with couch, desk, two TVs with remotes, King bed and amenities.  The shower leaked and the bedding was a little stained but great room overall.  Did not let us know about the parking fees until after the stay from the final bill.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and I am glad to hear that your stay with us was a memorable one! We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.   Thanks, LQ Customer Care

Summary: Excellent location, .9 mile from Disneyland/California Adventure, commercial shuttle service to and from Disneyland for flat fee. Walking distance to fine and/or casual dining. Very clean and well furnished rooms.

We chose La Quinta because it accepted pets and was within walking distance of the Anaheim Convention Center. (It is also within walking distance of Disneyland.) It is quite affordable, our room was clean, and the staff was firendly. But there is a $9 per day parking fee; the two phones in our room did not work the first two days, compelling me to use my cell phone to reach the front desk; the vending machine on our floor was not working; there was no hot water the first day (it was warm enough for a short shower, but not hot); and, finally, the cable channel selection was limited. I know that these are fairly trivial complaints, and no single event ruined our visit. But, after all was said and done, I felt like there was no reason to select this motel again. With so many

The rooms were clean, a little dated for me but all in all it was a good room for the cost. We were in a suite 2 room. Beads were not hard but not soft either. Pillows were a bit soft for my liking but HAY if you bring your own it all good. Off the beaten path from Disneyland. you will have to take the shuttle ART.

Hotel was good with the exception of the bathroom drain.  Staff was friendly.  Parking was not the best. Close to Cheesecake Factory Restaurant and Disneyland. Would be very convenient if going to Disneyland.

great stay, great service from Maggie our check in clerk!! We love this motel and have always had great service and good quality for our money!!!  Close to Disneyland, they always have helped us with any of our needs.

Summary Heading: A great price close to Disney
Summary: We are a military family and La Quinta has, hands down, the best rate of any national chain.  They are within walking distance to the parks and surrounded by restaurants.  Rooms are clean and staff is super friendly.

This hotel is less expensive than many others near this location. It is a little run down compared to other LaQuinta's I have stayed at. The staff was helpful and friendly and knowledgeable making this Disney trip successful.

Summary Heading: Great place for family with pets
Summary: Great breakfast,close to restaurants & walking distant to Disney Parks. Friendly & clean. Had a great time would stay their again for the price and convince, well worth it.  Art shuttle for a fee can be purchased from hotel and picks you up and returns you back to hotel save on the parking fee $18 at Disney lot, leave your car at hotel and take the shuttle.

Staff is friendly and helpful.  Hotel is older but still a value for the price.  I always know what to expect with this location.  Also the hotel is in a good location to go to major attractions and centrally located for work.

Had to asked for different room because we were given a room next to the laundry  room which shooked the bed everytime the washer was in use. Loud people in hallway walking to and from elevator. Once we were in our new room, the room door did not close completely and had a 2-3 inch gap which allowed noise, light and smoke from people illegally smoking in the hallways.

I booked this hotel for my family's quick trip down to DIsneyland for Mickey Mouses' Halloween Celebration. Nothing spectacular going on here. The rooms and grounds are average at best. The parking is horrible. Spaces are small and there are not many. If you have a big car like I do (Suburban), good luck. The room were dated and could have been a little neater. The breakfast was good. A lot of variety for even the pickiest eater. I didn't have much interaction with the staff besides checking in and out. On a negative note, we did find old dried up dog poop in our room. They quickly cleaned it up and gave us a night for free. Overall, I wouldn't book here again.

Summary Heading: Great Staff makes you feel at home
Summary: This was our second visit to this hotel and the staff remembered us and our dog from the last visit. You never wait for anything, beds are confortable, rooms clean and towels are plenty. Suites give you an option to spread out and enjoy yourself during down time.

We choose to stay here due to the close proximity to Disneyland. We had two adults and two young kids. We decided to park on Disney property...mistake! The lot was farther than the hotel. It is a 20 minute walk...it is seriously faster to walk with a double stroller than to drive for our family. (We actually tested this on the way home). Breakfast was good and had a nice selection (boiled eggs, waffles, oatmeal, yogurt, cereals), but coffee was awful. You are warned if you are a Starbucks drinker.  We had a two room suite with a door. Unfortunately, the dividing wall was frosted glass so when the kids went to bed, we had to turn the lights totally off as not to disturb them.  Poor design if you ask me.  There was ample parking at the hotel for $9 a night.

I would never recommend this hotel to anyone, the price is above most and you get horrible food, no parking and a very unsafe atmosphere.  When you ask for help with anything, the staff just blows you off.
Manager Response: Thanks for your comments regarding your stay at our La Quinta Inn & Suites.  We’re sorry about the experiences you’ve mentioned, and your comments are concerning to us.  Service is something we take quite seriously, and we’d like to better understand what happened during your stay.  Would you mind contacting us at lq2009gm@lqreviews.com.  So we may discuss with you personally.  We appreciate your feedback and hope to hear from you soon

Summary: The staff at the La Quinta Inn & Suites really out did themselves this time. Andy & Maggie are phenomenal!!! We planned a special surprise birthday event at Disneyland for my daughters birthday. After a long drive to Anaheim, they were able to squeeze us into early check in so we could unload the car before heading over to the happiest place on earth. Upon return from the day at Disneyland, they decorated the room for my daughter with streamers & a banner. She was so excited she cried! I could not thank these guys enough for being so attentive and accommodating. The room was beautiful. Very roomy & clean. The free breakfast in the morning was delicious. My son had 10 waffles that morning! LOL. We'll definitely be returning for another stay at La Quinta! Thank you all so very

Summary Heading: A lot of bang for the buck
Summary: The kids were going to a prom in the area so my wife and I were looking for a hotel that had enough bedding space to accommodate our kids as well as local restaurants and shops. We were able to rent a room that had more than enough space as well as privacy for the kids to get dressed. Plus we were able to keep an eye on their activities without hiring private detectives.  The people were friendly and the hotel clean. If we end up in the area for something else we will definitely be back and consider La Quinta for other events in other locations.

We just stayed here for one night.  We went to celebrate my step daughters 12th birthday.  First thing that our stay great was the staff.  With Andy and Maggie.  They just made sure everything was taken care of.  They went well beyond the call of duty.  They probably service thousands of guest a year.  They were so kind to our family.  The valet staff were also great. I have give Felipe a shout out.  Overall we will be back to this hotel for sure.  The rooms were great they were very clean and roomy.  The free breakfast got us off to great start the next day.  Thank you again La Quinta staff.

I was in town for the scrapbook expo in Anaheim. Needed a modest hotel for my stay, and I've stayed at this location before. I arrived at midnight, and the parking was terrible- no spots open, and so small. They did offer to valet my car, which was fine. Parking is now charged ($9) which is something new. The room was fine- I stayed with a friend so we got the king size- 2 room with sofa bed. Accommodations were fine. I stayed in room 440, which is at the end of the hallway. My room shook off/on, it felt like a long rolling earthquake. My assumption was it was the elevator, but I am not really sure. Made it hard to relax and sleep. Never experienced that before with my previous stays. Breakfast was fine- oatmeal, hard boiled eggs, waffles, bagels, cereal, etc. Overall- a decent

I enjoy staying here for Disneyland.  Pet stay free wish they had more grass for our 4 legged friends.  Not a bad free breakfast.  Has great suites that work for large sized families.  There is a shuttle that will take you to disneyland for small fee tickets can be purchased at the front desk.  Walking distance to assortment of restaurants.  Clean rooms and if there happens to be problem they will take care of it.

Our room was very clean and comfortable, the breakfasts were disappointing compared to other La Quinta's we have stated in.  Go to breakfast early or they may run out of the basics before you get there.

The photos are very misleading. The pool and hot tub are next to the parking lot in what feels like a dark concrete cave. No sunlight. The food is not good. The room was clean but feels like way too much money for the quality of this place.
Manager Response: Thanks for sharing your comments about your experiences at our La Quinta Inn & Suites.  We appreciate you taking the time to post your comments about your stay, and we’re sorry you did not get a great pool time while with us.  We want all of our guests to have a great time when staying with us and we’re hoping you’ll come back and give us another try!

Summary: We stayed for a Disneyland trip. The hotel was VERY loud. People yelling in the halls and crying babies woke my family up more than once. We have been here 3 days and they haven't cleaned our room once. We've had to ask for new towels every day. The breakfast isn't all that impressive. Waffles and oatmeal are the only choices. Coffee is bare bones. The walk to Disney isn't bad in the morning, but it's a loooong walk at night with kids. Pay the extra $$ to stay across the street from Disneyland!!

Summary Heading: Not my fave La Quinta to stay in.
Summary: Disappointed that the shuttle isn't advertised as a fee service. It costs $5 per person. We've stayed at many LQ and never paid for a shuttle. Rooms are stuffy - Windows do not open and no fan, you cannot adjust the theremastat. Water drips from vent by the vanity (room 230).  Desk staff wasn't overly friendly, valet was very friendly.  Pool always had dirty towls laying around, I actually saw towels that were never picked up from the day prior. I had to ask for clean towls. Breakfast was LQ standard, 2nd breakfast room was closed off for our 3 day stay. The last morning there wasn't any room to sit so we were forced to eat in our room.  Very small spaces - rooms are not large. Beds are very stiff (some may like this).

The reason for this message, is just to share with you my bad experience at your hotel, located at 1752 South Clementine St. in Anaheim CA. 92802.    On Monday, March 21st 2016, at 2200 hrs, I arrived with my family consisting of my wife, two small boys and my mother in law. Since my mother in law is handicap, requiring a wheelchair to move around I had requested a handicap suite, but learned upon my arrival that the requested suite was not available. This situation was very stressful for the whole family, safety is a big issue with my mother in law. No safety bars and no shower bench, entailed no shower after a very lengthy and challenging trip.   The last thing on my mind, was not finding the amenities I had become accustomed to, when visiting any of your branches.  On the
Manager Response: We've read your review regarding your recent stay at La Quinta Inns and Suites Anaheim. We're concerned about the issues you encountered during your stay. We'd like to chat with you further about your situation so we can ensure what you've experienced does not happen again. Would you mind reaching out to us at lq2009gm@lqreviews.com so we can chat further? Thanks for your feedback, and we're hoping to hear from you soon!

Summary: Older hotel with excessive noise from floors above and very poor breakfast.  Find a newer hotel near Disneyland and go to McDonalds for breakfast.  The pool timer was not reset for daylight savings and thus had to find staff to open it.
Manager Response: Thanks for sharing your comments about your experiences at our La Quinta Inn & Suites.  We appreciate you taking the time to post your comments about your stay, and we’re sorry you did not get a great night’s sleep while with us.  We’ll be working with our team to make sure they are more aware of the surroundings so they can help talk to guests and stop issues like excessive noise from happening again.  We want all of our guests to have a great night’s sleep when staying with us and we’re hoping you’ll come back and give us another try!

Summary: It is quite a walk to Disney parks and stores. There are many restaurants nearby. The breakfast is decent and everyone was satisfied with one of the available options. The food service personal were extremely nice and kept up with fresh supply and clean-up. They allowed us to use the microwave for our personal food so that we did not have to go all the way back to the room. The room has nice televisions, decent size, 2 separate sleeping/relaxing areas with their own TV on each side. Personally there was a problem with the pull out bed folding inward and one of the other beds wiggled uncontrollably with every slight move but the other bed was fine and comfortable. We had a little issue with the cleanliness of the bathroom but that may have just been a fluke. Unfortunately there

I stayed for 2 nights. Nights were very noisy so I could not sleep at night after a long day at a business show. Noisy visitors that returned back to their rooms around 2am were talking loudly, slamming their room doors. I could hear people walking in their room on a top floor above my room. Basically the room walls and door are not noise prooved. The room itself is a good size and the breakfast was good. It looks like  this hotel is a choice that most of the groups visiting Disney World would stay Internet also was not working too well

good hotel, friendly staff and accommodations modern and clean, only compliant was the pool was not usable, ice cold water and the hot tub was not warm enough either. After a long day at Disneyland it would have been nice to go for a swim but the water was not warm enough, very dissappointing

This hotel is located conveniently close enough to Disneyland but far away enough to avoid the traffic of cars and tourist. It's got the bells and whistles of a high-end hotel, with a friendly cost. A hidden gem! Don't get me wrong, it has flaws, but you'll look past them with the savings.

We stayed 6 days. Originally we had booked 5 days but arrived a day early and LaQuinta was able to accommodate us with 2 rooms for Saturday night. One room had a trundle which worked perfectly for the kids and we were able to keep it for the stay. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. No parking problems and there were always open spaces in the lot. Although parking garage was tight but that was expected  2 amazing things happened. First we got a call at 6:30am from the desk letting us know that the parking attendant noticed a window in our car was down. I had some valuables in the car. Everything was safe and sound thanks to the alert attendant.  All the parking attendants were very personable. Second, one of the kids ran back to the room to get something. After a

Summary Heading: Not very clean, not overly impressed
Summary: Arrived early (after nearly 20 hours of travel) a room was ready so they allowed us to check-in which was great! Room wasn't quite what we thought it was going to be at the time we booked  but will do & no crib for our 11 month old which we requested! It wasn't until 11pm when getting ready for bed that we noticed the sheets were dirty, appeared to have blood & food crusted onto them...yuck! We requested fresh sheets but front desk could only offer a wool blanket to put on top of the dirty sheets which we didn't want to do. They advised they would go and find some clean sheets and bring them up but no one came! Not very impressed. Staff have been nice and it's not their fault the rooms aren't clean but very frustrating. Floors also dirty and could do with a vacuum!
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback regarding your stay at the La Quinta Inn & Suites.  We’re very concerned about the issues you’ve mentioned and are sorry that we dropped the ball as we did during your stay.  You should expect a room that is clean and well taken care of, and we failed you here.  We’re very sorry and we’d like to chat with you further about your specific situation.  Would you reach out to us at lq2009gm@lqreviews.com.  Thanks again for your review, and we’re looking forward to chatting with you soon!

Summary: My stay at this hotel wasn't very pleasant to say the least.   It all started when I called to make a reservation. It took me two days to make one because I was being hung up on each time I called. Eventually, I got through and was able to book.  When I arrived at the hotel, it was very nice and updated for a La Quinta and the room was also beautiful! Everything was fine until I took a shower and saw that the majority of my towels had orange and yellow stains on them!! EW. With the rate they're at, they should be able to afford new towels.   Other than that, it wasn't too bad except for the fact of being next to the electrical room, elevator, and vending machines. I wasn't able to sleep too well but that's my own fault, for I didn't call and request a room change and decided to

Summary Heading: Lack of communication and poor manners
Summary: Very disappointed with my staying. The worst experience ever. Lack of communication between staff members and guests. Manners are not part of the job descriptions, starting  with the GM, Bonnie Gardner.  First room nasty, bed sheets never changed, cigarettes filters every where and not mention "other things".  Lost my zip id case with all my credit cards and ID's in the facility due to exchange rooms and absolutely anyone was helpful. Was such of inconvenience for all the staff,even for the GM, forcing me to get police force involved.  After three days without my belongings and ruining my vacation, and not mentioned wasting taxpayers money, my IDs case was all along at the office. Just because management or staff members were to lazy to look up or do any extras performing their

In town for the Montreal Canadiens visit to the Anaheim Ducks for NHL hockey. La Quinta provided a very clean, spacious, delightful room with a delicious breakfast too. The staff were all very friendly, helpful and courteous. Well worth a return visit.

The hotel rooms were the only nice thing during our 6 night stay. When we first arrived to check in the lady that was working at the front desk didn't smile the whole time during the check in process. We stayed on the second floor near the elevator and the breakfast room and that was not pleasant. First of all the elevator would make this loud sound whenever it would stop and it was very loud in our room all night. The walls are paper thin so we had to listen to people every morning as they waited for the breakfast room to open. Whenever there was someone in the room above us the wall that separated the living room from the bedroom would rattle. There were a couple of days when our room wouldn't get cleaned till after 4p or they would clean the room but not restock coffee or

Stayed here for 2 nights to visit Disneyland and it was fantastic.  Upon checking into our room we found we only had 1 double bed and a sofabed (we had requested 2 doubles) however we were immediately moved without any hassle at all to another room with 3 doubles.  We had loads of space and my mum even had her own little bedroom area - perfect!   Breakfast was simply lovely and all that you need to fill up for a day in the Disney park.  Bagels, muffins, toast (with preserves and peanut butter), oatmeal, waffles/pancakes with syrup, cereals, hard boiled eggs, fruit, hot and cold beverages. It was all fresh and really delicious. It was about a 10 minute leisurely walk from Disneyland and close to lots of shops and eateries if you didn't want to dine in the Disney park.  The

Our room was very clean and spacious. Friendly employees and excellent rate. The free breakfast was fresh and the dining area very clean. Location is great! Right next to Disney and across the street from some wonderful restaurants. (Cheesecake Factory, Bubba Gump Shrimp Co, California Pizza Kitchen to name a few). We will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Disney Trip Stay at La Quinta
Summary: Was driving in from Las Vegas early in the morning arriving to the hotel around 10am... called earlier and spoke to David asking if I would possibly be able to check in early.. David stated yes they had a room ready, to go ahead and go to the hotel and we would be able to check in... Got to La Quinta and immediately upon arrival the Valet guy greeted and welcomed us... we went in to check in... the process was fast and easy.. room was ready! I was able to buy my Disney tickets at La Quinta as well as the shuttle bus tickets.. very convenient we were able to park our rental through valet at the same price as there general parking fee. My family and I enjoyed our one day trip to Disney and the convenience of the hotel in which we were able to walk to CVS for some items needed.

more spacious and better furnished than most hotels at this rate.  Convenient location to restaurants,  convention center and Disneyland.  Did not experience the bad comments by other reviews.  breakfast has greater variety than most continental breakfasts as there are several fruits (apple, orange, banana), oatmeal, waffle, besides the common cereals, breads, etc.

La Quinta is a great place in a great location. Easy walking distance to Disneyland. Choice of many good restaurants just across the street. The front office staff are very friendly and efficient. We will definitely stay here on our next visit.

Hadn't stayed at this particular hotel since they remodeled.  Rooms are very nice and modern.  Customer service is always decent at this particular location.  Seems like they are going over and above these days.

What a great hotel this turned out to be.  Spacious suites giving a family room and seperation when needed.  Staff was wonderful and the hotel was clean.  Breakfast was your normal eats, waffles, toast, oatmeal and such.  Good enough to start your day off.  We were there during the week so parking wasn't an issue but I can see how it could be.  We will be back, next trip planned for April.

We returned to La Quinta again after staying here last October because we like the price, the amenities and the distance to Disneyland.   Upon arrival this time we found we were in room 240, which we have had in the past, We immediately asked for a change and were given an upgraded room with a very comfortable King bed and a double with a trundle. They have some great room options at the hotel for larger families. (From my previous post, I would avoid room 240 because of its closeness to Housekeeping, the elevator, and it's right on the end of the hotel near the pool. The noise levels were just too much.)  Breakfast remains average. But compared to what you would pay at a restaurant, it is quite sufficient. Waffles and syrup, hot oatmeal, bread, pastries, yogurt, hard boiled

Hotel was clean and quiet. Well maintained and perfect for our trip to Disneyland with my grandson and Nephew. The breakfast was average, The bagels were stale but had many other options. We watched the fireworks from our room. Will stay again.

Hotel was nice, and offered many sleeping options within one suite for a family.  Nice that it had a refrigerator and microwave as well.  Odd outside elevator entry, that then opened to inside hallways for rooms.  Would prefer inside elevator for security.

Do not understand why now you have to pay a fee for parking at a hotel that you are paying to stay in. Plus you do not have enough parking for the guests that stay at the property. But Friendly staff and nice rooms.

We have stayed multiple times at this La Quinta and will continue to use it.  It is in close proximity to all of the Disney-Anaheim venues as well as the Anaheim Convention Center and a relatively short distance to multiple sporting venues; is reasonably priced given this proximity; and has the added benefits of a free, though slightly limited, breakfast and La Quinta welcomes pets.  There are multiple restaurants close by as well as shopping for those forgotten items.  Parking is somewhat limited, but valet service is available for off-site parking.  The pool is small, but great for kids 10 and under.

The hotel is located within walking distance to the park. Arrived shortly after midnight. 15 minutes later receiv Ed d a call from the front desk about a noise complaint. I told them to ccome a find out who is smoking marijuana on our floor because the hallways smelled really bad. Tried to take a sbower in the morning because heaven forbid i make anymore noise. Shower head flew off and hit me in the chest. Came back to the hotel to tale a break to find housekeeping put my phone charger in a bowl of yogurt i left in the tabke. Charger fried. Yeah that kind of a trip. In short paper thin walls. Poor room maintenance and good luck getting someone to open the lobby after hours. NEVER going back.
Manager Response: Thanks for your comments regarding your stay at our La Quinta Inn & Suites.  We’re sorry about the experiences you’ve mentioned, and your comments are concerning to us.  Service is something we take quite seriously, and we’d like to better understand what happened during your stay.  Would you mind contacting us at lq2009gm@lqreviews.com.  So we may discuss with you personally.  We appreciate your feedback and hope to hear from you soon!

Summary: We planned out last Disneyland trip too late to get any really good deals really close to Disneyland, so we had to stay a bit further out. This hotel is definitely walkable....but it is a LONG walk to & from Disneyland. That's the negative of the location. The positive is that it is right across from the Garden Walk which has great restaurant choices (Bubba Gumps, Cheesecake Factory, California Pizza Kitchen to name a few).  We booked a King Suite. When you entered the bathroom was immediately on the right, then the first room had the King bed with a dresser and closet. Just past the sliding door was the 2nd room with a sofa bed and PLENTY of room for the complimentary crib they provided, and another dresser and desk.  Plenty of room for our family (4 year old & 16 month old).

Summary Heading: A very pleasant and enjoyable stay!
Summary: Great location, in walking distance to Disneyland but far enough to avoid the noise/traffic on South Harbor Blvd. Modern, clean and spacious rooms. Stayed on the 4th floor which was reasonably quiet. We had reserved 2 rooms (one King and 2 doubles) but upon check-in they gave us both with one King. After heading back down to reception they promptly apologised and fixed it up for us - good service! The valet was more than happy to call a taxi for us on more than one occasion and the staff at the front desk were always very friendly. No complaints about the free breakfast - there were waffles, cereal, toast, bagels, fruit, yoghurt and oatmeal, which is all you really need! We weren't able to purchase our Disneyland tickets from reception as they had run out but not a worry as

I needed a place to get away. I had no interest in Disneyland, though it was really close. My friend paid for my flight and the hotel...all I had to do was rest. The beds were comfy. I really loved the pillows! We had a room that had a partition so when he needed to work, he didn't disturb my sleep. (The room was 513.) I never woke up in time for breakfast, but their little snack shop was nice and convenient with reasonable prices. They had a fitness center, which I used the elliptical and the treadmill. There was a TV in the fitness center, but the remote needed batteries. I forgot to mention that to staff! I would stay there again. It was a decent place, not too many frills, but comfortable, clean, and courteous.

I stay at a lot of different hotels and some are chain's and I rate this hotel as one of the best. Service was  fast and courteous and very friendly. I would definitely suggest this hotel to friends and family.

We took our kids for the first time to Disneyland and decided to stay at this hotel.  We had a two room king suite.  The room was excellent.  The food at the morning break was great.  The swimming pool and jacuzzi were nice and clean.  The hotel is only a short walk to Disneyland, and many restaurants are nearby.  We even brought our dog and found a dog park nearby.  You can't go wrong staying at this spot.  We loved it!

Summary Heading: they did not give us the room we reserved
Summary: We reserved a 2 room suite and we were given two separate rooms that were dirty, and at different ends of the hall. 2 adults, and 3 children two of which are very young. This Hotel is a disgrace to La Quinta. What hotel doesn't keep your room for you. Then they give us dirty rooms. shame on them.
Manager Response: We've read your review of your stay at La Quinta Inn & Suites Anaheim. We appreciate you sharing your comments, and we're sorry we disappointed your family during your stay with us. Being able to have a comfortable room that meets your expectations, especially when you have called in advance, is important, and we'd like to chat with you further about your specific situation. Would you please reach out to us at lq2009gm@lqreviews.com. Thanks again for writing us, and we're looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Summary: It was a very well hotel where our family  enjoyed all Disney Park's attractions  with our pet included by a reasonable  cost / value ratio. The service of shutter routes and price was definitively excellent.  It was the best option to receive the new year at Anaheim.

Plan on listening to dogs barking all night, people walking heavily above and possible no hot water. I overall I like this hotel but this last stay I had 3 rooms and it was something in each room.....

Summary Heading: Great Rooms, Great Price, 1 block away from Disneyland, Convenient Location
Summary: I was really impressed by how nice the rooms were at this location.  The room had a living room or sitting area with a pull out Sofa Bed, 2 TVs, Microwave, Mini Fridge.  The 2 rooms have a sliding door to create a full division between the living room area and the bedroom.  The beds were confortable. I slept in the sofa bed with no problem. My only tip is if you close the sliding door, you might not get the heat in that side of the room which is the living room area.    Across the Street, there is a mall.  Where you can find a few places to eat, shop, even a movie theater.  If you walk accross the mall to the other side, you will find a parking lot which is where the Disney Shuttles leave from. ***So you don't need to buy the shuttle tickets that some hotels sell***   You just

Not my best hotel experience. Barking dogs and not following rules. Took too long to check in. Had to change rooms after a long day! Triedto send a review on hotel website and couldn't. To say the least we are not coming back.

This hotel is a very good value for the location and convenience to Disneyland.  We walked there.  There is a shuttle, but the schedule was not as accommodating, and you have to pay cash of $5/per person and no change given.  The breakfast was okay, but no hot eggs.  The beds were decent but I like a little more cushion.  However, it is good for families, as they do have rooms with a trundle bed.

This hotel is in an excellent location to Disneyland and across the street from Anaheim Gardenwalk. Disney shuttle stops at hotel. We reserved a 2 double bed / 2 room suite; the living room was separated by a sliding door which allowed privacy for the guest sleeping on the sofa bed.  Room was very clean with modern beddings and furniture; bathroom was small than most hotels. Continental breakfast area was huge and well lite but not much food selection to chose from. The staff we encountered were courtesy and helpful; this includes the valet staff.

Great location for Disney vacation with an easy walk to the Disneyland entrance.  The Hotel staff was friendly, and our room was nicely cleaned.  Parking and breakfast selection were the only two disappointments in our stay.

Summary Heading: Close to Disney, nice room but covered pool!!
Summary: This hotel was very close to Disney and our room was lovely, perfect. However, the covered pool was a true bummer!  It was sunny and beautiful out and we wanted to swim and sun but the pool has concrete over it. Other than that, it was a great stay and across the street from Cheesecake Factory, McCormick & Schmick and others.

We have stayed at this hotel for several years now during our yearly Disneyland Trips. This hotel offers a good location, away from the mainstream trafffic. It also conveniently offers a trolly bus (for a small fee), that commutes to and from the disneyland park every 30min. I do, however,  feel that the wait times for the trolly have grown, as have the fees. The free continental breakfast has always been an added perk, altho the food could be better. It is, however, free and free is always better than nothing, and definitely saves money in your pocket for other trip expenses. The room sizes are decent, but would certainly benefit from a new face lift. The pool area for the kids is a plus. The new parking fees were definitely a new downfall, given that we've enjoyed free parking

Summary Heading: Stayed for Knotts Berry farm and Disney Land
Summary: This hotel is very close to Disney Land , can walk there in about 10- 15 minutes .  The room we got was nice for the price and the staff are always helpful and friendly. The breakfast area was set up very nice, it had room to sit and   guest could get there food very easy with a lot of space.  The only thing I did not like at this hotel  is they charge for parking at this hotel.

Overall experience was only fair. I won't book this hotel again, nor any other La Quinta. I stayed here 2 years ago and it was OKAY. This time the manager was grumpy, the shuttle was awful, the noise was awful.
Manager Response: Thanks for your comments regarding your stay at our La Quinta Inn & Suites.  We’re sorry about the experiences you’ve mentioned, and your comments are concerning to us.  Service is something we take quite seriously, and we’d like to better understand what happened during your stay.  Would you mind contacting us at lq2009gm@lqreviews.com.  So we may discuss with you personally.  We appreciate your feedback and hope to hear from you soon!

Summary: nice hotel.15 mins from d/land.lots of restaurants around.breakfast in the morning was good.enought to get you going for sure.not the hilton but certainly not bob's budget hotel either.would stay here again for sure

Summary Heading: Room is great, some things have changed
Summary: It's been about 6 years since my last stay here.  They have remodeled the hotel and rooms (nice) and they are clean and modern.  The rooms seemed quieter to me than last time.  They charge for parking now (boo) but that seems pretty consistent in Anaheim.  They still have the free breakfast which is a nice option, but they have really cut down on the offerings.  No longer was there a hot egg option or really anything fresh prepared.  Expect waffles, bread and bagels to toast, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, oatmeal and dry cereal.  There was orange or apple juice and a big coffee maker that wasn't working for our entire stay.  That actually really bugged me.  One day:  things happen.  Several days?:  get it together!  The adult guests of Anaheim are propelled by caffeine.  I still

Summary Heading: Great rooms but staff needs update
Summary: The beds were comfortable and clean as usual at a La Quinta Inn & Suites. We've stayed here three times now at Disney over the last few years. All Suites so you get a lot of room for what you pay, especially in this area.   The room staff was great always doing what they do best but the breakfast crew and front desk need to be friendlier and more understanding that this is a family hotel.   My biggest complaint is with the breakfast staff. Yes, it's scheduled from 6:00 to 9:00 on weekdays but shutting the door a few min early or even to the exact second is ridiculous. People are here to come to the happiest place on earth, you are not starting the day off well by being grumpy and rude.   Most La Quinta's the breakfast is in an open area to the lobby so you can't shut the door

I enjoyed my stay here overall, the rooms are big enough and clean.  Free breakfast in the morning, not the best but better than nothing.  Only problems was that the wi-fi was really slow and the AC/heater was leaking in the bathroom area.  But its for a good price that is near Disneyland.

We really enjoyed our stay at La Quinta. Everything was on point, the room comfortably accommodated 6 people. Breakfast was tasty and always well kept, our kiddos definitely enjoyed it and say is was the best.

Beautiful setting for an extended stay or just an overnight.  My husband and I wanted to get away for the Thanksgiving weekend and this was a great spot to stay. Thanksgiving Day we went to Downtown Disney for dinner and were very happy with the selection of restaurants.  The next day, we walked the 1/2 mile to the park with no issue.  Staff were extremely friendly and accommodating!!!  Highly recommend for all visitors!

Summary Heading: Alway a good place to stay
Summary: I like the La Quinta because it is close to Disneyland, the price is right, they provide a good, if carbohydrate rich breakfast, the staff is friendly and it is in a safe area.  This time around, my daughter and I got one of their standard two-room suites. This is nice because the sitting area has a fold-out couch I can use, while my daughter takes the other room and we can have some privacy. There is a TV in both rooms, and the TVs have the necessary plugs to allow us to hook up our portable DVD player.  A new wrinkle this year is a parking fee along with a new valet service, although you can park your own car if you like, outside. It seems to me that people can park their own cars since the hotel is fairly compact and I feel obligated to tip the guy if he parks my car for me.

My first impression when I walked in my room was really good because it was exactly how they show on the pictures, love the room and it's so nice to have the separation between the bed and the sofa,  the only bad thing was the noise, you can hear everything since we where right next to the elevator and the Ice machine...WHO needs Ice at 5AM..just saying. other then that had a good time, really like that they offer a $5 all day pass to ride the bus to the theme parks.

5th time we stayed at this hotel to go to Disneyland.  It is very convenient to parking.  Rooms are clean and large. 2 room 'apt' is comfortable for 5 people.  Beds comfortable. Upgraded rooms. Can watch fireworks from the room window.  They added a parking fee of $9 per night this year and valet parking which is ridiculous.  The attendant drives the car to 2nd level garage where guests use to park themselves. In the morning guests have to get in line to get their cars.  Pets allowed. One night a dog cried over 2 hrs. from 2:00am til after 4 am.  Called the desk and was told they had contacted owner who was out.  They offered to let us sleep in another room. We didn't want to move the children at 2 in the morning.   12 o/o military discount.

Any parent who has visited Disneyland knows how valuable coffee can be. The coffee offered at their breakfast is goopy, like pudding. This morning there was no coffee left in our room for the coffee maker so I called the front desk. She told me there was no one on duty at 6am but she would send valet up with coffee. Problem solved, I think. Then, she calls back and says she doesn't have coffee at the front desk and suggests I go to the breakfast. Can't because the kids are still sleeping. La Quinta, coffee is your most valuable amenity for parents visiting Disneyland. Get a better system for us. Thanks.

We stay in La Quinta hotels more often lately than any other chain. They are clean and comfortable. I happen to be a rewards member so I have a little more incentive to seek them out when we need a place to stay.   This location is very close to Disneyland. We were going to Knott's Berry Farm for an evening event. It's about 7 miles from Knott's via the 5 freeway.   I knew about the $9 nightly parking fee as it was disclosed to me when I booked via the La Quinta mobile app. It was unusual to me to be charged a parking fee but understandable for the area.   We had a very spacious room that included a king bed and a full bed with a twin trundle. The room also included a space divider door with frosted glass, so the kids had their space and we had ours. Each area also had its own

Room was good, hotel was very noisy. I have stayed at other La Quintas in Southern and Northern California, and I have never had anything stolen.  They avoided responsibility and didnt care if the issue was resolved with the parking company. After a week I have not heard back. Another 4 cars were broken into that I know of.  They need security cameras.
Manager Response: Thanks for your comments regarding your stay at our La Quinta Inn & Suites.  We’re sorry about the experiences you’ve mentioned, and your comments are concerning to us.  Safety is something we take quite seriously, and we’d like to better understand what happened during your stay.  Would you mind contacting us at lq2009gm@lqreviews.com.  So we may discuss with you personally.  We appreciate your feedback and hope to hear from you soon!

Summary: Don't let the promise of "free breakfast" sway your decision to stay here. The hotel was decent, the location was great for us (adults, no kids) to walk to Disneyland. But the breakfast was underwhelming, even by free hotel breakfast standards. The standard menu consists of small waffles, a pot of porridge/oatmeal, a large vat of pink yogurt (spring for the individual cups, people!), mini muffins, cereal, whole fruit, and sliced bread. One morning they had bagels, but the next morning, just more bread and no bagels. The room layout was a bit odd - when you enter the room the single sink is immediately by the door. We had a decent stay with no issues. The breakfast just left us hungry for more food in Disneyland, which wouldn't be good if you were traveling with a family and

Summary Heading: A great Disneyland hotel for those on a budget.
Summary: We all know a trip to Disney can be pricey.  This is a great place to stay if you are on a budget, or if you are like me, only spend time in your room to shower and sleep because you are spending your vacation out and about and not sitting in your hotel room.  It's about 3/4 of a mile walk to Disneyland with a shuttle at the neighboring hotel you can take if you don't want to walk.   The rooms are quite large and have been recently updated. Our room had two full beds and a separate area with a couch and second television (not that we really watched either one of them)   The free breakfast is decent - they have lots of simple items to choose from i.e. waffles, oatmeal, fruit, yogurt, bagels, toast, cereal etc.    All of that said, if you are expecting a 5-star hotel and its

Summary Heading: Reasonably Priced and Close Proximity to the park
Summary: This is a wonderful option for visitors with small pets on a budget. It is within walking distance of the park, restaurants, and the freeway. Additionally, it is also located next to one of the Anaheim Resort Trans stops.

We have stayed at this hotel approx. 5 times in the past 7 years and have always been treated exceptional. The staff at the front desk is what makes your stay great, but not this time. I booked a four (4) night stay there and no where on the booking page does it say that there is a $9.00 a night (plus tax) parking fee. When I asked about this at check-in, the young lady that was helping me told me in a very sarcastic tone of voice that there hotel was an exceptional value even charging the parking fees and if I needed to look for other accommodations I could do so. So you can see my stay started on the wrong foot. With cranky grandkids I didn't argue the point and got my keys and parking pass and left. The room was nice and clean. But during the four nights, I had to ask for

Over all great place and staff but watch out for extra fees like parking…$9 @ day! Room accommodations were what we requested. Breakfast set up is a good deal and the service staff works hard to keep everything fresh a nd supplied so don't forget to tip.

We ALWAYS stay here whenever we stay in Anaheim for Disneyland and are always treated with excellent customer service, clean rooms & bathrooms and the few times we have had minor problems the front desk has handled them immediately.  The parking is a little tricky and I was surprised because there is a $9 parking fee now.  $9 is still cheaper than Disneyland parking!

Staff is very friendly and courteous. Our check in time was quick and our parking attendance was kind enough to write down our license plate number, which was good because I can never remember that. The only issue is parking is a bit tight. Other then that our stay was just what we needed.

My family and I enjoyed staying here.  We had 6 in the family, 3 were teenagers.  Even though the room fit 6, it was too small for our liking.  We could have used 2 rooms.  But the room was clean and nicely designed.

Awesome stay at this hotel. Staff is friendly and professional. Minutes way from Disneyland! Staff returned items left behind. The breakfast was excellent. this is the second stay for me and my family. We had a similar experience both times. The hotel is of great value for its location and the rooms it offers. We will be definitely be staying here in the future should we be in the area.

We stayed here at the last minute after our reservation fell through at another place.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Parking was reasonable and available. Wi-Fi and breakfast were included. The room was very spacious and clean. Only one exit up from Disneyland (about a 5 minute drive)We will definitely return!

I just started staying at La Quinta's because we like to travel with our small dog. The bathtub was nice but you could not fill it up because the faucet was to short and the water would go on the floor. the outside elevators were very cheep feeling. and the pool was like swimming in a garage.

This is a good hotel if you have an annual pass for Disneyland and/or don't mind staying a little further away from the parks and you want a nice affordable place to stay with the best breakfast options.

We always stay at La Quinta in whatever state we travel to. But this one did not have the great breakfast we get at other La Quinta hotels. No meat served and the same stuff every morning Also when I asked for Coffee and the condiments for my room 3 times no one took care of our request. I had to go find a maid cleaning a room and get it myself. Not so cool when you are spending that kind of money.

Enjoy our room, clean and roomy. It worked out great for our family.  Very spacious.  We would stay there again.  Breakfast was perfect also.  Thank you.  It was also in walking distance for us to Disneyland.

I stay at La Quinta's all the time and always have excellent service and accommodations except for this time.  Our first room keys did not work.  Finally once in we seen little critters in it.  Not happy.  We were placed into another room and our keys didn't work again.  The air conditioner was loud and couldn't sleep well.  My baby's favorite blanket was missing from the room.  Laundry said they didn't have it.  Horrible.  Never again.
Manager Response: Thanks for your comments regarding your stay at our La Quinta Inn and Suites Anaheim. We're sorry about the experiences you've mentioned, and your comments are concerning to us. Service is something we take quite seriously, and we'd like to better understand what happened during your stay. Would you mind contacting us at lq2009gm@lqreviews.com.So we may discuss with you personally. We appreciate your feedback and hope to hear from you soon!

Summary: We stayed here after a snafu at the original place that we booked online. I found this hotel through the app Hotel tonight.  The staff was super friendly and helpful. The room was a large (there is a sliding door to divide the room if you want and one side has a couch that folds out into a hideaway bed),very clean, the beds were comfortable and there were two flat screen TV's. Breakfast was complimentary and included oatmeal, fruit, hard boiled eggs, cereal, bagels, toast, waffles, juice, milk and coffee. Parking was $9 plus taxes. There is a 7-11 within walking distance also. Only one exit up from Disney (5 minute drive).... The price is affordable and a good value for the room that you receive.  Building has a security feature that requires your room key to use the elevator.

The room decor is very nice and the hotel photos are accurate. It was great having two rooms, the living room separated by a sliding door from the bedroom. The room was clean except that the carpet needed to be vacuumed.  There were corn flakes on the carpet in the living room.  We wore white socks and they were dirty because the carpet needed to be cleaned.  The room doors are thin so you can easily hear people in the hallway.  We heard crying and shouting kids all morning which made sleeping in difficult. If the parking lot gets filled, they will valet your car as part of the flat parking fee.  Breakfast consists of pre-made waffles, cereals, tiny muffins, bread for toast, fresh fruit-bananas, apples, oranges, hard boiled eggs, bowl of yogurt and machines with orange juice,

We booked the La Quinta based on the positive reviews here and we were not disappointed. We stayed at this property many years ago before it was a La Quinta so we already had a feel for it’s location.   We checked into the motel on a Saturday afternoon after driving all day.  Check in was quick and efficient. Front desk staff was accommodating. Parking is very tight and they charge an extra $9 per day per vehicle, something that was not disclosed in advance at reservation time. Also, at peak times, you will be required to have them valet your vehicle as there are not enough spaces for every room.  We were in a room at the back of the hotel away from the street, though Clementine is not as busy and noisy as Katella or Harbour. The property has interior hallways rather than being

We had a 6 night stay in 90+ degree heat.  Our first night was miserable, no air conditioning and an 80+ degree room.  The following day I went down to the desk and requested a change in room.  The representative was apologetic and quickly put us in a new room.  Overall a pleasant stay, friendly staff, bare breakfast but it works.

Summary Heading: Disgraceful, don't ruin your trip too.
Summary: My boyfriend and I arrived  at the La Quinta near Disneyland on October 14, 2015. Right off the bat the valet told us parking was full and we could "park it ourselves" in Valet. We checked in and headed for our room.  The first thing I noticed was the dirty towel smell in the bathroom. Followed by soap scum and hairs stuck to the shower walls. I was so exhausted I didn't even care...until I came to the mirror in the bedroom. It had a full handprint in, honestly, what appeared to be lube...I hope it was lotion. I took a picture to show the front desk when I went to request a different room...when I slid the French doors across they were filthy too. It looked like a child had drooled and drawn all over the doors. At this point, we asked for a different room. So then we moved down
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to comment on your recent stay at the La Quinta Inn and Suites Anaheim. We're sorry about all of the issues you experienced during your stay. We would like the opportunity to address your concerns directly. Would you please contact us lq2009gm@lqreviews.com. We're looking forward to hearing from you!

Summary: The stay was nice except for the very warm hallways and a couple of bugs in the room.  The breakfast was not very good unless al you expect is cold cereal, toast and very fat pre-made waffles that do not fit in the toaster. The room was OK but from check-in to check-out the tissue box was never dusted. works well for a trip to Disneyland or Convention.  ART picks up right behind hotel and after a couple of days walking around at Disney comes in handy.

Had a nail coming up through the carpet. Took all day to get this taken care of. The breakfast also is lacking a bit. only thing hot are pre made waffles.  No pastries.  Also parking can be a bit difficult at times.  The location is great.

LaQuinta was a great hotel to stay for our vacation to Disneyland.  We were just under a mile for Disneyland and we walked over everyday.  The rooms were great, recently renovated and very roomy! Beds were comfy and the rooms were clean!  We stayed in a double bed room, with a sofa bed (gave us extra room) and it was perfect!  Decent breakfast, waffles, fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, the waffles were made for you so it didn't take so much time.  Perfect place for a family and the price was fantastic.  Close to PF Changs, Bubba Gumps and other restaurants.  We usually stay closer but the price made us try this hotel out.  Great staff and really nice valet guys!  The pool isn't very big, but our kids had fun playing in it.  Would definitely recommend staying there!

Our stay was OK.  Location is good. Not to far from the Disney Parks. Would not consider it walking distance though. But it's doable for adults not children.  Went to check in at 3:20 and room was not ready. They offered me another room which would of been a downgrade or wait 15 minutes for the room to be ready. An hour later our room was finally ready. The clerk was very nice and after a discussion about check in time she did give us a small discount.  Parking is very tight and limited.  Both nights we stayed they were at max and offered valet. We had handicap parking so didn't have to deal with that.  On our last day while my family was in our truck waiting for me to check out the person parked next to us swung the door open and hit our truck. I wasn't their or she would of

The Hotel is close to the Disney parks and has just been redone, the new clean rooms and nice staff where great However Breakfast was a let down. But still a good value and a nice place to stay for the weekend.

My husband and I stayed two night in September of this year. The hotel was very clean and the staff was wonderful, from the moment we parked to the moment we left. The room was very nice and clean and comfortable. The front desk suggested the ART passes to get to Disneyland and back, we were able to get it right around the corner. The whole experience was great and we certainly will stay there again in the future.

Summary Heading: Good price but, left wanting more
Summary: our room was HOT! we had the AC on 65 but it was always MUCH hotter than that! Our room (#521) must have been on top of the maids room because every after noon our entire room would shake like it was on the spin cycle (the first day we thought it was an earth quake!) Room was very musty/moldy/mildew smell but over all the apperance was very clean and nice. Breakfast was 'Meh'. Next time we visit disney I think I'll spend a little more $ and stay closer to the parks.

We are regular visitors to the Disneyland Resort area, so we've made our rounds and tried different value (i.e. budget conscious) hotels available there.  We've stayed in this hotel multiple times in the past few years - our last stay here was during the half marathon weekend in September.  The rooms are spacious (suite sized) and have a modern decor.  We are a family of five (plus a dog) so we had the kids stay in one room and we had our own king sized bed in another.  The hotel is pet friendly with no extra fees, so we really enjoy that convenience.  The only real issue here is the parking, as there is extremely limited space, but there is a friendly valet service to assist.  The hotel is very close to the parks, but it is just slightly outside of walking distance for most

After reading many reviews, I wasn't sure what to expect.  We were pleasantly surprised by a modern, updated room, clean and a fairly quiet stay except for the usual after disney crowd coming in at night Only concern was the rooms air conditioning.  We had a suite with three different rooms(spacious and private!) however there was only one control for a/c.  We set it at 65, which was the coldest it allowed, however our rooms all stayed alittle too warm to be comfortable for sleeping. Suggest you bring a fan for each room in the summer.  Other than that, staff was friendly, we used the ART shuttle to disney which we found easy to use and the drivers nice. The pickup stop was right behind the hotel.  We walked one morning to disneyland, and it was not a bad walk, about 15 min

For the most part this place is great, but with that being said, my family had to try and sleep in an extremely hot room for two nights and all they offered was a smaller room or a very small credit. The breakfast could be a little better, but overall it is good

Summary Heading: Ok place to stay with your dogs
Summary: This hotel was a pretty good choice since we were traveling with our dogs but they don't have a designated pet area.  We had to keep going to the hotel next door to use their grass/pet area.  The breakfast selection was ok, we've had better but free is free.

Aside from the Valet guys, the staff are not at all happy to be working there. Very rude and non-friendly.   Breakfast - go to Del Taco down the road and spend your money there cause there is not a lot to choose from at this hotel.   Parking - you are charged $10 per day whether you park your own car or the valet does it for you. This includes if you have a handicap plate or not. The parking lot is very narrow and makes it hard to get in and out of.  Room - AC broke and had to change rooms in the middle of the night. Housekeepers were very slow and would arrive to clean the room at 5 pm (not everyone is gone to the Disney Parks all day long).  Location is great. There are a lot of choices for restaurants across the street. If you miss the bus to Disney, you are only a few blocks
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to comment on your recent stay at the La Quinta Inn & Suites Anaheim. We're sorry about all of the issues you experienced during your stay. I would like the opportunity to address your concerns. Can you please contact us at lq2009gm@lqreviews.com? We are looking forward to hearing from you!!

Summary: right next to I5 exit, within 10 minutes walk to Disneyland, many restaurants within walking distance, pet friendly hotel, even valet parking are nice to my "always bark to stranger" dog, highly recommended if you travel with a dog and planning to go to disneyland

This hotel was a great location near Gardenwalk and a hop, skip, and jump from Disneyland on foot.  There is a nice pool outside the hotel and it is minutes from restaurants and shopping.  The rooms are spacious and average for cleanliness.

Summary Heading: Happy Stay near the "Happiest Place in the World"
Summary: This is a Great hotel. Very convenient location, close to Disneyland. Also easy I-5  freeway access. The Anaheim Garden Walk is across the street. Convention center is very close.  Angel Stadium is a couple miles away.  I will stay there every time I go to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Not the best, prob not the worst
Summary: Not trying to be picky....but, it has its issues!  We had issues with our room keys constantly, the hot tub was overflowing with "soap bubbles"..... Ick!  Our toilet flooded out the bathroom because the float stuck, the one lav sink was plugged, the hotel is fairly dirty, parking is tight.  ON THE PLUS SIDE:  free bfast was good and stocked well, excellent location, we walked to Disney each day.  Beds were comfy with good pillows, well insulated with quiet rooms, very nice staff.

Summary Heading: Tasteful, Quiet rooms, close to Disneyland
Summary: We were very happy with our King Suite at La Quinta, though we weren't there very much. We arrived early on a Sunday, and were given a parking permit, though it was too early to check in. Mid-afternoon, after some time at Disneyland, we came back, checked in and freshened up. Then we spent several more hours at the Park. So, as you can imagine, we were exhausted! What a pleasure to come back to this quiet oasis. We slept as well as we've ever slept in a hotel, and awoke ready for our second day at the Park. We paid for a second day of parking, left our car until 7:30 pm, and spent another full day at the park.  This hotel is close the the Pumbaa parking lot, which has shuttle buses to the East gate of Disneyland. This cuts the walk to and from the park in half! The Pumbaa lot

Not a hotel for light sleepers.  Our first night we heard the people above us walking back and forth past 2am.  We could also hear people getting ice repeatedly just as late.  Can hear people coming from far down the hall as well.  Most of the room was ok, but the bathroom felt dirty and had corrosion around the faucet.  The room was for 8 people, but was very cramped with 3 adults and 4 kids.  3 double sized beds and one double had a twin pull out trundle.  Free breakfast was very crowded and had to wait multiple times for items to be refilled.  Just a continental breakfast with terrible coffee.  Recommend going to the Denny's or IHOP across the street from the Disney Main gate.  Only thing we enjoyed about the hotel was the Anaheim ART bus with a stop in the parking lot to

Extremely hard beds. Horrible basic breakfast with tasteless food and paper plates and plastic utensils. Rude front of house staff. Rooms ok. Great wifi. Kids enjoyed pool area. Good location for Disneyland and close to several restaurants. Public transport best way of going from place to place as there is a bus stop in the hotel car park. If the hotel improved the breakfast and provided proper crockery and cutlery it would make a big difference.

its close for walking to park, clean, has a pool the area is well kept and again clean, has a parking attended. Why I have no idea parking should be free.  Charges for bus shuttle to park should be free any way to make a buck

We go to Southern California once or twice a year. This is the only place we stay every time. The rooms are clean, the breakfast is great, the price is amazing, the staff are all so friendly and helpful. It's not a 5 star hotel, but that's not what we are looking for. We want something comfortable and affordable.

The La Quinta is 4 blocks from the Maingate. Recently remodeled nice rooms good internet connection. Covered pool & pool area. Good value for location. rt restaurnts close by, Cheesecake Factory, California Pizza Kitchen, etc. are across street. Parking can be a challenge late at night.

My stay was good but my wife told me about a issue she had at the beginning. She said if you make changes to your reservation make sure you get the person name you talk to, because my reservation turn to change to the next day to being canceled, to me being charged as a no show, and she was really annoyed by the time she got the problem fixed. I stay at this location often i am pretty sure this is just a one time thing i hope over all  my stay there have been pretty great.

I will say that this hotel near Disneyland is okay for the price. However, I was booked to stay 5 nights and left after 1 night , it just wasn't what we thought it would be. The rooms are not very big, staying somewhere with children I think requires a little more space. The description online also was a bit misleading so make sure you ask clarifying questions, I had to learn the hard way. I like the location of the hotel, it's directly across the street from a small shopping mall with restaurants. Also the complimentary breakfast was lacking a bit. They really need to make some changes there. Overall, I think I would find different accommodations if in the area again.

I think this is a pretty good place to stay.  The rooms were a little older but nice enough.  Pool was liveable and the walk to Disneyland was decent (about 15 minutes).  Breakfast was decent to start the day as well.

Stayed 2 nights at La Quinta Inn & Suites. The room was very nice, clean and spacious. The staff was friendly.  10 minute walk to the parks. Restaurants and shops across the street. We would highly recommend this hotel.

The hotel staff was very nice, very helpful. The room was clean. there was a little smell but had a air freashner that helped. The pictures made the rooms look extreamly big compared to what they really look like. But overall the room worked out great for my family and I.

I stayed here because it was close to Disneyland and pet friendly.  The rooms were recently remodel and up-to-date.  The sofa sleeper isn't bad to sleept on, but get more pillows.  I liked that there is a door that separates the 2 rooms with 2 TV.  The walk is about 10-15 minutes to the park.  However, I would take the Transit after a long day.  Be sure to ask for multiple days, it is cheaper.  Also ask the transit driver about the different buses that come in the area.  Since this bus comes every 20 minutes, if you miss your bus and instead of waiting another 20 minutes there is another transit bus that picks up at Extended Stay.  The parking area is hard to navigate in, but the valet will help you.  I would stay here again.

Very disappointed, service was horrible.  The staff lied about the room charge when checking in and overcharged upon checking out due to them losing the signed agreement and then stating there was no proof.

Great stay at LaQuinta, Ahaneim. We would highly recommend this hotel.  The rooms were spacious and the beds were extra comfortable.  Our room had recently been updated.  The staff was outstanding and the price of the rooms was very reasonable.  Great experience here!

Room is right next to housekeeping room on the second floor. They make so much noise every morning talking loud when they come in and constantly slamming the door throughout the day, I couldn't sleep in. Didn't make our bed until 5:30 pm. I wasn't informed that I was going to be charged an additional $9.99 plus tax a day when I purchased my reservation online. Told supervisor about the noise but nothing was done. Besides that, room was clean and walking distance to food places.

Summary Heading: The land of Mickey and friends is just a hop skip and a jump away
Summary: This hotel is one of the only near Disneyland that can accommodate a party of 8 in their 2 queen, one king suite with separate living room with pull out sofa. A must when traveling with the 3 kids, niece, nephew and in laws. The parking situation can be a little dicey as they only issue one parking pass per room regardless of occupants, but it's manageable. Buy Disney shuttle tix in the lobby for convenience or walk for your health. The pool and spa which are very clean and inviting are open rain or shine since it's a covered area. But we all know it never rains in Southern California (except the week of the vacation you've planned all year long, sigh)

A/C was preset and could not be adjusted. Room was hot at night to a point that we could not sleep. There was always a battle for parking if you were out late in the evening. The pull out bed was wore out, about two inches thick. Had to put the coffee table under it for any type of support.

Stayed 4 days at La Quinta Inn & Suites. The suite was very spacious and beautifully decorated. The staff was friendly and helpful. If you are visiting Disneyland the "ART Shuttle" is available for your transportation at a very reasonable cost and picked up directly behind La Quinta!! The only thing was the breakfast offered was very limited! Already made waffles, bagels, oatmeal, different juices. A little more like sausage, scrambled  eggs would have been nice. Other than that, I would highly recommend others to stay there!!

What is so sad is this place has so much potential. If the owners or management would put some money into this place it would be a five star. The location is excellent  The breakfast area is very nice but the breakfast is subpar I don't expect a great free breakfast but something other than frozen waffles would be nice.  The condition of the hotel itself is just fair needs to be updated furniture needs to be replaced and the beds were just Soso  What a shame we were so excited to be staying so close to Disney and out a pretty well-known name brand hotel but this place needs to step it up.

Clean updated living areas. We liked that the kids room was at the back of the suite. Bathrooms could be updated. Breakfast was disappointing. Not a lot to choose from and even less when families stacked their plates for others that were not in the room.  Pool is average. Location to Disneyland is a short walk and also not far to bus stops for other attractions in the area. Wifi was slow and had a lot of dropouts. Reception staff could also use so,e training on how to get around. First day was advised a 30min walk to downtown Disney rather than the quicker shorter route. Another day was advised they didn't know which bus to get to knots berry and to just look at the map.

Little trip with the family, had a wonderful stay. The staff was so kind and helpful. The room was very nice, clean and comfortable. Plenty of room for the whole family. The pool was clean and fun for the kids. Very convenient location close to everything, we even watched the fireworks at Disneyland from our room. Will definitely use again.

Don't bother booking this hotel if you are looking for an included breakfast! It was the worst that I have ever seen. We never ate it at all. The pool was green and did not look clean and it was very small. The room was clean and very appealing.

The room was awesome and clean. We can see the fireworks from our room. Great memories. It takes about 8-10 minutes walking to Disneyland. Pet Friendly is a very big PLUS!   Breakfast was awesome. Excellent food. If i were you, I'd book it right away without any doubts.

The staff is very friendly and helpful; and it is great to be so close to Disneyland.  It only takes about 10 minutes on the ART bus that comes by the hotel.  Easy access.  Great breakfast area with outdoor seating.

extremely noisy hotel, breakfast very limited, hallway carpet very dirty.  Not enough towels and washcloths for parties registered, no lotion bring your own. The location is fine but I would not stay here again.

We stayed here for 3 nights.  The price was reasonable.  I liked the split room with 2 Queens (seemed like a full size) in one room and with a trundle in the other room.  1st room is very tiny so there barely any room for luggage.  Also, DO NOT stay on the second floor, we had room 208 it was "extremely" noisy, way too close to the breakfast area.  The walls and ceilings are thin.  We also could hear every time a little kid ran up & down the hallway.  I would probably not stay there again.  Breakfast was ok, if you like waffles and cereal.  Menu did not change much.

I have stayed at this hotel several times over the last 4 years. They have completed all the hotel renovations and are now working on the pool. The rooms are nice and spacious and you can easily sleep 6. This is a very loud (kids screaming) hotel. I have learned not to stay by the elevator but housekeeping started knocking on doors at 8 am. Don't stay on the 2nd floor as this is the breakfast buffet floor this adds to the noise factor. They have recently implemented a $9 per night parking fee. It helps with their limited parking as they valet the car. They hotel is across from Garden Walk which has lots of great places to eat. You can walk to Disneyland not a bad hike

The hotel is located two blocks from Toy Story parking lot. It has a great location and the personal is helpful. When I left the hotel they were remodeling the pool and hot tub. Overall it was a good experience, I do recommend this hotel.

Overall great hotel for the value.  The room suited us well as the kid's section was in the back of the suite (vice other suites where the children have access to the door).  It also had a small table for the children to eat and play at.  The breakfast was excellent for children and just as family expects.  Access to Disney and pool made this a great spot for our family.

Summary Heading: Our recent stay at La Quinta Anaheim
Summary: We were very pleased with the hotel.  The room was very nice and updated.  The staff was very courteous and helpful.  We were leary about staying at another La Quinta as we had a very bad experience in San Antonio, Texas.  We will stay here again when we are in the area.  Price was excellent!

Didn't expect to stay over night in Anaheim when we visited.  Rate was kind of high but it was to be expected since it was last minute, the extra parking fee should just be included in cost of the room.   The hotel room was beautiful and clean,  but I gave it 5 stars because the accommodations were suitable for our St. Bernard, not many hotels accommodate our large dog without a deposit.  Customer service was also good.

we were on the 5 floor which was fine, I really enjoyed my self and I dont mind stay there again. I love being in a clean place.The rooms was very clean and I loved the pillow they were so soft. I would mind staying there again.

This hotel was only a $4 Uber ride to the Disney Parks. Breakfast was minimal but suffient. the noise from the hall and elevator was very load. I would suggust requesting a room at the end of the hall away from the elevators.

Good service and friendly staff.  Clean rooms.  I would recommend this location to friends and family. Convenient location, walking distance to food and fun. Shuttle service and buying disney tickets at the hotel were very convenient.  Family friendly and Continental breakfast a big plus

Summary Heading: Decent, but not for long stays
Summary: We stayed in the 2 bedroom with bunk bed with our family of 5 in Dec. 2014 for 8 nights. To save some money we had planned to eat some meals in our room( lunch, snacks, etc.) and had pre-ordered food knowing we had a mini fridge in the room. Here a few things to know about the hotel that we hope can help make your decision easier if you are considering staying here...
