CONS: - there is no freezer in the mini fridge so don't plan to purchase frozen foods(like we did) to keep in your freezer....the fridge is very small! We pre ordered groceries from Von's and did not have enough space for everything. Ended up throwing out most of the frozen stuff as there was no where to put it and had to really squeeze the cold food into the fridge. - there is a sliding door between the master and

Summary Heading: Best hidden treasure in the Disneyland area!
Summary: If you're not averse to a 15 minute walk, this LaQuinta is a great place to stay if you're visiting the Disneyland Resort.  Clean, newly remodeled, and a free breakfast at a great price.  Fantastic Value!

We have stayed at this hotel many times and they have always been a pleasent experiance.  The staff is very accommodating but this time our room was not cleaned in a timely matter.  If you were not out of your room when housekeeping was in your area, they did not come back to your area.

We recently took an 8 day trip to Disney and chose LA Quinta for it's location amd room rate. We had an overall great experience with great employees and the room was adaquate for our needs. Then, on our last day, it turned into the Twilight Zone. Our room was rearranged while we were out and the items our youngest had out on the bed were moved without our knowledge. The trundle under the bed where our oldest child slept was not even made during the disruption. When we returned late at night after the fireworks we were dumbfounded at why the bed had been turned in a way where guests can no longer enjoy the view but instead the light through the divider from the main room would now shine into the eyes of sleeping children. Bedte was a nightmare amd we reported the issue to the

Room was very clean and comfortable, staff very nice and liked the valet parking.  We had a 2 room suite with 2 beds and a sofa bed which was perfect for our family of 5.  Loved all the new renovations done. We will definitely stay here again. Good value for the price and close to Disneyland, restaurants and shopping.

We stayed here to attend Disneyland. We have stayed here before. The rooms are remodled and are very nice. They are clean, modern, and there is lots of room for the whole family! The breakfast was good. The walk to Disneyland is a little longer but still not bad. Allows you to walk off all the junk you consume in the park. All in all, our family had a great time and we will return again!

good value, great spacious room, would stay again, no frills, just honest value.   this is an area with a multitude of hotels with a significant number having small rooms at high per night room rates...not this La Quinta

Summary Heading: A good place for a large family
Summary: The place is clean and looks fairly new.  The beds are comfortable though I would prefer queens to doubles.  The bathroom was in great shape and well stocked.  My only quibble was with the breakfast.  It was ok but not as good as other La Quinta's I've stayed at.  If you have a family of 5-6 this is probably about the best bang for you buck within walking distance of Disneyland.

Room remodeled and small. Some items appeared new while others like bath tub and doors were recycled. Surprise parking fee upon arrival of 9.00 per day, and have valet. This parking area is way to small for fees and valet service. Stayed in king suit with sofa bed, two rooms, with 2 TVs and small refrigerator. King bed was comfy not so much for sofa bed. Stayed one night.

Staff well informed,Clean,large room, kids running in hall way, just call desk, it stopped, Breakfast was good, walking distant to Disneyland.  Across the street from nice restaurant. Security guard on all night.

This was an excellent trip and the hotel stay made it even better.  Our family will return very soon.  Thank You for the excellent service and friendly staff and clean rooms. This was one of the best hotels we have stayed at for such a low price.  Good quality and the breakfast is the best with fresh fruit and coffee.

This is my favorite hotel to stay at, we are annual pass holders at Disneyland, and this is the best, clean, newly remolded hotel! Highly recommended! I come to this place again and again --- Worth every penny!

Recently remodeled, so the rooms are in much better shape than my last visit. Hotel layout, and parking is a little strange. Being a family hotel, it can get a little noisy. The free breakfast is a little weak. All that said, it's still a pretty good value for doing Disneyland on a budget. All the employees treated us very well, and had good knowledge of the area.

The room was good size and long, we had a double queen and there was a separate sitting area with its own TV. The bathroom or vanity area had good lighting which makes it easier to put on your makeup and get ready. We didn't wake up in time for breakfast but it was included. The front desk receptionist was very helpful since I was a dope and booked the room for the wrong date, luckily there was availability and got us a room quickly. The only complaint was the elevator that took forever to open and close. Our room was on the 2nd floor so we just used the stairs instead. Would stay here again

A great place for visiting Disneyland at an affordable price with the most comfortable beds around and after a day of Disney fun you'll really appreciate that.  It lives up to the name La Quinta.  They know how to do it right.  Our King with Sofa room was really 2 rooms, bed & bath and sitting room. TV's in both plus microwave and refrigerator. Compact but comfortable'

Nice room but encountered a few issues with the roomservice. Brought up the issue of dirty sheets and was told they'll address it at their daily meeting. Didn't offer anything to compensate for the several issues brought up.

Summary Heading: Stayed for almost a week, enjoyed all of it
Summary: Stayed here during the NAMM show. A really quick 1/2 mile walk to the Convention Center, close to anything you may need like a regular deli store, great selection of restaurants, in just that 1/2 mile anything you could want is there.   The hotel was perfect, breakfast was good, beds were comfy, service was great, rooms were clean. I will probably stay again next year. A great experience overall.

For the price, the hotel is reasonable, pool could be better if it was heated as being undercover it gets very cold. Location is close to shop, restaurants and transport.  Valet staff very pleasant and polite.

Came here in the summer to visit Disneyland - very good value for a shared room with 3 friends, the food was very good and the pool was amazing as there was no one else in it but us. Very enjoyable throughout.

We stayed here 2nd time to accompany son & grandkids to Disneyland. This hotel is close to Disneyland & has a lot of Disney stuff in it.  I was shocked that the hotel allowed explicit sex on tv that could easily be accessed by the kids. Granddaughter watching Jeopardy & when she got up I changed the channel one channel up & people were having oral sex. Next channel was even worse. These were on channels numbered under 10 such as 7,8,9. I went to son's room & told him & we all had to hide remotes so the kids could not get them. I complained in lobby& they acted like they were surprised and when they changed channels in the lobby, guess what, those channels were blocked in the lobby but they told us they couldn't block them in the hotel rooms.  Those channels should be "pay for

Great place. Some Building reparations during our stay, some miss and noisy. Breakfast regular. Rooms clean and confortable, very close to Disney just 3 Blocks. Nice pool area. Remodelated rooms. good option, and relation, cost-benefit

Was very pleased with our recent stay at La Quinta Anaheim, the room was spacious and modern including a separate living room area. All the flooring and furniture appeared brand new and everything was very clean. The staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast was good with fresh fruit and waffles. Overall would stay here again, the only negatives were quite limited wifi outside of lobby although it was advertised there was free wifi in the rooms. The pool is outdoors but covered and quite dark and dingy, there were lots of leaves in the pool and didn't end up using it as a result. Finally, the location is about a 15 minute brisk walk to Disneyland, would be much longer with kids, so be prepared to use the inexpensive settle bus which runs about every 20 minutes to and from the

Summary Heading: Hotel OK, leak NOT okay especially with a 2 year old!
Summary: We stayed at the La Quinta April 29 to May 2nd 2015.  We noticed on Wednesday night that there was a leak coming from a vent about out sink area by the door.  We told a janitor/maintenance person on Thursday morning about the leak when we were leaving the hotel room to go to the park.  He said he would fix it, but for right now just turn off the AC (in 90+ degree weather). He didn't fix the problem and the room was very stuffy when we came back to the room. Friday morning we told to front desk about the leak and that we had already reported the problem to someone else, they didn't fix it either, instead we came back to a stuff room again. Normally we would have put a towel down and that would have been the end of it, but later that day when we came back for our afternoon nap

Summary Heading: Best Laquinta we have ever stayed at!!
Summary: We stayed at Laquinta Inn & Suites Anaheim for 5 nights and I have to say this is the nicest Laquinta we have ever stayed at!  We always stay at Laquinta because I have never had a bad experience at one. Everything was the best quality, rooms were spacious and clean, pool was great, within walking distance of Disneyland. Someone was smoking in another room on our non smoking floor..I called the desk and within an hour the problem was fixed. Breakfast was great! Waffles, eggs, cereal, orange juice, Apple juice, milk... The selection was very nice. Can't say enough great things about this Laquinta!

Had a wonderful stay at this hotel. I would recommend to everyone to stay here. Everyone is very nice and helpful. The beds are very comfy and having 2 bathrooms in the 3 room king suite was very helpful to get everyone going in the mornings. Plenty of hot water.

Summary Heading: Already booked another stay at La Quinta :)
Summary: This hotel had a friendly and helpful staff. Actually, the nicest staff I've seen in years. I loved the Modern look of the interior. Beds and pictures looked very current. Breakfast was easy and convienent. I have already chosen a La Quinta hotel for my next vaction.

My friend and I stayed at this La Quinta during a visit to Knott's Berry Farm and the Disneyland Resort. It's in a convenient location near both places. The beds were very comfortable, towels were soft, and the room was big! We had two queen size beds and a pull-out sofa in the area separated by a full height screen from the beds. Also a big-screen television, desk with multiple electrical and USB outlets, microwave and small fridge.  The toilet and bathtub/shower are in a separate room from the sink and mirror, which is convenient when more than one persob is getting ready in the morning. Breakfast was adequate, unless you are gluten free or low carb. Emphasis was on waffles, muffins and Danish. Also oatmeal, cold cereal and one flavor of yogurt in a serving dish (tasted like a

Summary Heading: The worst experience at a La Quinta I've ever stayed at
Summary: I've stayed at a few different La Quinta hotels and my wife and I've stayed at least a couple of them together. We were in town for the Star Wars Celebration convention and Disneyland. This hotel is supposedly renovated but it looks like they threw a coat of paint on the walls and maybe replaced some furniture and possibly new floors.   Pros -Mini fridge and microwave were a great thing to have -Rooms were clean -Standard La Quinta breakfast was decent  Cons -AC air handler unit dripping in room - it looked from the covering that it was very old -Large gap between floor and entry door let in more light and noise than normal in my opinion -TV functionality poor at best - remotes didn't always work well -Elevator was outside the lobby and while it required a key to get in, it's

Summary Heading: The remodel is only a mask to hide the...
Summary: This will be the last time I stay at the LA Quinta Anaheim.  The moment we get there they charge us as guests for parking.  The valet out front says there is no parking at the moment so I will take your keys and park your car later.  He was basically driving the cars around all night to move them out of the way of other cars they were parked in front of.  I refused and he miraculously moved some cones and I parked my car.   So not only are you paying for parking,  your paying for wasted gas.  The breakfast options have dwindled with the remodel and the coffee is horrible.  The hotel is extremely over priced and it's still quite a walk from Disneyland.  For the price the hotels near the entrance are more convenient after a long night.    The customer service is subpar when you

My friend and I spent Dec 30th and Dec 31st at the hotel. It's across the street from Anaheim Gardenwalk, an outdoor mall with multiple chain restaurants. It's also near a huge parking lot for Disneyland Cast Members and visitors. Can you walk to Disneyland from the hotel? Sure. Do you want to? Probably not after a long day on your feet. You would have to cross multiple major intersections and it would take a good 15-20 minutes before you reach the security check point.  I've stayed in several LaQuinta locations before and this was by far the best room I've had. When we opened the door, we saw a couch, a coffee table, a chair, an entertainment unit, TV, microwave, and mini fridge. Walk through that room and the large vanity and sink are on your left and toilet and shower are in

Summary Heading: This was not my best trip to the La Quinta.
Summary: They did not have bunk beds anymore and my reservation was made months ago I was never notified. The maids knocked on the door 2 times with the do not disturb sign on the door even thought we were staying 3 more days. The hot tub was cold. The computers were down when I arrived at 2:30am so I had to wait an extra 30 min. after a 6 hour drive for them to figure out a room. The walls are paper thin so expect to be woken up early be people in the halls

The photos must have been enhanced because no way did this place measure up.  Parking tight, difficult to even enter property, front desk had no appeal, was not inviting.  Property worn and could use a thorough deep clean.  Rooms not stocked with enough lines or towels.  Shower head filthy, laundry room and equipment dirty, no laundry soap on site to even purchase.  Breakfast poor and not even real coffee.  Pool area / water smelled awful and water too cold if you could get past the smell.  Seriously disappointed thought I did a better job researching.

Great location, clean and recently updated hotel.  Breakfast (slightly more than continental) is included and great for that quick bite in the morning.  Staff is helpful, nice, and they work hard.  We as a family stay there at least twice a year when traveling to So California

Summary Heading: A HUGE mistake to stay here
Summary: I have had no worse hotel stay anywhere else.  We arrived on a Sunday to find the wrong room given to us.  No manager works in the weekend, AND no management staff works for corporate on the weekends, either.  So we're stuck in a room that doesn't have enough room for our family for two days.  No other rooms available.  Tough luck, but we could talk to the manager on Monday if we want.  We requested an early check in approximately 24 hours prior to our arrival and were told no problem, and upon checking in, the staff did not even welcome us and NO ONE smiled.  Not even once.  Oh, and no early check in.  "We have no idea who would have even told you that", (check in was at 3 and we requested between 1 and 2), and we were sent away.  We returned at 3:30pm and our room still wasn't

Summary Heading: Nice hotel a little farther away from Disney but still walking distance
Summary: We decided to stay here because the rooms are a little larger than some of the hotels and because it is 100% non smoking. We stayed here for 7 nights and they offer a AAA discount.  The hotel was clean and beds were comfy.  Breakfast was included which consisted of waffles, oatmeal, toast, bagels ( only on certain days ), oranges, apples, hard boiled eggs, yogurt and cereal. We have stayed at other LaQuintas which offer a little bit more, but this was enough to fill us up before our daily adventures.  Beware there are many familys grabbing all the fruit and bread to make pbj sandwiches to bring to the park with them so get there early or the food will be gone.  It is a little farther walk to Disney ( about 20 minutes) , but it is only 5 minutes to a bus stop.  They are also just

Summary Heading: Our stay at the Anaheim La Quinta
Summary: I have stayed in many La Quintas here in CA as well as other states. I would NEVER EVER stay here again. They are way over charging for this low rate hotel. The outside elevator was substandard and sketchy at best. They over charge AND charge for parking! The breakfast room was out of control and had poor offerings. Try another property!

My family and I traveled all the way from Northern Oregon for a much needed vacation, and we chose to stay at this hotel for our Disneyland vacation. Huge Mistake. I am a loyalty member with this chain, and will not be for much longer. The first night of our stay, we wanted to use the pool and the hot tub. There were no pool towels, and Stephanie at the front desk advised that she would have some sent over right away. While in the hot tub, we were disgusted to find that we were covered in feces and what seemed to be a green slime. The towels still had not arrived (this was almost 30 minutes later). I again went to the front desk completely disgusted, and didn't even recieve a suitable apology from Stephanie. She just said "sorry about that!". VERY long story short, 4 days later,

Walking distance to Disneyland.  All staff was friendly. Hotel updated and fresh. Room was spacious. Parking cost was extra.  Parking attendant was very nice and easy to deal with. Would stay there again.

Hotel has been completely refurbished. Dark faux-wood flooring, rooms all in dark browns and beiges. Very nicely done. We had a one-bedroom suite. King bed, dresser, two nightstands, flat screen TV. Sink is open to the bedroom, with toilet and shower closed off. The bedroom is separated from the living room by a slider. The wall and slider are opaque glass. Living room has another dresser with flat screen TV, queen (?) size sofa sleeper and an easy chair. Nest to the dresser is a desk and chair. Hotel serves a lite breakfast every morning, waffles, cereal, coffee, but no eggs/bacon, etc. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland. Service was excellent! I remarked to Stephanie that we were celebrating our anniversary and asked for an upper floor. She was very

Summary Heading: Best hotel in the Anaheim area
Summary: I would recommend the Anaheim location to everyone. the staff is friendly and very helpful.    check this location you wont regret your decision. the prices are competitive to the surrounding areas. property is clean and well maintained

Great friendly staff they were willing to let us check in early. The location is great for the Disney parks. We were able to see the fireworks from our bedroom window. The breakfast they serve is decent. All in all a good hotel for the family.

Had a great experience. Rooms were a good size especially with 3 kids. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Just a 10 - 15 minute walk to disneyland or a shuttle near by. Close to restaurants and shopping. Will definitely stay again.

We usually stay here when we take a family trip to Disneyland. Usually the hotel is adequate for what we need. It's clean, spacious and newly updated. Our last trip we didn't have hot water for nearly a day. We had to basically go birdbath style in order to get ready and head to the park. This was after waiting until 10 am to get ready because we were told they were working on it since 7 am. Needless to say we lost the entire morning and cost of our park tickets, which aren't cheap!! After everything was said and done we had a small adjustment on the bill...$30.

Everything was Great and very convenient for us to go and come to Disneyland. We took our Granddaughters to Disneyland for their first time and the location of our stay was awesome. They enjoyed their trip and it made it all a success. We even brought our dogs and everything went well.!!!!

Summary Heading: Great as long as you don't mind staying inside
Summary: The rooms are well designed.  We comfortably housed 6 young women (and all there stuff) comfortably for 5 days.  Plenty of power outlets was an added bonus.  Staff were wonderful. Very friendly and helpful.  The breakfast room and balcony are great spaces; however, while free breakfast is nice, it is kept to a bare minimum (cereal, waffles with syrup, toast, pastry, strawberry yogurt only, hard boiled eggs, toast, and apples and oranges only)  Outside... well, this is where this hotel fell super short, but there is hope for it should they invest a little.  For sunny outdoor space, there is only the parking lot and west facing balconies off the breakfast room.  These are only open until 10am though 😢😢😢😣😣😣.  The pool area:  Well, there is a pool and hot tub.  The furniture

Summary Heading: La Quinta Inn & Suites worked out great!!
Summary: We booked a 2 room suite and it was a good room with lots of space.  The complimentary breakfast was good and the staff was very efficient.   The hotel was in walking distance to Disneyland.  We will definitely stay here again.

To be honest, I was a little nervous staying here after reading the reviews, but it turned out to be a great stay. The room was nicely renovated and we were able to fit 6 adults since there were 3 full size beds and a pull out. The air conditioning was working, warm shower, and there were many families swimming in the pool. The breakfast was OK- waffles, boiled eggs, small muffins and cereal, but who can complain if it's free. It's also walking distance to Disneyland and the convention center.

We always stay at LaQuinta this time our visit was not the greatest. Parking person was very rude and not helpful. Breakfast was not up to LaQuinta standard at all. the server for breakfast was rude as well..

Summary Heading: A favorite for families on a budget
Summary: This is a great place to stay within walking distance of Disneyland. Consider the price and the type of accommodation you might expect at the La Quinta, then add large crowds and plenty of school groups into the mix.There really wasn't much in the free breakfast and kids and families seem to be eating and grabbing food ravenously, but when you consider the price of food in the area you can understand why families are really pigging out and house staff just can't keep pace nor provide the variety. The breakfast area could not meet the capacity of the number of people in the hotel and probably should be much larger. There was an opportunity to eat on the balcony, but again, nowhere near enough space for the number of hotel guests. Our room looked fantastic, smelled fresh and

If you are coming to Anaheim and you have kids this is the best hotel to stay at! Very clean! Lots of space in the rooms! The new renovations are awesome! This hotel accommodates big families at an affordable cost with really nice large rooms! Very clean! The staff is awesome as well! you will not regret choosing this hotel! I give it 10 stars!

This location is very convenient to both Disneyland and the Convention Center and we have stayed here a number of times. The hotel is quiet, very safe and clean. Everyone is professional and friendly. Didn't do the breakfast, so I can't speak to that. But, very close to restaurants. Room was a little warm for me up on the 4th floor, next time I'll shoot for ground. However, we booked 8 rooms and most appreciated the temperature.

This is an older style La Quinta, but well maintained and very comfortable.  All the rooms are two room suites, so it was very roomy.  An added bonus was that my room faced Disneyland and I was able to watch the nightly fireworks show from the comfort of my room.  There were two queen beds in the bedroom and a great work area and a sleeper sofa in the second room.  There were also TV's in both rooms.

Very expensive for what this place it really is. Scarcely cleaned..I needed to ask to chagne room because the bathroom was dirty with long hair when arrived. Noise of the A/C pump on the roof all night. Breakfast: better to forget! At the reception they are friendly but they do what they can...

This hotel is located within a 20 minute walk to Disneyland, and even closer to some great restaurants. It was very quiet, and being able to start the day with a breakfast was great...and much cheaper than Disneyland food.

Summary Heading: Slightly overpriced LQ in a good area next to Disney
Summary: I am a regular LQ guest and was an elite member for years. I decided to do an impromptu visit to knotts and disney for a weekend following an incredibly stressful 2 weeks.  Usually, I stay at the Menage but they didn't have a room I needed for both nights...I kept checking other hotels and LQ was my next go to because they allow dogs for no extra charge. First and foremost; the yelp and TripAdvisor reviews do not do this hotel justice. Some people absolutely amaze me with their audacity to knock a star off for trivial things. This hotel is better than fine for a visit to the Anaheim area. It is clean, free of bugs, well-lit, in a safe and convenient area and has ample parking.  I stayed in a two room king suite with trundle bed. There is literally two small rooms that make up

I am always very pleased with this hotel and it's staff! The rooms are great and we sleep so well in the very comfortable beds! I was disappointed to learn of some new (undisclosed) fees. I was not prepared for them when planning my trip budget. :-(

This was perfect for our family of 6 .  There were a few issues but even with the issues we would stay here again! The issues we had were the following; ac not working fast enough, no ventilation in the bathrooms and the vending machines were not working.  We still enjoyed our stay!!

Clean, close to Disney. Walls are thin, so it can be noisy. Continental breakfast is 'meh. Would rather individual container/packets of yogurt/oatmeal, and some of the items be fresher, *but* there are other areas around to have something. Parking is $9.00 a day, which is disappointing because all of the signs outside state "courtesy" parking. All in all, would come back.

We've stayed here several times and this hotel meets our needs...but not going to return. Got text our room was ready but when we arrived it wasn't so were given another room not in our preferred area. Not happy but okay. The a/c or heat in this room cycled constantly on night two. It was awful! I complained the next day and they said they fixed it. Night three was better though still cycling some. night four totally cycles all night and we get no sleep. Complained and asked for pro rated refund. Desk clerk promised manager would make it right and would call me right away. Never did and was given no discount. Lousy follow through, did not take care of frequent customer. There's too many choices near disneyland to give your money to a hotel who provides poor service, stay

Summary Heading: Great location, good breakfast, pool not so hot (literally)
Summary: When we head to Disneyland for more than a day, our family always likes to stay here. Location can't be beat (a long walk to the parks), you can bring your dog for free, breakfast is good, beds are super-comfy, there are fridges and microwaves in the rooms, and rates are reasonable. Cons: they just imposed a parking fee per car per night, and the pool is in a covered area and never gets any sun, so it's pretty cold. Spa is nice but little kids don't usually like the spa. It's a basic hotel for a price that won't break the bank on a Disney vacation, leaving you money to spend on the other stuff, like park tickets, food and souvenirs.

Summary Heading: Used to be our favorite place to stay...not anymore
Summary: At 1st glance the room looked clean but then the bath tub was dirty and the fan did not work. We had a large 2 king suite with a family of 7. After 7 showers the room was unbearably humid and stuffy. The AC worked but dripped on us while we were tring to get ready in front of the mirror. I informed the front desk staff the day after arrival. 2 days later it was still not fixed so I went to front desk again. This time a guy said he was sorry and would note the room and adjust our rate. Then by the time we checked out I asked about the rate and she informed me that there were no notes on the room and no adjustments made. Then they forgot to apply AAA rate and said it was too late to do anything about it. The food was horrible although the ladies there were very nice. To top it all

Summary Heading: Great place to stay near Disneyland
Summary: This is a great place to stay so close to Disneyland.  Across the street from Cheesecake Factory.  Rooms are large, well appointed and clean.  And pet friendly too. Complimentary breakfast is a really nice bonus.  I would highly recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: good hotel and in walking distance
Summary: Bunk beds have been replaced with a double bed with a pull out trundle, which worked well.  Really enjoyed the two sectioned off areas in our room.  Breakfast was fine, but nothing exciting.  Have had way more options at other La Quintas.  Pool is very disappointing as it is undercover and dark..otherwise, clean, comfortable beds, friendly staff and a 8 minute walk to the park..easy!  Would stay again..and there is a Cheescake factory across the street!

Summary Heading: Great Value for Family Disney Trip
Summary: Had a great stay here last week for 6 nights with our 2 small children visiting Disney parks.  Rooms recently updated, spotlessly clean, and beds comfortable. We had a 2 room suite on the 3rd floor away from elevators, with a king in front room, and double with trundle bed in 2nd room for kids with sliding doors to divide. Each bedroom had separate TVs. Only issue with the room is walls & doors are old and thin. Could hear every footstep and conversation of passersby in the hall and from the room above us. Air conditioner would drown it out most of the time, and quite honestly we were always so exhausted from days in the parks that we all slept pretty soundly regardless.  Front desk service was knowledgeable, helpful, and professional. One of whom went above and beyond for us

The rooms are updated nicely but that is where the positives end. Pool and hot tub were very cloudy. Hot tub was lukewarm. It was open air but covered. Service was very slow. Very understaffed even during peek check in times. Our room vibrated the whole time. I believe it was a furnace unit on the roof above us. We changed hotels After the aecond night. 2 doors down to Marriott Residence  Inn. 100% better!

The free parking on trip advisor and on La Quinta's website isn't so, it's $9 per day, which once you are checking in what are you going to do? Pay it. Took a cold shower the next morning, after talking to other guest at breakfast we found out the hot water issue was a broken boiler and had been going on since they had been there for a week. Went to the front desk and was given a free night. At check in 1/2 our reservation was missing, keep your emails!  Tub wasn't the cleanest. Room was clean. Feel like when we have stayed at La Quinta's with our pets they were nicer.

Good service, overall clean.  Walls are too thin and internet is not very fast (but it's free).  Breakfast is OK, but not near the level that some other La Quinta locations provide.  Easy walk to Disneyland.

I was here about 3 years ago, it looks alot better now, everything is very clean and staff are very friendly and it's not too expensive around the corner from Disneyland. The beds are very comfortable, I have a back problem but their beds and their pillows are very comfortable, I was able to sleep all night long with no problem, after a long day at Disney all you want is a good night sleep in a comfortable bed with nice comfortable pillows, that is the whole purpose of staying in a hotel.

Summary Heading: Big Rooms, Short Walk to Disneyland.
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights to go to Disneyland. A very short walk to Disneyland. I was with my in-laws. Very large rooms - we had a family room and it had 2 bedrooms with their own bathrooms. The rooms are a little dated but it appears that they are being renovated since I was there. There is a complimentary breakfast which was pretty adequate. It's right across the road from Anaheim Gardenwalk Mall (and Cheesecake Factory yum!). Was a very comfortable stay and staff were very pleasant. Would recommend/visit again.

The rooms were newly remolded, clean and spacious. There was a small area for children to sit and eat or color. I really liked the double beds for the kids. Slept comfortably. Staff was friendly! Pool was not spectacular but covered and nice and clean. Close to Disneyland! Good price for the value. I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great Value for Families at Disneyland
Summary: Pros: 1. 10-15 minutes walk to Disneyland Strongly recommend walking to Disneyland from the Hotel as Disneyland's car park (Toy Story lot) is right next to the hotel. Disneyland charges $17 per day for parking when the parking lot is right next to the hotel anyway. Hotel parking is $9 per day.   2. Kid Suite was a comfortable size to accommodate everyone We stayed in a Kid Suite which had 2 king beds plus a sofa bed which was ample space to fit everyone. The lounge room was separated by a door and that had the sofa bed.   3. Room was clean and well maintained.  Quality was good and on par to a 3 or 4 star level hotel. Definitely not 5 star quality but comfortable and I would recommend for those willing to go for a 3 star minimum hotel.   4. Across the road from the Cheesecake

Summary Heading: Nice, good value, close to Disney
Summary: After searching for a hotel for our family of seven that wouldn't break the bank, we discovered La Quinta Anaheim. With a two bedroom suite plus living area and two bathrooms for under $150 a night, we booked it and we're happy. No one else came close. It was not too far away. We could all there with all our kids, but after a day in the park, you'll want to ride the shuttle or take a cab back. Taxis run $8-$10, and  for us, that was cheaper than the shuttle fees per person. Everything was recently renovated, and the  website pictures are very accurate. The covered pool and  hot tub plus a free breakfast were great. The breakfast was simple, but our kids loved it, and they ate heartily every morning: eggs, waffles, bagels, yogurt, toast, etc. Many hotels don't include this, an

This hotel worked great for our trip to Disney. Check in was a breeze and the check-in clerk was very helpful. Parking was $9 a night but I think every hotel near Disney charges these days. Nice clean suite with a separate sleeping area for our friend. Our little dog was accommodated with no problem. Room was quiet for the three nights so we slept well on the very comfortable bed. We found it easier to ride the shuttle ($5. for an all day pass) that picked up directly behind our hotel because it is a bit of a hike to get to Disney and after a long day on our feet we didn't want to walk another 1/2 mile or so. Breakfast was adequate but not alot of protein choices. I think I will bring some breakfast items the next time and keep them in the room refrigerator in fact. We will

I got a suite for about $120 including taxes and I was happy throughout my stay. Rooms are as good as they look in pictures online. Comfortable bed, clean rooms with flat screen TV in both living room and bed room, speedy wifi, free local calls from room phone, coffee maker, iron with ironing board, microwave and fridge were all provided. The free breakfast was good and I loved the mini waffle, but sometimes the fruit wasn't ripe. Gym wasn't big but equipments were adequate. Pets are also allowed, and parking attracts $9 daily. Their staff are friendly and helpful.  There are choicy restaurants nearby. It takes about 20mins walk to get to disney gate (takes longer to get into the park). They sell $5 disney shuttle ticket which you can use throughout the day, bus comes every

this hotel was great for what we needed during a trip to Disneyland. The breakfast was complete and constantly being refreshed. The showers were always hot contrary to many reviews I had read. The parking lot was a bit small unless you were driving a sub compact car but we were able to easily find parking in the attached garage. Everyone was very nice. I would recommend some sort of insulation or something for sound as some guests do not find it rude to yell down a hallway at 6 am or let their kids yell as they run down the hall. But you can't really blame a hotel for people being inconsiderate. the pull out bed that my kids slept on was very thin but after a day at the park they could have slept on a pile of jagged rocks without a problem. The ability to order food from nearby

If your looking for a great hotel within walking distance from Disneyland this would be the place for you.  The staff is very friendly and willing to help in any way they can.  With clean rooms and nice outdoor pool you can't go wrong.

Summary Heading: Paid parking?? Absurd as it's still 20min walk to convention centre
Summary: I stayed at this hotel a few times, staff is helpful.   Recently they renovated the rooms and now charge $9/day for parking, really strange as it's a 20min walk to the convention centre so why charge parking?

The location of the hotel was excellent, for accessing  Disneyland, the hockey arena, and the numerous excellent restaurants (right across the street).  Our room (#321) was spacious and I think a better  layout than the room our son was in (#315).  Hotel was clean, staff was friendly and helpful, parking underneath plentiful and convenient, and the breakfast room got the day started nicely.

We arrived on a Wednesday and Checked in with no problems. Fast and efficient. The Parking attendant was helpful and nice. The room was nice, quiet, clean, and overall excellent. Everyday I said HI to the staff and they were quick to reply with a smile. The Checkout was simple and quick. Easy walk to great eats , shopping,  Disneyland, and other attractions.

Summary Heading: Good value and convenient for the Anaheim Convention Center and Disneyland
Summary: This hotel isn't fancy, but is clean with good sized rooms and suites and offers good value accommodation. I've stayed here several times and the staff are always helpful and friendly.   It is only 15 minutes walk to either the Anaheim Convention Center or Disneyland. It is about 50 minutes from LAX.

Summary Heading: I was really unsure after we booked but pleasantly surprised.
Summary: It was not the ritz but recently completely 'renovated' (basically painted, new flooring and new furniture). It was a cheap place to stay for a week and a big room for a family of 5. We walked to disney most days and took the art bus ($) when tired. The cleaning staff were so friendly but front desk seemed a little grumpy each time I went there. Careful on the store they operate in the hotel it is stupid expensive. Pool is literally in the Parkin lot. Would I stay again?... I really don't know.

Summary Heading: Dog friendly and close to Disneyland
Summary: Very happy to have found accommodations close to Disneyland and we were able to bring our dogs with us.  The place is newly remodeled and offers continental.  The staff keep the breakfast stocked and everyone is very friendly at the desk.  They now how valet parking but it isn't for everyone especially since they started charging $9 extra a night to park your car on top of your hotel rate. Overall good experience.

La Quinta, was in the perfect location to the parks without paying the high park related fee.  It was a great hotel, the staff were very nice and helpful.  I especially appreciated the fact they allowed my dog to stay with us.  That was the deciding factor for using this hotel.  I would definitely encourage people to stay here.

this hotel was so nice to stay at was clean and staff at front desk were so helpful will definitely return to this hotel! we didn't have a way to Disneyland so front desk sorted us a shuttle pass quickly so were able to get on the next one going.

Summary Heading: We had a great time at La Quinta
Summary: Everything was according to our plans of having a great time in our lives. Nothing was a cause to the contrary.    Thanks to everybody working there. The place have been renovated and it did look much better than when my last stay the second of August 2014  My rating is based on not expecting a  5 star hotel of course.

Nicely renovated. Room is great for the price. Nice furniture and appliances. Towels are not first class but they are surely clean and comfortable enough. Comfortable beds. Bathroom is clean but not flawlessly new (that's ok).  Breakfast was ok, though there were no eggs or sausages, I also hope they add more staff. Especially during breakfast rush hours. Staff are friendly and accomodating. Will surely recommend and return when possible.

Very nice hotel, excellent location and warm attention. Quite limited parking lot, but guests have a hotel-paid alternative on a lot close to hotel. Enough space on breakfast area. Definitely an option to consider on Disney vacations.

The property is nicely renovated and very comfortable. The walk to Disneyland was about 10 min. Breakfast every morning was pretty good and very convenient. We had an issue with a broken toilet and the staff promptly moved us into a nicer room. I would stay here again.

I loved the fact that we could get a ART, Anaheim Resort Transit ticket and for $5.00/Day per person we could ride to Disney Resorts and back all day.  The Hotel lobby is open 24hrs, and the snack bar includes the usual candy, chips, popcorn...etc.  And a frozen foods section with hot pockets and lean cuisine meals!  We felt safe having the parking valet attendant always there, and the pool area was away from the traffic & noise of the street.  I enjoyed my stay with husband and teen daughter and her friend in a room with king bed and a separate bedroom with bunkbeds, a sliding obscure glass wooden slider separated the rooms and both spaces had the heat/air vents and flat screen tv's.

Do not stay here if you plan to sleep. This is by far the loudest hotel I have ever stayed in. I am here now writing this. All I can hear is the kids next door screaming. When I call down to the desk they tell me there is nothing they can do. I will never stay here again. There was actual crap stains on our sheets. On the 5th floor their vent system has a continuos vibration sound and feel. I am so fed up with this place. I usually don't write a review, but I had to for this place. DO NOT STAY HERE !!

La Quinta Inn, Anaheim, is a great place to stay for going to Disneyland. It's only 1 block away from Disneyland. The hotel has been completely remodeled and looks beautiful! The staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms rates are very competitive and actually a deal because in most rooms they have a pull-out sofa sleeper for 2 people. This works for my family and so I'm happy!

Christmas vacation at Disneyland and California adventure what a perfect location or the hotel five minute walk to them or you could catch the shuttle at the back of the hotel great neighborhood was able to walk it at any time of the day or night. thank for everything

Summary Heading: If you have pets, this is your place.
Summary: I love Disney, but if you're a dog owner your choices of dog friendly hotels in the area are limited.  La Quinta never fails in its dog friendly policies.  The pros are that it allows pets, provides breakfast, and is reasonably priced.  The cons are, although it is close to Disney, I wouldn't say it is walking distance unless you're ambitious.  There is also no specific area within the hotel grounds for doggy relief.  We had to walk to the hotel next door to find a place for them to go.  It has a pool, but being under the parking garage, it is not conducive to relaxing next to it.  However, being a dog owner, I'm willing to deal with the cons.  All in all, the rooms were clean, the staff friendly, and the breakfast was adequate.

My friend and I always take our children on mini vacations throughout the year. We have always wanted to see Disneyland at Christmas time. My other friend recommended this hotel to me; she informed me that it was a reasonable priced hotel near Disneyland with free parking, free breakfast,  it was recently remodeled and the rooms were big enough for bigger families. Well she was right, it was a great stay, the rooms were big and comfortable. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay here again and I would also recommend my friends and family to stay here.

Excellent hotel.  Spacious suite, very clean.  Bright side breakfast was great, varied selection of food,plenty of room for everyone in to eat the breakfast area. Again La Quinta is pet friendly and I love that, although I didn't have my dog with me this time. Short walk  to Disneyland, which is a priority to me.  All staff members were very friendly, helpful and courteous especially in the breakfast area. I go to Disneyland 2-3 times a year and will definitely stay at this hotel again.

This hotel was great. We have 2 dogs and didn't want to have to take them to a kennel each day we went to Disneyland or went out to eat and since this hotel is dog friendly we were able to leave them in the room. The rooms were clean, and everything seemed updated.

These rooms were PERFECT for visiting with family late into the night. There are separate suites that can be closed off (we had a new baby). Just 2 miles from Disneyland and the hotel was clean and bright.

Hotel was just ok.  The breakfast was decent.  Not a lot of protein.  Mostly waffles and bagels.  The room was nice.  We had a separate room for the kids.  They had bunk beds.  The plumber coming at 8:00 AM and waking up the entire hotel was not fun.  We might stay again.

Summary Heading: Good place for Family Disney Visit
Summary: This is a nice roomy place for a family with teens to stay. Good beds, nice to have separate beds for the kids, which the bunk beds in the divided room provides.   Very short walk to Disney, Cheesecake Factory right across the street for dinner/break.   The complimentary breakfast was ok, but worked for an early start at the park.  The price for the location makes this a very good choice for Disney visits.   Twice the room at half the cost.

Great location for Disneyland and Anaheim. Rooms are clean with very comfortable beds. Staff is very efficient and tends to your needs in a timely manner. Have stayed at this hotel many times and it is always a good experience and great value.

I rented 3 hotel rooms for myself and my children with their significant others.  I thought what a great deal with location, parking, internet and hot breakfast.  We were all attending two family events while we were in Southern California.  We were all at the hotel on Friday evening with our first event happening Saturday morning at 9:00 am.  I did notice right off that the garbage in the room had not been taken care of but I figured it was just overlooked.   Saturday morning everyone got up only to find that we had no, and I mean NO hot water for showers.  When we called the front desk we were informed that the boilers had gone out and it would be over an hour to get any hot water.  We had to take cold showers for our event and it was horrible. Those that were done showering

There are 2 or 3 places I stay when I visit Anaheim. Now that this La Quinta has upgraded their rooms I will stay here more often. Our room was wonderfully decorated and very large and clean. The staff were friendly, observant and quick.

Enjoyed our stay in Anaheim. Disappointed to find out this hotel will start charging for parking. I think this really stinks. I stay at this hotel often and one of the things I look for when booking a hotel is that parking is free. If a guest has more than one car, I understand why the hotel might charge for parking.

My family which includes my husband, two sons ages 12 & 7 and my elderly father were enjoying a Disney Holiday.  La Quinta Anaheim met our expectations and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.  The shuttle to the parks were right around the corner and the drivers were so nice.  Highly recommend!

This hotel was perfect for our family of 6. We could walk to Disneyland, they have a nice breakfast, and the room was spacious enough for our family. Excellent service. We will stay there again. Very great for the price!

This is the only place we stay when we are in So. Cal. Thanks for always making our stay so wonderful!!! We love the breakfast. Lots of food to chose from! Our room is always clean and taken care of. WE LOVE IT!!

We were thrilled about our stay at La Quinta Anaheim from 12/1/14-12/6/14 The front desk was super friendly and helpful. We stayed on the third floor and it was quiet. I imagine the 2nd floor where there is laundry & breakfast would be noisy... It was clean & had modern updates from the recent remodel. We walked to Disney each day & it's about 3/4 mile I'm guessing. My kids loved the covered heated pool & waffles at breakfast. We plan on always staying at Anaheim La Quinta every trip from now on when we go to Disney😊

Cannot recommend this hotel enough. Staff were friendly & helpful, breakfast was fresh & plentiful & the location was superb for all the local attractions. Was in town for hockey at the Ducks & Disney & this place ticked all the boxes. Good selection of bars & restaurants locally. All recently renovated. Would definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Insufficient Parking Spaces for Noisy Hotel
Summary: "Across the street" is the positive spin the indifferent staff puts on the location of an offsite parking lot that must be used if you arrive late or take your car out of its parking space during the day.  To determine if parking is available at the hotel, you have to drive through and back out of two levels of parking.  If you are unlucky, then a 1/4 mile walk, after a long drive or after a day of walking around Disneyland, is required from a public lot that is across the street at the far end of a large parcel of restaurants.  The staff has been trained to explain that, "technically," the lot is across the street and adjacent to the hotel, insensitive to the distance or the inconvenience to customers who have already had a long day.  The hotel has a pass that must be displayed

The staff very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The rooms clean, comfortable and plenty of towels.  This location is in walking distance to Walt Disney Land.  This hotel is pet friendly but not much locations for walking your pets-  Although this site is pet friendly you would never know by the rooms, clean and no smells.

Rooms are decent for the $.  It is NOISY.  Front office is indifferent. THE ENTIRE HOTEL HOT WATER SYSTEM BROKE. They ran out of Disney tickets and were of no help...had to go next door to a diff. hotel to purchase them.

Hotel was near freeway off-ramp in Disneyland area, room was spacious, beds comfortable, lovely styling and lots of light.  Did not like the external 1st floor elevator access and the breakfast was disappointing.

Stayed here on January 1, 2014. The room was clean and well maintained. The shower on the other hand had so much hair in the drain that it was making the water rise. It was so gross! They did send a maintenance guy after we requested it and fixed it while we went to Disney Land. The hallways smelled funny, but we don't know why. A little shop is set up inside so it was convenient for those on the go items we needed. The staff was friendly and the location to where Disneyland is, is pretty great! They had restaurants across the street as well that we dined at and although Cheesecake factory wasn't that great we most likely would stay here again.

Close to Disneyland, close to Gardenwalk with great restaurants and pet friendly. Meet all our needs. You could walk to Disneyland but the Toy Story parking lot is close and easy after a long day at Disneyland.

The first suite they put us in was not as clean. Dirty pillow like some threw up in it and the bath tub was clogged so they gave us a new room. The second room they put us in did not have hot water at all until the next morning. Even then the hot water comes and goes. Call front desk and the lady was so rude about it. I'm never going to stay here again. Horrible!

Recently stayed at this hotel in early November 2014. Hotel was recently updated, and it's very nice. New flooring, new bedding, new TVs - this all shows that the property owner is committed to offering a good experience.   The front desk staff are great. Check in was wonderful. The room was nice (two bedroom king). The hide-a-bed needs updating, and I don't understand why we needed to ask for pillows for the bed and an extra blanket - odd.   There's quite a bit of ambient noise from adjacent rooms and from above. Although the noise was a nuisance, mostly coming from people in the hallways at night or in the morning, it was the noise from the room above early in the morning that was not nice. I realize that there will be small children because of Disneyland, but the sound was

Clean room and very friendly staff but breakfast was mediocre (frozen boiled eggs and cold waffles).  Kept running out of hot water in shower in about 1 minute,  Great location and easy to use public transportation was a real plus.  Very clean and quiet.  Price was very reasonable for the area. Mattress clean but pretty hard.

We had a two room suit with a king-size bed and a living are with a pull out sleeper.  My teenage daughter slept on the sleeper bed and found it comfortable.  There were tv's in both rooms.  The bedroom room was the room you entered into, which was odd however, being on the inside proved more  privacy.    If staying again, we would ask for an extra blanket at check in for the sleeper bed, since we found the blanket to be to thin. Also additional pillows was appreciated, since we all like multi pillows.  Breakfast was adequate. The waffles were awesome.  The refrigerator and microwave

The Anaheim La Quinta's room was twice the size of most rooms! This room could have slept four people in the two separate rooms that had a privacy divider! Fridge and Microwave, two televisions! Full couch, two easy chairs and a desk with nice office chair.

This was the first time we stayed at a La Quinta.  Our experiance was great.  We have a dog and there was no problem with bring the dog with us.  The breakfast that was served was good and the dining area very clean.  I will stay at this hotel again.  If all La Quintas are like this one, I have found my new hotel chain

From the photos posted I thought the rooms would be run down but when we got to our room I was surprised how clean and nice the room was. The bathroom was nice and clean too. Everything looked new. I would stay here again.

We always stay at the La Quinta in Anaheim when we go to Disneyland. The rooms are large, clean and reasonably priced. You can stay at places that are cheaper, but you don't get what you don't pay for. What you do get at the La Quinta is a clean, safe place to stay with good service, friendly employees and  nice place to hang out when you are not at the park.  The hotel is within walking distance of Disneyland but we drive over to the big parking garage. On that note, Disneyland will try to direct you to outlying parking lots. if you don't care then follow the signs, otherwise, drive up Harbor Blvd and turn left on Ball Road. In less than a mile you will see the lanes that turn into the parking structure.  Back to the hotel. They have a nice, clean indoor pool, vending machines

I havent stayed at this Hotel and probably I will never back.  I asked information about Disneyland and the Ladie at reception was very rude. She sold me a shuttle to go the Disney and had no patience to explain. That is not a costumer service! 03 November/14- 03:20 PM

Summary Heading: Great hotel. Huge rooms. Recently renovated!
Summary: This was a great hotel. The rooms are huge, with a bedroom separated from the seating area (with a sofabed). The rooms were recently renovated (and in fact they completed the lobby when we were there), so everything was brand new, and the linens and furniture were all tasteful. Service was excellent, and you can buy your tickets to Disney from the hotel.   Breakfast was included, which was a huge convenience. They had enough variety - including very good waffles plus cereal, fruit, juice, coffee, muffins, hard boiled eggs, and other things. The fact that breakfast was a buffet at the hotel was really great bc it allows you to hit the park right away without thinking about your meal. Parking was free.  There was a jacuzzi and a pool. The day that we went, it was late afternoon,

No real complaints it is a nice hotel. It can be a bit noisy if you have a bunch of little kids in the room above you. They have a very nice breakfast and the staff was very friendly. The upper two floors were being completely renovated while we were there.

4th time we stayed at this location to go to Disneyland.  We got a 2 room suite for 2 adults and 2 kids.  This room is perfect for privacy for both.  The flooring and furniture has been refurbished and is very nice and clean. Very affordable. Breakfast is adequate to start the day and continually restocked. Staff helpful and friendly.  Swimming pool basic but kids liked it. Easy drive to Disney parking lots and shuttles.  Will stay here again.

Hotel is excellent for walking to and from Disneyland and restaurants around the area. No need for taxis unless you are not a walker. The room was neat and clean. Baths are very clean. Water pressure is great! They offer a complementary breakfast spread that is well attended by a great staff. I would stay here again without hesitation!!

Absolutely loved the room with Bunk Beds.  Grandparents traveling with daughter,son in law and 3 grandchildren, is a challenge for room accommodations, howver La Quinta, Anaheim was a perfect solution with the 2 double beds and a separate room with bunk beds (full at the bottom and standard at the top), included 2 flat screen tvs for convenience.  Newly renovated lobby and recently painted exterior.  Plenty of room for all 7 carry on bags and all the souvenirs from Disneyland.  Breakfast could have been a little better, we were expecting at least scrambled eggs to be available, the kids were not a fan of hard boiled eggs for protein.  Overall we were very happy with the value of our stay.

We have stayed here 3 times before & were pleased with the upgrades.  The location is convenient to Disneyland (we walked the first 2 times here; then rode bikes the last 2 times) & good eating is just across the street, but you are far enough away to avoid the crowds.  We especially love CARRIE at breakfast:  friendly, kind, helpful...the best!  Hope to be back some time soon.

This is an older style hotel in need of refurbishing, which they appear to recognize since the entire lobby area is under construction when I was there.  The rooms themselves are very large and well maintained, and the beds were extremely comfortable.

stayed here with my three grandkids, husband, son and daughter in law in june 2014 for 3 nights. rooms completely renovated, clean, 1bedroom suites are roomy with microwave, fridge , bunkbeds with a double on bottom and another room with 2 queens. only downside is 1 bathroom. nice continental breakfast.. cons.. they were still doing renovations and there was no parking when we got to the room at midnight. had to drop family , go to desk and ask about parking. was told we would have to park down the street in a parking garage for the night, then we had to walk to hotel from there. they could have had a shuttle at least get us back to room. the hotel paid paring fee though. The elevator would not work several times and we had to take stairs. This is a dog friendly hotel so there

Recently remodeled room was beautiful and the staff very friendly.  Just a couple of blocks from Disneyland's overflow parking and shuttle bus.  Very easy to get to the theme park from this location if you have a car.  Within walking distance of some good restaurants.

The suite was very spacious.  Beds were comfortable, plus there was a seating area with a fold-out sofa.  Breakfast was typical La Quinta -- simple but decent.  Plenty of tables to accommodate families getting ready to go to Disneyland.

If you are looking for a mid-range hotel that is right on the shuttle stop for Disneyland - this is the hotel for you!  The recent renovations (some are still taking place in the lobby and hallways) have made a big difference and the rooms look modern, fresh and clean!  As far as La Quinta's go this one is an A+.

This LaQuinta has and awesome location near the ART line.  The room was clean and big enough for 5.  The free breakfast was awesome!  For anyone going to Disneyland and California Adventure Park, this is a great location.

Lobby construction noise into the late night. No hot water in our showers but given a second room to shower in but had to carry stuff back and forth. Room in hall flooded, people were playing in the water in the hall, cleanup crew from flood made noise till after 4am.

Enjoyed our stay.  Great having two rooms and two TVs, although we did not spend much time at the hotel.  The kids loved the pool.  Having the breakfast each morning was a bonus.  The kids loved the waffles.  Not a big variety but it was adequate as a breakfast.  Beds were very comfortable.  A 10 - 15 minute walk to Disney.  Restaurants nearby and also a 7-11 store and ABC store.

Positives: The room was a good size and Disney was close-by.  The cleaning service was below standard in keeping supplies stocked and actually cleaning the floors.  We had to call several times to remind them to come back.  My daughter developed scabies during our trip.  We're not sure if it was from the room but that was the only place she would had exposed skin for the mites to enter.  The fire alarm went off numerous times one night and the staff seemed disorganized in getting the situation under control.  The wifi was terrible throughout the week.  The lobby was under construction which seemed to be the only place that it had a strong connection.  The check-in staff seemed less than pleased to be at work and annoyed by questions.

I have stayed on 2 separate occasions and have loved both experiences!  I've received exceptional customer service with the staff being very friendly and super helpful.    Being newly renovated, the rooms are very clean/nice and the beds are sooo comfortable.  I love that there are 2 rooms divided by a French door, with 2 tvs, and is so roomy for my family of 4.  The complimentary breakfast consists of waffles, fresh fruit, oatmeal, cereal, muffins, toast, juice, and coffee.  There is an ART stop right outside the hotel with a shuttle that runs every 20 minutes to/from Disneyland.  It is close to restaurants and Target is just minutes away.  This La Quinta is a gem... I hope you discover it!

We stayed at this hotel while on a business trip. Even though we were on business we had to watch our expenses and this hotel helped so that. Only only issues was the lack of variety on the breakfast bar and the limited parking. Rooms were clean and large,k allowing us to spill out into the extra space and put our clothes away for the duration of the stay.

The La Quinta has recently remodeled updated rooms. Rooms were very clean. The Family Suite had two beds plus a pull out sleeper, so this was great for our family of six. The price was great at just under $100. The distance to Disneyland is great, about a 10 min walk. If you have little kids then you may want to consider the shuttle (ART) to the park.

all our family gave this hotel an A+, guest services and cleanliness met our expectations.  we plan to use this hotel for other vacations as well.  overall our stay was a positive outcome to this family reunion.

Hotel rooms have been nicely remodeled.  I wouldn't recommend a room near the elevator as guests with children aren't very considerate and are loud in the hallway in the morning...... excited to get to the park I suppose.  The elevator to rooms is on exterior of building and is slow.  Liked the Suite with separate room with nice bunk bed, additional tv and desk.  Very nice.  Room could house 6-7 people

I'm handicapped and asked fo a room close to the elevator. They put me close to elevator #1, elevator #1 didn't work half of the time, when I asked about it they told me that a part was on order . It was over 100 degrees and the pool was closed, when I asked about that the clerk didn't know it was closed.  The air conditioner rattled everytime it started up and woke up up all night long. The staff didn't have a clue what was going on.

The hotel is clean and the staff makes you feel at home.  There is a parking garage that is free of charge and a nice pool/jacuzzi.  The hotel is across the street from a PF Chang's, Cheesecake Factory, and Bubba Gump Shrimp Co, and many more.  If you are planning to visit Disneyland, shuttle busses pick up a short distance from there.

hotel fits our needs. we are enrolled in a lung cancer trial at UC-IRVINE WHICH IS VERY NEAR TO ANAHEIM. THE hotel location is very convenient,and close to good restaurants. it is quiet and well furnished.

This hotel provides above average bed and rest quality within close proximity to Disneyland with easy transportation options to the park and resort areas compared to other moderately priced hotels.  Restaurant options are somewhat limited within walking distance but Bubba Gump Shrimp and the Cheese cake factory are very close and there are many options within and around the Disney resort area.

The room layout is great.  has a door/divider so kids/teeanger can be on their own.  My teen stayed up without interrupting our sleep.  Room has microwave and small fridge as well.  Hotel is located blocks from Disneyland. and plenty of surrounding restaurant.  Ideal location.

It took 6 phone calls to the hotel and LQ central reservations to reserve one 3 room suite and one two room suite. Each reservationists agreed that the previous reservations were incorrect and they they would fix it. It was still incorrect when when checked in. The amount of time I spent on the phone with LQ was absolutely unacceptable.

We stayed here during our recent visit to Disney. Walking distance to Disney parks and across the street from the Garden Walk which has a large selection of shops and restaurants. Room was clean and comfortable. We stayed in a two room suite which came equipped with small refrigerator, microwave, two televisions and a sleeper sofa. The staff was very helpful and we were able to check in early due to our arrival. Parking is limited, so if you go during peak season you may have issues finding parking. All the basics, soap, shampoo, and clean towels. The wi-fi internet was free and fast. They have a swimming pool that is under the building so no direct sunlight. They were still in the process of remodeling but our room looked very good. They have a complimentary breakfast on second

Summary Heading: GREAT PLACE TO STAY, Very Comfortable.
Summary: What can I say... There are at least 10 different types and styles of restaurants within a 10 minute walk. PLUS DISNEYLAND is a 10 -15 minute walk too!! Adi, from the Front Desk,was a wealth of information and help when ever it was needed. I had a 2 room ADA suite for 3 days and it was VERY reasonable. In fact, it cost less than a lot of my other stays at other smaller room stays at the same Venue Hotel Chain across the United States during our travels. It was a GREAT PLACE for an mid - older aged ADA couple to stay at. I would highly recommend it to anyone wanting to go to Disneyland or to this area.

Great hotel newly renovated clean beautiful comfy rooms.Had the 3 bed suite. Great choice price good close everything in area. Cheesecake factory across street, good food.  Free breakfast is good here. Catch the bus behind hotel to go to disney. Save on parking and gas. got tickets at hotel  3 day pass 12 dollars. Only down side was keys not working for elevators or door. They need to improve there keys.I would recommend this hotel and will be back to stay again.

Rooms were very comfortable, Fridge & Microwave a plus and Free Breakfast including waffles. Nice covered outdoor pool area. Shuttle to Disneyland only 5.00 per adult and 2.00 per kid, runs every 20 minutes, very convienient. Would stay here again!!!

some of the hotel smells like smoke because of people smoking in the pool area and in the hallways. The breakfast was pretty sparse. The pool was over chlorinated and the maid service left a bit to be desired. Overall the accommodations were good and a great value.

At first I was a little concerned when booking this as it was not listed as a Preferred Disney Hotel but my fears were allayed once we checked in!  We had a three room suite and it was attractive clean and perfect for our three generation group!  We could shut our door when we felt our kids needed family time, or we needed a short rest! It had a  refrigerator and microwave to help offset expensive dining at Disneyland.  The front staff, though busy were quick to help whether answering questions or printing out directions.  The ladies who worked the very busy breakfast room were friendly and very efficient and hardworking to replenish supplies. The shuttle stopped a few steps from the hotel and with small kids this was helpful.  the beds were newer and while not pillow tops they

We got a free upgrade! Staff was extremely efficient and friendly. I paid for a 2bd 1 king 1 sofa sleeper for a family of 5. We ended up staying at a 2bd 1 king and bunk beds. Botton bunk is a full size and top bunk is a twin size. $157 taxes included for what I got is a great deal. Complimentary continental breakfast.

I just spent 4 nights at this La Quinta from Aug 14th through Aug 17th.  On our first night While taking a shower that first night I found that the drain in the tub ran slow so by the end of my shower I was standing ankle deep in water.  On the way to Disney Land the next morning I stopped in and told the front desk clerk of the problem.  She said that she would have maintenance take care of it.  My grand-kids and  I returned to the room about 1:30 the room still had not been cleaned, around 4:30 the house keeper came to make up the room, but the kids were sleeping so I told her no service.  While I was waiting for house keeping on the way to get some ice I saw a house keeping cart in the hall and exchanged my dirty towels and took some fresh ones for the room.  That night while

Stayed here for 4 nights. We chose this hotel because we were traveling with our 3 medium sized dogs. The 2 King bed suite was perfect for our family of 3. There was a living room area that had plenty of seating and the beds were very comfortable. We had a great time here and the convenience to Disneyland was great. There were a few things that could have made our experience better though. A grassy area for the dogs to relieve themselves other than the rocks along the parking lot. We had to take the dogs to the hotel area next door to find a grassy area. Working ice machines on each floor would have been nice too. Overall, a great value for the 2 King bed suite.

price is right free parking( free breakfast decent  ) walking distance to Disneyland i travel with wife and son we all like i well come back to this hotel..and recommend to all my friends. i'm travel for business to San Francisco and always stay at la quinta  martin              from chico ca.

This hotel is minutes from Disneyland and reasonably priced. The rooms are a little small but they are clean. There is nothing really fancy about this hotel it's just a place to sleep. Complementary breakfast consists of cold hard boiled eggs, pastries,  cereal,  oatmeal, juices and coffee.  The lobby is not open all night and is separate from the elevator that takes you to your room, its located outside. Parking is cramped and they could run out of space but its free. Overall it's okay for the budget minded travelers.

If you are looking to find hospitality and friendly staff visit this location anytime an employee named Julian is NOT working. I work for an company that I choose not to name, that using La Quinta for its corporate account for any travel plans. It would be a safe estimate to say that my company uses la Quinta on a daily basis in hundreds of locations across the country. Myself, I have stayed at numerous La Quinta in the north west for hundreds of days over the last 10 years and I have never been treated the way I was by Julian at this location. Being in a hospitality business, the Anaheim La Quinta must do a better job screening it's employees so that it can continue to attract guest in an ever competitive business. Julian had an " I don't care" attitude, lack compassion,

There are not Orange juice and coffee. Food is not enough. We had bought breads for our breakfast next days. We want you to add more variation and amounts. If you improve it, it is very good for our familty

Summary Heading: Affordable option for families if going to Disneyland
Summary: We went to Disneyland and stayed at the La Quinta near Disneyland. The room was very comfortable for four people. There was a room that had its own king bed and bathroom, one room with two double beds that was separated off from the living room.  The beds were comfortable and the staff was quick to provide extra towels when requested.  The hotel provided a shuttle to Disneyland which was nice (but be prepared to wait a while for it to pick you up at the end of the night).  The couple complaints that we did have was it was very noisy in our room. Our room was located toward the road and you could hear every horn, siren, and all other kinds of traffic noises. You could also hear the people in the room above us walking (or jumping-not sure) around.  The hallways were noisy with

Nice front desk employees, especially Adi, hotel was in a safe area. felt extra safe since you need to use your key to get on the elevator or to open the door after climbing up the stairs to the floor your room is on. Room and hallways were clean and updated and room felt large. Was pleased to find a microwave and fridge in our room. Shuttle to disney round trip is $5 through Anaheim resort transportation. Found the shuttle to be quick and efficient. The only issue were the crowds at breakfast. The food kept running out and the 2 employees manning the breakfast station were working hard to keep up. We had to wait in a long line for waffles and finding seating was challenging. That being said I think it is probably peak season. Overall a pleasant stay and I would recommend this

Could not get enough towels for our group of 4, didn't get soap or shampoo either.  Called front desk for some, didn't get any, finally went down to get it.  This happened twice...... Ran out of hot water, 3 in our group took cold showers.

We stayed there 3 nights.  We had the big 1 king, 2 double bed, 1 sofa sleeper room for our family of 7.  Very roomy, 3 tvs, fridge, about a 20 minute walk to Disney.  They offer a free breakfast but as others have said it is the same every day.   Mini waffles,  bagels/toast, boiled eggs, oatmeal, cold cereal.  They also have milk/juice/coffee although on one morning the juice and milk were not working.  No milk eliminates the cold cereal option for the kids.  But, having an all you can eat breakfast will save you some $$$ on buying multiple meals at the park.  The room was nice, sheets and towels were clean.  The only mechanical issue was there was a pipe that dripped rusty water in the far end of one of the tubs.  Nothing dangerous, just unattractive.   I think with taxes and

We recently stayed in this hotel for 6 nights. On 3 of the nights we had no hot water. In fact it was just cold water.  We stayed in a room on the fourth floor. It seem liked the kids on the fifth floor were running around the room the whole night.  Also, this hotel needs to have more parking.

The breakfast was horrible!!! I stayed there 3 mornings and they served the same thing over and over again!!! They had mini waffles that they make, by the time you serve yourself the waffles are hard and cold... I Did not see any variation of the food!! But the worse part was that horrible smell as you walked in the breakfast room!! My suite was right beside the breakfast room and I could smell it all the way to my room!! I was disgusting!!! it smelled like rotten eggs or something!! It literally made me gag!! I complained to the front office gladly they took care of the smell. Also, one of the lightbulbs in my kids' room went out and they never changed it!

Excelent ubication, excelent room, excelent service!!  My kids loved to have their own TV on their room. Is great to be very near for the parks after a  very long day. Very clean room, very clean bath, very good breakfast.

I personally stayed in a sweet, as i always try to.  I appreciate the roominess and extra living space. This hotel never disappoints for the price. Great staff , great rooms plus a little breakfast bonus. Thats why Im a rewards member.

Good hotel, however horrible parking, get in early and don't leave, otherwise no spots available and have to park 1/2 mile away. If you try to park, and it's full, its near impossible to get out! People park on the ramps making room for one car to get thru, have to back out the entire way to the road, and watch out for other guests coming in while you're trying to get out...Let the yelling and fighting begin!!  Also, beware of barking/crying dogs! The room across from us had a small dog,(which they allow), left it in the room ALL day and night while they went to Disneyland! Couldn't sleep until they came back after 2am! Each night! Other guest were yelling/cursing in the hallway thinking that would quiet the dog and stop the owners from leaving it.. Made for a very uncomfortable

First off, and most importantly, the rooms are clean, attractive, comfortable, and private (read: quiet). You're going to be spending 90% of your time at the hotel in your room, so we're off to a good start.  It looks like the hallways were recently renovated, and they were apparently still in the process of renovating the rooms.  There was a room being gutted just a few doors down from mine during my stay - I heard no construction noise from my room, and the only evidence anything was even going on was when the workers opened the door as I was walking by.
