So: Everything's clean and new, and the management and staff are very considerate of the guests.  The staff, from my experience, was pleasant, friendly, and competent.  I didn't have any issues or concerns during my stay, so

Pros: Breakfast was decent. But since it's free and you're probably staying at the Anaheim location to visit Disneyland, it really helps to keep the cost of the entire trip down. The breakfast attendant was AMAZING! I don't know how she could do everything and with a positive attitude. I'm very picky about rooms and it was very clean! The staff was friendly and helpful. If you get a room on the third floor or above with a Disneyland view, you can see the fireworks from your room. Cons: the fitness center was a very small room with only three cardio machines. But each time we went no one was there so it wasn't a big deal. Also, you can't open any windows so you have to rely on the air conditioner. It works great but at times can feel stuffy if you don't keep it running. I was

I stayed with my son for the weekend, and was friendly and relaxing. The staff was very friendly and helpful to my questions and requests. The room was comfortable and roomy. Their continental breakfasts were a little lighter on choices compared to other La Quinta Inns. But that didn't take away from a place that's close to Disneyland and other attractions as well as other forms of entertainment. I will come back here and stay again. Thanks.

I love the upgrade, that was made to the hotel. Wish they would keep the rooms with the Jacuzzi tub. When you spend the entire day walking, it was a great way to relax. Overall  enjoy staying here 4 times a year.

Summary Heading: Don't expect too much and safeguard your personal belongings
Summary: This is not a good value; you can get better rates closer to the resort, a friendlier staff that will not take your things, and an overall better experience for the same, if not less per night.  This hotel allows dogs, which I think is great; however, the staff does not hold pet owners accountable for their dog's behavior.  The bathtub was clogged after the first shower; something that would have been noticed and fixed had housekeeping washed the tub.  We had to ask for extra towels each day, in spite of me making this request when I made the reservation and when I checked-in.  This was just an overall horrible experience; we checked out a day early...just couldn't take anymore.

I am a wounded vet, I was wounded in Iraq and the parking lot is very small and I had both of my cars with me and my family. I was forced to park one of my cars about half a mile down the road. However it was a nice walk with a great view. I was on the top floor and the view was beautiful. The staff was super friendly and attractive. They always had a smile on their faces. The ladies were very pretty and the gentlemen were very hospitable. It was within walking distance from Disneyland. The staff was even willing to draw a map right to the entrance of Disneyland. The only problem was that the hotel was doing construction which was on the same floor as the kitchen, which meant that free breakfast was hard boiled eggs, waffles, and cereal. But that wasn't to bad the hard boiled

This hotel was recently renovated and it met all our needs. My family stayed 3 days to visit Disneyland and we were very satisfied w/everything the hotel offered (i.e. location, breakfast, pool, parking, and cleanliness). We would definitely stay here again!

The hotel room literally shook when laundry was being done.  The hotel staff was casual and did not appear very professional.  The lobby was unkept and desperately needed to be vacuumed.  The front desk staff could use a course in customer service

Summary Heading: La Quinta Anaheim is a dive!
Summary: This hotel looks OK on the outside but it is an overpriced dive. It is fully under construction. The noise is constant. The phone, fridge and plumbing did not work. There are not enough parking spaces for guests and you are forced to park a great distance away at a parking terrace that charges $10 a day.

While I understand the hotel is undergoing renovations, and the room itself was very clean, the set up and breakfast left a lot to be desired. I prefer a suite to have 2 separate rooms like embassy suites, with the bathroom in the middle, not like what I experienced in La Quinta. The kids were in the room closest to the window, with the main room and bathroom at the door. There was little to no light from the outside in the main room, and the kids had to keep passing through the main room to go to the bathroom.  Not well thought out.  Also, the breakfast was pretty pitiful - toast, mini waffles, boiled eggs and oatmeal and cereal for the kids.  Not enticing at all.

I have stayed at LaQuinta's before but this hotel really made me wonder why I stay at these.  Most hotels like to make people happy and upgrade them.  We got downgraded - to a King suite - with 4 people!  We were literally on top of one another for 5 days.  The hotel is under construction so there were workers and boxes and stuff everywhere.  Beware parents with children who want to go swimming - the pool is UNDER the hotel - right by the parking garage!  The complimentary breakfast was awful and luckily there was a 7-eleven that was close.  This one was definitely a mistake!

La Quinta Corporate note:  you should advertise that a site is under construction.   When the guest arrives, constuction becomes the standard excuse for all short comings.  We had a clean room and the hotel is a 15 minute walk to disney.  The breakfast room is a beautiful facility.  Given the area, the rates are reasonable.  Breakfast was skimpy and not well done.   The breakfast bagels on Sunday were stale.   The Nestle coffee is mediocre (old, I guess).   Breakfast is 6-9; there is no coffee in the lobby during the day.    I got to breakfast at 9:30AM (yes,late) and this guy blocks my way into the restaurant, when asked he admitted  there was no coffee elsewhere in the hotel, and then told me that if I wanted coffee, I should make some in my room.... rude, rude, rude.   I

Usually reviews about hotel problems wouldn't be called Outstanding Service, but in this case it is. We checked into a 3-room suite with 4 grandkids and immediately had problems with the TV set in the living room. A hotel service rep was at the door in 5 minutes to resolve the issue.  Within a few minutes the problem came back and once again the service rep was there to fix the problem for good.  Shortly after the TV issue, we found the refrigerator was not providing adequate chilling for some medicine. Another rep appeared within minutes and appeared to fix the problem, but that was short-lived and a 4th service call was made. This time the rep brought a new refrigerator and removed the old.  Four service calls within the first hour! What makes this stand out is that on each

Stayed here with my wife and our 4 kids.  Enjoyed the family suite with 2 doubles and a bunk bed.  Comfortably fit our family.  Our floor was recently renovated and the updates look nice.  The bed frames were pretty cheap and the doubles were a little too short for this 6' 4" guy.  The breakfast was pretty much continental (plus mini waffles), and the pool area seemed to be ignored by maintenance.  BUT despite all of that I would probably consider this place again.  The price and location made it worth it.  Only 12 minute walk to the Disneyland and California Adventure Park entrances.  If you can get here on a shuttle from LAX, you won't need a rental car if you are only going to visit Disneyland.  Also nearby is a nice mall (Anaheim Gardenwalk) - while it was pretty much a

First the negative the mattress had urine stains which is understandable since the room caters to families not a big deal the stains were old. The problem was the bedsheets either that specific bed was used before the room was given to us. Or the sheets were never changed out. Unfortunately for us the sheets had a fishy odor penetrated on it and to our surprise a  sticky nasty item was found inside. We called the front desk and they advices us to change rooms for the night while they got us a new mattress in the morning. Problem was they only had a room with a king bed, which did not work out for us since not all of us fit in a king bed. The floor did not sound cozy for us to sleep in, so we kept the room and asked for new sheets. Honestly didn't want to look for a new hotel

STOP! Don't make a reservation here. The only good thing is that the hotel is close to Disneyland and next to the Garden Walk.  After a 7 nite stay, here are the negatives.  I am also a home based travel agent.  I look at things as a consumer and as a travel agent.  I wouldn't recommend this place.    Hotel is under remodeling with two weeks left or so.  This information was not shared when room was booked through the call center. There was a broken room phone upon our arrival.  That was replaced. There is no AC in the halls. Only in the rooms. The pool is outside and under a roof.  There is no direct sunlight.  The pool is advertised as being heated, I think not. The Breakfast Room is on the second floor of the hotel which is being remodeled during our stay. Not impressed with

We recently stayed here during our trip to Disneyland and everything was great during our stay..Our room was one of the new ones and it was really nice and clean..Big enough for a family of 5..Breakfast was nice..There was cereal, waffles, toast, muffins, fruit, oatmeal, juice, milk and coffee..Would stay again and I would recommend it to anyone visiting Disneyland..

Was under remodel as of June 2014.  The new rooms are nice, clean and quiet.  We did not eat the breakfast because the parents were letting their kids 'play' with the food in the serving trays.  Not much parking but they will refund parking fees from the Gardenwalk parking lot.  Close to Disney and some nice restaurants - we will stay there again.  Office staff found my wife's lost phone and promptly let us know, very good front desk service

Summary Heading: Wonderfully Renovated and great new staff
Summary: Stayed with my 4 kids in Family Suite. They loved the bunk beds and I live the great new rooms. The walk from/to Disney is not bad especially when you're not paying $500+ per night like Disney charges.I forgot a pack of diapers and a pair of my daughters Converse and they held them at the front desk for me.  Overall wonderful experience.

Summary Heading: Poor breakfast, tired property, good location
Summary: Other than its proximity to Garden Walk, I cannot recommend.  The ART shuttle to Disneyland picks up in the parking lot, otherwise is a 20 minute walk.  The room was decent in size, but furniture was weathered.  The free breakfast lacks variety and quality. The attendant did keep things in order.

Very close to everything and if you decide walking is not for you, there's a bus pick up behind the hotel to the parks. A little bit of a walk to the convention center, takes 12-15 minutes. Renovations are going well, nearly complete and are really nice!! Loved our king suite, separation between spaces worked well for our family. Staff were very friendly and helpful!

If you want a peaceful stay in a clean room with working phones, elevators, etc with reasonablely helpful or polite staff, find somewhere else to stay. The rooms are not worth half the price. Management is rude to the point of hostility, the endless construction clutter & noise are frustrating, room basics like tv, wifi, phones, hot water, etc, work sporadically, rude nasty attitude towards the smallest request for  service make this hotel a nightmare.  When we arrived, the hotel was making much needed repairs to the walls, floors & more when we arrived,  but the management did not bother notifying guests prior to or at the time of check-in. Only after they charged your credit card & hand you keys are you told to be careful going to your room. If its inconvenient too bad, no

We chose this hotel due to its close proximity to Disneyland, plus, the opportunity for our dog to travel with us.  We were able to walk to and from the Disney parks, and the front desk staff was helpful in the way of directions and maps.  Parking is free here.  We were placed in a large renovated room where it more than comfortably slept four.  The fridge and microwave were a plus.  The bathtub/shower combo area didn't look as if it had been renovated as nicely as the rest of the room, but nonetheless, it was clean.  The breakfast was a standard continental breakfast (nothing to write home about), but still something in your belly before hitting a long day at Disney.  We will be staying here again for Disney's Star Wars Marathon weekend, and would recommend it to others.

Wonderful hotel, clean, close walking distance to Disneyland, great bargain for Disneyland area. Also, for 5 dollars per person, you can use shuttle to Disney all day long, so you can go back and forth to Disney. I liked the free breakfast and free parking. Also, across street from variety of restaurants for dinner, including Cheesecake Factory which has a huge menu to please all cravings!

If you aren't spending a lot of time in the hotel, it's not a bad deal.  However, don't rely on breakfast every morning unless you want a carb fest.  Very little choice and not the greatest food.  Bedroom and sitting room was clean and nice, but the bathroom didn't match.  Tub had stains in it, the curtain and toilet paper holder was old and worn.

We love staying here rooms were nice, staff was AWESOME! Located near Disney, easy to find from both Disney and freeway. Rooms very comfortable! We will be staying here again. Staff was very helpful and professional as well as personal.

We had a great stay at one of the Suites that they offer. Breakfast was great but there was a rush right before everybody goes off to Disneyland, we found out the very first morning we went down. Getting to watch the Disney fireworks from their bedroom suite was the kids favorite part. The housekeeping service was great and the front desk girls were very helpful. Having the restaurants walking distance was perfect. Other than the construction the stay was delightful.

We booked a one night stay here on a Friday night. We showed up very late to check in and everything went smoothly. The room was comfortable. Shower worked good. Breakfast was ok. Pre cooked waffles, boiled eggs, bananas, cereal, toast, bagels, yoplait. We headed out to the park around 8:20 and we were at the entrance in 10 minutes. We are regular walkers and runners so we might be faster than most. I would say it is about 1.25 miles to Park Entrance to Hotel Elevator.

Looking at other reviews we were skeptical. Although some had complaints we could not complain at all. Although they were still renovating on another floor we were not disturbed or inconvenienced.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: pleasure trip to Disney w/ Family
Summary: We were very pleased to be able to fit our family of 7 which included two couples.   It was clean, quiet, the beds were comfy, and it was close to the attraction that we visited.  We were also very pleased that they accepted pets at no extra charge!  That was a bonus and could have really hampered our trip.  Thank you for your service.

Worst stay ever!!! Being woke up from hammers pounding on the walls @ 6am every morning, Blood on the floor in the elevator(when we could use it), having to walk up stairs w/ luggage and 2 very young children because the construction workers were using it. The hallways to our room were dirty cause of the construction. Housekeeping didn't keep them clean. No where on the website said that this hotel was under construction. Such a disappointment.

Summary Heading: Good Clean Hotel with great interior
Summary: Good Hotel, clean interior on top renovated floors, good space. Kid Suite had nice bunk beds that my children loved. Good Hotel, clean interior on top renovated floors, good space. Kid Suite had nice bunk beds that my children loved. Good Hotel, clean interior on top renovated floors, good space. Kid Suite had nice bunk beds that my children loved. Good Hotel, clean interior on top renovated floors, good space. Kid Suite had nice bunk beds that my children loved.

Summary Heading: Great hotel and close to Disneyland
Summary: We had a wonderful time at this hotel. The staff was very helpful, and were able to help us with our early arrival and late departure. The room was perfect. Very comfortable and clean. Breakfast was alright. There could stand to be more variety with the food.   Overall a great time and we will be back. We will definitely recommend this to others.

This was the second time I have stayed at this hotel during the VEX robotics championship. The fact I returned says that it is good value for money. I stayed at the Hilton betweekn my two visits and felt ripped off by the Hilton. The room we stayed in was tired but clean. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom had a good shower.  Our 2nd floor corridor carpet was damp in several places but that was being sorted out. The laundry facilities were fine. It is nice to be able to get a free breakfast and select cereals if you want them. Easy walk to Disneyland. The hotel is undergoing a complete facelift and they have already started on the 5th floor. I just hope they do not raise their prices too much. The building work was hardly noticeable and did not get in the way at

construction below me woke me up every morning before 9. dust was everywhere from recent remodeling of rooms. nice location, close to Disneyland but shuttles to cost money per person. the hotel shakes, floors are bumpy. im not sure the building is even safe.

Great deal for the stay and area. Close to parks,restaurants also in walking distance if shuttle isn't an option because it isn't included with room.  Children loved the bunk beds, new renovations made were a great addition. Gift shop inside was helpful.  Love LQ

We've stayed in a number of hotels with 3 kids and this one is by far most bang for your buck!  Great rooms big enough for 3 teens and 2 adults with room to spare. Spaces are separated by doors with a bunk bed for the kids and plenty of floor space.  Always good when you travel with teens.  Rooms were clean and updated including lots of plugs for electronics.   Breakfast was waffles, cereal, some fruit, and oatmeal.  Walk to Disneyland was easy, 3 blocks.

Only a few blocks from the resort parks.  This hotel was very clean and the staff was awesome.  Family and pet friendly makes this hotel a great vacation spot.  Not too crazy about the water downed juices for breakfast but it made it up with pre made waffles.  Good way to not spend time in line in the breakfast area because you will be doing that at the parks.  LOL Yes our family will return to this location Two Thumbs up!

Our family had a great stay at the La Quinta in Anaheim, CA.  It was easy to walk to Disneyland from it. The staff were all friendly and the rooms were always clean.  We had a great 6 night stay. We will definitely look forward to going there again.

I'll start by saying that if the review box would allow me to give a 0 I would! Awful, from the uncaring staff to Housekeeping, condition of the rooms and the quality of breakfast! When we made our reservation we requested an early check-in. We arrived early but later than the time I mentioned on my reservation. The room was not ready and the lady at the desk (from her attire looked like a manager which makes it even worse) did not offer to call us when the room was ready, wouldn't even attempt to get a time for me when we could check back, no empathy after a 6 hour drive in the car with two kids and was she was pretty rude. We left for 2.5 hours to get lunch. When we arrived back the room still wasn't ready. We waited in the lobby and got into our room about 2:30pm. Chantel,

I really enjoyed my stay this year...The new decor is nice and I happen to stay in one of the newly done rooms ...I really enjoyed it The staff was very kind and professional...This is the only hotel we stay in going to Disneyland location is great...We walk to the Disney park being only 2 miles away but they have a shuttle that will come pick you up and drop you off for a small fee. Also there many places to choose from to eat  prices from $$$-$. Very clean location. If you choose this hotel I hope you enjoy your stay like my family and  I did...very children friendly as well

I like staying at La Quinta hotels.  This one was conveniently located close to Disneyland.  It was approximately 1/2 mile walk to the gate.  It is off the main street and it was quiet.  Breakfast could have been a little better- a few more choices, but it was adequate.  Beds were comfortable, staff friendly. We were allowed to leave our car there after we checked out so we could spend the day at Disneyland and not have to pay for parking.  Overall, I would recommend it.

We travel monthly, to visit our adult children all around the country. For this reason, we need reasonably priced rooms to continue to make it possible. We booked a basic room, with two double beds and got a great rate. Boy, were we pleasantly surprised! The desk staff bent over backwards to accommodate our early check-in request. The room was immaculate! Our room had a living room and a separate sleep room, 2 TVs and a refrigerator. The sink and spacious vanity was a treat. The hotel offered a shuttle to DISNEYLAND, but it was close enough that we just walked back and forth from the resort to the hotel. The breakfast was nice, the regular Continental breakfast, but the dining area also exceeded expectations. There was outdoor, patio dining available!

Our stay was wonderful. The staff was great and friendly and very helpful. Our rooms were superb and always clean. The location was perfect and right around the corner from Disneyland. I highly recommend this hotel to stay at and it is a very reasonable price.

The hotel was nice and the staff friendly and helpful.  Our major problem was with transportation to the area attractions such as Disneyland and Knott's Berry Farm. The local transit system was terrible and rarely on time, and not according to posted schedule.  The hotel is was a little to far from Disneyland for us to walk.  The hotel is gign to be nicer as the are in the middle of a remodel. This hotel would be better if they would offer some sort of shuttle to area attractions as well as to the airport.  This was an extra expense to us. We had booked 4 nights but only stayed 1 and moved to a hotel closer to Disneyland (right across the road - The Desert Inn). It was not as comfortable for sleeping but closer for walking.

I stayed one night for business in a two bedroom suite. the room was spacious, clean and overall the grounds and facilities were neatly kept. The girl at the front desk was very nice, and helped us with a speedy check in and check out process. I guess that if you choose this hotel because you are going to disneyland, it would be a good choice because it is only a 10 minute walk from the parks. And the cheesecake factory is right across the street, so that is very convenient. Overall, would consider staying here again.

WE loved it! It was very clean and the service was great at one time we needed more towels in our room because our kids had used them for the swimming pool and we asked one of the housekeepers if we could have more and they gave them to us right away. Thanks for the nice stay!

I have stayed at this La Quinta several times while we attended conventions in Anaheim. We park our car at the hotel it is a quick walk to the Convention Center. The rooms are nice and have recently been updated. Noisy guest we will ask to be away from the elevator. Great restaurants across the street.

The only positive is that this hotel is fairly close to Disneyland (~15 min leisurely walk). Otherwise, the cleanliness of the room is, mildly put, substandard. The carpet was dirty and the rooms were smelling of must. The shower barely worked and it took forever due to very low water pressure. The pool area does not look very sanitary either and the water is very heavily chlorinated. Definitely not for families with little children. I do not recommend it and will not stay there again.

Good services, rates and accomodations.  Receptionist  friendly and accomodating.  Room clean and breakfast   was good.  Staff friendly.  Will consider making reservations again.  My stay has been very enjoyable.

We stayed at LQ on Clementine street for 3 nights and it was a Good experience. The location is only 15 mins walk from Disney parks and breakfast is served early in the morning which gives you opportunity to plan your day for disney and other attractions, you can get ready and line up at the gates before time. It is also very close to local restaurants, you can walk to them in 2-5 mins and best is cheesecake factory which is across the street. While it solves the purpose of stating at a safe and decent place, As an suggestion of improvement , LQ can improve the quality and variety of the breakfast as well as improve the bedding of main and the sleeper sofa beds.

Summary Heading: Needs improvement esp location of the elevator and improve food variety for breakfast
Summary: I don't like their elevator near the pool, smells chlorine & wet always. Breakfast needs variety. Same food everyday. Curtains w/ holes, we were like in the Universe seeing stars esp during night time.

We traveled with two 60+lb pets. This was the only hotel I could find in the area that would allow two large dogs and not charge a large non-returnable cleaning fee.   We got a clean suite in a great location. You are walking distance to Disneyland and the convention center, not to mention many restaraunts and shopping. The ammenities included a microwave and refrigerator, plus free breakfast.   The property could use some updating but for the price, we found it to be a great value! The place could use some updating but overall we were very happy with our experience there!

worst hotel experience of our lives.  the online pictures are deceiving.  the hotel is dirty, noisy, and subpar.  the designated smoking area is right outside the pool so you and your kids have to breath in cigarette smoke if you want to swim. the room appliances are not guaranteed to work and the elevator is slow and falling apart.   their "Disneyland shuttle" is a city bus that stops at multiple other hotels so it takes longer than walking and costs $5 per person per day.  This hotel is a disgrace!

Stayed here late March to be near the Convention Center.  It was well priced and the room had bunk beds and a king bed.  Worked out great for the kids to be in a separate room, it even had a little table and chairs and separate TV.  The hotel itself is average and a little dated, but the location is really good.  Across the street from shops and restaurants.  It is a bit of a walk to the convention center, and even further to Downtown Disney, but again, for the price and the amount of space, it was worth it to me.  The parking lot is very small, so if you can't find parking, the desk clerk said you can park across the street in the mall parking lot.  You will have to pay and then come back to the hotel to get reimbursed.  It is a little far to walk, so drop off your luggage

This hotel is in terrible condition.  Dont expect much from your room.  The accommodations here are old and beat up.  They need a major renovation.  Staff was pleasant and returned the items that we left in the room.  That was appreciated.

If all you're going to be doing is sleeping here after Disneyland, I highly recommend this place. It's clean and quiet. The staff are very courteous and it's within walking distance from Disneyland (7 minutes tops). Would stay here again on our next trip. Looking forward to our next trip and our next stay here. Also across the street from the Cheesecake Factory and next to the garden walk. Awesome location!!

Summary Heading: Always the best choice in hotels
Summary: I only use La Quinta hotels. The rooms, service and value is always amazing. We were able to fit 6 people in our room comfortably, and we could have fit 1 or 2 more. The only downside to this hotel is the parking.  You can only park 1 car on site.  Everything else was awesome.

There had been some not so good reviews for this hotel, but I have to say that my family and I were very happy with our stay.  They are in the process of remodeling - but didn't affect us at all.  Our room was excellant, and the staff went out of their way to help -  If ever here again, wouldn't think twice about staying again.  Thanks for a GREAT stay

Summary Heading: We have a new favorite hotel at Disneyland
Summary: We visit Disneyland several times during the year, often staying at the various hotels on Harbor.  A friend recommended this hotel.  It was clean, quiet, and very pleasant.  The staff was friendly.  The walk to Disneyland was a bit further, but enjoyable.  We will be back.  The breakfast was sufficient.  I noticed the absence of a "tip jar" - often present at the breakfast at so many hotels. We had a very pleasant stay.

This is my favorite Hotel to stay at when visiting Disneyland.. My whole family (2 small dogs)  Enjoy the large clean rooms. It's easy to get to Disney each day. They offer a breakfast with hot and cold food served each day. The rooms were clean and fresh. I can't wait to go there again on another family vacation.

This place is just perfect for a family. It offers free parking and breakfast. They have great customer service and it's just very economic. This place is just perfect nothing more nothing less gives you just what you need. Best of all, they are remodeling it for the summer so it'll be even better! Highly recommend La Quinta!

this has ask for a review i have explain to the best of my ability what my review has been please add meat to breakfast  the cheerleaders that were that were very noise but i dealt with it   ok i made this comment and went on because this 200 characters would not not let me go further  this needs to be change to write no more than 200

The 2 main things I need from a hotel is a place to sleep and a place to shower. The bed was very comfortable but it was extremely hard to get a good nights rest with all the noise we could hear. Noise from the hallway, noise from the people upstairs and next to us. Just very noisy, that's not even incuding the loud 3:30 fire alarm that went off, startling us awake. Now on to the shower; Yes there was water, but it wasn't hot, or even warm. Tepid. My kids cried because it wasn't warm enough. It sisn't matter how long you waited for it, it was luck of the draw. Only 2 of the nights we stayed there did the water feel warm. I was also disappointed in the breakfast. It's not the worst I've seen, but not the best either. Sticky floors, tables and chairs in the breakfast room.

Very convenient locations.  The hotel is clean and well kept. The only problem is parking.  There doesn't seem to be enough parking for the reservations. The staff is very friendly and helpful.  We have stayed at this hotel quite a few times.

Hotel was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. We have 5 in our family so we required a roll-away bed, this hotel did not have one, but tried to accommodate us as best they could and the stay was good.  The breakfast was good, but the choices were limited.  Overall a good place to stay and great proximity to Disneyland.

We booked a two room suite for one night before our condo was available during our week-long visit to Disneyland. I have to say, I am glad it was only one night. This hotel is over priced, as are many hotels in this particular area. However, this La Quinta is significantly below the quality of most La Quintas we have stayed at across the country. The hotel room looked like it was in desperate need of an update. Paint was chipping, wall paper starting to peel, it looked like rather than updating or repairing the bathroom the staff had re-caulked the bathroom over and over. Our "two room suite" was not at all what I expected, which I might have known were there any pictures on the website. It looked like a standard two-queen hotel room with an extra large closet where there was a

Summary Heading: La Quinta Inn Was The Place
Summary: My family and I really enjoyed our stay at La Quinta. The service was excellent and very helpful. The room was perfect and really enjoyed being able to have a sitting room with an extra television.  The location was near everything and a shuttle to Disneyland right at the front door. Will definitely stay there again.

We stayed here three nights this week for a trip to Disneyland. We checked in very late in the evening.  When we got to our room, the bathroom was locked and there were no maintenance people to unlock it. We had to change rooms. The front desk person was apologetic and nice about it though. Breakfast was very light. You can get a snack but not really a full breakfast. The bathroom in the room seemed dingy and there was a dirty sock that belonged to someone else in our room for days.  The hotel really could use some overall updating compared even to other La Quinta hotels I have stayed at before.  The bunk beds were fun for the kids though.  We had also asked about parking one day and they directed us to the Mickey and Friends lot. That lot was already full and we lost an hour

Always enjoy our stay. Excellent staff and matching service. Rooms are comfortable and restful. Breakfast is good selection and fresh. The room can be noisy sometimes…chairs scraping across the floor and echoes.

We had an amazing time with the kids and the hole family on our stay in la quinta it was a couple of mins from disney that was a thumbs up because next day we had a good breakfast from the hotel. Very very happy.

Summary Heading: nice but a little run down or old.
Summary: We enjoyed our stay very much we had a great 3 rm suite. I only wish the rm with the 2 double beds was switched with the rm with the sofa due to the noise in the hallway.  Loved the thick towels & the thermostat control. Maybe a few more cups for as many people we had.  We had 3 kids & 2 adults & only 4 cups. Our stay was Fri - Sun didn't need maid service but did need cups.  Which I got from the maid. Front desk staff was very friendly. Gift store was lacking in small chikdrens shirts but a very nice reasonably priced gift shop & friendly sales girl.  Breakfast was great just ran out of oatmeal both days.  All in all we had a great time @ la Quinta.  Will stay there again might even join your rewards program.

Great location, I love La Quinta hotels but this one made me park a block and a half away because it has limited parking. Sucks big time after 12 hours of walking at Disneyland. You have to park in a mall parking lot and pay 10 bucks. The hotel pays you back but it's still an inconvinence. They should at least offer valet parking. Other then that I like the hotel.

Summary Heading: Gone downhill since our last visit!  Won't stay again!
Summary: This is our third stay at this property and sad to say it will be our last.  As we were staying here for 8 nights I decided to splurge a little and booked a Jacuzzi Room with King Bed.  Upon entering the room we were pleased to see it was quite large with a separate sitting area with TV and work desk, and then the bedroom with King Bed and the bathroom with Jacuzzi.  However, this room needs refreshing.  The tiles in the bathroom could do with a good scrub and the shower has mould… a pet hate of mine!   The bed linens and towels were always clean and fresh and I think the cleaning staff probably do as well as they can in the time allotted.  The bed sagged in the centre so hubby and I rolled together all night.  The worst thing, however, was the smell of dog urine which seemed to

some of the best service we have had on our many trips to the area. We go to disneyland a lot and always stay here. They always treat you well and help with any and all needs that may come up while on your trip. We tell our friends to stay here also. one other thing thats a nice part of your stay is the food in the morning. Carrie will have you happy and full befor you leave 4 your day.

Summary Heading: For the price, it's a steal
Summary: I was nervous after reading the reviews here, but our stay was excellent. We spent two nights over Christmas here to go to Disneyland. We prefer to stay at La Quinta's for their generous pet policy (our two aging dogs go wherever we go). Since we are military, we have stayed at 20+ locations over the past 8 years. We travel frequently.  The property is no frills - it is what it is, but for the money it was more than enough. As I said, we stay here for our pets and to us, that is priceless. We had a King Suite on the 3rd floor (I think, maybe 4th? Its been awhile now). It had a jet tub in the bathroom, the bed was nice and comfy, and the sitting area had a pull out couch. Its not brand new but it also was clean. No issues around our stay - we parked outside of the garage the

Summary Heading: Fool me once, shame on me
Summary: The two room suite advertised on their website is a single room with a sliding partition.  The breakfast is very limited in scope and quality.  While promoted as a full breakfast, it is more accurately described as a glorified continental breakfast.  There was old food and garbage in the drawers of the night stand.  The room was not cleaned upon our arrival.  It was also not cleaned very well throughout our 4 night stay.  Only one of the two TVs was functional.  The front desk said that they would send someone from maintenance to fix the TV.  They never did fix it.  I mentioned the deficiencies to the hotel clerks.  Nothing was ever done to correct anything.  At check out, a very feeble apology was proffered.  No attempt was made to correct anything.    It is close to the local

Great value for the money. Room was large and comfortable. It was really nice to be able to come back from Disneyland and unwind by relaxing in the sitting room and watching a little tv at the end of each day. Breakfast was adequate with plenty of choices for a simple continental type. Only problem was that we found everyone must be getting up and into the shower at the same time to be at the park for opening, because the shower was cold during that hour or two. Evidently the boiler cannot keep up. But the staff was excellent and accommodating.

My family and I really enjoy staying here. The family suite has enough space for the kids and the dog. It's clean considering, a lot of people stay here with their dogs.  The front desk staff is excellent and nice like always. We have been staying here about 3 years in a role. Since we decide to go Disneyland for Christmas. Skip giving gifts and cooking Christmas dinner.  I just wish they had their own van to take you to and from Disneyland and another local theme parks. Cause waiting next door for the bus SUCKS!!! It's always late and pack!! Better to walk or pay for parking. Since you are kind of paying the same price for the bus.

Summary Heading: Will stay somewhere else next time
Summary: My family had a horrible experience at this hotel. We drove from Texas to California to visit family for Christmas and surprised our kids with a stop at Disneyland on the way home. We had reserved a room with bunk beds for our children at least a month ahead of time. We had our credit card stolen before our trip and had no time to replace it before we left, so I called LA Quinta to give them a new one so we would not lose our reservation. They told me that it wasn't necessary and we could just pay with a different card when we arrived. After driving all day with two exhausted kids and a dog in the car we arrived and they had given away our room because of our credit card. They said they were completely full and the only room they had left was way too small for my family. They

I was a little worried after reading the reviews.  But, I was pleasantly surprised.  The layout of the room, double beds and then an extra "room" with a sofa sleeper, two TV's, microwave and fridge was great.  The bathroom seems recently remodeled and clean, which is super important to me.  The sink was in the main bed area, which I thought was weird but then it later made sense.  The beds were very comfortable. As far as the noise level mentioned in other reviews, only maybe twice we heard neighbor noise, it was not a major issue.  The front desk staff answered all my questions and provided help when I needed.  The breakfast was nice, but after a few days it got old.  There are waffles, oatmeal, bagels, hard boiled eggs, donuts, cereals, whole fruit.  It will do to save money

First, the good news: the staff was friendly.  The bad news: this property looks much better from the outside than the inside.  We stayed for three nights in a fourth floor "apartment" that was shoddily remodeled and felt dirty. There were places where you could see the original wall covering and ancient baseboards, and the kingsize bed had a big uncomfortable bump down the center, like a speed bump, leading one to wonder if it was two twin beds shoved together?   The three room suite had just one non-working phone and the light switches were either nonfunctional or hidden in strange places.   The fourth night we moved to a smaller two-room suite with a better kingsize bed. It seemed to have been remodeled and was intended for families, with a bunk bed in the second room, but

We booked this trip through the La Quinta website. Booked in advance, price was fair. The check in was speedy and smooth. The room was huge!! Included flat screen tv's(2), fridge, huge closet and pull out sofabed in adjoining living room type area. Continental breakfast stayed replenished. We had a family of 5 (2 adults, 3 kids (16, 13, 10). Plenty of room and an easy walk to park.

Summary Heading: Good place to crash, convenient to Disney
Summary: Would I return here. Probably. Was it the best hotel experience ever? Mehhhh.   The good: typical La Quinta pet policy...no extra charge. The room was spacious. A double suite meaning two double beds in one room with a flat screen tv, with an attached room (sliding door/curtains) with a sofa bed, and another flat screen tv. Reasonably clean. Bedding very clean, bed comfortable. Friendly front desk staff. The anaheim shuttle that goes to disney is directly behind the hotel, and the front desk sells tickets for the shuttle. Parking seemed reasonable while I was there, but it is the shoulder season as opposed to the middle of summer. It isn't a huge parking lot, though there is garage parking (free). They do ask that you only have one car per room though, otherwise you have to pay

We recently stayed for 4 nights midweek during our fall break.  I had said I likely wouldn't come back but a lot of hotels were either booked for one of the nights or too expensive for what I wanted to pay.  We settled on the Apartment suite which had a nice King bed and bunk beds in a separate room.    Likes, have stayed before so we know the ART system well and it was easy to get around. Breakfast is OK.  Room had plenty of room for the 4 of us (Myself, wife, 12 and 10 year old).  Nice TV's.  Great front desk staff, was pretty clean and not a bad walk to Disney (Which we did one night)  Dislikes.  Parking garage is very old.  Breakfast room was very crowded.  The hotel is a little older.  Pool was nice, but out of towels and hot tub was only a couple of degrees warmer than the

Summary Heading: Stay away if you want a good nights rest
Summary: Disney hotel number 4 for us. All the usuals were booked do we stayed here. Big mistake. Walls are paper thin. You hear everything.  The walls and bed were literally shaking during the day. The shuttle to Disneyland is the ART which was really late. I called the front desk for a room change because of all the noise in the hall and they told me they couldn't help me.  We did think of just leaving during the middle of the night. Other hotels in area are superior

The location is great 15 minute walk to Disneyland. There are many close restaurants, movie theatre, stores, and other conveniences you might need for your vacation. The room was comfortable a little outdated but for the price it's acceptable. Breakfast is continental; toast, bagels, donoughts, oatmeal, fruit.

The La Quinta Anaheim is an awesome place to stay, especially if going to Disneyland/CA Adventures.  It is an easy 15 minute+ walk to both parks (which saves you the $16 Disneyland parking fee).  It's close to shuttles to the park too, if you don't want to walk.  Also close to many nice restaurants right down on Katella.  The rooms are very nice, the hotel staff is very pleasant, and the breakfast is a great plus too.  I highly recommend this hotel, especially if you can get less than $100/night.  It's especially nice for a family, to save on parking, breakfast, etc...which makes the cost that much more reasonable...

Summary Heading: Our "Annual Disney Vacation" home away from home...
Summary: We visit Disneyland regularly and on average, stay for at least a week at a time. The La Quinta Inn in Anaheim has served us well.  Sure, it may not be perfect, but the rooms are clean, staff are friendly, and the prices are right. We bring our poodles with us and the fact that this is a dog friendly hotel is very important to us. This place is a very good deal in our eyes!

If you have ever heard the expression "You get what you pay for", that is how I would describe this hotel.  That being said, this was a trip on a budget which is why we stayed here.  It needs some work.  Breakfast less than adequate.  We are rewards members and were asked if we wanted to upgrade for a higher rate,  when we should have been for no additional fee due to our elite status. Sink in room, old and gross.  Staff however were nice and courteous.

I stayed with my 3 kids (11, 12, & 15).  I had reserved a room with 2 full sized beds and sofa.  My plan was to put my 15 year old son on the sofa, but upon check in, we were upgraded to a room with 2 full size beds and bunk beds!  It was a nice surprise!  The room was clean, spacious, and had 2 t.v.s.  The breakfast was plentiful and dining area was very clean.  The pool area was clean and the jacuzzi was great to soak in after a long day at Disneyland.  One afternoon, there were no towels at the pool.  I called the front desk from the phone in the pool area and had towels in 5 minutes.  This was my first experience at La Quinta, but it won't be my last.  I truly enjoyed the stay and it's close to Disneyland and dining.

We generally try to stay in La Quinta hotels because of their accommodating pet policy.   This is the closest to Disnet we could find, and it worked out great.  It's an older hotel, could use some freshening up, and you can hear the heavy footed walkers in the room above yours, but it is clean and sufficient.   The staff is very nice and helpful.   Would we stay here again? Absolutely.

Summary Heading: NICE STAY AT LA QUINTA LA
Summary: The staff at the hotel were great. The room was nice and comfortable. The pool area was very clean and covered from the sun. The front desk staff were alway there to help. The best thing is the hotel is near Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Good family hotel for Disneyland Trip
Summary: 2nd time we have stayed here.  We get the 2 room suite and use the military discount. Great buy.  The room affords privacy if needed and lots of room. Breakfast has good variety and restocked all morning.  Roll away bed provided at no extra charge.  Garage parking. Very clean room.  Very comfortable beds. Fold out bed had thin mattress but ok for kids.  The sink in the bedroom was odd but we dealt with it.  We could see Disneyland fireworks from our window too.  Recommend for family.  We called the day before and asked for a refurbished room.  We got it. Very accommodating staff. Will stay here again.

Nice area.  Near restaurants, garden walk, movies, etc.  Rooms were nice and very comfortable.  Allow dogs, which was my favorite.  Pool was very nice, outside but covered with a beach scene.  Excellent service all the way around.

We have always used this hotel as well as other Laquita locations for at least the last 10 years. We have never been disappointed. It is close to everything and he staff is consistent. We always feel important there.

Summary Heading: Check around - better hotels may be available for similar price
Summary: My family and I stayed at the La Quinta for four nights in late August.  Buyer beware -- not all La Quintas are equal.  This hotel is frumpy -- it needs to be upgraded to what I believe are LaQuinta standards.  Parking is very tight -- it might be hard to find a space late at night. The price was OK at around $89 a night but the place needs a good coat of paint, newer furnishings, lighting, etc.  The hotel does not air condition the hallways -- smells musty.  It was not a real two-room suite as promised by the front desk  -- it was a  two-bed room with a sliding glass door and low-quality draperies separating the king bed and the sofa bed. The hide-a-bed was very uncomfortable.  Room also are not sound proof -- we could hear kids running down the hallway.   It also seemed

Summary Heading: A few things could make it better....
Summary: Location is walking distance to Cheesecake Factory..Bubba Gumps..etc. Art shuttle is directly behind hotel in parking lot of neighboring hotel. Breakfast is sufficient and nice to have..mini waffles..bagels..cereal...donuts. Gift shop is a tad odd. Its cramped and not on the main floor...but it has the cheapest water if you need some to take to parks.  The two room suite was nice but only one mirror was bad. And only one washcloth the first day was wierd for a room that potentially accommodates six. The bathroom could use some TLC....rusty towell holder. Theres a lack of cool air in hallway and especially elevator. We took the stairs since the elevator was always in use and extremely stuffy. There's lemon water that's never available in the lobby. Its always full of ice but no

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, But Not Expensively So
Summary: This was a spur-of-the-moment trip to Anaheim and Disneyland.  Not wanting to spend a huge amount of money per night, yet being within walking distance of the parks were important factors in choosing the La Quinta.  The facility is about a half-mile to the Disneyland property, and (depending on the route one chooses) on well-lit streets to and from.  Because of the price, I took the wheelchair accessible room.  The 4th Floor room ended up being a two-room suite, lined on one side of the living room and 1 1/2 sides of the bedroom with floor to ceiling windows (nice curtains for privacy, but a nice view when you want it).  All three areas (living, bedroom, bathroom) were clean and tidy.  Had I been staying longer than the two days I was there, the full-size closet would have come

We had to move from the Disneyland Hotel because of it being booked up on the weekend for a marathon.This was one of the only hotels available. Upon arrival, the front desk person was nice and helpful, and they had ice cold lemon water to drink which was just what we needed on that hot day. We went up to our room (elevator is outside) and had the family suite that had a kids room with bunk beds. That part was nice, beds were comfy but the room seemed to lack character. Maybe it felt plain and old because we had just moved from the Disneyland Hotel. The Bathroom is kind of in a weird spot and the sink sits in an odd spot. There was only one mirror for our party of 5 to try and get ready with which was not convenient.The one nice thing is the ART pickup is right behind the hotel

We travel to Disneyland about 4 times per year. We have stayed in many of the properties "within walking distance" over the years. This time we had our small dog with us and booked this Hotel because it did not charge a per day pet fee.  We just returned from 4 days at the Hotel and we thought it was great.  Upon request we were given a 'quiet' room. There was a very comfortable King Size bed in the first 'room' and a full/twin bunk bed in the second. The room was not as big as some other hotels, but it was very clean and perfect for a family of 4 that was going to be at the Park all day.  The pool was clean and enjoyable.  The breakfast was of decent variety & included waffles & yogurt.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  We walked to the Park each day (didn't want to pay the

We stayed at this location 2 years ago and decided to stay there again this month.  It is less than a half mile to Disneyland so it is very convenient if you are planning on spending a lot of time at the park.  Last time we stayed it was looking a little dingy around the edges.  This time they had freshened up the paint and the carpet in the hallways.  Our room was very clean; except it still had old dirty-looking carpet.  Our bed was comfortable.  The free breakfast was a lot better on our first trip than on our recent trip.  The price is very reasonable for a family stay and they have mulit-room suites for larger families.  We were able to get a 2 room suite for $79 per night.  Parking is free, but limited.  They have a pool area that is covered so you can swim even if the

I needed to book a room for a retreat weekend with church friends. The deadline had passed for booking rooms for the conference and the hotels they listed had doubled at expiration. I was able to book a suite at La Quinta that was perfect. It was also about $100 less than any of the others wanted for a regular room. The friend traveling with me said La Quinta will now be her home away also. No noise, no wandering people, felt secure, and for women traveling alone that's a plus. Thanks La Quinta Inn

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: Great location to Disney, restaurants, shopping.  Good shuttle service available.  Great for larger families with the suite sizes.  Pool are4a convenient, good parking, Security was great.  Breakfast area fills up fast and gets very crowded.  Gift shop available.

My family of 6 went on a much needed last minute Disney Trip earlier this month. Cleanliness & service were really good, esp. the night clerk was very helpful since we arrived late & came back late every night! Location was nice(except parking) staff had helpful maps showing fast, convenient ways to parking for the parks! Rooms were nicely decorated, enjoyed having the separate room w/the bunk beds for the kids! Beds/pillows/sheets

Summary Heading: I get chills just thinking about how dirty the rooms were.
Summary: We stayed as a family (5 suites total). The hotel is very close to Disneyland, we walked there daily which was a big plus. The hotel's biggest problem is the cleanliness. In one room there was blue toothpaste around the sink when we first arrived, in another there were hairs in the bed and in the shower and in yet another room I found a large red bug that resembled a cockroach. Also, the Pull out beds are torture, i woke up with back pains. Customer service is standard, nothing to complain about there but nothing to really boast about.

Room was spacious and very comfortable, slept really well! :) We had 2 doubles & a sofabed in a separate room with glass doors, a TV for each room. One leg of a bed collapsed the first night, but it was very late so didn't say anything. The next day we came back to find a whole new bed frame. Breakfast was great... belgian waffles already made (no waiting for the waffle maker), muffins, great donuts, good fruit selection, and much much more, excellent selection and always replenished quickly. It is walking distance from Disneyland if you're ok with a bit longer of a walk. Free parking at the hotel, so it was worth walking and not paying $15 each day to park at Disney. Had dinner at the Cheesecake Factory across the street, really good! Pool & hot tub were decent. Only negative

The hotel was clean and the management was very helpful. We had a two room suite, but it was arranged really weird with a sliding door between the suites that didn't close properly. The room was clean but in need of updating. The location is great though, just hop on a shuttle to Disneyland. We had our 6 year old granddaughter with us. We went back to the room after a morning at the park, took a nap and returned for the evening festivities. It worked out great.

Summary Heading: Horrible! Days inn or a motel will give you better service
Summary: If I could give it a negative rating I would. We paid a high price, and expected better service. We originally paid for a large 2 bedroom suite with a bed in the couch for the kids. But our hotel room was filthy. There was stuff the previous people had left behind the bathtub was filthy, and the floors were sticky. We called the front desk and told them about it, and they were 'suppose' to upgrade our room. Yeah, right.. They gave us a one bed , with bunk beds that were torn, and the room was even smaller! okay, then we went to Disneyland for the day and came back , our room wasn't cleaned or anything. The maid don't clean until 7 pm.. are you kidding me! Even when the maid came to clean she didn't even clean it right and its not like you can ask them for anything. Since none

This hotel had more than we expected. We got 2 spacious 2 room Suites very clean with 2 tvs. The kids enjoyed the bunk beds and the grown ups were happy with their full beds. Slept very confortable, no noise from street. The hotel was full with families and the breakfast area was crowded but what else do you expect from continental breakfast. I really enjoyed their Nescafe dispenser. The swimming pool was small but  my 4 kids enjoyed it. I was happy with the acomodations and the customer service provided by hotel personnel.

Stayed in a 2 room suite with a king bed with Jacuzzi and a pull out sofa-bed.  Great room, clean lots of windows and we walked to Disneyland. Got a great rate on this room $107.00 a night!  Free breakfast had plenty of choices.  The staff was friendly and knowledgeable.  Would definitely stay here again.

I booked this hotel through the La Quinta rewards program, which I have done many times. I was told that a King room / suite was booked for me.  Upon arrival at the property I was told that the only king room available was a smoking room. Awesome. I'm definitely not a smoker. I did not even know that CA allowed this any longer.   I was politely offered a double double room, which would not be so bad except that I am 6'4". I also paid the same price for the double room.   As for the property:  if you are looking for a "budget" $150 / night hotel to cram the kids in so that you will be close to Disney, this might be for you. Last minute business travel, not so much.  Breakfast, not impressive. Better at most other properties.   Rooms are old & beat.  Separation between beds and

The room was great we had like a mini suite (2 beds and a sofa), the area was great, walking distance to Disneyland, had a little souvenir shop, but the breakfast could have had a little more variety to include bacon, sausage, and scrambled eggs, but overall a nice hotel

The suites in this hotel are standard room with a see through divider and a curtain. The breakfast is terrible. I expected better. The only plus is that it is near the park and that has good restaurants near by. If you are looking for a suite, this is NOT the place.

Summary Heading: This was the worst La Quinta that I have ever staid at.
Summary: Generally, I love La Quinta.  Free breakfast and free Wi-Fi makes it for me.  This location, however did not give the room we were promised.  We booked a family suite with 2 queen beds and 2 bunk-beds.  What we were given was a room with one queen bed and 2 bunk-beds.  There simply were not enough beds available to sleep all the members of our family.

We were wary of this hotel due to poor reviews. However, we got an incredible rate on the official La Quinta site, so we decided to take a chance. We stayed a week and were very pleased. The room was big enough for a family. It was in good condition and clean. The bed was comfortable, but the hide- a-bed in the couch was understandably bad. The breakfast area was newly renovated. It was kept clean, and the offerings were simple but very adequate. There was plenty of free parking. The internet was free and reasonably speedy. The staff was friendly and attentive. The hotel is about a 15-minute walk from Disney or you can do a shuttle. I did a thorough search of hotels in the area, and this location has the best combination of rate, services (free parking, free Internet, free

we stayed her a few years ago and came back may 2013, are room was great, pool and spa was fantastic. the breakfest was also good. the staff was very nice and helpful. we will definitly stay here again. we are going back next year!!!!!!!!!

Summary Heading: Needs a little updating but fantastic location
Summary: We had a little mix up with our room type reservation and oughtn't was going to be an issue at first but manager was very nice and fixed what central booking has messed up. I suggest you call the hotel directly when booking to make sure your specific room types booked correctly, manager even suggested this!! We stayed for 5 nights with 6 adults and 3 kids. Kinda disappointed in the breakfast, wished they'd offered scrambled eggs instead up just cold hard boiled eggs every single morning!! Transportation to the park was very convenient!!

We stayed here to attend the Rolling Stones concert and while we were pleased overall, some things were a let down. The walls are super thin and we stayed on the 4th floor near the elevator & gift shop, so at 7am there was no more sleeping & you could hear people talking. The front desk clerk upon even check in (may 18th) was not rude, but it is Disneyland and we thought she would be friendly, helpful, outgoing and was the opposite - she was having a bad day or doesn't like her job. Morning staff much better. Hotel is easy to access from the highway, convenient location, grocery store is a 5 minute drive!  Able to walk to plenty of restaurants & shopping, in the heart of it!  2 miles from Honda Ctr, cab was $12 and we walked back (safety was not an issue at 11:30pm) - Angles

This is the second time staying at this hotel.  The location is unbeatable.  Just a short walk to Disneyland, but also has bus service right at the hotel if you are not in to walking.  The staff is unbelievably helpful.  I had a problem with the closet door and by the time I got home that evening it was fixed and always cheerful.  They bent over backwards to be helpful and meet my needs.  Breakfast was well served with a nice variety.  Beds comfortable.  The heated pool was actually heated to a comfortable degree. I It is great that it is pet friendly. The hotel is older and not new and fancy, but it sure met my needs.  My only criticism is that the carpets were not clean and smelling nice.

The rooms were very clean.  The staff very helpful and friendly.  The pool was perfect for the kids.  The free breakfast was good and appreciated.  The only complaint I would have would be there were a lot of dogs staying at the hotel.  Every time you walked down the hall, the dogs would bark.  Leave the animals at home.

My family and I stayed here on a recent trip to Disneyland.  We were upgraded to a room with bunkbeds for the kids and they absolutley loved it.  Our room was clean and comfortable.  The breakfast had cereal ,premade waffles, toast, bagels, oatmeal.  We would defintley stay here again.

Smoker beware. this hotel only has one smoking room and it is noisy! Placed right above the pool and sandwiched between an exit door, the maid and laundry facilities and the elevator. Little sleep was had. However its a great value depending on the time of year and close to the disney parks.

This was my second stay with this property. The 2 bedroom/2 bath  family suites are perfect for families.....each with their own television and free Wi-Fi.  Ask for a suite on the top floor to avoid the noise from above. We had loud "jumping" sounds late at night as we could only get a room on the 4th floor but with one phone call to the front desk this problem was handled with politeness and professionalism. This property is located a short 15 minute walk from Disneyland's gates.  Plenty of food establishments within easy walking distance and in the room is a list with menus of establishments that deliver.....and quickly too!  Everything was very enjoyable from the small gift shop (get your sodas there instead of the vending machine) to the breakfast to pool to the front desk.

Our stay was absolutely wonderful!!! The hotel is not the fanciest one you could find and there are a few aspects that could be updated BUT the hotel was very clean, quiet and the staff was friendly! We could not have asked for a better stay for the amazing price we paid! The breakfast was an added benefit and who can beat complimentary? It was about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland we had 4 kids who didn't complain once! We will stay here again! Thanks La Quinta!!

Summary Heading: Worst La Quinta I have ever stayed at
Summary: Our 1st room had a horrible, nauseating smell that made us all have headaches and felt ill.  We were told it was due to them 'redoing' the showers on our floor.  We were moved to a 2nd room...where we had BED BUGS! GROSS!!! I think the smell was not from re-doing the showers, but from bug spray!!  We were moved to a 3rd room, right next to the breakfast area and elevator where it was very noisy.  The hotel was very dirty, the pool area never had enough towels, the breakfast was not replenished and food was barely tolerable.  The hotel staff was not very friendly or helpful either.  We will NEVER stay here again.

We were in the area and happen to need a hotel just for the night. Looked at different hotels in the area and settle on La Quinta Anaheim. Quick check in and check out the breakfast in the morning wasn't bad either plus it was a great deal for one night.

After reading reviews our accommodation expectations were low.  However, the day before our arrival we requested a refurbished room and got one. We stayed in double bed two room suite.  Nice sized rooms. New carpet, new bathroom fixtures, good shower, comfortable double beds. Grandkids slept on the hide-a-bed which was thin but they did not complain.  Breakfast was convenient and staff kept it well stocked and cleaned up quick.  We found it cheaper to take our own car to Disneyland than paying the fee for each of us to ride the shuttle.  We could see Disneyland fireworks from our room. It was odd to have the sink in the bedroom and needed another mirror.  Overall good stay and affordable.  I would stay here again.

First off i checked in to the hotel and got misleading information regarding parking,which costed us 30.00 and lost time from Disneyland. Second was condition of room, which was unacceptable. The vents we're broken in the bathroom which when on it blew out dust and dirt. The walls in kids room were dirty with writing underneath bunk beds. The TV remotes needed batteries, which we could not use. I think this place only focuses on their free breakfast and not keeping up the condition of room. Very unhappy.

I have stayed at this LaQuinta several times, but not for about four to five years.  It's way past time to update.  If I could I would give it 2.5 stars.  What I like.  The king suite with bunk beds.  Perfect amount of bedding for my family of five. The bottom bunk being a double bed. Two TV's one for each room.  The space both rooms had. Breakfast is adequate. Staff was friendly enough, though admittedly we didn't have much interaction with them.  Towels and sheets seemed clean and smelled clean. The king bed, for us, was SUPER comfortable.  I wish I knew what kind of mattress it was, I'd go out and buy one. TV was new and nice and they had a good choice of channels.   What I didn't like.  The shower was scary gross.  There were so many pits, scrapes, scratches, different

We are repeat customers to the La Quinta Santa Ana.  While the Anaheim La Quinta does not have the same 'charm', it is more convenient in terms of being walking distance to Disneyland.  There is a free parking garage, king suite room w/ sleeper sofa a plus, and price was reasonable.  The morning breakfast is quite busy with folks trying to get to Disneyland at opening time, but hotel staff worked hard to keep food options available and ready for fast turn around.  Only areas of improvement noted:  could offer free shuttle to the park rather than paid public transit that picks up in parking lot BEHIND the hotel, could rearrange breakfast layout to maximize traffic flow, and could add blanket/pillow to the rooms that have sleeper sofa.  Overall, highly recommend and would gladly

Summary Heading: This was the worst experience in a hotel, that I ever had.
Summary: Dirty uncomfortable .Deceptive "suite" description on line. Small and dirty rooms. Run down facilities Mattress on couch was skin and bones, coils covered by a cloth.Noisy all night long. We left the next morning and cancelled our remaining 3 nights. RUN from this place

We stayed at LaQuinta for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland.  We booked it based on price and proximity but started to have second thoughts after reading some less-than-stellar reviews.  But by that time other options were either booked or much more expensive so we went ahead with our plans.  I was pleasantly surprised and all worked out fine.  When we were there the hotel was quiet and we all slept well.  It seemed fairly clean as well.  The front desk staff was nice, helpful.  And the walk to the park was very do-able.  We were traveling with teenagers.  It might be a long walk for small children at the end of the day.  (There is a shuttle available for $3/person one way if you choose that instead.)  Some reviewers mentioned parking problems but we had none.  The pool didn't

The staff at this La Quinta are very friendly and helpful. The location is close to Disneyland. Other than that this hotel was very disappointing. It is very run down and yet still expensive. The one room suite that we had booked was designed very poorly. The bathroom was near the entry with the sink outside of the toilet shower area. The room with the king size bed therefore had the bathroom sink in it. The sitting area with the pull out couch was divided from the king size bed area by a sliding door that was widowed and had a sheer curtain. So there wasn't any privacy between rooms. The sliding door also was also broken and very difficult to slide open or shut.  The dumpster for the hotel is right next to the lobby and elevator. You could see the trash. Including old furniture

This is an ok hotel.  We chose for our trip to Disneyland for three main reasons:  1) Price (~100/night) 2) free breakfast in the morning 3) proximity to Disneyland.  The breakfast is the morning was fine:  usual cereal, breads, coffee, and juices.  They also had waffles.    As far as the distance to disneyland, it looks closer on the map that it actually is.  It is right on the border of being walkable:  about 20 min walk which is fine in the morning but was too long on the way back after walking in the park all day.  There is an ART shuttle which has a stop at the hotel but I think, if you are ok with the walk in the morning, a cab at night might be the best option:  no waiting for the shuttle or driving around to other hotels.  The room itself was ok.  We got a jr suite type

the room was bigger then we could have ever expected.  The buffet breakfast wasn't THE best but not THE worst either.  The gift shop was little but unique stuff in so that was fun.  Parking was tight but we parked.  I say "if you can book this for a vacation..do it!!!

Summary Heading: Awesome hotel! I love the bunkbed suite!
Summary: Check-in staff was quick & friendly. Room was clean and spacious with comfy beds. I love the separate room with the bunk beds, a small table, and a TV. The sliding door between the adult room and the kid room is fabulous! The room was kept clean and they gave us plenty of towels. The pool was nice. The breakfast was good, there was bagels, donuts, hard boiled eggs, waffles, cereal, yogurt, oatmeal, and fruit juice. The location is a short walk to Disneyland. Overall, a great experience!

Summary Heading: Its a roof and a bed but dont go here with expectations
Summary: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights while visiting disney.  Its location wasnt bad... maybe a 10 minute walk to the gate and within walking distance of restaraunts.  Check in and Check out was quick.    The noise in the hotel was terrible.  I think I could even hear the guests in the hotel next door.  This room slept 7 which was nice, but the toliet clogged constantly, no matter how little paper was used.  Really tough for 7 people, especially when the restroon in the hall is also locked.  Maintenance was fairly attentative to plunge it but it was a nuiance to call pretty much everytime the bathroom was used.  Breakfast was ok... the food was average but ran out quickly and usually tables were in need of cleaning.  The condition of the room was shabby and looked as if it needed a

The room was great and very clean . Close enough to the park to walk although we chose to take the shuttle because my wife can not walk well. I believe the breakfast could be a lot better. Only waffles and doughnuts. I have stayed at other cheaper hotels and they had bacon, sausage and eggs available. Otherwise a great place to stay.

We traveled with five; two adults and three kids between 6-13 and loved our stay! The room was clean, spacious. We had two tvs which was great so the kids could watch their shows and us adults could watch ours. The breakfast was the best we've had. Even with it being packed because of spring break the staff worked very hard to keep the food stalked and the room clean and smiled while doing it. Even when my in-laws came down the front office was kind enough to give us an extra parking pass for them. All in all for our next visit to Disneyland we will be staying there again! We loved our stay!!!

Spent 4 nts Mar 11-15 2013 in a family suite (542). Room was nice and comfortable. Two separate bedrooms w/baths, 1 Kingsize and 2 full size beds plus a sofa sleeper in the living room. Hotel had roofing contractor show up on our first full day with no notice to guests. Took up half the front parking lot (where my car was parked). Got a call while I was in Disneyland to come move it. They couldn't have let me know when I checked in the day before? Smell from the roofing was awful. Breakfast area was extremely crowded. Doubt I'll be coming back. Lots of other choices for comparable rates.

This hotel is close to Disneyland and you can walk there to avoid Disneyland parking lot fees. While some hotels in the area charge for parking, it's free here.  This hotel provides a nice breakfest room. The breakfest is free, and the lady taking care of it while we were there was top notch! She kept the tables and floors clean, kept it stocked with food, and made sure people had what they needed. (Take note mangement, she is a keeper and deserves a raise and a pat on the back!)  Our suite was nice; plenty of room, clean towels, clean sheets, and good room service. You will like having the separate room you can close off so the kids can rest while you stay up a bit longer talking about the day and making plans for the next days events.  Some folks in the next room had some

Summary Heading: Really old facility but good location and staff
Summary: This hotel has a great location, but is so run-down that it's depressing. It's just old and funky and badly in need of a re-do. When I arrived, the elevator was broken and the first room they gave me had a broken air conditioner. The staff was very nice and promptly assigned a new room, but they can only do so much with the old facility.  The location is terrific, though. It's right next door to Garden Walk with several great restaurants. The price is reasonable for Anaheim. The staff is very helpful.

Summary Heading: La Quinta, is now our family hotel only.
Summary: Customer service is always polite,quick and very helpful in checking to make sure you are a satisfied customer and will do what they must to make your stay a comfortable one.  Rooms are always very clean, beds are very comfortable, plenty of room. Morning breakfast is good and even though they have a sign that tells you what time breakfast starts and finish......I find they keep it open a little longer for those of us who might have slept in!  I indorse this chain of hotels.

So I just got back from my trip to Disneyland and stayed at this hotel 3 days.  I chose this place mainly for the fact that I could bring my small dog with meat no extra cost.  and they accept pets. I wasn't told this ahead of time, but when you check in they have you sign a paper saying that they have the right to kick you out of the hotel if the animal becomes a problem. Just a heads up for anyone bringing a pet.   The hotel must have been there quite a while because it was dated, as in the carpet in the room was orange and worn and was dirty at the entrance to the bathroom.    The Tv was flat screen and there were 2 of them (A plus), the fold out couch in the extra room was cheap as in not well made, so I imagine to sleep on it would be uncomfortable.  There ads boost of a

Rude staff which did not care about my necessities. Jacuzzi was cold and was NOT "in door" more like "under roof with no walls". All towels were dirty and we had to wait a long time to recieve them or walk through the freezing atmosphere to ask the, rude, receptionist for some damn towels. The bedroom door was broken so it wouldn't close or open properly. The maintenance was nice but DEFINATELY not the people in the front desk. They have no regard and did nothing to make us comfortable. $200 a night is not worth it for this hotel.

I was so pleased with this hotel.  I loved the comfortable beds, the fact we could bring our dog, the cleanliness of the room, the free breakfast and the location.  Only thing I didn't like was having to pay $5 per person to shuttle to Disneyland each day we went.  The continental breakfast was more then "continental" it had a lot of variety and had HOT waffles!  I really would recommend this place for the family.  The price was a little bit higher then a few other hotels in the area, but well worth it.  We will be back!

Highly recommend!!! Great stay. Close to Disney and will stay there again next time we visit. Thank you so much.!! The service was great and the rooms were clean. My family and I were very satisfied with the stay.

Summary Heading: Paper thin walls and domestic violence fights outside our room?!
Summary: First, central reservations assured me that the room I was booking would have two beds, a pull out couch, and a set of bunk beds. I asked and tripled checked before finalizing my reservations that all the above would be in our room and the gentleman reassured and confirmed that yes all the above would be in our room I was booking. I am thankful I called prior to arriving to make sure our room was ready an confirm sleeping arrangements. I was told there was not a pull out sofa in our room.
