So I had to book a second room to accommodate my large military family. However, la quinta agreed to wave most of the cost for the second room and for that I am very grateful!   Secondly, the walls are very thin in this hotel. You can hear everything! I just spent the night at a hotel traveling

Rooms are very clean, spacious and comfortable. For families kids they offer "family rooms" which have a bedroom with bunkbeds for the kids! Great for privacy of adults.. love it! Walking distance to front entrance of Disneyland also.. great place to stay.

This is a nice little hotel, great price and within walking distance to Disneyland.  Hotel is pet friendly so if you don't like dogs would not recommend this place.   Room did have a slight smell, but I always bring air freshener with me and that cleared it right up.  Comfortably slept 7 in a suite for less than $350 for 4 nights.    Parking is free, but limited and breakfast is even more limitied, carb overload.  Better hotel that I have stayed at for this price, and with the price of Disneyland for 7 you take your savings where you can get them and this one is a great one.  Stay here every year.

Stayed in a King Suite. There was a lot of room. Sink was outside the bathroom, which I didn't care for. They do allow all dogs sight unseen. I brought my small well-behaved dog and her crate. I'm incredibly grossed out by photos posted of large dogs on the hotel's bedding--how can anyone be so self-absorbed and inconsiderate?? Anyway found staff to be really apathetic and unorganized. Wouldn't allow me to check in an hour early, and wouldn't call me to let me know when my room was ready. When I returned an hour later she assigned me a room on the 4th floor, I aked her "You want my dog to stay on the 4th floor?" She immediately changed to a room on the second. When I lugged my substantial dog crate to this 2nd floor room, there were 2 people inside cleaning it, insisting that I

Second trip to this hotel - they accept BIG dogs, no questions asked.  Ours is very well behaved and sleeps a lot but hadn't been able to find many hotels which would take dogs, and then they were limited to 10 lbs.  I've seen cats bigger than that.  It is super close to Disney and you could probably walk it if adventureous although there are shuttles zipping up and down the street all day which I think run about $10.  Enjoyed the complimentary breakfast 2 of the 3 days I stayed.  Hard boiled eggs, mini waffles, all kinds of bagels and breads, oatmeal with raisin and brown sugar, juices, coffee, cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit.  Pretty much everything the Embassy offers with the exception of scrambled eggs or made-to-order omelets but at a significantly reduced price.

Took the family to Disneyland - stayed at the Anaheim La Quinta in a three bedroom, two bath suite.  Hotel is 2 blocks from the main Disney gates (we walked every day). Rooms are good, Beds are comfortable. The only complaint I had was that the carpets could have been cleaner they are run down.  The breakfast was a traditional La Quinta breakfast except that the waffles were pre-cooked and in a warming tray. They were fresh but it wasnt quite the same. The hotel is full of young families and excited kids. This is good or bad depending on what you are looking for.   Overall this is a good inexpensive Disneyland hotel, we would definitely return.

Summary Heading: Amazing location, free parking, free breakfast, friendly staff
Summary: My husband, son and I stayed here while visiting area theme parks.  We would definitely stay here again!  The location is amazing - directly across the street from the mall with great restaurants including Cheesecake Factory and Bubba Gump's.  You could walk to Disney to avoid parking fees and the long waits in the parking lines.    The hotel has free parking and a free breakfast.  Breakfast isn't amazing, but... it's free.  They have several cerals, bread, muffins, bagels, oatmeal, juice, milk, coffee, hot chocolate, hard boiled eggs, small belgian waffles with syrup.  They keep the breakfast area well stocked and clean.  The hotel staff was very friendly and I even was able to use the computer in the lobby to print something out at no charge.    Upon check-in, they asked how

Summary Heading: If you want to get a good nights sleep DON'T stay here
Summary: They didn't have enough pillows our first night, the pull out couch was terrible. You could hear everyone who was walking overhead and on either side of you.  Each morning we were awakened by the cleaning staff  outside our door at the linen room laugh and talk about what they had done the day before and if you came into to late you most likely would not find a parking spot that you had payed for.  They were inconsistent with towels sometime you got three face cloths sometimes you got none!!

Summary Heading: a little run down, but perfect for us.
Summary: We have a family of five, which makes it difficult to find a hotel with enough space to accommodate all of us, as most standard hotel rooms are set up for four.  There are not very many hotels around Disneyland that are spacious enough for 5 (my children are all older by the way, and we are far beyond the years where we could tuck all three into one bed, or put one in a crib.) doesn't kill you with the price, and is close enough to Disneyland so that you aren't exhausted from the walk getting there. When we are looking for a Disneyland hotel, we are not looking for posh, expensive.  We are looking for inexpensive, comfortably will sleep five (bonus if it has an extra room and tv!), and free breakfast is a MUST.  (other things I look for are free internet, and a work out room).

Wonderful staff, very friendly. Room was immaculate and beds were very comfortable.  Wonderful shower.  The breakfast could have more hot things that I have seen at other La Quintas such as scrambled eggs and bacon but overall it was good, nice way to start off before a long day at Disneyland.  Love the shuttles that run to Disney every 20 minutes.  I will definitely stay again.

Stayed during the new years weekend in a suite room no 419. yes the walls are thin we can hear the running water from the bathroom behind the king's bedroom.  The room above us the people there were awake almost until midnight and you can hear footsteps and kids running all the time.  Breakfast is the same nothing to brag about but enough to satisfy your need in the morning.  Parking is of no issue to us since we can find a spot even late at night and besides I don't feel it is quite a distance with the elevator.  I do agree that the carpets are really dirty but not much you can do since the traffic is heavy especially if its raining all the time and the activity from the pool area.  Our room is clean and bathroom as well.  although I recommend they need to clean the vent in the

Dump!! Gross bathrooms/carpets. Pull out bed on the couch has broken springs and you get no blankets or pillows.  Just a sheet set.  The elevator is no where near the parking lot and since animals are allowed, there is hauling and barking to wake you.  Walls are thin enough to not only hear your room's bathroom activities but your neighbor's as well.  Gross!!! did not stay here by choice (our hotel had a fire) and would never ever, in the most desperate of situations return.

I have stayed in better La Quintas before. The carpets were dirty. The breakfast was nothing special. They don't offer the fresh fruit water like other La Quintas do. This La Quinta is not worth full price, try and find a discounted rate. Parking is free but they charge you for a "hotel upkeep" fee on top of the room price and taxes, which I don't see where that money is going to... It is a good location though, right next too restaurants, a movie theater, and down the street from Disney.

The staff was very nice. The carpets and bathroom were filthy and smelled bad. The walls were thin and there was a space under the door to the hallway. I could also hear the people above us walking around. The breakfast they served was pretty good.

Took the family to Disneyland - stayed at the Anaheim La Quinta for 5 nights.  Hotel is 2 blocks from the main Disney gates (we walked every day).  Rooms are good, Beds are comfortable and the jacuzzi room we had was overall very good. The only complaint I had was that the carpets could have been cleaner.  We had a toddler with us and her socks were solid evidence of that.    The breakfast was a traditional La Quinta breakfast except that the waffles were pre-cooked and in a warming tray.  They were fresh but it wasnt quite the same.  The hotel is full of young families and excited kids.  This is good or bad depending on what you are looking for.  We had 3 kids with us so it fit right in with our expectations.  Overall this is a good inexpensive Disneyland hotel.

We keep coming back for the familiarity of the Hotel. We know what to expect, and that is comforting. The breakfast, basic but great. Rooms, always roomy and comfortable. Staff, the best! It's close to everything we need or want to go. There are always some things that we discover that are just a little quirky, but expected because its the Anaheim LaQuinta. We will keep going back, unless things were to make a big change.

Summary Heading: One of the best deals on the block
Summary: During the past few weeks I have stayed in three hotels located in the block surrounded by Katella/Anaheim Blvd/Clementine/Disney Way.  The La Quinta is one of the better deals on the block.  I found the facility to be well maintained and overall, other than a few quirks, an excellent choice.  My first stay was in a king suite.  I liked the sliding French door dividing the sleeping room and the living/office area.  An excellent work desk and chair.  The one issue here is that there is only one phone in the room, located next to the bed.  There was a phone jack in the office area, but it was inoperative.  Room was quiet and bed was excellent.  Most hotels, including the La Quinta have gone to the duvet (quilt) type bedding.  I dislike it as it is both hot and heavy, especially

I liked the price at this hotel and normally have a very good experience at LQ. Checked into my room 215 on 11/26 and found the couch cushion ripped beyond repair and two of the most stained chairs I have ever experienced in my life. I would not sit down on them. Housekeeping must be blind not to see this before approving room for quests. Front desk was very nice and switched me to room 217 on same floor and it was much nicer until I stepped in a wet floor near fold out couch. Won't be staying here again!

This hotel was great!  The atmoshpere was really nice.  I was afraid of staying here cos I have read alot of other reviews of cars being broken into, and staff being mean.  But it was really safe.  At least I thought so.  We went for a cocert at the honda center, which was right down the street from the hotel.  We didnt get to disney, but that too was not far from the hotel.  We didnt do the breakfast cos we did get up early enough, so I have no comments on that.  But the room overall was nice!  2 room suite with 2 double beds and a sofa sleeper in the other room, which was great cos my mom and i got dressed in one room , while my grandfather got to enjoy his tv (which he really didnt enjoy for the limited channels).  And the reason I had picked this hotel was because it accepts

We love the value and the location of this Hotel. If you have two families traveling together, the 3 room suite is a great value. There are two bathrooms, two seperate rooms and a livingroom with a sleeper. The beds are comfortable and the employees are great. It is an older remodeled hotel, but very well done. There is an outdoor pool that is covered. Its a great spot. They serve a good breakfast and a money saver if you have a big family. It is close to Disneyland and bonus, its across the street from Cheesecake Factory!! Enjoy

We were very pleased with our stay until we went to check out. There was only one person working behind the desk and a long line. We think the management should anticipate that people would be checking out and have more help. The girl working behind the desk was very calm and very professional.

The hotel had the best employees. Everyone was so nice and helpful. The hotel is close enough to walk to Disney Land. But if you are walking all day you may want to take the bus shuttle that runs all day long and drops you by the back of the hotel. The cost is $5 per person for unlimited rides all day, or $12 for 3 days of unlimited rides. Our room was clean and very comfortable. It is perfect for families as it has glass doors that could separate the living room area from the bedroom area. It had a tv in each area so the kids could watch what they wanted and the adults could watch their show. A microwave and refrigerator make things very convenient. Breakfast was good for a quick start to the day and was always restocked. One think that set this La Quinta ahead of others is

Pricing was good for the location.  Parking is limited so make sure you get there early.  It took them ahwile for my room to be ready.  But the hotel was reasonable close to Disneyland.  Rooms were clean, but had some patching in bathroom and a couple of screw holes in dresser.  Bed was comfortable and room was spacious.

Summary Heading: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
Summary: The Good - Front desk personnel are helpful and friendly. I needed to fax a critical document with my signature for work. The front desk happily took care of this for no charge. Very nice.  The hotel is on an ART route very close to Disneyland. This ART route only has 2 other stops on it, so the trip to the park is quick and painless. THe bed linens are of very high quality and the beds were quite comfortable. Our room had a separate room, separated by a pocket door, with a set of bunk beds. Full on the bottom and twin on top. Also had a kid sized table and four kids chairs. My 6 year old niece loved it. This room also had a small refrigerator and microwave.  The Bad - This hotel bills itself as "pet friendly". Not an issue, unless there are yapping, barking, squealing dogs

The hotel was located in close proximity to vacation destination of Disneyland.  The hotel did the minimum of of outside and public area maintenance. Needs updating. Breakfast bar very minimal. No hot entrees.  Pool and spa area was above average because of the temperature of both. Overall, needs some improvement.

Checked in & went downhill from there. Carpet in hallways was filthy. Hotel's guide said not to use room towels in pool area and to use towels in pool area; none there; went to lobby in bathing suit and they looked at me like I was speaking a foreign language--gave me towels, but no verbal interaction at all. Turned jacuzzi timer on; ten minutes later, still colder than pool. Went to lobby in bathing suit to find out if hidden switch for heat; they said jacuzzi was broken & it would be fixed tomorrow (they couldn't have mentioned this when asked for towels?). Jacuzzi water level was about a foot below top of tile--not enough to cover shoulders. Later that night . . . 2 big TV's in room; 1 wouldn't power on no matter what outlet plugged into; the other's sound was so distorted it

I stayed with my son and grandson.  There was plenty of room and the furniture was ideal for a four year old.  We were a fifteen minute walk from Disneyland.  The service was very good.  The breakfast exceeded our expectations.  The pool was a great way to end a hot day with a four year old.  This is an excellent place for people travelling with children.

We stayed at the La Quinta Hotel in Anaheim near Disneyland.  It was horrible.  The suite was dirty all the time.  The furniture had stains on all over them.  I was afraid to sit on it.  Their were two sinks in the suite and one had so much dirt behind the faucet I didn't want to use it.  The carpet in the hallway was so stained not even a deep shampoo would help it.  It needed to be burned.  There was a dirty pair of socks laying on the floor in the hallway for three days.  There were bandaids on the floor in the hallway for two days.  The formica surface of the furniture in the room was coming loose and missing in some areas.  There were no drawers in the bedroom for clothes, the drawers were boarded over.  In the sitting room the drawers would not open or close because the

Summary Heading: Pleasant Surprise and Great Place to Stay
Summary: At first, we were wary about staying here due to the negative reviews, BUT we were glad NOT to listen to the negative reviews. First of all, if you do not like animals, or do not like dogs, please do NOT bother to leave a negative comment because your comment will just be prejudiced. Yes, this hotel needs some updating, but for the value, it is a good hotel. For 2 nights before we stayed here, we stayed at the Worldmark next door, and that was a headache because Worldmark is not pet friendly and we ended up driving 60miles each way everyday just to check up on our pets. On our second day at Worldmark, we looked out the window and we saw the La Quinta, so we got all excited and stopped by. We immediately booked a stay and drove back home to get our 2 little dogs and checked out

It was hard to gauge this hotel from the reviews as they ranged from wonderful to the Bates Motel but I was happy with our experience. Trip to Disney and was looking for a little more space in the room but still wanted to walk to the parks, this hotel fit those needs just fine. The room was fairly standard without a lot of bells and whistles but had 2 flat screens, coffee maker, microwave, refrigerator which was nice to have. Not lavishly appointed but was clean overall, bathroom was cleaned and room itself felt clean. The hide-a-bed couch in the sitting area would have been essential for a larger group but we never used it. The layout of the room was an issue as you have to navigate through the “bedroom” to get to the sitting area which seemed backwards, we were tripping over

Summary Heading: We always stay here when we visit Disneyland!
Summary: The great: Almost everything. We love the staff, the location is great, the rooms are clean, well-appointed and roomy.  The really good: There is enough parking, but it gets a bit tight. It is what it is and they really can't do anything about it. My recommendation is leave the park before the other guests do!  The good: Breakfast is actually excellent, the food tastes great, it is fresh and the dining room is first class. I put it in the good category only because they need more protein. Scrambled eggs people!  The Okay: We stay here all the time so we know where it is. But the sign is hard to spot. I think it was fine when the place was built, but the palm trees hide it. Basically, when you turn on to Clementine, hit your right blinker immediately and start tapping the brakes.

the price is great...i used my AAA card and room was 114 with taxes...real close to alot of fun things and great steak houses.... rooms were very clean and very big...  .... the breakfast is also good and they kept it well stocked all morning.... Ill  stay again .....

Room was very clean. Had a great room for us and our 2 adult children and girlfriends. We had our own room and adult children shared a double room. Check in was easy. Breakfast was waffles, oatmeal, bagels and yogurt with fruit. Breakfast room staff worked very hard to keep room stocked and clean. Within walking distance to Disneyland.  Was very pleased with room and experience. Price was amazing for 6 adults. Will definitely recommend and will stay again as the room was great and the set up fit us perfectly. Recommend highly.

Summary Heading: GREAT!! got more then what i was expecting.
Summary: Pro:    Room was Great. very large and clean. having a separate room with a desk, TV,table, and couch was extra. was not expecting that at all and was a great thing to have for trip. made room feel more like a mini home away from home.stayed 4 days and was great always. large breakfast room and a gift/everyday shop help for forgotten goods like soap and all that. Location is great. Walking distance from a strip of nice restaurants to eat at and parking for Disneyland. Just a small walk away from a shuttle or a shorter drive to a garage where the shuttle is at. Great service at desk and helps quick. needed room for extra day and easily was able to extend out with no hassle. Beds were great. 3 covers soft mattress and alot pillows. all fresh and cleaned and smelled great. was

This hotel is pet friendly and there are no rooms that are non-pet rooms.  We were not informed of this prior to booking and I am allergic to cats and dogs.  My husband first asked for a non-pet room (which they didn't have) then, we asked for new clean blankets so help.  The blankets never came.  It was a sleepless night for me, which is not fun when you are spending the next day at Disneyland.    Truthfully if it hadn't been for my allergies and the lack of response then this wouldn't have been a bad place to stay.  I still give it a poor rating because for me that's what it was.

Hotel just steps from Disneyland attractions! Quiet location off main streets but yet close to everything. Only problem we encountered was pool being closed for chemical testing...no one on staff was able to test we guess because it was closed all 4 days that we were there.

We thought everything was a very good value with the hotel. There were no issues with the room. The only issue we came across was that the pool was not available. With three children it was a big reason for where we chose to stay with what we thought was a covered pool, but it was closed for what looked like a remodel.

So I checked in this past weekend and the girl (Areli I believe) who checked me in was extremely nice, polite, professional, all around amazing.  The room was perfect and I was extremely happy with it.  I attempted to check-out on Monday morning before 5:00 am as I had an early flight, I rang the doorbell, called the hotel, rang the doorbell again, and called the hotel again. for roughly 10 minutes I waited as I either rang the doorbell or called and no one came to help me. I finally got so frustrated I called the reservations number and told them that I was attempting to check out and that I wasnt able to reach anyone. I waited on the line for about 5 minutes when I saw the front desk girl going to answer the phone. She was wiping her eyes as if she had just woken up. I believe

I was only staying for one night on a 2-day visit to the parks.  My requirements included free parking, free internet and free breakfast.  That limits the choices to 12 hotels in the area.  As I would be spending very little time at the hotel, I wanted did not want to pay a lot for a room.  I was pleased to get a king suite for $67.  I arrived after the parks had closed, my check in was quick and the hotel was convenient. As others have said, the carpet in the hallways is well worn and in need of replacement.  My room showed its age, but was very clean, two flat screen TVs, good air conditioning, spacious.    The breakfast area was clean and well stocked with their offerings, which are basic.  Okay for one morning.  For adults, it is not exciting fare, but if you have children,

The service we experienced was awesome. The rooms are very clean and very restfull. Location was in the middle of everything & the amenities awesome I have 2 dogs that are very picky and I can tell they enjoyed there stay... We where there for about 8 days and just awesome I slept better there than in my own bed...If I had to complain about anything it was the coffee needs to get better and you need eggs and bacon for breakfast..

This was our families 2nd time staying here. We loved it so much the first time that we were excited to stay here again. The rooms were clean and well kept while we were there. It is nice to have a real breakfast before heading out for the day. The breakfast area was always clean. My kids loved the waffels and other choices. We will be coming back again!

I was able to check in early at no cost since there was availability. I also received a free upgrade! Great customer service. Rooms are clean and spacious. Beds and pillows are super comfortable. The gift shop is very well stocked, I found everything I needed. I will make it a point to check out the pool during my next visit. Oh, and lets not forget that they offer shuttle service to the Disneyland parks for a super low price.

Summary Heading: Not all bad for the price
Summary: We stayed here four nights in a Suite (2 queen beds and a separate room with a pull-out couch.  The employees were very helpful and we were able to check in very quickly.  The hallways to the room were very warm and had dirty carpeting.  Once in the room, the carpet could have been cleaner but we were able to walk barefoot without our feet looking dirty.  The a/c in the room worked great and the beds were very comfortable.    The bathroom was very clean, but the shower looked like it had been painted and it was peeling off.  The breakfast was ok, but after the second day the same thing just wasn't appetizing.  Some of the stuff just tasted "off", it wasn't bad or spoiled but the juices and cereals just didn't quite taste right.  What you are really interested in is the location,

I will never stay here again, unless its completely remodeled. I even wrote to manager all my complaints. He said he was sorry and hoped i stayed again. We got there an hour early they told me we were early, but our room was ready and we checked in. We had a 3 room suite. ? The master bathroom sink wouldn't drain, they came and fixed it pulled out a disgusting amount of hair , threw it in the toilet, FORGOT TO FLUSH it down, so we came back to that...GROSS! The carpets were so dirty, in our room and hallway. The shower/tub wouldn't drain in the second bathroom, they said they fixed it, it wasn't fixed. We came back from being at disneyland all day to our room door open, i checked it to make sure it was closed , the maintance guys were looking for tools they thought they left  in

I stay at many La Quintas all over the country and this is the worst one I've ever stayed in.  The best part of it was the lobby.  The carpet in the halls and rooms was filthy.  The rooms smelled bad.  The place was full of animals (the room across from ours had 5 dogs).  We had several families from the same area there and one couple had to change rooms due to water leaks.  One couple had to park elsewhere.  This hotel needs a complete makeover!  Even though it was close to Disneyland, won't be staying here again.

This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. The hallway was extremely hot the first night we checked in. That should have told me something but I went into the room anyway. Bad mistake! The air conditioner in the room was weak, the rug was dirty, the mattress and chairs had stains, the walls had holes in them and there was a hole in the screen that my nine year old niece could have stuck her head through. Also, you have to use a key to get on the elevator. The whole time we were there the card never worked. They fixed it on the last day and didn't bother to let anyone know so we had to walk back to the front office. That doesn't seem like a big deal but when you've already walked ten hours around Disneyland ten more steps seems like too much. Overall it was just a really bad

Summary Heading: A clean & reasonable place to stay.
Summary: This hotel is a nice decent hotel. Nothing fancy, but just a decent place. Close to Disneyland main gate. Right across the street from the Garden Walk (which is a huge plus). But if your looking for a decent room at a decent value, this is the place for you.

My mother,  nephews, niece, and I stayed 3 nights at this hotel.  It is in a great location with food and some shopping right across the street.  Hello Cheesecake Factory and other "eats" right within walking distance.  We went to Disneyland which is just down the street.  You could walk the couple of blocks or pay for the parking just down the road so you can use the shuttle...its cheaper than the hotel Shuttle if you have a larger group.  The rooms are very clean and spacious enough for a larger group (6 in ours).  We had one of the split suites that had two VERY comfortable beds, a pull out couch bed, 2 tvs, a sink and mirror outside of the toilet and shower room and a slide door that divided the room if wanted.  The kids enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi.  There is a breakfast

I asked if we could check in early at 11 AM the front desk lady said  no room available yet, so i asked if we could just park and get the Shuttle Bus going to Disneyland and  bought the Shuttle bus fare ticket from her, came back 2nd and 3rd time, no available room yet, was able to get the room after 3 PM Hallway carpet was smelly and filthy.

Due to last minute medical necessity we finally found a vacancy at this Inn.  After taxes and local fees it was around $135 for a semi-decent room.  Bathroom needs remodeling.  Carpet dirty.  Enclosed parking was disgustingly filthy:  Dried milkshake including cup & straw stuck to concrete.  Free breakfast was OK but then again it's, "free."  This facility is near Disneyland.  I think this Inn is typical of the offerings around major attractions / amusement parks so I'm not surprised by lack of cleanliness.  Demand is high so quality suffers.  Won't stay there again.

We were let down at the last minute by our planned accommodation so only found La Quinta by chance. Read some poor reviews, but we were VERY pleased. No problems parking, all staff (front desk to maids) VERY friendly, clean room, comfy bed, nice separate area (and nice to watch TV from a sofa, rather than the usual hotel room bed!). Very impressed. I read one review that complained of worn carpets in the hallways.  Yes, they are a bit. But we didn't sleep in the hallways... Read another review that complained about excitable children. In a hotel that's walking distance from Disneyland... Like I say we were impressed!

This hotel was great!  The front desk was very helpful with all of our questions and requests.  Our room was older looking but clean.  The breakfast was excellent.  Our only issue was that we could hear the people above us walking around their room.  The location was perfect for going to Disneyland.

$$ is good. we stayed in rm#542, 2 queen bed and 1 king bed, 2 bathroom and living room. it was a corner room. the floor is trembling fr the AC and you just get use to it. pool area is small, crowded and dirty. smoking area next to the pool is not a good idea. the smoking air blows to the enclosed pool area. breakfast is good.

The hotel was nice and a more reasonable rate than others in the area.  Parking there is terrible and they don't have enough spaces for their guests.  When parking runs out, guests have to park in the parking garage at the shopping center across the street.  The parking garage is located quite a distance from the hotel and is quite a walk back.  They didn't offer a shuttle service back to the hotel.  People with problems walking should not stay in this hotel, just in case they run out of parking.  We saw many irate customers over this issue.

Summary Heading: Nice rooms & location but too noisy
Summary: It was close to Disneyland but I wouldn't say close enough to walk, especially after a long day at the Parks. Our room was nice and comfortable. The girls loved the bunk beds and we liked the extra TV. The pool is small and was crowded. The free breakfast was good but didn't have many healthy choices. The breakfast room was way too small for the number of guests trying to use it. Many guests just took the food back to their rooms. Customer service was good. We always had enough clean towels and fresh linens. The front desk clerk was very helpful with info about the Disney shuttle and parks. Overall our stay was pleasant, just don't get a room near the pool. It was way too noisy!

We booked this hotel because we were travelling with a group and this was the cheapest suite we could find: big mistake.  The first problem was the parking - there aren't enough spots so we had to park a few blocks away and pay for parking.  Yes, the hotel reimburses you, but that was not a fun surprise to find at 11:30 at night after spending all day in Disneyland.  We could also hear everything in the hotel - cars driving on the road, honking in the parking lot, our hotel neighbors talking and showering, the baby down the hall crying... You expect some noise in a hotel, but these walls were even thinner than normal.  The cleanliness of the room was also lacking.  There was a hole in the wall, the bathroom was growing mold, the blanket was old and worn out (and had other

Summary Heading: It was last minute so you get what you get...
Summary: This was a last minute booking done through Hotwire so we can't really complain.  We wanted something that was within walking distance to the Disney parks so we could come and go during the day.  If you are walking it is about a 20-25 minute walk. There is also an ART shuttle ($4 per day unlimited rides) that picks up about every 20 minutes in the parking lot of the next hotel over --this turned out to be very convenient.  It drops you off at the entrance to the parks. The Anaheim Garden Walk is right across the street from the hotel  with several restaurants to choose from if you don't want to eat in the Disney area.  Despite the fact that everything in the room looked old -- very well worn carpet, drapes, furniture, and fixtures the room was clean.  The walls are thin so you

4 children means two rooms or large room.  Best value for large room available.  Slept well (good mattress), clean, breakfast!, walkable to DLR, even saw fireworks from our room.  Only downer was the pool is not well lit, is outside underneath the building on ground level and not enclosed.  I ended up with smoke from someone(s) drifting into the pool area.  But we weren't there to swim were we?

Summary Heading: Being a Gold Member meant nothing
Summary: We arrived after 6 pm and our room was not ready.  Had to wait behind walk-ins before even being acknowledged.  Then when came back down to office, we were belated given a welcome gift for 2.  There were 4 adults checking in.  The rooms are backwards, meaning the living area is furthest from door.  Made no sense at all.  We were on the gift shop level.  The worker kept opening the stair doors for the air, thus letting the cigarette smoke and smell completely envelope our room.  Plus, in doing this, any person off the street could enter the hotel.  Say what?  Our secondary desk worker was very nice.  Also the breakfast helpers were nice too.
The late night front desk girls where AWESOME and VERY HELPFUL!   I LOVED the oatmeal that was part of the breakfast. Nice, big breakfast room.  I will be staying here again (possible soon).

Yes you can find hotels that are more modern and look better on the inside. You won't find one that is a better value or has such great service. We gave used this hotel 4 times now and we just love it. It is close to the park. The family suite we always get is huge. They always take care of us and work hard to make sure we are happy. A month before this trip we heard the pool heater was not working. We called a few days before and they checked the actual temp in the pool for us and called us back the tell us what it was. They go beyond what they have to, to give great service. The only bad thing is you can only park one vehicle during the busy season. However they had us park the second car across the street and they are going to reemburse us for that cost. We love this place.

The hotel is in a great location and looks great outside but is a great disappointment inside.  The carpets are filthy.  The rooms and halls smell bad.  Needs more parking.  Would be best to look for another hotel.  If we could've found another hotel, we would've moved.
Our stay at La Quinta was great.  Breakfast was free!  Parking was free!  Staff was friendly and helpful!  Room was clean.

Summary Heading: Anaheim/Disneyland La Quinta is always our first choice!
Summary: Great value so you have more to spend at the parks.  An impresssive continental breakfast gets your day off to a good and quick start.  The walk is certainly doable and saves the hassle of parking at Disneyland.  Having the extra (suite) room is very handy as it makes the room more spacious.  Rooms are clean and quiet.

Summary Heading: like staying at a family members house
Summary: We stood here last minute and it was the only hotel with a room available.  The staff was awesome and provided us with complimentary tooth brushes and other toiletries to help make us comfortable for the night.  This was a huge plus since it was after midnight and almost impossible to find a drug store open.  The hotel could use some remodeling but it was clean and comfortable.  I didn't like that the parking spaces were tight and limited and the hallways are dim.  My son said that it reminded him of Disney's Tower of Terror.  LOL...The continental breakfast was decent enough with thick waffles and warm syrup, oatmeal and pastries.  It kept us satisfied until lunch.  The place is in need of a good updating but not bad for space, location,comfort and price.

We booked this hotel because of the kids suite. We arrived at the specified check in time and were told that the 5th floor kids suite (I also read reviews and was told this was the best location) was not cleaned yet...but there was one available on the 2nd floor.  Since we were using the room to sleep and shower, I didn't think a little noise would bother us...boy was I wrong! We were two doors from the breakfast area and there is nothing like being awakened by the smell of burnt toast!  We stay late at the park and sleeping in till 7am would have been nice...but hoardes of people wanting boiled eggs, stale donuts and bagels, dried cereal and waffles desended to that room like it was their last meal!  I met the maintenance man who said he was there to check the room, and when I

This is a comfortable hotel and very close to disney too!  When the toilet got plugged up it was fixed within five minutes of our call.  We arrived early and were allowed to check in early no problem.  Front desk staff was great too!  You can see the disney fireworks if your room is facing the right way too!  All rooms enter from the inside and you need a room key to even get on the elevator or in the stairwell so it felt very safe.  The only downside was the breakfast, if you are ok with just cereal, toast, hard boiled eggs, muffins, and soggy waffles then youll be ok.  I wanted some eggs and bacon or a wafflemaker, but that said i wouldnt let the breakfast stop me from staying here again because it was a nice hotel overall.

I have stayed a plenty of La Quinta Inn's and this has been the worst hotel ever. The rooms where very down graded and the elevator smelled horribly. I will not stay here again and will not recommend to anyone.

Loved are 4 night stay, will stay again. Only problem was that are phone in the room did not work but we have cell phones, and the walls are really thin. Kids running up and down the hall, probably from all the excitement from Disneyland.

I generally like to stay at La Quinta hotels because they are pet friendly and generally are pretty clean.   However, upon arrival I was sorely disappointed!  Old and outdated, dirty floors that I didn't feel comfortable walking around without shoes on.  Even the bedding was old and the bed was uncomfortable.  Bathroom was not acceptable.  The walls of the place seemed as if they hadn't been painted in years.   We tried to go to the pool and the water was like ice, and so when we tried to get in the hot tub the foam was covered in brown grime and smelled almost fishy.  I did put my feet and legs in to warm up and when I got out my skin smelled horrible.  Don't think that is up to cleanliness code. I would give this place a 1/2 star out of 5 stars, if even that much, and I warn
Hotel was good for the money.  Quiet, they take pets, close to Disney and staff was very nice. Breakfat was good and very fresh.

If all you need is a good night sleep near Disneyland, then this was a good value.  The staff also was very nice.  However, it was not as nice overall as other places we have stayed in the area.  All rooms open to interior hallways which were dark, with worn carpets, and not super clean.  The rooms were renovated when LQ took over about three years ago, but the quality is just not quite there.  The "free" breakfast is in a nice location, and on par for LQ...which I think is pretty poor.  I don't think we would stay here again.  There are other "budget" options in the area that are nicer overall.

This was my second time staying at this particular hotel and both times were enjoyable. The rates are very reasonable and the hotel staff was very friendly. The room was clean with a good shower and a comfortable bed which is all I really ask for when traveling. The complimentary breakfast was convenient and had just enough variety. The best thing about this hotel for me was the location. It's just a few blocks from the Honda Center and Angel Stadium and a one minute walk from a number of different restaurants. If your going to Disneyland it is located just around the corner from the Disney parking lot, less than a mile from the park entrance and right near a bus stop (the shuttle goes to the park and comes every 20 min. or so). Overall, I have been really pleased with this

Hi, we have stayed here once before and had a much nicer room. The only complaints would be the door handle was broken and had to be jimmy'd with and the elevator had tile around it which was right outside our room and the noise was immense. The particular room we had wasn't as nice as the other one but the bed was pretty good and clean and bathroom was clean.

All in all it was a good stay.  Only main complaint is that they didn't put enough towels in our room for the 5 people that were in he room.  Only 4 bath towels, 2 hand towels and 2 washcloths.  Went to front desk and they were very nice about it and gave us what we needed.  Would have thought that they would have filled room with proper amout the next day but still same amount.

Our family stayed at this hotel for 4 nights.  We loved having a seperate space for the kids.  They could go to sleep earlier and then when they were up they could watch TV.  It helped keep the travel stress down having some space for adults and kids.  There were some minor maintenance issues we noticed.  Also if you like your mattress soft it was great, but I felt sea sick everytime my husband turned over!  Hot water got a bit sparce when everyone was getting ready in the mornings.  Couldn't use the iron as someone had used it with something that left a coating that was sticky and gross.  We used the ART shuttle to Disney and it seemed to run slower than its schedule stated. Otherwise, great location for dining, tons of great food all around.  Call early before 5 if you need
bed was comfortable room looked old but for last minute trip it was ok for the staff was awsome and very helpfull
just needed a place to sleep.  The suite was huge and met all of our needs.  Easy walk to Disneyland and on the shuttle route. Would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Overnight stay to see a concert at Honda Center
Summary: Nice hotel for the price.  Breakfast free, but limited.  Noisy in the morning with families going to Disneyland, but otherwise very nice.  Very quiet at night.  We would stay again for sure.

We left for Disneyland and I forgot my iPhone in the room. When we got back at midnight it was still there. Jesus was the housekeeping that day and I was so happy I gave him money to thank him. I thought I dropped my phone at the Disney parking not knowing I left it in the room.

Summary Heading: A different hotel will be a better option.
Summary: My opinion/comments about the property and it should come as no shock or surprise but the property is in need of either a deep cleaning, renovation, or both.   The carpet in the guest hallways and the guest rooms is dirty  and shows signs of excessive wear and tear and filth.    The lighting in the hallway either needs new light bulbs or to be tightened since they flicker making the hallway look like the Bates Motel.  The guest sleeping rooms show signs of excessive use and wear.  There is major scaring on the walls, burn holes in the floor, and the blanket had a burn hole as well.  When the sheets were changed on the 2nd day they did not change the blanket, it was just moved to the opposite side as I was able to track the burn in the blanket.  The bathroom wall by the tub

The location in relation to Disney was good, the hotel was clean enough, everything worked.  We had a suite and it was pretty good.  The pool and hot tub were decent and really warm.  The place could use some minor maintenance here and there.  I found the beds to be creaky and when one of us moved, the other person would move a lot.

Our Travel Agent recommended this hotel for us as my husband and myself were traveling with 3 teenagers.  We were told that we'd have a separate room for Mom & Dad and a room with bunk beds for 2 of the kids and a pull out couch for the third kid.  Guess what?  The hotel doesn't even have a room that fits the criteria.  We walked into our assigned room and panic set in really fast.  The room itself was older, many defects, the bunk beds broken and no place for 3rd kid to sleep.  We were expecting a suite like we get at others hotels and this was just 2 rooms with a glass siding door (broken) between the rooms.  No privacy or rest for adults as the bathroom with the non functioning toilet was in the parents section.  The large spider crawling across the bed also did not add to
the room smelled of cat and there was actual cat poop under the kids bunkbed.  i would have thought maybe they would give us a free night, but no.  stay away from this hotel.
I stayed with two kids for 7 nights, only one day of cleaning. I had to pick up fresh towels, fill up toilet papers, empty trash everyday.

This very affordable hotel is within walking distance to Disneyland and set up to comfortably accommodate families. Our party included three adults and we selected a suite that included two beds and a fold out sofa. The beds were comfortable, but the sofa bed was unusable. The first night was spent with two adults in a double bed listening to other guests making banging noises in adjoining rooms until three in the morning. The second night we were moved to another room with better sleeping arrangements and less noise. Staff was friendly, breakfast food was good, coffee was not. The older facility could use some sprucing up.

Parking (free) "appears" to be tight but we were able to find a spot every night without difficulty, although if you have the option of bringing a smaller vehicle it would probably help on the lower level parking. Interior hallways which is nice, free WI-FI, and towels stacked at the pool to use, free slightly-more than a continental breakfast.  Meaning there were waffles, fruit and I think cereal in addition to muffins, juice, coffee, etc.  First room we were assigned hadn't been cleaned yet although the desk thought it had been - said it was checked off on their list, but they fixed it right away and we had a very nice one after that - separate living room with a big picture window and a big window in the bedroom facing another direction.  Second day when we returned around

this hotel is older, the staff always had a smile, household staff bent over backwards for us. We did smell burnt toast often.... Picked up bus  next to hotel to Disneyland, our room could see the fireworks at  Disneyland. Would stay again, free parking. Heated pool.

In our experience everything was fine. No parking fees. Pets stay free. Free breakfast. Depending upon the rate you pay. This is the place to stay close to the Land! You can walk to the main gate in only 15 minutes! If your experience was like ours, you will be happy, just a short walk from the happiest palce on Earth.

Summary Heading: Yes for Disney/family/budget travel, maybe not for business...
Summary: We were in town for a conference, and I know from previous trips that LQ is not really a business hotel per se so I'd say this hotel is really better suited for families traveling to Disneyland or those on a budget.    The rooms are quite spacious, and the suite design are ideal for families as there is a separate sitting room with a fold-out couch (and French doors and second TV) which is ideal for kids.  The flat-panel TV's are great and the king bed was comfy.  There are a lot of reviews in here about the carpet being dingy and smelly, and that's true in the hallways but not in the rooms.  There is a breakfast room on the second floor and they have a good spread - cereals, yogurt, bagels, muffins, toast, juice & coffee.  It's included in the room rate and again, really ideal

Summary Heading: We - family of nine stayed in two Suites - Comfortably
Summary: We have a family of nine - 4 adults, two teens, two toddlers and one  infant!   The staff has been extremely accommodating and helped by printing out various events and costs, along with maps.    We stayed from March 5th 2012 to the March 11th,2012.   Close to disney land and there is a shuttle at side parking lot.  The Grey line stops curb side to the INN.    Shuttle to Disney land is every twenty minutes.  We bought a $10 three day pass for the shuttle - by a little wallet that goes around older kids neck they carry them in the gift store fourth floor.  Blankets at the gift store was reasonable(13-16 dollars)         Buy the younger kids 2,3,4 yr old mickey ears from this gift shop because they are only $3.99.  Breakfast was really good.  First day heading to Disney land we

Summary Heading: If you get a room at a good price its definitely worth it!
Summary: I stayed at this La Quinta from Feb 27th 2012 - March 3 2012.  I arrived late on Friday night and had no problems checking in. Fast, efficient, and up to my room. You use your key card to call the elevator that is outside the lobby door up to your rooms.  My room was #405 on the fourth floor near the gift shop. It is a two room "suite" although the room layout is completely backwards. You walk into the bedroom where there is a sink in the bedroom and a small bathroom. The bedroom opens up with sliding french doors to a living area with a sofa couch. There were TVs in both rooms. So the living area actually has the window is more private than the bedroom.  I had asked for a room with a view of the park but it seems they were full and with the layout of the hotel it wouldn't be a

For the price and location its a great place.  Kids loved the bunk beds in room.  Service was wonderful.  Close to Gardenwalk where there are great restaurants.   Place could use some upgrades, but despite the older look, it was clean.  Would definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Leasure Trip for College Softball Tournament
Summary: My recent stay at your La Quinta was a 6 on a scale of 1-10. I was pleased with the rate I received, parking garage was great, breakfast was good and overall room was setup nice & clean even though I found the room outdated. However the carpeting in the hallways were quite soiled and I was disappointed to find out you do not have a business center for your guests.

This is a great family/pet friendly hotel for the price. We vacationed with our children and their families, ages 15 months up to 65 years. The staff was friendly and efficient, the rooms were large enough for us and all our gear and the property seemed very secure.  Despite all the families and pets it was fairly quiet and clean - some refurbishment is in order - and the price is right.  We drive down to Disneyland every couple of years and have stayed in all 3 Disney properties, several Good Neighbor hotels and a residence style hotel.  We'll come back here next visit.  We bring our own food, as several of us are Celiac, and the rooms allowed us plenty of space to prepare breakfasts and lunches for the park. The microwave and fridge were old but worked great, heating and air

We originally chose this hotel a few years ago because it is dog friendly.  We have continued to stay regardless if whether we have out pet.  The front desk staff is extremely helpful and handle request promptly.  The hotel was clean, the beds comfy and the WIFI works fine.  The carpet and sofa beds could be replaced but other than that it was great.  The hotel is withing walking distance and the ARC stop is right in the next parking lot.  The staff is knowledgeable about the transportation and local amenities.  We typically ride the Amtrak to Anaheim, the store our luggage and belongings while we are in the Park and allow us to pick it up later.  This is a huge convenience and we enjoy staying here for money.  The continental breakfast is standard but perfect and they have a
Excellent value, excellent breakfast.  The only thing that needs improvement is the smell of the room which may indicate uncleanness.

I have stayed at many La Quintas but I was disappointed by this most recent stay.  The employees were great but the room was lacking, especially when compared to the La Quinta by LAX or by Magic Mountain.  I was actually in two rooms, and I think the wattage of the light bulbs needs to be increased, neither room was very bright.  The second room I was in was quite large but one of the beds had a bent bed frame and the box spring started to fall through.  The toilet would not flush until I removed the lid and manually flushed it.   In general I am a great fan of the La Quinta chain and I think these few changes would make it competitive with the other hotels in the area.  I did think it was a bit pricey.

When my wife and I stayed here we were in a two room "Suite", the room is smaller then it sounds. The cleanliness of the room was acceptable, but several thing were in need of repair or remodel. The Bathroom was the biggest negative for several reasons, 1- the light switch was above the toilet which wasn't even close to the door. 2 - the caulking around the tub, sink , and everywhere needed to be redone. The hallways on our floor were disgusting and in need of a serious cleaning or replacement. The breakfast was okay for a continental breakfast. Overall not a horrible experience, but I would definitely pay the extra for a hotel close to Disneyland that may be cleaner.

Summary Heading: Older hotel, but they take care of you!
Summary: My husband and I stayed here while on our Honeymoon to Disneyland. We had a large King suite with a jacuzzi tub. The room was spacious and clean & had awesome windows facing the park to view the fireworks at night. It could use some updates and some decor to spruce it up, but other than that the place was totally adequate. The best thing about this hotel was the customer service. Check in was a breeze and our hostess was friendly and thorough. About ten minutes after we got up to our room she called to make sure everything was up to our expectations. Nice touch! Parking is free and pretty secure in a structure below the hotel. The breakfast in the morning was decent: little waffles, toast, bagels, cereal, oatmeal, fruit, hard-boiled eggs, etc. We didn't use the pool facilities,
I stayed in this hotel just one night but it has a good quality and the room I had was so quite ı slept very confortable.

Summary Heading: Disneyland at Christmas time, the best!
Summary: Being close to your location, in this case Disneyland, really makes it so easy. Being able to have a very tasty, nutritious, filling breakfast right at the location so you can get an early start on your day is so helpful.  A pool and hot tub for that evening relaxing after a long day, is marvelous. The building itself may have to have a three star rating, because its older, but everything else makes it a Five Star! VJ is the best Hotel Manager and the staff is ultra friendly and helpful.
The bathroom was not clean, the tub dripped, the air conditioner was broken, the fire alarm was going all night into the day, the parking garage was flooded.

Stayed during busiest week of year.  This is our third time.   Pros.  Close to some good restaurants, first stop on ART line, good size rooms, nice friendly staff.    Con.  Pullout couch had such a bad mattress no way to sleep on.  A little run down. pool is not real clean, but ok, Hot tub did not work,  Problem with wireless internet, but support was able to work around.  Overall, it's not a bad place to stay for the money, but had declined a lot over the last 4 years.  Likely won't stay again.

Summary Heading: Big rooms, pretty close to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is just far enough from the resort that I would recommend an ART pass for e duration of your stay - but on the bus it is just a couple minutes.  Room was plenty big for our family of five ( get the adjoining kids room with the bunkbeds if you can), nice and clean, modern bathroom with lots of hot water.  Breakfast is prefab "stuff" - the oatmeal was like cement!  The eggs and salsa were OK.  The second time we went to Disneyland we opted for a hotel closer to the resort so we wouldn't have to take the ART.

Start with breakfast just awesome. Front desk is great and helpful. Rooms are also great, they don't say this in description but king room was actually more like a suite with bunker bed. Our kid enjoyed this a lot. Restaurants are in walking distance.

Summary Heading: Front desk manager Maria was great.
Summary: we recently took a trip to disneyland and decided to spend the night, for the price the rooms aren't bad. just have to say that the front desk manager Maria was pleasant and had great customer service skills. she made our stay enjoyable even though we had to move rooms because the people above us had a dog who kept running around and barking. she was able to find us a room with a king bed and a bunk bed for the kids and she also found us a room where there was no one below us because of our little one who likes to run around. all in all it was a pleasant trip. great job Maria, you made our stay great and we will stay here again because of you.

I think this hotel needs an overhaul. We asked for a nonsmoking room but to our dismay we got a room that smelled and seemed like someone was spewing cigarette smoke all the time(We found out later that we were actually in a nonsmoking room--nonsmoking floor; thought we were in a smoking only floor.). Beddings smelled like they weren't change particularly the ones placed on the sofa bed. Found a left-over pizza in the microwave upon arrival. Cable not working. All the more, their website boasted that there were meat products(ham,  bacon) served during complimentary breakfast but again, there was none. Brewed coffee tasted sour.  The most, unforgettable thing that happened to me and my family was that we had a hard time looking for parking. What's the point of registering our car

The hotel is in a great location close to shopping dinning and Disneyland resort! The staff if amazingly friendy and on there A game to make sure you have the best stay possibly! The only negative thing I have to say was the pool kinda wasn't the best but other then that I was very happy with my stay :)

I agree this hotel is a little bit run down, the hallways smelled of cigarette smoke, I need to swipe a few times of the key to open the door each time, first night the shower was not working, the breakfast is OK but the juice and coffee taste strange, the bath room is hard to find flat place to hold bathing stuff. These are the bad things.  The staffs there are generally friendly, they help to resolve problems when we reported. The bed type are something my kids love, we live in a room with a King bed, a separate room with bunkbed for kids, which is convenient for all, that's the main reason I choose to stay here.  Last thing to remember, this is a hotel close to disneyland, so expect many tourist and kids live in, they walk and talk till late, so it's not an ideal place if you

This hotel is run down, and needs a remodel.  It wasn't very clean either.  The hallways smelled of cigarette smoke, we had to use the washer and dryer and they were dirty.  Recptionist at the front desk was the one delivering pizza's to rooms, they were short staffed.  Motel 6 nearby was much nicer than this.  It's too bad, but we will not stay here again.

I was disappointed in the  breakfast offered.Very cheap!!! Old oranges, day old muffins/doughnuts, and when they say they have waffles,know that they are mini precooked waffles that are full of preservatives.The yogurt was served in a big bowl and the orange juice tasted like Tang. Make sure you get a room away from the stairs/elevators as you could hear everything outside our room  making for poor sleep even if not a light sleeper. The staff were very warm and accommodating,boosting the rating to average,otherwise I would have rated the stay much poorer.

Summary Heading: 1st and last stay at this hotel
Summary: The staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful. The gift shop on the fourth floor was great for cheap souvenirs. The flat screen t.v. was great. The parking was limited. We needed to park our SUV at another parking lot and paid $12. They refunded the money during checkout. The hallway smelled like cigarette smoke. The breakfast was junk. There was no sink in the bathroom. The carpet near one of the beds were ripped, which was unsafe to walk on. The top bunk bed wooden frame had a crack, which was unsafe for kids to sleep on. The beds were uncomfortable. Housekeeping did not do a good job. Our beds were not fixed, mirror above sink was not cleaned and the carpet was very dirty. My money was not worth it staying at this hotel.

Summary Heading: Can't wait for the next stay
Summary: Once again a fabulous stay. Staff is extremely warm & welcoming. Room clean & bed very comfortable. Price was perfect. Can't wait for the next stay. Thank you La Quinta in Anaheim/Disneyland. "Where dreams really do come true."

Summary Heading: Another great stay at La Quinta
Summary: This is our second stay at La Quinta. The staff is so helpful and friendly. We love having the two rooms so the kids have their own space. The location  is about a 15 minute walk, but we chose to puchase the ART passes from the front desk, and the ART stop is right behind the building. We love utilizing the indoor heated pool after spending a long day at the parks.
Very dusty room, no heat or air working, broken furniture, it was a very uncomfortable trip. On the bright side, the employees were great at trying to help.

This was our second time staying at the La Quinta, very clean rooms, friendly people, and the best part for us is that they except pets. Close to everything, good breakfast, felt safe walking our dogs. Will be back again.

Pros: Perfect sleeping arrangment for our family of six. Two flat screens so kids could watch their shows and we could watch ours. Very friendly staff. Close to Disneyland but not on the "main drag" where all the crowds are. (about a 15min walk) Must have thick walls because we couldn't hear the screaming kids next door when we were in our room! Only in the hall.  Cons: Smallish rooms and lack of drawers. (Think cruise ship) Plan on living out of the bag with a large family. Breakfast was ok but I've seen a lot more variety at other La Quinta's.

I highly recommend staying here. It was a good experience the whole time, starting with the easy check -in. The room was very nice, clean and comfortable. The local area was nice and we felt very comfortable and safe. We felt safe enough  to walk to and from the parks with children. The continental breakfast was very nice, with plenty of hot food and other choices. Good coffee, and other drink choices, as well as a comfortable and clean dining area. The whole experience was a good one. Thank you La Quinta.

Free internet and business center provided the core amenities we needed at a reasonable price.  There's nothing more disappointing than shelling out a lot for more expensive hotels only to have to pay additionally for slow, spotty wifi and per page print outs at the business center.  The room itself was aqequate, a little warn but it got the job done.  Definitely well maintained and clean, just older and well worn.
We had eight in our party and stayed in the family suite.  Plenty of room and the king mattress was amazing in our room!! Lots of room at a great rate. We will definately stay again!!

Room sandwiched between the pool, exterior stairway, elevator and housekeeping room...very noisey. Of course the smoking room didn't have any ashtrays.  Went to the lobby to get one and read the paper (TV wasn't working) - no newpaper. One of the few rooms you can't crack the window open - yes, a smoking room. The in-room desk had no electrical outlets within six feet, had to move the table to use the laptop. The TV didn't work. Night maintenance couldn't repair. I "fix'ed" it in the morning as I noticed not all the electrical cords were plugged in. Outside looks good, inside appears worn.

Having read some of the negative reviews, we were pleasantly surpised with the facillity and staff for our 2 night stay.  The rooms were great, the bed was firm, everything worked good (except we had to tinker with the tub stopper to get it to stop and unstop.  The breakfast food and seating were fine.  The staff that we dealt with were very nice and efficient.  We would be happy to stay again.

Summary Heading: Great front desk staff, dumpy hotel
Summary: The staff at this hotel are just great, friendly and helpful and caring.  The hotel itself is gross.  Old, in poor repair, very slow elevator, dingy, blankets with cigarette burns, etc.  The poor staff tried their best to make things right and gave us a discount after the cleaning people failed to properly clean the room and also we found left over food under the bed upon check in. But, the sweet front desk staff could not make up for the fact that the hotel is just so old and run down and generally gross.  The bathroom door did not close, the shower curtain was ripped, the cabinets were chipped and worn, the sliding door which should have separated the rooms in the suite was off its track and broken, the fold out sofa bed was made of no mattress and just all springs. For the

Summary Heading: Needs serious maintenance....perfect example of mismanagement!!!
Summary: All La Quinta Inn's I stayed in prior to this one were excellent.  I can't believe a property like this is allowed to exist under the La Quinta Inn banner.  Especially one so close to Disneyland.  You would think La Quinta Inn would want to better protect it's market reputation.  This should be a flagship property.  It is sad.  Some of the staff there really seem to care.  It seems that have been sabotaged by ownership.  It looks like at one time this was a great property.  It also appears that instead of reinvesting the money into the property for maintenance and staffing the ownership decided to pocket the money.  I hope something can be done to save this property.  I will have to avoid La Quinta Inn in the future if this is the type of properties they are going to use.

Summary Heading: Not the bad for the price, but not great by any means.
Summary: I was recently tasked with finding a decent hotel near Disneyland which could accommodate my family of 5 plus a toddler who we brought along as an added guest. After spending hours searching for an economical hotel near the resort, I came across the La Quinta Inn and Suites. I was definitely impressed by the photos and the amenities mentioned on their website. When visiting Disneyland, we typically spend the entire day at the resort and only return to the hotel for the evenings to get some rest and maybe take a dip in the pool or spa. I figured that for the price it would be worth trying even though the reviews online were less than spectacular. I called and booked a room which consisted of two "queen" beds and a bunk bed for the children. The representative on the phone was

hotel was dirty!!! they put us next to housekeeping, we got no rest the next day!!! we were on the second floor and the maintance man must of been working on that floor, he left all his stuff on the hallway..dirty bin, and his working cart on the way...horrible stay!!! we were very dissapointed!!! never again!!! front desk were rude uppon check in!!!

quite enjoyed the stay with two rooms to discover the difference customer services is very good i really liked the suites , although many rooms are remodeled but very good tastes and plenty of elbow room , the evenings are pleasant with anviance  and the smell of restaurants near by and plenty of places to walk too after a nice dinner

I wanted to thank everyone at La Quinta Anahein/Disneyland, and a special shout out to BJ and Maria for making our stay extra special for our daughters 3rd birthday to Disneyland. Thank you BJ for your attention to details,which made a huge differance in my eyes. Thank you Maria for your personal touch and kindness. You are a very sweet mananger. All the staff were super friendly and accommodating from the brightside breakfast attentant, who brought out more food quickly to ensure all the food was available for everyone.  To  the room attendant who brought us extra towels and napkins, Thank you everyone who made our stay more comfortable. I am now a forever loyal La Quinta Anaheim/Disneyland guest and will stay here everytime we come to Anaheim. I think the kids suite is the

Summary Heading: Maria and VJ are the best!
Summary: This was a very important stay as it was my grandaughters 3rd birthday and my birthday too! So I wanted everything just right. I called and spoke with VJ a couple days eariler and he was so helpful. I explain why were staying and he made sure that everything was just right. He moved us to a suite with the bunkbeds and it was perfect. We had 3 adults and 2 kids in this room and it was very roomy and the kids loved it. The shower had lots of hot water and we got extra towels from housekeeping really fast. The microwave and refrigerator were a blessing with kids. The pool was so great with the spa we spend our downtime there. The staff is great and took care of everyone so well especially Maria who walked me through the room and made sure I had everything we needed. There are so

Everyone at the hotel was very friendly. The rooms were cleaned very well everyday. Breakfast was good. All staff members were friendly and ready to help. Great job!!  Also there is a shuttle available to Disneyland next door.

My friend was in town and I convienced her to allow me to find a quiet hotel for her stay and therefore delay her 2 hour drive back home until the morning. I've stayed at other LaQuinta's in California located near airports and have found the hotels to be of very good value with good locations. The Anaheim Hotel on Clementine street met our needs. We got a room with a King size bed which also had the small "office/living area" with the couch for two, big screen TV and desk. Coffe maker, plenty of paper cups and a mini fridge.The only blem was the shower floor that has seen better days. She remarked the hotel felt cozy and she liked that the Anaheim Garden Walk is right across the street, She commented that "next time in town" we could plan to dine there and "we" can stay at the

Summary Heading: Good place close to Disneyland that is pet friendly
Summary: We had stayed here 4 years ago and decided to come back mainly because we were traveling with our chihuahua mix.  The best thing about La Quinta's and pets is no additional pet fee (unlike other pet friendly lodgings that we paid $25/day or $75/stay).  We booked the same type of room as before for the four of us, an apartment suite w/ a king bed and separate area w/ bunk beds.  These are nice sized rooms, especially the bunk bed area (which is separated by a sliding door and curtain) that has a kids table, work desk, and dresser plus the small fridge & microwave are in there.  The main area has a long counter where the sink is, long enough to hold all your stuff.  Too bad there wasn't a second sink in the toilet, combination shower/tub room, Then 2 people could brush up at the

My girlfriends and I wanted to get a hotel room for a night so we didn't have to drive home after a girls night out.  This location is conveniently located down the street from Disneyland and right on the corner of The Garden Walk in Anaheim.  The front desk staff was very accomodating and very friendly.  The room was just what we needed for a bunch af girls to have a sleepover.  The room was called the children's suite and was perfect for families.  They also offer a complimentary breakfast with a good range of foods for adults and kids. The room was clean and the beds were comfy, but the bunk beds we had in our room were very noisey when someone turned during sleep.  The elevator is slow, but there are only 5 floors so the stairs were nice exercise without luggage of course.

Summary Heading: Very nice staff and the rooms were great!
Summary: We were welcomed very nicely by the staff and checkin was quick and easy.  They accomodated us very good.  The rooms we had were perfect!  Walking distance to Disneyland was good too!  The breakfast was great! Checkout was even good!

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay with pets
Summary: Close to Disneyland, walking distance, cont. breakfast and clean rooms, what else could you ask for.  I will be returning to this hotel in Nov. for a weekend trip to Disneyland.  They do have a shuttle for a fee, but if we weren't too tired we would walk the few blocks away.  The only thing is I wish they would have a grass area for the dogs.  Otherwise, we love this place and look forward to coming back.

Summary Heading: Under remodel, very dirty, thin walls and ceiling... never again
Summary: Let’s start with the fact that the picture of your hotel on the website did not match.  I did not know it was a high rise with limited parking and with construction bins throughout the exterior parking lot, which made entering and leaving your hotel very challenging.  When we returned to the hotel a little after midnight, we were surprised to walk into a room that looked as if it wasn’t cleaned.  The carpets looks dirty, there were stains on the bed covers and to top it off, two of the shower towels were dirty.  One had dried blood on it, and the other had lipstick on it (at least we hoped it was lipstick.  The toilet seat moved like it was going to break off.  When you looked into the tub, the tub was dirty and the chrome piece on the shower head was broken and dangling.  In

Summary Heading: The worst hotel ever...very disappointed....super bad experience
Summary: I really should believe the reviews that I read at this place.  There's not even one nice things I could say about this place.  Where should I start?   Parking lot is so small and narrow.  Service guest is rude.  Only one super old elevator.  As soon as we step out of the elevator, there goes the bad smell of stain old dark dirty carpet.  The room was dirty, the closet door is broken, there's no table or chair for a so called APARTMENT SUITES.   The toilet had stains, and some dark burning marks, and there was no hot water on the first day we arrived.   Only three towels for our family of six.  I had to called for more clean towels every morning.  Our room didn't get clean for two days for some reason, someone put a DO NOT DISTURB SIGN in the front door.   The carpet in the room

We stayed here for a family trip, had two rooms next to each other on the 2nd floor.  This hotel is in DIRE need of a remodel regardless of what you read and see on their website.  the rooms are NOT as depicted.  They are old, smelly and not maintained.  The plastic tub in our shower had a hole in it with sharp edges, such that we could not bathe the kids.  Even if we wanted to put them in that filthy tub.  DO NOT stay here.  Disneyland was awewome as always, but this hotel really was a damper on the trip.  I will never stay in a la Quinta again.

Summary Heading: Highly overpriced for what they offer
Summary: La quinta was not what I expected at all. They preach guest satisfaction at every turn but don't do anything to please guests. The parking was tight and limited. The front desk clerk was new and didn't know anything. My bed sheets were stained and hair filled and I tried calling the front desk with no answer a trillion times so finally I walked down stairs and spoke to the front desk guy who had to bring me a new sheet because there isn't anyone else working. There isn't an elevator easily accessible to my room from the parking garage so I carried my luggage up 4 flights of stairs. In the morning, construction workers were loud because the hotel is being hopefully renovated. It needs it. The elevators were so slow... when I found one... that people said forget it and used the

We stayed with 2 kids (13 and 10). The bedroom was very clean and roomy. There were no issues regarding our car safety. It seems the problem has been solved. The staff was very amusing and prompt to help any time.

Booked a suite which looked nothing like the photos on the website.  Tiny rooms with a glass door in the middle.  Had to keep asking for towels, they provided three towels for six people (including children).  Breakfast was awful - watered down juice, cold waffles, kids would not eat so we had to go to a restaurant.  The elevator was broken the entire time and we were on the third floor.  Still broken when we left.  An alarm went off the second night we were there - someone hit the water pipes under the hotel - staff did not tell us what was going on and the alarm kept going off and scaring the kids.  One of the kids left a bag in the room - still have not had a call back from the hotel letting us know if they ever found it.  Will never stay there again - what a rip off!

We stayed for 2 nights while we visited disney. It really wasnt a bad hotel i just think i had higher expectations. The suite was really in need of updating. It would have been nice to have a sink outside of the bathroom since we were with another couple. The room was pretty clean i think i just expected more for what we paid but i guess that was typical for the area

This hotel is only good For one thing it is close to Disneyland!!! And it has a transit pick up right behind the building. I will NEVER stay here again!!!! The sheets were stained, the room was humid and ac didn't work very well. Mind u it was only 75* out, so I couldn't imagine staying in a warmer month!!! Horrible horrible service!! I asked for a room to see fireworks, our view was the parking garage!! I asked for a late checkout cause our family from san Diego wouldn't be there til 2 and they gave us til noon. Not very much of a late checkout!! Not to mention I had to get issued 8!! 8 different room keys due to failure of working! We only were there for 4 days!!! This hotel is dirty and old in need of a remodel bad!! Maybe a class on customer service too.

Summary Heading: Disaster this should not be a good neighbor hotel
