Summary: We arrived at la Quinta inn on Friday June 24th we reserved a three bedroom suite we traveled with my parents and my brother and his girlfriend as well as my fiancé and I Many things were wrong with this hotel to start off the sliding glass door that connects to the living room part was off the rails as me and my fiancé have a one year old son I did not like that someone did come and fix that the 2nd thing is the toilet over flooded our room we had to change rooms and the room they changed us too was a three bedroom suite but it was way smaller the front desk clerk offered to put us in the same exact room but we would have to wait until the following day so we did so with that being said they didn't have our room ready until after 4 pm so that left us stuck in the hotel!! The

Summary Heading: not bad for the price, bunk bed good reason to stay
Summary: positives: stayed with family for a week, great location,close to activity the kid's suite was great ,each of us had our own bed to sleep, liked the micro and mini fridge, in room safe helped a lot , house keeping was good paid $115/night which was not a bad deal with free breakfast and adequate free  parking break fast was good especially the yogurt negatives:coffee not good quality , the hotel is dated with old furniture,plumbing and fixtures in need of repair.Carpet very dirty and stained,the worst I have ever seen .Dont ever take your shoes off !

Summary Heading: A good hotel, one block away from the happiest place on earth.
Summary: This hotel is great for families! The people there are very polite and always willing to help you. The rooms are very spacious and has 2 parts to the room. One part with the bathroom, 2 beds, a t.v, a closet area, and a sink. The other part has a couch, coffee table, a table to do paperwork, another t.v, a microwave, and a refrigerator. Their pool was alright, not the best one though. Their is also a laundry room, very convenient!  It's a walking distance from the happiest place on Earth!  The only complaint I had to make was the noise. One night it seemed like their was a party next door to our suite and I called room service to talk to them. But the noise kept on continuing so I had to talk to them myself, which was not great! Had an argument, but got it resolved! Besides

Summary Heading: Kids Loved It, Parents Didn't Hate It
Summary: So we chose this hotel because we were going to Disneyland for our daughter's birthday and she thought the bunk beds in the kids' suite looked awesome.  Plus, I saw a couple of other reviews that said you could see the Disney fireworks from the hotel and that it was walking distance to Disneyland.  All turned out to be be true, but with some items to note.  Bunkbeds:  Clean, kids loved them, worked really well for our family.  Item to note:  Bottom of the top bunk was made of cardboard, which was ripped (probably by various other kids that had claimed the bottom bunk over the years).  Disney fireworks:  You CAN see them from the hotel, if your room is on the Disney side of the hotel, but on the second floor, the view is sort of obstructed by trees.  Walking to Disney:  Possible,

Summary Heading: Great Location, Good Price, Ok Hotel
Summary: Stayed here for the LA Religious Ed Congress at the Convention Center.  I was a bit worried after reading all of the reviews, but we had 3 adults and each wanted our own bed so this was the best option within walking distance of the convention center that was within our budget.  Easy 10 minute walk down the street to convention center.  Cheesecake Factory right across the street.  Breakfast was ok, room was nice, waffles undercooked but my friend found that if you toasted them they were just right.  No problems with noise, although we were close to the elevator.  Comfortable bed.  Slept well.  2nd "room" with pull out sofa is a good size.  Three adults had plenty of room.  Negatives: -Bathroom was very small.  Would be helpful to have a sink near the toilet for hygiene.  Tub

Summary Heading: Disappointing, should have read the reviews!
Summary: We stay at hotels, a lot, and have stayed at various La Quintas, so we were quite disappointed when we walked into our room.  The rooms were aged and worn, that wouldn't have been so bad, if only...  After a 14hr. drive, we entered our "non-smoking" room which reaked of fresh cigarette smoke and the window cracked as an attempt to get the smell out.  We changed rooms and found our next room with no cigarette smell, but obviously it had not been properly cleaned.  We were very tired so we decided to try to get some sleep and let the staff know in the morning.  Needless to say, by day 6(!!) with me complaining everyday (finally to the manager, who was very nice), someone finally cleaned our room right!  I have never complained about a hotel before, it's usually we get what we pay

We choose this hotel for a 4 day, 3 room family vacation mainly because everything else was booked.  It did not take 2 minutes to realize why this one was the last available one in town.  The rooms are at least 15 years old, dirty, plastic bathtub was cracked in one room,  all the screws on the bunk beds were loose and made the bed unsafe for children.  The linens were old and worn, and in some cases not clean.  Grounds and inside the hotel was old and dirty.  The breakfast was awful, ended having to pay for breakfast somewhere else after the first day.  Oatmeal (tasted like cardboard), hard boiled eggs, yogurt and bagels, cereal, juice and coffee, Denny's is better.  The only good thing I could mention was the price.  But if you have any concerns about cleanliness, I would pay

Summary Heading: Good, comfortable, reasonably-priced hotel near Disneyland
Summary: Our king suite with jacuzzi was a corner room, which provided a unique structure to the room layout. Complete with a microwave, fridge, and a second TV in the living room, it was a very comfortable stay. The room was clean and the bathroom spacious, and our only two complaints were that the shower stall had a little mold (which, understandably would be there but not exactly something you'd expect in a hotel) and that the floors seemed thin as we could hear our upstairs and downstairs neighbors. Note that the jacuzzi does not comfortably fit two people. Also, the parking garage is tight with limited spaces so you may not get a spot if you come home late at night. Great location, close to Disneyland and Honda Center (which was the reason for our stay). Despite its few

As the Review on Feb 20th we stayed here fro the week of the 12th, there was 6 of us, including 2 girls( 4 &6) and after reading all the reviews i went here as it was the best choice iif you have dogs but there was lots of negative reviews that made me worry.  all the staff was Great, very polite and helpful. one night we had a noise room above us at after 9 pm and we called the front after it continued for a while and then it stooped within seconds. as for thew breakfast it was a bit lacking but still not bad just could be a little better i give it a 8 out of 10 as the breakfast room itself was the best i have seen in my experience. lots of seats. the pool and hot tub was awesome after a full day at the parks and the only issue there was we always have to ask for towels before

I stayed at La Quinta for 4 nights with my 3 children and dog while we visited Disneyland. We had a King Suite (king bed in one room and a pull-out double sofa in a second room). The room was on the 5th floor (top floor) so we did not have problems with noisy people above us. We paid $95 for 3 nights and $114 for 1 night (plus ~15% tax). The hotel was very good value for what we needed. Firstly, with a dog, one has very little choice---only 3 Disneyland Good Neighbor Hotels accept pets. The La Quinta welcomes pets and does not charge extra for them (assuming your pet does not harm the room). Secondly the La Quinta offered complimentary breakfast, free wifi, and free parking. The breakfast is a bit lacking on the healthy alternatives but they do offer oatmeal, boiled eggs, toast,

We started staying at La Quinta hotels when our now 22-year-old daughter started playing club volleyball at age 14.  It is not the Ritz or Four Seasons, but meets our needs and expectations.  The hotel rooms are essentially 2-room suites, with televisions in both rooms, free internet and parking, and coffee in room.  It is a high-rise property with only the lobby on the first floor.  The free breakfast area is located on the 2nd floor, with the exercise room on either the 5th or 6th floors.  Ice machines are located on only a few floors.  The hotel is located 3/4 mile from the American Sports Center (ASC) for Southern California Volleyball Association (SCVA) tournaments, about 1/2 mile from Disneyland, and various restaurants (PF Chang's, California Pizza Kitchen, Cheesecake

Summary Heading: Decent budget hotel close to Disneyland
Summary: Overall, we were satisfied with the value of this property.  It is a decent place to stay...nothing fancy.  The 2-room "Suites" are a bit small, but ideal for families with young kids.  Check-in was quick and efficient.  It is a 15 minute walk from the front lobby to the main gate at Disneyland.  There is also a city shuttle you can take for a small fee.  Breakfast was a disappointment.  Coffee was awful, and food was quite limited....donuts, rubber waffles, yogurt, cereal, and toast.   If you are on a budget and want to be near DL, this is not a bad choice.  Just don't come with Hilton expectations.

Close to main attraction and some nightlife. Made a big impression on our there children because we had what they call a "2 double room".  We would stay again if we're lucky to make the trip out west again.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel Great Service Great Price
Summary: My Fiance and I stayed here three nights for a Disney fun weekend. The hotel room was above my expectations for the price. We had a king size bed with separate living area. The bed was comfy and the linens were very clean. The whole room was very clean. The furniture is in good condition. The staff is very attentive to your needs. We had an awful couple in the room above ours who were busy doing their "thing" a couple times over two days. It became such a problem for us that we called the front desk. They moved us to an upgraded room in no time at all. They really took care of us. Also, the parking was great. There is a covered garage. No one experienced any problems with break in's or anything of the like. Their pool and jacuzzi are awesome. The pool seems to be heated because

Summary Heading: Pet Friendly and wonderful location!  Great Value! DL Fireworks!
Summary: We stayed with 2 adults and one small dog for one night this past Friday and we honestly could not have done better for the price.  The room was very big with two double beds  plus a pull out couch and dining table.  Room had a fridge and a microwave too, as well as two TV's with some pretty good channels.   Best part is -- we could sit in the comfort of the room and watch the Disneyland Fireworks from the dining table!  Don't expect 4 Star Fancy.  It's a budget friendly room, so some of the furniture is old-ish - but I found the room clean and comfortable.  Will not stay anywhere else when returning to Disneyland!

Summary Heading: Comfortable rooms that were VERY clean and cery roomy too.
Summary: We had a three room suite which was upgraded by the hotel(at no extra charge) it was very clean and very comfortable. The towels were plenty. The linen was fresh. NO holes in the blankets. The bathrooms were well stocked and very clean. We stayed on the fourth floor and it was quiet and fine. We ate across the street at the Cheesecake factory. The pool at the hotel was very clean and heated. my kids enjoyed swimming . Their were other children as well as other adults in the spa. Everyone was friendly. We had no problems. We didnt get a chance to try the breakfast(we slept in) but im sure it would have been suitable as well. We are coming back to California in December and we will most definately stay here again.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel... helpful staff... good location... comfy rooms... would stay again!
Summary: We have stayed twice at this hotel.  The first time we were in a family group of ten where we had four guest rooms.  Everyone was happy with the standard, the cleanliness and above all the price of this hotel.  Our second visit was Jan this year (a friend and I on a shopping trip).   Staff were friendly, the common areas were clean, guest room was always well cleaned and when we had a bit of a problem with the television, they called a technician in and we had it fixed within a few hours.  We have stayed in other hotels in the Disneyland area and the breakfasts were VERY sparce... la Quinta offers a generous breakfast... fresh fruit and more variety than other family hotels.  We are planning another trip for next January and will stay at La Quinta again.

I traveled with my 3-year-old granddaughter to Orange County for a family reunion/celebration.  We stayed at the Anaheim La Quinta for six nights.  To be honest, I was slightly concerned after reading some of the reviews, but the reservations were made and time was running out.  I must say I was pleasantly surprised!  Our room was on the fifth floor.  (I don't know if that makes a difference or not)  The room was very spacious for just the two of us.  There was the bathroom, of course, the bedroom with a king-size bed, and another room with a couch that could be pulled out to sleep.  There were two televisions, a microwave, small refrigerator, ironing board and iron, blow dryer, alarm clock, coffee maker, coffee, cups, ice bucket, cups and trays.  Everything was in working

We usually love La Quinta's  since  they take small dogs for free and have great breakfast. This location does NOT measure up. The breakfast was sorely lacking- they said its the kids that make a mess and waste food. that may be true, but the offerings were not like most locations. There were no individual yogurts (which I love), no bagels with cream cheese, no apples or bananas.... no hot chocolate...  We had a leak over the bathroom sink. Splashing all over our toiletries...Maintenance came and "fixed" the problem. So... then the leak happened in the middle of the bathroom floor, a slipping hazard. We asked to switch rooms. The door from the hall stairs to the 2nd floor handle came off in my hand and I had to go up a floor to get to my room. I literally carried the handle to

We traveled with friends and a total of four kids all under 5.  We stayed in one of the La Quinta's 3 bedroom suites which worked perfectly for us.  We could bring the kids back from a busy day in the park  for bed and let the other couple go back and enjoy the rest of the evening enjoying attractions that were not as kid friendly while one couple stayed with the kids.  The Disneyland La Quinta is a good value considering the other properties in the area, but be warned it is an older facility that sees a lot of use.  Everything was generally clean and maintained but well used.  The price was affordable making a Disney vacation more reasonable.

Summary Heading: Great Value and Very Good Location
Summary: We stayed in a kids suite.  The sliding door separating the rooms was broken, the coffee pot was broken, and the blankets were full of holes.  We complained to the front desk about all three.  The blankets were changed the following morning, but the other problems were never resolved.  The rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable.  We spent most of our time in the Disney parks, so most of our time in the room was spent sleeping.  The breakfast consisted of boiled eggs, waffles, toast or bagels, muffins or donuts, juice, coffee, tea, yogurt or oranges, oatmeal, and cereal.  It was pretty standard, but the dining area was large and well-maintained.  The room was very quiet even though the rooms on our floor were full.  The only sound we ever heard was the fireworks from

Summary Heading: Great place for money but husband says never again.
Summary: Great place to sleep if you are not the kinds who worries all night about your car getting broken into. Lots of people just hanging out in the parking lot. ( They did not appear to be staying at the hotel either) After reading reviews about car thiefts in the parking lot you would assume management would be watching for this kind of activity.... This property in actually in a good location which leads you to believe that if management would actually take care of the loitering in the parking lot the thiefts would not be happening all the time. when I asked the front desk their answer was ..... don't leave anything that would invite them into your car. They said even the charging cord would be enough to entice them into your car. They just did not seem to concerned.   Bottom

Summary Heading: Do not stay here if you own a car - high crime rate and auto break-ins
Summary: Do not stay here if you own a car, don't want windows broken out, and don't want to spend time with the Anaheim PD. We stayed at La Quinta Inn on Clementine St for 3 nights. During check-in each guest is handed a flyer warning that there have been problems with auto break-ins and theft in the area. It turns out the warning is specific to certain hotels - one of which is the very hotel you're checking in to: La Quinta on Clementine St. While we were only there for 3 nights, 5 cars were broken into in the open, unsecured 2-level La Quinta garage. The Anaheim PD officer who came to take the report in the morning said that "I'm here all the time" and that "certain hotels cooperate less than others".  Yeah right. Guess which hotel he was talking about. Although the hotel is within

Summary Heading: This hotel should not be charging more than fifty dollars per night
Summary: This hotel was one of the worst hotels that I have stayed in that charges over $100 per night.  This hotel is very outdated, I would like to know when it was built.  Our bathroom had no sink to wash our hands, the walls were dirty and the bottom of the door seemed to had been eaten away by termites.  The screen in our room had a long and wide whole in it which a small child could have fallen half way through.  I have stayed in hundreds of hotels in my over 50 years of life and this is by far the worst for the price we paid.   This hotel needs work on the interior,  clean the walls, replace doors, more update furniture.  Sorry but this hotel gets a thumb down.

Pro's: Location: -Hotel is near enough to Disney to walk if children aren't too small or if they aren't already to worn out from having fun all day.   There is a shuttle though if you don't want to walk.   -Location is also near lots of restaurants: CPK, Cheesecake Factory, McComicks (?), Bubba Gump and a mexican restaurant but I can't remember the name.    Pool was nice and we liked that it was indoors due to cold weather at the time of our stay.  Staff was quick to correct a problem that we had with room and even refunded me one nights stay.   I was very grateful for that and it completely made up for awful nights sleep especially when I wasn't seeking that out.  I just informed the manager when asked how the stay was as I checked out about a problem and she refunded me that

Summary Heading: Place is BROKEN, from locks to AC
Summary: The card keys do not work reliably.  We had to get four replacement keys.  The drink machines are constantly empty.  The AC did not work in our first room.  Unfortunately, we discovered this after we had completely unloaded our suitcases, etc;.  They gave us a new room (nearby) with another set of defective card keys.  Breakfast is good with a lot of hot food.  There was no wireless service in our room.  They do have wired internet service but you will need a network cord.

Summary Heading: Don't stay here ever, it's not good.
Summary: We woke every morning with bites all over us, had items stolen, not enough beds supplied and told to bad, ask for enough towels for 6 adults and never recieved them. Dogs in other rooms barking all night, hallway had a crushed biscuit on the floor on our first day and it was still there 6 days later.

Summary Heading: Good for Families of Four to Six
Summary: We stayed here for four nights with great satisfaction. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast was up to standard, though it would be disappointing to those who must have meats of any kind. Our room was tidy and good for families of four to six. Housekeeping was helpful and punctual too ! The location of the hotel is about fifteen to twenty minutes walk to the Disney theme Parks, quite reasonable.

I requested a room at a 3 star hotel through Hotwire and received the surprise that my boking was done in this La Quinta Hotel. As most of you people know, La Quinta Hotels do not have a 3 star level. I complaint with hotwire and they insisted that this specific Hotel has indeed a 3 star category. Hotwire lied as even in their examples they rate Quinta as a 2 star hotel.   Anyway, I have stayed in other La Quinta's before but this one is really dissapointing. Very small breaffast area with very limmited options. Small lobby and in general the hotel loooks old. The location is good as I was attending to a summit at the convention center but that is the ony good thing that I can comments about this hotel.  The Internet conection is placed on the nigt table, next to the bed. No

Summary Heading: Will not stay at La Quinta again
Summary: As previous reviews have also indicated, several cars were broken into during our 5 night stay.   We did not leave anything in our car, so we did not have any problems.   The room was worn, the bathroom was utilitarian, and some of the outlets didn't work.   The breakfast was lousy.   They advertise a selection of items, however, they rotate those items day to day, so the selection is minimal daily. Thawed frozen waffles, cheap donuts (not fresh), bread and cereal.

Summary Heading: Do not stay!!!!!! Beware!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Please read!!!!!
Summary: 1. The most important part is 5 cars were broken into last night at our stay at this place ours included!!! over $5000.00 wurth of equipment was stolen!!!!!!!!! The fix it guy who fixed ours and 4 others smashed in windows said he is here every week fixing windows!!! guess who doesnt have camera or cant do anything about it! LA QUINTA!  2. its stinks and its dirty  3. there were BUGS  4. the blankets all have holes in them.  5. the Breakfast is nastey  6. The staff is the mpost ghetto poeple they could have hired who are probably behind all the break ins since all the alarms went off but no one did anything (and trust me you can hear everything from the structure to the lobby)  DONT STAY EVEN TO SAVE A BUCK OR YOU WILL LOOSE OUT ON MORE!!!!!!!!!!!

I had a party of 7 (5 adults and 2 toddlers) and we were very comfortable.  We stayed in the 3 room suite.  The continental breakfast was nothing special but we enjoyed it every morning.  Plenty of parking.  We felt safe since you have to use your room key to get into the building.  Its about a block to disneyland but they do have a shuttle that runs every 20 minutes for a fee.  We drove and parked at Disneyland and still had quite a walk.  It was very clean and I would stay here again.  Cheescake factory, California Kitchen, PF Changs and other yummy resturant directly across the street.  Awesome stay and I will stay here again.

Summary Heading: Stay Elseware, you get what you pay for.
Summary: Beware of room 324, the showers are ICE cold, when management was contacted and "fixed" the problem all they did was make it worse!  Rooms have very little free space, plugins are worn and nothing will stay pluged in, maids only make beds and empty garbage cans the breakfast dishes and cups were still as left that morning, and the breakfast was very minimal, only the first in line got hot eggs, gravy pot was empty every time, counters a spill fest mess, toaster did not toast, orange juice was diluted, only good thing was the hot coffee (which was needed after the freezing shower), carpet in hallway on 2nd floor was not laid straight, front desk staff was rude to other members of my party (I didn't have that experiance), the parking spaces were ok, a little narrow for a van, but

I have stayed in a lot of hotels owned by La Quinta and have always found them to be affordable and clean. The Anaheim La Quinta is in an excellent location. It sits next door to a new full service mall. The rooms were nice and spacious, and very clean. You really have to watch for the entry drive way to the hotel or you'll find you self going around the block to get on to the hotel property.  It is a nice walk to the Disney resort, and seems to be a very safe area. There were only two things I didn't really like about this hotel and it's not a very big deal. The hallways were not air conditioned- so it was like walking into an oven when getting off the elevator. The breakfast, was very minimal and didn't really have much of a variety. There was no ice machine located on our

Summary Heading: Great place if you really just need a place to rest/recover from theme parks and want some privacy from kids
Summary: We stayed here before it was a LaQuinta (around 2002) and it is largely the same.  We stayed in room 213.  It was clean and adequate for our needs.  No bedbugs in our room, and believe me I checked it right away after reading the earlier post regarding them.  It was nice to have the second bedroom so the teens could hang out, stay up later without disturbing us and sleep in while we woke up early.  Our neighbors had a dog in the room (didn't know they were allowed) and there was some barking, but otherwise it was very quiet and easy to sleep at night.  We got the "family suite" with the bunk beds (twin/full combo) and even though are children are teenagers, they were comfortable.  There is certainly nothing fancy here, but if you are feeling cash-poor after spending 8.99 on

Summary Heading: Nothing special-get a good rate if you stay here...
Summary: My wife had a conference in Anaheim in July so my two daughters, ages 6 and 9, and I decided to tag along and go to Disneyland while she slaved away at her conference. We chose La Quinta Inn and Suites based on price, location and TripAdvisor reviews. We spent 4 nights.  CHECK-IN/PARKING/STAFF  We arrived early, about 7:30AM, received a parking pass and were informed that our room would be ready after 3PM. The parking was crowded, but we found a spot. We left our luggage in the car and then my daughters and I spent the morning and early afternoon at the park while my wife attended her conference. We used the Anaheim Resort Transit (“ART”) to go to and from the park-the front desk sold us the passes. The shuttle was convenient, reasonably priced and there is a stop right next to

Summary Heading: Liked the room, hated the bed bugs
Summary: I liked the room configuration and location and ease of getting to Disneyland, HOWEVER, the bed bugs were HORRIBLE!  I know there is an infestation in California but this was over the top!  Management was responsive but with an infestation this severe moving to another room just was not an option!  We left in the middle of the night because we couldn't take it.  I'm not putting down any other La Quinta and in fact if it weren't for the bedbugs and the fact that I asked for a non-smoking room and I was put on the smoking floor, the room would have have worked OK.  Maybe other La Quinta hotels are great but this one has a real bed bug problem!    Before booking with this hotel ask them out right if they have gotten the bed bug problem resolved.

I'm a big fan of La Quinta, and this one didn't disappoint.  I was on a trip with my wife, father and younger sister for my dad's birthday. We stayed here one night, as we had booked three night's over at the Paradise Pier hotel using some Disney Vacation Points. Since we weren't spending the first day at Disneyland (we instead went to Universal Studios), this was just a less-expensive option than paying for an extra night at the Paradise Pier.  The hotel is located conveniently off of I-5 and was very easy to find. It's on an smaller, more isolated street, but that made it quite nice. I could see the Tower of Terror and the Matterhorn from the hotel, and that made me smile.  Upon arriving, I was afraid that we wouldn't find a place to park, but that was never actually a

This was a very good choice if you have a family, are spending your days at the park, and want a little privacy from the kids at the end of the day.  We booked an "apartment" room.  It had a king bed with doors and a curtain dividing the space and a bunkbed and kiddie table on the other side.  (Parents bed near bathroom - kids near the window.)  The mullion doors still let the light through to our side, while the opaque curtain allowed us some privacy after a long day at the park.  We have 2 kids and it was nice to have a solution that allowed our boy and girl to have separate beds, afforded us privacy, and didn't force us to pay double to get an adjoining room.  The staff was very friendly.  Our room was very clean.  They have a continental buffet in the morning with donuts and

Conveniently located close to the Disneyland..which was our primary reason for visiting Anaheim. Very cheap and timely transport takes away your worry of commuting there. The staff was again helpful with all the details to plan our 1 day trip to Disneyland. We also ran into some very helpful guests at the hotel, who helped us plan well. Not a very convenient place for someone who wants to hook up a laptop and catch up with some office work...the connectivity is poor. And so was the breakfast..nothing worth talking abt. But at the end, served our purpose of travel well!

We think this hotel must be seriously affected by the downturn in economy as evidenced by the following: Room Service:   1)  Bare-bones staffing. 2)  Cleanliness=filthy.  Our child walked across the carpet twice in our room in white socks and held them up and they were black.  Our maids threw our pillows on this filthy floor to make up the beds.  I experimentally placed three things on the carpeting (not in the corners) the first day we arrived and they were not vacuumed up during the week we stayed there.  Sheets are changed every three days.  We came back from Disneyland one day to find gross gritty black stuff in our sink (did our sink back up while we were out?)  Smelly bathrooms.  My child and I visited Disneyland while my husband was in town on business.  We seriously

Summary Heading: Yuck!   Avoid the La Quinta Inn and Suites Anaheim/Disneyland
Summary: Avoid this hotel.  I found the rooms, hallways, service, odors and amenities all sub-par.  My son and I stayed here for 4 nights at the end of March, 2009 as part of a school trip so we had no choice.  I would have left immediately but we were stuck.  A motel can be simple, but it does not have to be dirty.  The hotel is about a 20 minute walk to Disneyland so it is convenient, but surrounded by other low-budget hotels it has an "industrial prison" appearance inside and out.  The concertina wire alongside the parking lot is especially inviting.  With both elevators outside the lobby, you get the feeling that they do not want guests at the front desk.  While checking in I noticed the ceiling of the lobby was full of water spots and most of the light fixtures had cobwebs.  Not a

We statyed in Los Angeles for 5 days. Our stay with this hotel was very comfortable. Though the rooms are not very nice, it is a convenient place to stay with the kids and near to Disney Land.  The staffs are very friendly and their service was great. Breakfast was also good with many items but with same menu everyday.  It is an ideal place to stay with kids.

It was AWFUL. First room we were in was a kids' suite. We had more then thirty flea bites between our three children and had to be moved to another room. That night we had no water for three hours due to maintenance issues. The next two days had luke warm only at best. They double charged our card and then they had three randomn charges for $11.90 that they could not explain. The sheets were holey and the pool was never restocked with towels. For that amount of money, it was a FLEA bag and hated our stay. If it wasnt for the holiday week and all other hotels being booked solid, I would have left in a heartbeat. Never,ever again will I use a LaQuinta due to this experience.

We stayed here for 6 nights in Oct 2008.  We chose this hotel because it had a fridge, coffeemaker, iron, laundry, and free breakfast.  We paid $79 a night + tax.  If we got this price again, we would definitely stay here.  If the price is higher, we would look to see what else is available.  Hotel/Location:  The hotel had 5 stories with a parking garage, pool, jacuzzi, inside corridors, laundry, gift shop, and internet.  To access the elevators, you had to have a room key so that made us feel safe.  The hotel had easy access to all major streets and the I5 freeway.  There is lots of dining nearby.  We did drive to Disneyland everyday since it was more convenient for us, but if you had to walk I would say it's a good 1/2-3/4 mile to the park entrance.  The shuttle does have a

We have stayed at this hotel approximately 10 times for days at a time. I have never had anything but a great stay (and I travel A LOT!!!!!) For the money it can't be beat, two room suites in every room, individual tv's in each room of the suite. Spacious, fridge, microwave in each suite. Hotel staff has always been exceptionally helpful, polite, and professional. I have never had a problem with my accomodations and I love knowing that I get a suite each stay. I honestly don't care about the breakfast since it is so easy to eat at disneyland or in the room (cereal and milk). It is honestly a great value and when we come it is to go to Disneyland and we love the convenience.

Summary Heading: Great location, Hold on to your belongings!
Summary: This has been our hotel of choice for Disney vacations for several years. True, the breakfast isn't great, but it's free so no complaints there. The hotel is older, but clean. HOWEVER, this trip ended in disaster. We left in a rush because of an emergency at home, and then one child remembered she had left her keys with her iPod attached in the drawer. We immediately called but the housekeeping staff was already gone. No one could check on the ipod, but they did say that the room wasn't occupied that night & promised to call me in the morning. No call by 10am. When I called no one had a clue, but they would check & call right back. 2 hours later I called again, no ipod had been turned in, but again they verified that the room had not been used yet, and what a shock - The keys

Summary Heading: Cool furniture for the kids if you book that room
Summary: I booked this hotel for a trip to Disneyland of course.  I used my Rewards and upgraded to the kids themed room.  It consisted of 1 king bed.  And a seperate room with a bunkbed (double + a single on top).  And plastic kiddie table and chairs in cool colors.  For my nieces and nephews who spent a few nights with us.    The breakfast was sufficient.  I don't know why people complain about it.  Of course it will be crowded as families book this hotel for Disneyland.  And families wake up before heading to the park, and eat breakfast.  It's a value hotel.  You're not going to get eggs custom cooked by a chef.  Most hotels don't offer a free breakfast.   There was a covered pool area and spa, but we didn't use.  We drove to Disneyland Hotel, where my brother was staying.  And used

Stayed here at La Quinta for a week. Although I was a bit leary after reading the reviews, the place wasn't that bad. The rooms were clean and staff were friendly.  I probably will not stay here again though, because of the following reasons.  First of all, it is a 20 min. walk to Disneys' front entrance, which isn't bad but remember you will be doing alot of walking in Disney and by the time we had to return, we were exhausted. There is a shuttle that runs every 20 min. but it seems everytime we were thinking of taking it, it had just left, so we would walk rather than wait( no where to sit while waiting I must add) there is a cost to the shuttle as well.  As there are comparable places across from the maingates, we found this a bit of a drawback.  The rooms are big, but we

Stayed at the LQ Anaheim Disneyland for 1 night in May 2008.  I booked directly through the website and got a really low rate of $79 for a Friday night.  There are positives to the hotel--the staff are super friendly and helpful, it's an easy walk to Disneyland if you're not lugging your kids around (about 20 minutes), the place is clean and spotless, the hotel is easy to find from the freeway, the location is extremely safe, the pool area looked appealing, there are restaurants and shopping adjacent, and there was plenty of free parking.  However, there were many things I did not like.  They changed my reservation due to a mix-up, and placed me in a children's suite.  Now I'm a single traveler so it was useless to give me a children's suite.  Half of the room is separated by a

Summary Heading: Great hotel for trip to disneyland
Summary: I was a little weary about the hotel based on some of the reviews.  However, I was very happy with my stay at the La Quinta Inn.  The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful.  I stayed in a deluxe suite with my wife and two kids.  We had plenty of room and it was nice that the room was separated by a sliding door.  I was able to watch t.v. while the kids napped without being afraid of waking them.    The rooms were quiet and I didn't hear any noise from other rooms around us.    You do have to go outside to get to the lobby, but it is only about 3 feet from the elevator.    I was happy with the breakfast.  They had biscuits and gravy, toast, cereal, fruit, donuts.  One day they had pancakes and the other day they had eggs.  Also included orange juice, apple juice,

We tried to check in at about 7:30 in the morning since we flew for about six hours from Hawaii. They told us to come back because they didn't have a room available. So we took off to go to Disneyland even though we were all tired, but we didn't mind since we were going to DISNEYLAND. We finally got to check-in later on in the late afternoon. By that time we were all dead tired and needed a nap. We stayed in a Kids Suite for 6 nights. First impression was okay. The room was good enough for a family of four. Our room was spacious and clean but a little run down. The walls and floors is almost paper thin. We could hear our neighbors to the sides of us and above us. The room below us complained numerously about the kids running around.??Which did not make any sense since I have two
No complaints. Friendly, clean, well sized, well located, and decent shuttle service to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: A Great place to stay for visiting Disneyland
Summary: Stayed here recently whilst visiting Disneyland and had a wonderful stay. The room was divided into 2 seperate areas. First area was room entry, bedroom, bathroom and TV. Second area was fold away sofa bed, desk with free internet access, fridge, microwave and 2nd TV. This would be great for a family with kids. We didn't have any kids with us but still found it great as if one of us wanted an early night then the other could use the internet or watch TV without disturbing the other.  The hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk to Disneyland which isn't that far but if you take into account you'll do alot of walking whilst at the park then you should make use of the shuttle bus service that departs every 20 mins from just behind the hotel. You can buy tickets for it at hotel reception

we are a family from australia and this was our first holiday out of australia and the stay was perfect we have 4 children ages 10,7,1,3 and they made a lot of noise and no one complained it was really good the staff were very pleasant and didnt annoy us at all. the only thing that was not the best is the hotel maids couldnt understand when you asked them something as a lot of them are mexican i think if they could speak a bit better english it would be alot easier for all of us. but they were friendly though and the rooms were clean but the bathrroms could have been a bit bigger and there was no benchs to put anything on and there could have been a toaster in the room and a kettle there was only a coffee maker. but we are going back to anaheim next year in feb and will be

Summary Heading: Back for the second time, and I love LaQuinta!
Summary: I have previously stayed here at the LaQuinta last year for 3 days when I went to Disneyland with my family. I had such a great experience, I came back for a second time. I had 2 days at the Grand Californian, and for the third day we stayed here. Our rooms were ready on time, which was great! The front desk people were very nice and helpful. I got a kids suite, which was excellent for the kids, and I also got a 2 bed with a sleeper for the other room. The price was pretty good, and the rooms were clean. The housekeeping gal was super helpful and sweet. A lot of people complain of how old the hotel looks, but I don't see it. It's not glamorous, but it's nice. They actually have one of the best breakfast selections I have even seen. I would tell anyone who is trying to find great

Disneyland is supposed to be fun and it is if you don't stay at this La Quinta.  This is an older hotel that is showing its age.  Things are worn out and patched.  The hotel lobby is outside of the hotel.  The elevators are outside as well.  If you needed to go to the office during the night you would have to dress completely including a jacket.  They offer an expanded buffet breakfast including eggs and fresh fruit. If you consider opening a fresh can of fruit every morning to be fresh fruit then this is the place for you!  Eggs are offered every second or third day depending on who tells you what.  The room is minimally acceptable.  The family suite has a separate room for the children but the refrigerator and microwave are in there.  The desk and internet access is also in

Everything was great.  We stayed in a King suite, with a sofa sleeper.  After going to disneyland, we returned to the room and ordered pizza and it was nice to have a sitting area to eat -- not on the bed.  Fridge and microwave were nice for leftover pizza. The place was incredibly clean and the bed was pretty comforable.  The sliding door with curtain made it possible for us to watch different TV shows at the same time without bothering the other.  We were able to purchase Disney tickets as well as the $3 shuttle pass right at the front desk.  Very convenient.  We would stay here again!
This is a great place to stay.  The rooms are great.  The staff is great.  It is a convenient location in relation to Disneyland.  My family and I were really pleased.

We stayed here this past Thursday for one night.  And we loved it!! I was worried after reading the last reviews, but I think they must have been staying at a different place.  When we checked in we received a very friendly and helpful desk.  We had the King suite and had soooooooo much room.  I went with my  two youngest children ( 2 & 4) and they were able to spread out and not feel as if they were stuck in a room. I even ended up sleeping on the couch because of a coughing child, and it was very comfortable. The breakfast  wasn't fancy but it was free and plenty.  We had the choice of biscuits and gravy, pancakes (yes they were frozen ones, but they tasted fine), cereal, rolls and drinks.  My kids and myself left satisfied enough to go to DLand and not need to eat for quite

Don't be fool by the 5 stars people have given this hotel in the past.  La Quinta IS "La Ghetto!!!!!!"  My sister us booked a vacation package for Thanksgiving which included Disney 3-day park hopper tickets.  She booked what was supposed to be a 2 bedroom suite.  If anyone knows anything about a suite you know that it comes with a "living room" area, a kitchen or kitchenette, in addition to a larger bedroom and bathroom.    Now let me tell you, on the website, the rooms "look" nice because they only took pictures of the beds only.  You don't see the room.  IT IS NOT A TWO BEDROOM SUITE.! IT IS LITERALLY ONE LARGE ROOM DIVIDED BY A PARTION --TO BE EXACT, A CURTAIN AND A BROKEN SLIDING/WOODEN GLASS DOOR OF SOME SORT!!!!  There WAS NO SITTING AREA, unless you count the children's

The property is "good enough" if you want free parking and free breakfast.  Our first room had fleas.  Yep, pets are allowed.  But, they were more than happy to switch our room.  Breakfast is not bad.  Overall, it's good for the price but don't expect too much.  I wouldn't stay with kids since it's still a good walk to Disneyland.

We just returned from a 3 night stay at the LaQuinta Anaheim.  It was fabulous!  I was a little wary after reading some of the other reviews on here, but we were happy.  The hotel staff was very friendly, and check in was a breeze.  We stayed in a 3 room suite, with 4 adults and 2 small children we had plenty of room to stretch out, and it was nice having the living room when people were trying to rest.  Our room was very clean, and cleaned before we returned for afternoon naps each day.  The breakfast offered was only so-so, but it was free and items were refilled often.  We can't wait to go back to Disney and we'll definitely stay at the La Quinta again next time!

We needed a trip on a budget and we got one. Most hotels were at least $109 a night and we found this at $82.50 for an Apt. Suite. The room consisted of a king in one room and bunk beds in the other. The morning breakfast was actually a surprise,nothing special but it got us to the later morning before we needed to eat again. The hotel was close enough to Disneyland to walk. The only issue is a lot of construction nearby , but when the construction is done a Cheesecake Factory and Bubba Gump's will be accross the street. The construction was never an issue just made crossing streets a little interesting at times. I would stay again.

Pretty loud hotel, lots of kids since it's near Disneyland.  they run up and down the halls at all hours (6:30 am!!!).  Breakfast is alright, could be much better.  NO wireless internet in rooms as promised on their site, only in the lobby.  You're supposed to be able to get an ethernet cable from the front desk, but it was never available.  I was put on a waitlist on Monday, checked out Thursday morning, it still wasn't available!  Room was nice,kind of small, but it did it's job.  Not bad for the price.

We stayed for three nights in a king suite.  It was the first smoking room I’ve ever experienced that didn’t smell like smoke.  The room was clean and the bed comfortable. It really seemed that if we’d had children, we could have some actual privacy due to the french doors and blackout curtains between the two rooms. The hotel was aware we were on our honeymoon and it seemed they actually made an effort to put us away from occupied rooms.    We had no issues finding parking and getting to and from Disney was easy. Our view was nothing spectacular since there was construction going on next door.  The free breakfast was one of the better I’ve seen, and there’s a small patio off the breakfast room that allowed us to escape the kids.

This property has a lot going for it: easily accessible, ample parking, walkable from Disney, hearty breakfast tacos. But the pool noise really ruined our room time: it's in an open garage which amplifies the screams and shrieks. The noise made the suite portion unusable for relaxation. So demand a room in the front or on the left side. Also, the hotel is somewhat worn and the staff isn't overly warm. Don't pay more than around $100 for this property.

We stayed for 8 nights to visit Disneyland. The first night our roof was leaking from the airconditioner and we had to move rooms late in the evening. The room we were put into had a plumbing problem and the carpet infront of the sink was drenched. Maintennence was fast but we were still left with wet carpet. On one of our nights we had a complaint that our 18month old and 3 year old were making too much noise. This noise was caused by walking on the floors. The floors were wooden on the upper levels and noise travelled. It was impossible to move around without causing a thud below.  Staff were not very helpful. we asked for assistance to book transfers and was given a phone number that did not work. There were many more little things we were not happy with but at least th

The room itsself was near perfect.  Clean.  Beds were extremely comfortable.  We had the king sized bed w/ kids' suite, and it suited our family perfectly.  Had little extras like ironing board/hair dryer, etc.  The only things missing were small table for childrens' playthings,  plus table to eat at/fix sandwiches, etc.  Not quite as big as it appeared in photos.  Also, in case you're wondering, no DVD player, although there are two separate TVs.  In addition to French doors separating the kids' suite, there is a heavy curtain, which is helpful, but not pictured.   Pool - not so great -- too cold for kids to swim in.  Everyone crowded in luke-warm hot tub.  Plenty of towels, though.  Service -- be prepared to carry all your own luggage, find your own cart to do so.  They

This hotel was quite interesting. I was in a room on the top floor (5) and nothing really seemed to work. When we first got there we had just spent 14 hours driving with a day of disneyland on top of that. We just wanted to sleep and shower. The first member in our group goes to shower, the next one goes in and the drain didn't work. To shower you had to wait 10-15 minutes between each person to let it drain. It also looked like someone shaved their dog in the tub without cleaning afterwards,it was gross. The ice machine didn't work and the tvs didn't work too well either(not the channels they claimed to have). The breakfast was below-average but not inedible.  The last night of our stay the maids did something really weird. They didn't steal anything or lose anything. they just

I had recently stayed at three different La Quintas in Oregon and was happy with each one.  So I was surprised to be disappointed.  The room was spacious and the beds were comfortable, but the continental breakfast was not up to La Quintas standards.  The coffee was horrible, only powdered creamer was available, no fresh waffles like the before mentioned La Quintas had, no peanut butter available which disappointed my four year old son.  Only styrofoam plates, etc were used (which I hate).  We left hungry and uncaffeinated.  But the most annoying issue was the construction site that was right outside our windows.  Little did we know that come Monday morning we would be awakened at 6:30am by construction workers!  We could have been warned and given earplugs!  We had no problems

We stayed at La Quinta disneyland last month. We are a big family and decided to book the 2 bedroom suite. While the bedrooms do have 2 double beds and 1 king size bed, the double bedroom size is really small. King bed was good. One of the 3 TVs did not work (but then who watches TV when you are visiting Disneland). Breakfast was good. Internet did not work. Staff was extremely helpful. Two big hotels coming up nearby hampering the view from this hotel. However, when they are completed - this would be an awesome place to stay.  Can walk to disneland .. but a long walk .. but then agin you can walk if you want to. Many eating places around.
Everything was wonderful > NICE ROOM WITH SEPARATE BEDROOM.. Staff was very polite..CHeck in was fast.  Close to Disney. Nothing bad to say..Will go back again

We stayed at the La Quinta from Dec. 29, 2006 to Jan. 5, 2007 and we loved it!  We stayed on the 5th floor and had a great view of the fireworks at Disney.   We had a suite with 1 king bed and a pullout. We were a little concerned about staying there as we had read the reviews about noise and the breakfast, but they were wrong!  The breakfast had great selection of food.  I know other reviews said it didn't, but what were they expecting?  You aren't at a restaurant!  We just took our food back to our room and ate at our leisure. We never had any trouble with the noise except for the fireworks, which was just our reminder to get to the window and watch!   The only truth we found to any of the reviews was that the pool was cold and the hot tub needed more chemical in it to stop

We just got back last night!  Property was very nice and clean and quiet. (not if your room in near the elevator, we were lucky to be on the other end of it)  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Great place to stay with 6 people visiting Disneyland and just wanting a comfortable place to fall  and take a hot shower after walking and standing in lines for 14 hours.  Parking is very tight, but you can park at the parking lot next to it, because they are owned by the same company.  So, parking isn't really an issue.  Great Stay!

Summary Heading: Quiet stay, friendly staff, good value for a family.
Summary: We booked through GetAwayToday travel and got a terrific rate that worked out to about $80 a night for the king suite with bunkbeds.   I wouldn't pay more than that.    If you can get a great rate then this is a good place to stay.   Not deluxe but not bad either.    It is clean, friendly and adequate.   We stay busy at the park all day so we just need to sleep and shower.   Check in was great and we were given a room in a good location on the top floor.   Room was clean but a bit smaller than we remember when we used to stay here years ago.   It has been updated with some new decor so that was nice.  We enjoyed the pool and the breakfast was better than average.  There are towels at the pool.   Coin laundry was never busy and worked great.  They have an early maid signup list

As with the previous guests, I had braced myself for a rather trying stay, but did not face any difficulty at all.  All things considered, it was comfortable, clean, and quiet. The housekeeping staff were on the ball, and considerate with all the mess that children can make.  Always came back to stuffed animals arranged on the beds very nicely. Towels were like sandpaper, but you get what you pay for....  And I agree, it is FAR better to get your breakfast in early, as there are less critters under foot!  The only concern I had, as I work in the Hotel Industry, was for the fact that there was really no security provided, as stairwells were regularly blocked open (which are open to the parking area, therefore anyone could get into the halls) and the elevator could be accessed

We have just stayed 5 nights at La Quinta and the experience was not bad. Unfortunately I read all the reviews after I had booked and paid for this hotel so I was braced for an average stay and was actually surprised and I have no real complaints. We stayed on the 5th level and had no noise issues. Room was clean and we had 6 clean bathtowels everyday and there was only 3 of us. Breakfast was okay except coffee was terrible.. i went early to avoid the noise(too many small children) and children touching food.. Pool was clean and we walked to Disneyland everyday and that took about 15mins.

The hotel had a few good points:  It is within walking distance to Disneyland, though it is a long walk especially on a hot day. Free Internet access via wired ethernet. Good view of nightly Disneyland fireworks. Room is relatively large.  The bad:  The pool - the water tastes salty and does not look clean, not enough towels provided and the pool is very small.   The hotel dryer vents into a stair well. When you walk into that stairwell, it is like walking into a sauna.   The walls and ceiling are not well insulated.  You can hear your upstair neighbors as they walk, your neighbors in ajoining rooms, people in the hallway and doors slamming.  You can hear street noise too.  I second all the comments about the noise, including the shuttle busses driving by.   Breakfast is not as

Summary Heading: At least the beds were comfortable
Summary: This was definately a learning experience.  We stayed for six nights.  We had a group of ten, with two rooms, and called ahead of time to get neighboring rooms and were told that they had them for us.  We arrive and learn that they had given our room to someone else.  While our rooms were close, they were in what seemed like the loudest location on the second floor.  One room was around the corner from the elevator, the one that worked, while the other was right across from the laundry facility and around the corner from the "game room".  My first impression of the room was nice, until we found a dirty plastic fork in the corner of the childrens room.  the other room was very nice, except for the leaking faucet in the bathroom.  We also had a problem with only receiving one or

Summary Heading: Great place to stay while at Disneyland with children
Summary: I went to Disneyland with my daughter and young grandsons. We found La Quinta Anaheim to be a wonderful place to stay! The unit was a fourth floor suite with two queen beds and a queen sofa bed. It offered plenty of room for my daughter and I to have our own beds and my grandsons ages 5 and 7 slept on the fold-out sofa. The shuttle stop was nearby. We could go back to our room and rest up during the heat of the day and enjoy the pool and hot tub. If we tired out early, we could still watch the fireworks from our room window. The room was clean and staff friendly.  The only objections I had was the elevator was slow and the shuttle was never on schedule. But if we grew impatient with the shuttle, we walked. I'd stay there again while at Disneyland with my family in a heartbeat,

There were some good parts to this hotel, but unfortunately for our familiy the bad outweighed the good. We chose this hotel based on location to Disneyland, and the price. The housekeeping staff were very friendly and did a very good job on our rooms. The continental breakfast was pretty good and had lots of things that were kid-friendly. The gift shop also had a good selection, and it was reasonably priced. Although we had a few minor problems, at least the staff were quick to help. One of the worst parts was that the pool was small, and i don't know if it had too many chemicals in it or what, but the water was disgusting and really salty and gross. The parking wasn't very convenient and we wasted a lot of time waiting for the shuttle.  Also, if you are choosing this hotel

Summary Heading: Awful coffee, greasy/fatty breakfast, stolen sandals. no hot tub...........
Summary: My family of four (age 2, 7 & 30+) stayed four nights here in late April, 2006.   Good: friendly front desk staff, shuttle stop close, hotel was first stop on  ART's G route departing D-land, large variety of continental breakfast items sure to please most kids: cereal, muffins & toast. Plus sausage patties, oranges, bananas, hard-boiled eggs. Plenty of peanut butter and jelly and bread for lunches.  Bad:main brkfst entrees greasy, worry about germs with the # of people and kids touching the food. Coffee was absolutely nasty. Exercise room is more like an enlarged closet with a single treadmill. Two room suite was very small for the queen bed and lumpy little sofa sleeper.  One tv was on a night stand and we had only the nightstand drawers to put clothes.  Not enough room to use

We just returned from a family vacation at the Anaheim LaQuinta Inn and Suites.  We chose this hotel for its proximity to the park and for its room sizes and amenities.  I'll give you a breakdown on what's good and what's bad.  GOOD 1.  Room size and pricing. 2.  Comfy beds. 3.  Microwaves, refrigerators and free high-speed internet access in each room. 4.  1st on the "G" route for ART (Anaheim Resort Transportation). 5.  Yummy and free hot breakfasts including some of the best coffee I've had in a long time. 6.  Rooms are very clean.  BAD 1.  Doors to rooms are not insulated and noise is almost constant. 2.  The "G" route is apparently one of the slowest-running routes and we ALWAYS had to wait for a shuttle. 3.  Although the hotel is pretty close to the parks, it's a long walk

Stayed Apr 17-21 2006.   Good: Very clean, rooms are good sized, plenty of food at breakfast, curtious & helpful staff, first stop for shuttles to parks so always got a seat.  Bad: Too loud almost like walls are paper thin. Be sure to stay on the highest floor as you can hear every foot step above you. You can hear the busses for Disney staff all night long.  Lines at breakfast are long.  All in all not a bad stay but next time I'll spend a bit more to have more quiet.

Keep in mind, that this hotel chain is a mid-price hotel, and many of the hotels around D-land are fairly aged now, so my expectations were not high to begin with.I stayed in the 2-bedroom, family suite which had a great layout and provided a lot of privacy between rooms.  However, the negatives were many.  First, my room experienced a serious leak from the room above and leaked for several hours before the problem was addressed.  Second, the water was turned off for four hours without any notification from the hotel. Third, both showers dripped constantly and had very poor water pressure.  Third, the pay-per view had no sound.  Fourth, this room vibrated so hard (I guess a nearby a/c unit), that I felt like I was having "mini" earthquakes during my 3-day stay.  Fifth, the

We stayed at the La Quinta for five nights during New Years 2006.  We stayed in a "Kids Suite".  The sliding door between the two rooms was a nice feature and the everything in the rooms was decent.  However, the people above us were extremely loud and kept me awake every single night.  I'm not a light sleeper, so this was quite loud.  The continental breakfast was just okay, nothing to write home about.  Just beware that if you are planning to walk to Disneyland it is a very long walk.  Everyone in my group was in their 20's and it was very tiring (especially the walk home.)  It also isn't easy to "run and get something from the room."  Also be aware that they tack on a $25 per night "Resort Fee" which we were unaware of before check out.

We just stayed here from Feb 21-23,2006 for our Disneyland trip.  The parking lot is ridiculously small with barley any parking spaces.  There are some outside parking spaces but the rest (what little there is) is underground.  You can hear the people above you in the room as they walk and you can definately hear the people that are walking AND running outside your door on the hallway of your floor.  We had a room that was on the 2nd floor overlooking the small parking lot and the loud and noisy Katella Ave.  We could also see and hear the people in the pool.  When you are tired the last thing you want is noise!   The nice things were the microwave, mini refrigerator and the king bed was very comfortable.  We saved money by bringing our own TV dinners,drinks and snack foods and

My family and I booked this hotel through Getaway today since the Hilton Homewood Suites we normally stay at at Disneyland wasn't available.  The staff was nice, but the facilities were seriously lacking!  This hotel allows pets and my allergies and asthma could tell!  When I made my reservations I requested a room that didn't have a pet prior to my stay.  This obviously didn't happen.  Also, we were in a non-smoking room and people smoked in the halls.  The fridge either froze our food or didn't keep it cold,  my cooler worked better for my 1 year olds milk.  The "suite" was a room that use to be a regular hotel room, but they put sliding french doors in with a curtain!  It didn't feel clean the a/c vent in the bathroom looked like it had black mold and we asked them to clean

We enjoyed our stay at La Quinta, we were there for 9 nights.  The breakfast was great...good selection and great service.  The rooms were clean as were the public areas.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  We would stay here again....close to Disneyland and good value for money.

This hotel is OK.  It was not expensive, for the area, and the staff were polite, helpful and courteous.  The breakfast was good and it is only a 10 minute, safe, walk to the gates of Disneyland.  If you don't fancy the walk then a bus calls at the hotel.  If you want a hotel to use as a base from which to explore Disneyland and the California Adventure, and you don't want to pay a fortune then this is great.

My family & I arrived to LaQuinta on 12/26/2005 @ 1:00 pm ready for 3 fun filled days a Disneyland.  When we checked (room # 301) in and put our belongings in the room "looked" very nice. But from the first 5 minutes the whole experience was "horrible"! The toliet overflowed within the first 5 min. The front desk was very accomodating and sent a worker right away. We then went to Disneyland and returned to the room around 10:30pm. I wanted the kids to take showers and lo and behold NO SHOWER! I called the desk and said they would take a work order and have someone there 1st thing next morning. I did not appreciate having to wash my LONG hair in a sink with a plastic cup. The next morning we went to the desk and was greeted by a man named "Robert" & "Kay" they were extremely

My family had the opportunity to go to Disneyland on Nov.30,2005 & we stayed at La Quinta,Anaheim for 6 nights. This is an EXCELLENT hotel!!! VERY CLEAN, VERY FRIENDLY & HELPFUL STAFF!!!! AND their complimentary breakfast was VERY generous!! Not a noisy hotel either!!! You bet WE WILL stay here again & again!!!!

Summary Heading: One of the worst Hotel stays ever
Summary: O.K. here's the problems.  1. Lost my reservation.  2. Maids didn't clean room first 2 days there. Emptied garbage myself.  3. Holes and cracks in ceiling.  4. Towels on floor left for first two days there.  5. 3/4 in. Copper pipe protruding from ceiling in bathroom. Presumably draining from leak in ceiling?  6. Hotel called my room at 12:30 a.m. to request I pay the night before I was to check out, even though I requested to pay cash at the beginning to save myself the hassle of carrying large sums of cash around on trip and was told to pay at checkout.  7. Staff lied the whole time to our faces. First our room was not in the computer, and they had no vacancies of the double suite we ordered then when I suggested that they pay for the first night as it was their fault a double

My son (9years) & I stayed at this hotel for 8 nights. Before leaving Australia I had read some of the reviews & was not expecting too much upon arrival.  I was pleasantly surprised.  Our room was clean and well maintained.  The bed was new, extremely comfortable & everything worked except the hairdryer.  When I mentioned this to staff it was replaced straight away. The continental breakfast was fine with fresh fruit (apples, oranges & bananas).  I loved having a guest laundry which was very clean & only $1 for washer & dryer.  Vending machines & gift shop were also at this hotel.  Will definitely be returning again.

I would definately stay here again. My family of 8 stayed over a month ago, and it was awesome I read some reviews before going, so when I was actually in my suite, I looked for any examples of breakdown, big or small, and found nothing. I'm a professional painter, and I was very impressed with the paint job.  I loved staying there! The breakfast was good (not the greatest), but one of my favorite memories of the whole trip was having breakfast together as a family (my family is all over 20, by the way) before heading off to Disneyland for the day.

I will never stay here again, it was the worst 4 nights I have stayed in a hotel in my entire life!  Its flat out nasy and disgusting.  The carpet is dirty, sticky and the rooms smell.  I decided on this hotel because it was a two room suite.  I thought the space would be great.  I was wrong.  The pool was nasy too and small.  The water was dirty.  Housekeeping does not do a good job and we didn't even make a mess and we pick up after ourselves.  There was only three of us and we were never there.  The breakfast is not good, you should not stay here just for the free breakfast.  Its the same everyday, it never changes and the eggs were green.  Yes, green, lol.  We didn't eat the breakfast the last three mornings just to give you an idea how bad it is.  The staff was nice, it was

2 room suite. Nice. Maintenance needs to go over this place. Door lock problem. Ice machine Problem. Bugs at night. Great parking area. Secure. TV volume problem. Would be a really good value if problems fixed. Reported problems to LaQuinta website.

we stayed at the hotel for five days and throughly enjoyed it. the rooms were clean and spacious. the breakfast was plentiful and tasty. the staff very helpful. the shuttle easy and frequent. i would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel.

I read the reviews on this site before our stay and then decided to stay here despite some of the negative views because there were some positive things.  I have to agree with the person who posted "this was my creepiest stay ever"!  What a trip!  Good things:  I actually thought the breakfast was the best part of the stay despite someone else's comments.  Although, my breakfast only consisted of cereal, milk and juice.  My husband doesn't eat breakfast and my 7 year old twins were thrilled with all the choices.  I was concerned that they didn't have coolers for the milk and simply left gallons of milk setting open on the shelf. I thought the orange juice tasted fresh and was excellent.  For my family, the breakfast included as part of the stay is a very important part of the

The first night we were there we could not get any sleep for all the noise above us and out in the hall.  We called to complain about the stomping above twice to no avail, then a repeat performance on the next night, so we quit calling knowing nothing would be done.  This hotel looked great when we looked it up on the web but that is as far as it goes, the outside!!  Once inside there are paper thin walls, dirty worn out couches, no fan in the bathrooms and the tubs won't plug so we had to give a shower to a 3 1/2 in a slippery tub (try that sometime!), drawers that won't even pull out, a table with only one chair, lamps that are loose and seem to us to be a dangerous accident waiting to happen!  The pool is always cold plus it is under an alcove that has wind blowing through it

I have to say that when I read all of the reviews, we were nervous (to say the least).  We booked our Disneyland trip to stay 2 nights at the Disneyland Hotel (to utilize the unlimited FastPasses – which, if you have not looked into this, you should), and 7 nights at the La Quinta.  (June 2nd through June 11th.)  Everything was great.  We booked the “Family Suite” which had two bedrooms, two bathrooms, and a sitting room.  There were 3 televisions -  one in each of the bedrooms, and one in the sitting room.  The rooms were extremely clean, even the bathrooms were spotless.  My husband and I had a king sized bed, and our children’s room had 2 queens. (I believe the couch in the sitting room also folded out to a double, but we didn’t use it).  Contrary to what I have read, there

I can affirm some of the negatives already described in the other reviews, but I must add one that might give you pause if you still have thoughts of staying here.     We were booked in a suite with two TV's.  On the third night of our stay, we came back late from a day at Disneyland to discover that someone had been in our room without our permission.  We had left the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door when we left, but, upon returning, we noticed that somebody had swapped one of the two TV remote controllers for a different one.  The one that had been taken was very distinctive, particularly because of the black electrical tape that was wrapped around the battery compartment.   That remote had been replaced with a different model--left where the other one had been, with no note

Summary Heading: Fails to live up to even minium level of standards
Summary: Based upon personal experience from a recent stay, as well as the unfavourable reviews of others, I would strongly discourage anyone from booking this hotel. We had booked  a "family suite" for 4 days, but checked out after the first night. It is clear that this hotel has seen better days; lots of hard wear and tear, and appearant lack of maintenance, has resulted in an undesirable, rundown hotel.  Aside from the poor physical condition of the rooms, the desk staff was poorly trained and unable to handle even the most simple and mundane request.  There are less expensive choices available within close proximity to the Disney parks, so don't settle for substandard--check out your options carefully!  This hotel is not worthy of the La Quinta chain's name.

Summary Heading: Safe, friendly, unorganized, worn, cheap, close
Summary: My husband, 5.5 yr old son, brother and I stayed in a room with 2 dbl beds for 4 nights in February, 2005. We had reserved a King suite and we had called a day in advance to make sure that is what we were getting and were assured everything was in order. When we arrived, they could only give us the dbl bed suite - which was ok even tho it wasn't what was asked for.  Problems: The first night the door keys would not work tho we had tried all 3 of them.  Twice we went downstairs to get keys that would work and finally the handyman opened the room for us and said he would need to work on the lock itself and would do so the next day at 9 am. He never showed up.  We told the front desk and asked that they fix the problem by the time we get back.  When we got back only one of the 3

My husband, 2 yr old son, and I stayed in a room with 2 dbl beds for 5 nights in January, 2005.  We had reserved a King room with a crib.  We called a week in advance to make sure that is what we were getting and were assured everything was in order.  When we arrived, the reservation was still wrong.  The "crib" was a port-a-crib (playpen) so we just used our own that we brought with us.    Problems in room:  The Wardrobe doors were falling off, the towel rack by the shower could be easily lifted off its hinges and the TV in the bedroom didn't work.  Mid-way through our stay, the hotel staff removed a lamp and a chair from our sitting area but didn't leave a note telling us why or replace them.  How odd!   They were just gone when we returned to our room one night.   The

I read the "less than great" reveiws AFTER booking with this "hotel". I was nervous to say the least! I just just retured from a 6 night stay and all I can say is I can fully relate to all the complaints from other guests...and I have a few new ones of my own! SHEESH! The first two days of our stay our room was not cleaned AT ALL! (only used towels were picked up). We had to call front desk for toiletpaper! One day the jacuzzi was so hot I swear I had third degree burns on my legs. (I called front desk AGAIN if only to prevent a child from getting burned)! The next day when I went back to the jacuzzi to try again it was ice cold and being "worked on" by "maintenece",(I use that term loosley) Had to call the front desk for pool towels, which they state are supplied!. The only

as a 2.5 star hotel, La Quinta offers a pretty descent atmosphere for families of 5 or more... Although i have to agree with other reviewers that the staffs there are a little poorly trained, confused and ignorant, but we just looked at them as a joke.  What can u expect for the price they offer? WE were happy the whole time we stayed there because the room was spacious and clean.

If you don't mind homeless people staying in the hotel and doing laundry down the hallway from you, then this place is for you. Filthy small bathrooms with cigarette burns on the bathtub in my non-smoking room! Extremely noisy also. Front desk staff is rude and push park tram tickets on you when disneyland is within close walking distance. Hot breakfast is a joke. Powdered eggs shaped in round circles, very crowded and small breakfast room. I would never stay there again.

I stayed at this place with my family.  It was awful.  The best thing about the place was hot water and a clean bathroom.  The pull out sofa was so old you could feel the springs and bars.  The carpet had burn marks and filthy.  The breakfast that claimed waffles or french toast plus -was for four days eggs, bacon, bagels, toast and cereal only.  One day there was nothing to drink because the drink machines leaked water all over the floor.  The jacuzzi water was discustingly dirty and the pool didn't look much better.  They also checked us out of our room early while we were at breakfast the last day we where.  We got back to the room and couldn't get back in.

My family stayed here last June.  My dght, son-in-law, and 2 grandsons plus myself.  We thought the room was spacious and kept clean.  The bathroom was small but useable.  The breakfast buffet was something else.  You always had scrambled eggs with either bacon or sausage.  Not a choice of one or the other but whatever was in the wamer when you got there.  If you arrived early enough you might get small chocolate donuts left in their container like you get from a Sams or Costco.  There was only one cereal and no muffins or fruit.  In the afternoon you had popcorn for the managers reception and that was about it.  If you stayed on the weekdays I understand you had a better selection. The shuttle bus driver was rude and you had to let them know way ahead of time when you wanted to

This hotel was great. Very spacious. I loved having the seperate living room with the pull out bed. One room can accomadate a very large family. Also the free breakfast was great. It is not your common continenal breakfast. It has sausage, waffles, muffins, fresh fruit, and much more. The only bad thing is the frequency of their shuttle and the fact they charge you for it. I have gone to Disneyland several times over the past few years and I always try to stay here

Our family just returned from a 7 night stay at this hotel and we were rather disappointed. We had booked adjoining rooms with friends so that we could put our kids (each family has a baby and a 6 year old) to bed and stay in one of the living areas to watch tv or play some cards. The room divider is a wobbly sliding door with a shear curtain cover which blocks out no light or sound. THe sofa bed was missing many springs, the bed spread was so old and dirty loking, the sheets and blankets were very old too. Our bathroom kept having puddles of water from the ceiling dripping and they couldn't figure out why. Our tv remote did not work and the replacement we were given only turned then one direction so you had to flip all the way thru. During the week we didn't hear noise from

Summary Heading: The worst place we have ever stayed!
Summary: My family and I stayed at Hawthorn Suites in Anaheim over the Christmas vacation. This hotel is dirty and the service is horrible. The blankets had holes in them and looked like they hadn't been washed in quite some time. The coffee maker didn't work, we were left with no towels or washclothes on 2 separate nights and when we called for them they were never delivered. Two of our cars were broken into and all of the Christmas presents stolen while there was supposed to be a security guard on duty.
