When another person who also had their car vandalized, asked for help at the front desk, they handed her a phone book and offered no assistance. The police told us it would have been safer if we would have parked at Disneyland and left our cars there. I think that says a lot for the
Our band went to LA for 5 days and we stayed in that hotel for 4 nights. It was horrible...bad service, the power went out, and our light bulb in the bathroom was leaking water!

When we checked in they said we had reserved a non-smoking room. My daughter & I both smoke, why would I reserve a non-smoking room. They finally got us a smoking room. When we went to the pool the water was so cold we could not swim. The girl at the front desk did not even know you could see the fireworks from some of the rooms. The front desk person should be advised as to what can be seen and what can't. We won't be staying at a Hawthorne Suite again. Not a good time.

it was nothing like it said on expedia and the pictures of the hotel must have been from years ago because it was old and the hallways were hot and the hotel smelled bad.you had to wait 30-45 minutes for a bus outside on the curb to get to and from disneyland park.if your planning a trip to california stay somewhere nicer with room service and a shuttle to take you to and from disneyland park don't ride buses.

Summary Heading: Great deal for a large family!
Summary: We have stayed at Hawthorne Suites on several occasions & found it to be comparable to even the Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel. A better bargain at any rate. We have a large family & was able to sleep comfortably in the spacious rooms & a wonderful breakfast in the morning. The kids enjoyed swimming in the rather small pool. We are all there to go visit Disneyland & I think this Hotel was the best bargain ever! The rooms were clean & nicely furnished. I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends.

My family (7;my 4 kids & 3 adults) stayed July 6-9 in 2 rooms and what a shock. The last time we had stayed here was a 5 years ago (which we informed by the check in personal when the hotel was last renovated!) it was a lovely place and a great deal. Not any longer, the rooms are very shabby, the furniture damaged and worn, walls stained and marked with dirt and handprints on the ceiling. The bathrooms (we changed our rooms which were adjoining twice) were moldy and water damaged probably because the venting system was nonexistant, it helps to shower with the door open I guess. We needed are rooms together so when we found the one of the doors inbetween the rooms wouldn't open we had to wait to have the lock removed since it couldn't be repaired. The bedding was worn, the

I'm not a picky person but this place was terrible. Perhaps my sister & I were just cursed that weekend but we had nothing but problems! It started with my mistake of assuming check in was at 11 or 12 so we took an early flight. Check in was not until 3:00. My fault. Next we bought our disneyland hopper passes there and asked if they had a shuddle, yes they said, go wait outside it comes every twenty minutes. We go outside and wait, then the maintenence man walks by & we ask if this is where we catch the shuddle, no around back he says, which explained why we just saw it driving away. So we go around back and wait another 20 minutes, they arrive and ask us for our shuddle passes. What shuddle passes? We were never told we needed them. So the shuddle driver says I'm on a schedule
Others may warn for this hotel, but I have just been there and this place is great! I guess the hotel really decided to change, and it sure did change for the better.

We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Hawthorne Suites. Shabby is the word for this room. The beds were comfortable but the sheets and blankets were very worn, the bedspreads were dirty. The sleeper sofa was extremely broken. The towels were threadbare. The bathroom was old and dingy. The breakfast was good: served cafeteria style in an area with plenty of tables and chairs. Selection of scrambled eggs, sausage, hashbrowns, fruit, bagels, toast, and cold cereal. Housekeeping was efficient and friendly. They just don't have much to work with. This hotel needs a makeover.
